name: Tiny home in Caye Caulker · ★4.82 · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The cabana is just a moments walk to 'The Split', where the island is split in two and which is the most popular spot for swimming, snorkeling or to have a drink at the famous bar 'the Lazy Lizard'. The main street -Front Street- is right around the corner. Here you'll find several restaurants, supermarkets, souvenir shops and food- and fruit stands. The many local people you meet are always in for a chat. The part of the island where the cabana is located is only 100 yards wide so the sea & beach are always nearby.
host_about: Originally from the Netherlands and now living on the small tropical island of Caye Caulker in Belize. I enjoy the 'go slow' mentality of island life and live by the day.  I'm a real dog lover and work as a volunteer at the Caye Caulker Humane Society.

name: Condo in Caye Caulker Village  · ★4.86 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths

name: Bed and breakfast in San Pedro · ★4.92 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Marbucks Bed and Breakfast fka DayDreamin' Bed and Breakfast is tucked into the prestigious Tres Cocos neighborhood on the north end of Ambergris Caye.  This area is primarily composed of large, beachfront, residential homes and is quiet and very safe.
host_about: Avid divers and lovers of adventure, good people and great wine, Ambergris Caye was a natural fit when we decided to semi-retire to Belize.  In June of 2014, we broke ground on a unique cluster of luxe cabanas - unlike any other on the island - the kind of place we would want to stay and the kind of place we can readily host others.  We'd love for Daydreamin' to serve as the backdrop for the wonderful getaway you deserve.  Come see us soon.
neighbourhood: San Pedro, Ambergis Caye, Belize, Belize

name: Cabin in Belize · ★4.90 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Rental unit in Caye Caulker  · ★4.78 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Home in Benque Viejo Del Carmen · ★4.83 · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
There are around 10 families who live in this area. Most of them operate small farms but live in nearby Benque. It is interesting to see how farming is done using traditional tecniques. There are caves in the area. Horse riding trips are provided by a neighboring farmer. During the dry season river bathing is also available. You can go canoeing on your own or be acompanied by a guide or ecological instructor.
And our well preserved Xunantunich Temple and it's magnificent forest is only a short ferry ride from the main highway. A butterfly farm is only a half hour away. All trips in this area are reasonably priced and conducted by experienced persons.
host_about:
Hi my name is Kaissa, My family and I would be happy to share our home with you. Our farm house is located 2 miles out of town (Benque viejo town). We have 1 bedroom with a full size bed; clean sheets, blankets, towels and soap come with the room.
The environment here is peaceful and filled with all of natures beauties; lots of birds to spot, kinkajous, snakes, ponds with frogs and lots of fruit trees. The Belizean jungle is filled with life and our home happens to be in the middle of the jungle. During your stay you will have access to over a mile of forest trails, an outdoor kitchen with a wood fire stove, and all the seasonal fruits that you wish to try. 
If you would like, prepared meals can be arranged. We love to cook.
neighbourhood: Benque Viejo Del Carmen, Cayo, Belize

name: Rental unit in San Pedro · ★4.72 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 0 baths

I enjoy wood working, which is why I had our  house in Caye Caulker built of solid hard wood by the local Mennonites and have left most of the wood exposed.

name: Guesthouse in Caye Caulker · ★4.87 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Sol is located in a quiet and friendly neighborhood, close to the famous swimming area THE SPLIT,  FRENCHIE'S DIVING,  BLUE WAVE DIVING, PARADISO CAFE , just 5 mins walking distance from everywhere on the island.

I have been in the tourism business for approximately 15+ years.  We consider our family of 3 to be very outgoing and happy, and we also have 1 beautiful dog LUNA (Blue pitt) that loves to meet new and repeated guest. We treat our guest with love, respect, kindnes and understanding and spect the same from our guest.

name: Condo in San Pedro · ★4.94 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: This complex is just a block away from the turquoise Caribbean sea and white beach. It is conveniently located close to supermarkets,a hardware store, a bakery, gas station, restaurants and bars, golf cart rental and a church.
host_about: Hummingbird Island Suites is owned by Hummingbird Furnishings, an award winning Belizean family business. On October 5th 1987, Robert and Yvette Lopez humbly began crafting furniture in their garage. Today, Hummingbird Furnishings has become Belize's premier furniture manufacturer, furnishing the finest resorts and homes across Belize. In 2015, they ventured into the hospitality business with locations in San Pedro, Ambergris Caye and Maya Beach on the Placencia peninsula. Both locations have private vacation suites with accommodations for up to 20 guests to enjoy a quiet, comfortable and affordable vacation. Each suite is personally decorated and accessorized for guests to feel at home.

name: Bungalow in San Marcos · ★4.95 · 1 bedroom · 8 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
In Big Falls Village - ca. 10 min. by car - you can find some nice little restaurants. For example "Coleman`s Cafe". As well as a grocery store.
More different restaurants, bars and shops are located in Punta Gorda Town - 20 min away by car.
host_about:
Hallo, ich bin Marisa. Ursprünglich aus Deuschland, lebe ich zur Zeit mit meinem Mann und meinen beiden wundervollen Kindern (momentan 21 und 14 Jahre alt) im Dschungel von Belize, dem Land meiner Träume. 
Raus aus zivilisiertem Alltagsstress, überfüllten Autobahnen, überbevölkerten Wohngebieten, weg von Luftverschmutzung, Abwassergebühren, Werbesendungen im Briefkasten...ect. Rein in die Natur, mit Brüllaffen als Nachbarn, morgendlichen Weckalarm von Papageien, nur Insektengeräuschen der Zirkaden in der Nacht, viele fröhliche und freundliche Menschen rundherum. Saubere Luft, Sonne, viel Wasser durch die Nähe von Flüssen, Seen und dem türkisfarbenen karibischen Meer. Rein in ein neues Abendteuer!
Ich freue mich immer neue inspirierende Menschen kennenzulernen, die gern über den Tellerrand hinausschauen und an mehr glauben als einem die Medien zeigen. 
Liebe, lebe, lache!
Namasté

name: Rental unit in Punta Gorda · ★4.0 · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: We are located right at the entrance to Punta Gorda. We are right on the sea and the water is warm!  There are restaurants close by, the market is open downtown for fresh Fruit and Vegetables, evenings are quiet and relaxing either in the café or sitting on one of our balconies enjoying the sea breeze.

name: Home in Cayo · ★4.86 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is small, the home is at the top of the neighborhood with million dollar views.  Privacy is yours in your own home.
host_about: I am a 12 year expat to Belize. I moved here to slow down my life, and live longer. I enjoy the .  of life and the visible love of the Belizeans as well as the other expats here.  You quickly learn patience here in Belize. It is a nice change.  Living here has also given me the opportunity to travel more. I have visited most of the countries in the Caribbean as well as Cuba since being here. I traveled extensively before moving here, but the close proximity makes it so much easier.  I have traveled also to Spain, China, Britain, Africa, Mexico, Canada and Cuba, so it gives me some insight as to what people look for while being away from home. It is my goal to make our home your home while you are here.  I will give you space, but will be here for whatever your needs are.  I love being a host. I love meeting people. I love seeing people enjoy what our little paradise has to offer.

name: Cabin in Caye Caulker · ★4.93 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath

host_about: Having traveled a lot and lived in the States, Europe, Brazil and Mexico, we have a good feel for what guests are looking for in a hotel.

We have a bar and grill on our property serving breakfast, lunch and dinner. There are also a handful of bars and restaurants located in walking distance., some of which offer paddle boards and kayaks for you use with a purchase. The beach has crystal blue waters to enjoy. There is a water park nearby with water fun rentals. You can rent jet skis or take a fishing/snorkeling trip nearby as well. Enjoy the beach and beautiful waters of Secret Beach! Come enjoy this island paradise! A perfect place of relaxation and fun! Fun during the day, sunsets and stargazing at night, a perfect balance!  We are a 30-40 minute golf cart ride from the main town of San Pedro.

We love people, the sunshine, the beautiful beach, and the laid back island that makes up Ambergris Caye.  Our goal is to make your stay the best you've ever experienced. Please come and let us share La Isla Bonita with you.

name: Condo in Ambergris Caye · ★4.84 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
We are located a 1/2 mile north of the bridge leaving San Pedro, Belize. Our neighborhood is more relaxed than the hustle and bustle of downtown but close enough that you are just a short drive from the many restaurants and activities located in town.
There are three restaurants in the immediate vicinity of the property. The on site bar and restaurant, The Dog House Sports Lounge, is open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner (7am – 10pm every day). They have Belizean breakfast dishes and casual bar food and mixed drinks throughout the day.
Just to the north of our property (a 2 minute walk on the beach) is 303 Belize, an over the water bar and restaurant. They are open for lunch and dinner (every day of the week) and focus more on seafood. They have live music most evenings as well. Underneath 303 Belize, is Elite Adventures, a dive and snorkel shop.
Just south of our property is the Farmhouse Market and Cafe. They offer a wide selection of fresh coffees, juices/smoothies,
host_about:
Tres Cocos Resort @ The Cloisters, is a charming family-run establishment where island living meets modern comfort. 
We have fond childhood memories on the property before its transformation into a vacation rental oasis. 
Each condo is individually owned and thoughtfully appointed, ensuring a unique and personalized experience for our guests. We invite you to experience the warmth of Belizean hospitality in every detail during your stay with us.

name: Guesthouse in San Pedro · ★4.84 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: The guest house is nestled at the end of a street in the trees.  My guests love returning home to the birds and greenery.
host_about:
I was born and raised in Africa.  My parents owned a remote, luxury lodge so I was raised in the bush in Africa.  After high school I travelled extensively  and ended up in Hawaii for over 25 years!  My son moved to the eastern USA and as it was so far from Hawaii, I decided to move closer to him.  Luckily I landed in Belize!  I have been here for 10 years.  My guest house keeps me busy and I love the Airbnb lifestyle!
Can't wait to meet you!

name: Condo in Caye Caulker · ★4.95 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Cabin in San Ignacio · ★4.94 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
We are located A mere 15-20 minute walk to Cahal Pech Maya Ruins and the Iguana Sanctuary, the famous Xunantunichruins is less than 8 miles away !

San Ignacio is renowned for its close proximity to Belize's famous Maya ruins, and is a hub for outdoor activities such as caving, hiking, kayaking, horseback riding, and Belize being a small country the Caribbean beaches aren't far away. It is one of the last towns in Belize before entering Guatemala, where many visitors go to visit the Tikal Maya ruins. The population is mostly of Mayan and mestizo origin, but there's also a small Lebanese and bigger Chinese community in town, visible through their local businesses. Opposite the Macal River across the Hawksworth Bridge is Santa Elena, formerly a separate town that has grown together even administratively. Together they're known as "the Twin Towns" and with around 26,000 inhabitants form the second most populous urban area in Belize.

Originally a small village of logg
host_about:
The family's permanent  home is 'on site', Jenny and I live here with our 2 grown up children, Craig apart from assisting us  also works at the Belize rapture center, Kayleigh is the Crazy Cat Lady , as well as helping us she also owns/runs the only cat sanctuary in Belize it is located in the grounds but totally isolated from the rentals.
we never leave the property unattended so one of will always  available should you need any assistance

property_type: Private room in bed and breakfast

name: Guest suite in Belmopan · ★4.60 · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: This rental is centrally located just two blocks from the George Price Center of Peace and Development, a Shopping Center, laundromat, eateries, vegetable market and corner shop.  Public transport is a stone's throw away.  Belmopan is centrally located in Belize, with public buses to the north, south, east and west.  Belmopan is home to the national university and is the seat of government.  Everything, including schools, medical facilities, banks, parks, tennis and basketball courts, are within walking or biking distance.
host_about:
Hi, I like to work hard and play hard.  I multi-task and am engaged in many productive endeavors at any one time, but I also love to party and meet friends.  I enjoy reading for pleasure...not too serious material, and learning new languages.  I love to have intellectual discussion and debate...and I like swimming.

As your host, I will basically leave you your space, but am easily reachable for any questions or assistance you may need.  I like to provide an initial introduction to places, activities, and people in the immediate environment, so that you feel comfortable of your surroundings as soon as possible.  Because I work full time I am honest about the time when I can be available on any given day.

When I myself travel, I love to do so by road whenever possible and by staying at more basic accommodations, because I think that's when you best get to KNOW the people and place you visit.  I also like to have a fixed base and make day trips...something that is quite possible living in Belmopan, as it is in the center of the small but beautiful country of Belize.

It would be great if you choose to visit Belmopan, Belize, as the people and the country are multi-cultural, interesting, friendly and helpful.  I wish that someday you decide to grace us with a visit.

name: Cabin in Unitedville‎ · ★4.76 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: Our village is small (pop. 1000) but lively (6 bars & 6 churches).  But Lower Dover is on the fringe of town & secluded & quiet.   The neighbors you'll see will all be wild animals & birds since we are surrounded by jungle and waterways.
host_about: NEAR... YET TOTALLY FAR OUT! Ranked #1 Specialty lodge in western Belize by TripAdvisor!  Lower Dover is close to the famous ATM Cave & a 15 min walk from a busy public bus stop in Unitedville yet you'll feel like you are on a secluded jungle isle surrounded by rivers.  You'll be sleeping atop Maya ceremonial grounds & surrounded by 100 acres of Maya ruins, exotic wildlife, nesting toucans, deep jungle & huge trees. Come explore nature trails, swim in fresh water streams, see nesting Toucans & learn about medicinal plants & Maya/British/Mennonites history.  Awake to sounds of the rainforest & an organic farm. There are clean, safe accommodations for every budget plus adventure tours, local food, warm hospitality & big on-site Maya ruins (est. population 10,000 in 900 A.D) hidden in the jungle just outside your cabana door. Centrally located in Cayo District location (between Belmopan & San Ignacio or a 2 hour ride from Hopkins) Lower Dover is a base camp for those traveling from the BZE international airport, the coast, cayes, or Tikal. If you are from Wisconsin, get your photo taken with Bucky Badger!  blog:  LDFieldJournal.wordpress.

name: Treehouse in Burrell Boom · ★4.71 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Burrell Boom is a lovely little rural village along the banks of the Old Belize river. The people here are extremely friendly. If you walk up to the village and stop for some food at Miss Carol's, a cold beer at Yellow Man's pub - right next door, you will be enchanted by this little village. If you want to do some Reggie dancing, head down to Henderson's Bank on Friday or Saturday night, just follow the music -- you can walk, but bring the flashlight! Everyone will welcome you. This is a small friendly village and I hope you will have the opportunity to meet and enjoy the company and food of the local people - they are wonderful. The Black Orchid is a 15 minute walk down a lovely rural road. Or, a ten minute bike ride - the house has two bikes, And, once you arrive, you can have a cool drink and slip into the pool: ahhhhhh. They will treat you like gold, slowly.
host_about: I am people person that enjoy meeting new people. I have been in the service business for the past 16 years and enjoy interacting with guest to share about culture and exciting experiences in Belize. I have a beautiful baby girl that is my entire world. I have a compassionate partner and we try our best to work as a team to grow our small business.

name: Rental unit in Belize · ★4.51 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Bay Breezes is located in a residential neighborhood with a taxi, Julio, right across the street and a grocery store within stone's throw distance. Another supermarket is a two minute walk away.  There are several small local food vendors in the area.  You can clearly see the Bay from the rooftop.
host_about: Friendly and responsible.  Recently retired Principal of the only High School on Caye Caulker. Like the freedom, carefree atmosphere of the island and the friendly, helpful people!  Love to share my knowledge and experience of growing up on La Isla Cariñosa!

name: Aparthotel in Caye Caulker · ★4.65 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The Cottages are located on a quiet back street in a residential neighborhood. The Garden Cottages are 2 blocks for the Oceanfront Hotel. The lots to the north is undeveloped and helps add to the privacy and tranquility of the location.
host_about: We have been in the lodging business 30 years primarily in Vail Colorado. We owned and operated the Minturn Inn for 10 years and most recently owned and operated Hotel Minturn. In conjunction with those we have run minturnrentals which specializes in vacation rentals in Minturn Colorado.  2009  we expanded to Caye Caulker Belize and now have 5 small vacation cottages and a boutique 12 unit Hotel, Weezie's Ocean Front Hotel and Garden Cottages. We have 3 grown children and love escaping the cold Colorado winter for some warmth and sunshine in Caye Caulker

name: Home in Copper Bank · ★4.84 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: We love the peace and quiet that comes with staying here. The security of the property is wonderful and those that live here are fun to visit with. We are located between the small villages of Copper Bank and Chunox.

name: Rental unit in Belize City · ★4.88 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood, located just 2.5 miles outside the city, is made up of mainly professional, upper middle class families. It is very quiet, and a welcome escape from the bustling, noisy city life. Close to public transportation, restaurants and supermarkets.
host_about:
I was born in Belize, but I travel back and forth between Los Angeles, Miami, Houston, Belize and the world! 
I am passionate about Belize and I love helping others discover its untouched beauty.
I enjoy traveling and learning about other cultures. To quote Maya Angelou, I believe that people "are more alike ... than we are unalike."
I enjoy making my guests feel at home and I look forward to hosting you.

name: Rental unit in Caye Caulker · ★4.97 · Studio · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood is a quiet, residential area. It's amazing for bird watching and we have a huge strangler fig tree in our yard that many types of birds come to eat from.
host_about:
We own a small vacation rental business on the island of Caye Caulker in the country of Belize. I, Hilary, am from Quebec, Canada and started spending my winters on Caye Caulker with my family when I was nine years old. I permanently moved to the island in 2001.
My husband, Pike, is from Orange Walk, a district in northern Belize. He moved to Caye Caulker for work in 1994, which is when we met and fell in love, and we got married in 2006 on Caye Caulker.
In 2007 our daughter, Lily, was born and our daughter, Ayla, was born in 2016.
I am a scuba instructor, Pike is a retired water taxi captain and we run our rental business together. 
We love to travel and enjoy having travellers stay with us. Our business is small and intimate, allowing us to ensure that your stay in Belize is authentic, creating memories for a lifetime.
Looking forward to meeting you!

name: Home in Caye Caulker · ★4.91 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
Guesthouse in San Pedro · ★4.82 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
My small guest house "Feathers" is in a local area. The ice cream guy cycles by daily with home made ice cream. The children play in the street. The fabulous older gentleman cycles by daily with his fruit and veggies for sale. There are lots of trees on the property. It is like a park.
Its so much better than a cookie cutter hotel or resort! Its home!
host_about:
I was born and raised in Africa.  My parents owned a remote, luxury lodge so I was raised in the bush in Africa.  After high school I travelled extensively  and ended up in Hawaii for over 25 years!  My son moved to the eastern USA and as it was so far from Hawaii, I decided to move closer to him.  Luckily I landed in Belize!  I have been here for 10 years.  My guest house keeps me busy and I love the Airbnb lifestyle!
Can't wait to meet you!

name: Condo in San Pedro · ★4.95 · 3 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The island of Ambergris Caye, “La Isla Bonita”, is a popular tourist destination. You can get here from the mainland either via an 15 minute flight or a 90 minute boat trip.

San Pedro, the only town on the island, has retained its charm while handling the growing number of visitors. Sunset Beach Resort is located 2.5 miles/4 km south of the town core, which means you are away from the crowds yet still within easy reach of everything.

Town is not far away when you want to go in for some live music, shopping, restaurants, etc. But there are things close by too; here are a few things within walking distance of Sunset Beach:

--Suya Tour operator (1 minute walk)
--Marin’s, a small grocery store (2 minute walk)
--A couple of nice restaurants (4-10 minute walk)
--Beach Bar & Grill (15 minute walk; breakfast, lunch, dinner, live music, outdoor bowling)

The Belize Barrier Reef, the longest in the western hemisphere, is just 1/2 mile (
host_about:
I've lived most of my life in the U.S. (where I am from) but have also lived for a couple of months to up to two years in different countries: Germany, Spain, Australia, Colombia, Ecuador, Mexico, & Belize. Since 2011 I've been living a somewhat nomadic lifestyle while exploring, working & volunteering in new & old places in the Americas and Europe. It's a great way to keep learning!

In my travels I stumbled upon the opportunity to do something that I love -- helping vacation rental owners help people like you with their dream vacations on Ambergris Caye, Belize!

I also have a condo in Cartagena, Colombia; if you're looking for a 30+ night stay (to volunteer; learn Spanish, salsa dancing, or scuba diving; work remotely with a Caribbean view; escape the winter...) let me know!

'Pack for a Purpose' is an organization that links travelers who'd like to help fulfill wish lists of non-profits in developing countries. I partner with them with schools, community organizations & animal rescue groups in both Colombia & Belize. These groups would love to have your help!

Not yet an AirBNB member? Join via this referral link and save $$ on your first booking, maybe even for a stay in Cartagena or Belize! : www.airbnb.com/c/bsmalley

name: Place to stay in Belize City · ★4.51 · 2 bedrooms · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Quiet and tranquility.  Safe
host_about: We have own the inn started from 2006, we enjoy our new friends. Either you are passing through for a day or two, or even long stay, we welcome you to come to our beautiful country of Belize.

name: Guesthouse in Caye Caulker · ★4.89 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Everything is at a walking distance. There are dive shops, snorkel shops, restaurants and convenient stores near the property.
We are located on Front Street (Golf Cart Traffic and people talking outside). At night its get a little quieter, i recommend to bring along (EARPLUGS) for a more quieter sleep.
This Studio is located above The Ice Cream 🍦 Shop on the second floor which open around 1:30pm and closed between 8 to 9:pm.
host_about: I'm Chila Ugarte, originally from Nicaragua, have been living on Caye Caulker for the pass 30 years.  I have 2 beautiful daughters. I have been in the tourism business for approximately 15+ years.  We consider our family of 3 to be very outgoing and happy, and we also have 1 beautiful dog LUNA (Blue pitt) that loves to meet new and repeated guest. We treat our guest with love, respect, kindnes and understanding and spect the same from our guest.

name: Home in Placencia · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The Island is private and peaceful, you can watch the boats travel up and down the canal from the seclusion of the front deck.
host_about: Hello, I am a freelance artist and manage rental properties. We have owned our house in Placencia since 2001, we purchased it right before Hurricane Iris! Placencia is a wonderful place with such character and beauty. I am proud to offer a clean and comfortable cabin for visitors to enjoy the small fishing village charm that has become one of the most popular destinations in Central America!

name: Condo in San Pedro · ★4.85 · 2 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
I love the peacefulness and tranquility of the area. Private beach, private pier, you can't beat it!
The proximity of Suya Tours is incredibly convenient, as they are one of the premier tour operators on the island.
There is also a convenient store on the corner with the main road into San Pedro, where you can get basic food stuffs.
host_about:
I am so fortunate to have been asked by my oldest best friend to host rentals at her Sunset Beach and Cartagena properties! Both of us share a love of Latin American culture that has continued to solidify our friendship over the years. 
I frequently travel to both locations to know thoroughly the rentals and destinations!

My home base is in Tucson, Arizona, close to the Mexican border and a culture that is very close to my heart. My love of Latin culture and the Spanish language was inspired by my Mexican grandmother. I have traveled extensively in Mexico, Central America and South America.  I have been a hiking guide in the southwest (including the Grand Canyon) since 2000 and currently operate a guiding company in the Copper Canyon region of Mexico, home to the world renowned Tarahumaran.

From Reef to Ruins
I am enamored with Ambergris Caye and Cartagena and hope the enthusiasm is contagious!  
Most visitors are attracted to Belize for the water. The Caribbean offers innumerable opportunities for exploration. Belizean waters boast a myriad of amazing sea creatures, among them the incredible, huge and docile manatee. This beautiful giant is everywhere threatened, but Belize boasts the largest number of remaining manatees in the world. Explore the water from diving and snorkeling to simply hanging out on the beach! 
As amazing as the water is, what I find particularly appealing is the multi ethnicity of Ambergris Caye. One can stroll from one end of a street in San Pedro and hear not only English, the official language, but Spanish, Belizean creole and several dialects of Mayan. Want to pick up another language? Here’s your opportunity! People are open, friendly and kind.
Cartagena is a city like no other. Stroll aimlessly the streets of this World Heritage Site with a mind to simply "take it all in".  There is so much history in this city! From forts and beautiful colonial buildings, to great restaurants and museums, the Old Walled City has it all. And of course there is the wall itself and the sea!
As in Belize, the Colombians are unbelievably friendly and the Cartageneros particularly so. The Caribbean openness and "laid back" culture infuse everyone and everything. Shop for a few days in the local supermarket, and you'll be having little old ladies asking your advice on which cut of meat to buy!

name: Home in Punta Gorda · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 3.5 baths
Villa in Maskall Village Belize District · ★3.67 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview: Picture a canvas of blue skies, between the canopy of an unspoiled rainforest; now breathe deep and evaporate into the sweet air as you are romanced by the music of Mother Nature, such is tropical Belize. In case you are unfamiliar with Belize, it is a melting pot of many different ethnic spices and tradition.  An intoxicating melange of lovely Mayan ruins, rare wildfire, and endless beauty is what Belize delivers.  Nature in its most exquisite form, from the jungles, to the water, opens herself to the adventure seeker in each of us!  One place can let you bask in the sun, snorkel in the water, or hike in the jungles without ever having to unpack and repack – without having to move from one hotel to another – adventure upon adventure await you or just relaxation and pampering.
host_about:
The resort and the spa were conceived and created in the 1980's by my sister and myself of American  and Trinidadian/Austrian decent - designer Franziska Nicholson and physician Dr. Veronika Nicholson. The world traveled and free spirited sisters harmoniously blended the various Mayan, Creole, and African designs side by side with the jungle setting. This unusual 
result is a relaxing, artistically natural environment with a vibrant flair. It is a successful combination of modern amenities, fine cuisine, a vibrant bar, hip music and a diverse spa.
My brother and his wife now manage the resort and greet the guests with a friendly Jungle vibe!

name: Guest suite in Belmopan · ★4.67 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: This is a wonderful neighborhood, with a mix of old Belizeans and new Belizeans of different immigration eras, including the Chinese and Central Americans.
host_about:
Hi, I like to work hard and play hard.  I multi-task and am engaged in many productive endeavors at any one time, but I also love to party and meet friends.  I enjoy reading for pleasure...not too serious material, and learning new languages.  I love to have intellectual discussion and debate...and I like swimming.

As your host, I will basically leave you your space, but am easily reachable for any questions or assistance you may need.  I like to provide an initial introduction to places, activities, and people in the immediate environment, so that you feel comfortable of your surroundings as soon as possible.  Because I work full time I am honest about the time when I can be available on any given day.

When I myself travel, I love to do so by road whenever possible and by staying at more basic accommodations, because I think that's when you best get to KNOW the people and place you visit.  I also like to have a fixed base and make day trips...something that is quite possible living in Belmopan, as it is in the center of the small but beautiful country of Belize.

It would be great if you choose to visit Belmopan, Belize, as the people and the country are multi-cultural, interesting, friendly and helpful.  I wish that someday you decide to grace us with a visit.

name: Bungalow in Belize · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
host_about:
The resort and the spa were conceived and created in the 1980's by my sister and myself of American  and Trinidadian/Austrian decent - designer Franziska Nicholson and physician Dr. Veronika Nicholson. The world traveled and free spirited sisters harmoniously blended the various Mayan, Creole, and African designs side by side with the jungle setting. This unusual 
result is a relaxing, artistically natural environment with a vibrant flair. It is a successful combination of modern amenities, fine cuisine, a vibrant bar, hip music and a diverse spa.
My brother and his wife now manage the resort and greet the guests with a friendly Jungle vibe!

name: Home in Caye Caulker · ★4.43 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Belizians are very friendly and kind here on the island. South Point is a very safe part of the island.
host_about: We fell in love with Caye Caulker back in 2005, and think that island life is just the best!

name: Serviced apartment in Placencia · ★4.88 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Quiet & secure neighborhood with distant lagoon & Maya mtn views with spectacular sunsets as well as distant sea & caye views with gorgeous sunrises. 5 min walk to beautiful beach.
host_about: ex-pat from Pt Reyes, CA, living in Placencia, Belize for many years, as well as yearly traveller to all parts of the world. I designed and built my property with custom mosaic tilework, lush tropical gardens offering Bananas, Coconuts, Mangoes, Papaya, Star & Passion fruits and more for guests to pick & enjoy with adjacent compost to feed our soil-enjoy many aspects of life, especially all living beings, yoga, meditation, reading, live music and performance-LOVE PUNTA!, gardening, cooking & baking, biking, hiking, kayaking, swimming, snorkeling, and travelling to distant places, meeting like minded people who appreciate life and all it's wonders....enjoy welcoming guests to Placencia and sharing my love of Belize and her varied people and awesome sites.

name: Condo in San Pedro · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The island of Ambergris Caye, “La Isla Bonita”, is a popular tourist destination. You can get here from the mainland either via an 15 minute flight or a 90 minute boat trip.

San Pedro, the only town on the island, has retained its charm while handling the growing number of visitors. Sunset Beach Resort is located 2.5 miles/4 km south of the town core, which means you are away from the crowds yet still within easy reach of everything.

Town is not far away when you want to go in for some live music, shopping, restaurants, etc. But there are things close by too; here are a few things within walking distance of Sunset Beach:

--Suya Tour operator (1 minute walk)
--Marin’s, a small grocery store (2 minute walk)
--A couple of nice restaurants (4-10 minute walk)
--Beach Bar & Grill (15 minute walk; breakfast, lunch, dinner, live music, outdoor bowling)

The Belize Barrier Reef, the longest in the western hemisphere, is just 1/2 mile (
host_about:
I've lived most of my life in the U.S. (where I am from) but have also lived for a couple of months to up to two years in different countries: Germany, Spain, Australia, Colombia, Ecuador, Mexico, & Belize. Since 2011 I've been living a somewhat nomadic lifestyle while exploring, working & volunteering in new & old places in the Americas and Europe. It's a great way to keep learning!

In my travels I stumbled upon the opportunity to do something that I love -- helping vacation rental owners help people like you with their dream vacations on Ambergris Caye, Belize!

I also have a condo in Cartagena, Colombia; if you're looking for a 30+ night stay (to volunteer; learn Spanish, salsa dancing, or scuba diving; work remotely with a Caribbean view; escape the winter...) let me know!

'Pack for a Purpose' is an organization that links travelers who'd like to help fulfill wish lists of non-profits in developing countries. I partner with them with schools, community organizations & animal rescue groups in both Colombia & Belize. These groups would love to have your help!

Not yet an AirBNB member? Join via this referral link and save $$ on your first booking, maybe even for a stay in Cartagena or Belize! : www.airbnb.com/c/bsmalley

name: Villa in San Pedro · 3 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Sunset Beach Condos is made up of 12 condos that sleep 1 to 8 persons. This oceanfront condo is located directly on the beach of the Caribbean Sea! The world’s 2nd largest Barrier Reef is a mere 1/3 mile out which breeds an abundance of tropical sea life. The fishing and snorkeling out front of this condo is AMAZING! Belize is famous for its’ TURQUOISE waters which are heavily populated with sting rays, sea turtles, manatee and a huge assortment of tropical fish. While snorkeling from our dock, you will mostly likely see sting rays, lobster, bone fish and the occasional dolphins.

With a large group? Ask about booking multiple condos.

We have the following condos available at Sunset plus I have more vacation rentals nearby to accommodate large groups including additional studio’s, 1 bedrooms, 2 bedrooms, and penthouses. Sunset has the following condos: ~ (2) 1 Bedroom Condo ~ (7) 3 Bedroom Condo ~ (3) 2 Bedroom Condos w/ 3rd loft bedrooms.

name: Rental unit in Belize City · ★4.89 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: This is a quiet, upper middle class neighborhood, comprised of professionals and business owners.
host_about:
I was born in Belize, but I travel back and forth between Los Angeles, Miami, Houston, Belize and the world! 
I am passionate about Belize and I love helping others discover its untouched beauty.
I enjoy traveling and learning about other cultures. To quote Maya Angelou, I believe that people "are more alike ... than we are unalike."
I enjoy making my guests feel at home and I look forward to hosting you.

name: Cabin in San Ignacio · ★4.68 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
host_about:
I'm fully vaccinated 
I love to travel I've been to north south and every country in central America I've done a bit of Europe and a spec of the middle East

I'm a gold standard hotel owner in San Ignacio and started a  new business similar to uber 

I'm a easy flexible person and looking forward to hosting you

name: Rental unit in San Pedro · ★4.94 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
I love the peacefulness and tranquility of the area!
Ambergris Caye is safe and secure!
A police substation is about 1 block south of us. We also have the South Ambergris Caye Neighborhood Watch association (610 4911), which has a patrol station just two buildings down from us. They are around all the time and are on 24 hour patrol.
We have never had a crime issue at our complex. Alvin, Chapin and crew are around and availablel 24/7

The proximity of Seaduced Tours and other operators are very convenient. All will pick you up at our priviate pier.
There is also a convenient food store on the corner with the main road into San Pedro, where you can also get Belikin!
host_about:
I am so fortunate to have been asked by my oldest best friend to host rentals at her Sunset Beach and Cartagena properties! Both of us share a love of Latin American culture that has continued to solidify our friendship over the years. 
I frequently travel to both locations to know thoroughly the rentals and destinations!

My home base is in Tucson, Arizona, close to the Mexican border and a culture that is very close to my heart. My love of Latin culture and the Spanish language was inspired by my Mexican grandmother. I have traveled extensively in Mexico, Central America and South America.  I have been a hiking guide in the southwest (including the Grand Canyon) since 2000 and currently operate a guiding company in the Copper Canyon region of Mexico, home to the world renowned Tarahumaran.

From Reef to Ruins
I am enamored with Ambergris Caye and Cartagena and hope the enthusiasm is contagious!  
Most visitors are attracted to Belize for the water. The Caribbean offers innumerable opportunities for exploration. Belizean waters boast a myriad of amazing sea creatures, among them the incredible, huge and docile manatee. This beautiful giant is everywhere threatened, but Belize boasts the largest number of remaining manatees in the world. Explore the water from diving and snorkeling to simply hanging out on the beach! 
As amazing as the water is, what I find particularly appealing is the multi ethnicity of Ambergris Caye. One can stroll from one end of a street in San Pedro and hear not only English, the official language, but Spanish, Belizean creole and several dialects of Mayan. Want to pick up another language? Here’s your opportunity! People are open, friendly and kind.
Cartagena is a city like no other. Stroll aimlessly the streets of this World Heritage Site with a mind to simply "take it all in".  There is so much history in this city! From forts and beautiful colonial buildings, to great restaurants and museums, the Old Walled City has it all. And of course there is the wall itself and the sea!
As in Belize, the Colombians are unbelievably friendly and the Cartageneros particularly so. The Caribbean openness and "laid back" culture infuse everyone and everything. Shop for a few days in the local supermarket, and you'll be having little old ladies asking your advice on which cut of meat to buy!

name: Home in Hopkins · ★4.79 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Blue Moon Cabana is situated on a private beachfront lot and because we're in a village we do have neighbors. Hopkins is a vibrant traditional village that comes alive early in the morning with the singing of tropical birds and the occasional rooster letting you know it's morning! If you're looking to experience the culture of a local village in Belize, Blue Moon Cabana is the perfect spot. If you require a more luxurious and fancier experience, you may be happier with a resort-type accommodation in the north and south outskirts of the village. There is a variety of accommodation options in and around Hopkins to meet the diverse needs of vacationers.

In Hopkins, you'll have access to the best Belize has to offer, including fabulous beaches and easy access to the Cayes, diving and snorkeling, nearby mountains and jungles, and much more.

host_about:
I've lived most of my life in the U.S. (where I am from) but have also lived for a couple of months to up to two years in different countries: Germany, Spain, Australia, Colombia, Ecuador, Mexico, & Belize. Since 2011 I've been living a somewhat nomadic lifestyle while exploring, working & volunteering in new & old places in the Americas and Europe. It's a great way to keep learning!

In my travels I stumbled upon the opportunity to do something that I love -- helping vacation rental owners help people like you with their dream vacations on Ambergris Caye, Belize!

I also have a condo in Cartagena, Colombia; if you're looking for a 30+ night stay (to volunteer; learn Spanish, salsa dancing, or scuba diving; work remotely with a Caribbean view; escape the winter...) let me know!

name: Cabin in Hopkins · ★4.73 · 1 bedroom · 10 beds · 6 baths
neighborhood_overview:
We are located just outside Hopkins Village (about 2 miles away), a very quiet and relaxing fisherman's Village. If you are expecting exciting nightlife and the hustle and bustle of a large tourist destination like say for example Cancun, don't come to Hopkins, you won't like it.

However if you like good, fishing, diving, snorkeling, river tours, waterfall hiking and jungle tours, quiet beaches and surprisingly good restaurants for a small place like Hopkins is, then Hopkins will be your place!

We think our area offers the perfect balance between an unspoiled laid back Carib-Belizean feeling with enough added amenities to make your stay very pleasant and relaxing.
host_about: I am an ex Registered Nurse and new to Hosting but getting the hang of things.  Hosting is like caring for my patients except that they are all healthy and willing and able to get involved with the activities which Belize has to offer.  I try to keep things clean and inviting and I am willing to assist wherever and whenever I can to make my guests stay more comfortable.

I am so fortunate to have been asked by my oldest best friend to host rentals at her Sunset Beach and Cartagena properties! Both of us share a love of Latin American culture that has continued to solidify our friendship over the years. 
I frequently travel to both locations to know thoroughly the rentals and destinations!

My home base is in Tucson, Arizona, close to the Mexican border and a culture that is very close to my heart. My love of Latin culture and the Spanish language was inspired by my Mexican grandmother. I have traveled extensively in Mexico, Central America and South America.  I have been a hiking guide in the southwest (including the Grand Canyon) since 2000 and currently operate a guiding company in the Copper Canyon region of Mexico, home to the world renowned Tarahumaran.

From Reef to Ruins
I am enamored with Ambergris Caye and Cartagena and hope the enthusiasm is contagious!  
Most visitors are attracted to Belize for the water. The Caribbean offers innumerable opportunities for exploration. Belizean waters boast a myriad of amazing sea creatures, among them the incredible, huge and docile manatee. This beautiful giant is everywhere threatened, but Belize boasts the largest number of remaining manatees in the world. Explore the water from diving and snorkeling to simply hanging out on the beach! 
As amazing as the water is, what I find particularly appealing is the multi ethnicity of Ambergris Caye. One can stroll from one end of a street in San Pedro and hear not only English, the official language, but Spanish, Belizean creole and several dialects of Mayan. Want to pick up another language? Here’s your opportunity! People are open, friendly and kind.
Cartagena is a city like no other. Stroll aimlessly the streets of this World Heritage Site with a mind to simply "take it all in".  There is so much history in this city! From forts and beautiful colonial buildings, to great restaurants and museums, the Old Walled City has it all. And of course there is the wall itself and the sea!
As in Belize, the Colombians are unbelievably friendly and the Cartageneros particularly so. The Caribbean openness and "laid back" culture infuse everyone and everything. Shop for a few days in the local supermarket, and you'll be having little old ladies asking your advice on which cut of meat to buy!

San Pedro, the only town on the island, has retained its charm while handling the growing number of visitors. Sunset Beach Resort is located 2.5 miles/4 km south of the town core, which means you are away from the crowds yet still within easy reach of everything.

host_about:
I've lived most of my life in the U.S. (where I am from) but have also lived for a couple of months to up to two years in different countries: Germany, Spain, Australia, Colombia, Ecuador, Mexico, & Belize. Since 2011 I've been living a somewhat nomadic lifestyle while exploring, working & volunteering in new & old places in the Americas and Europe. It's a great way to keep learning!

In my travels I stumbled upon the opportunity to do something that I love -- helping vacation rental owners help people like you with their dream vacations on Ambergris Caye, Belize!

I also have a condo in Cartagena, Colombia; if you're looking for a 30+ night stay (to volunteer; learn Spanish, salsa dancing, or scuba diving; work remotely with a Caribbean view; escape the winter...) let me know!

'Pack for a Purpose' is an organization that links travelers who'd like to help fulfill wish lists of non-profits in developing countries. I partner with them with schools, community organizations & animal rescue groups in both Colombia & Belize. These groups would love to have your help!

name: Cabin in Orange Walk, Belize · ★4.82 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Orange Walk is a true feel of small town Northern Belize. If you're coming in from Belize City, look out for the sugar factory at the entrance of the town (you'll see two smoke stacks on your right hand side). Acres and acres of cane fields line the highways and villages surrounding Orange Walk. We are also home to 2 of the 3 rum distilleries in Belize. An 8-minute drive will take you to the center of town. The street leading to the market is blocked off for pedestrians on Saturday mornings. Take a stroll and buy some fresh fruit.

Orange Walk is not one of the traditional tourist destinations in Belize. Come here for Mayan Temples, culture, Mestizo cuisine, rum, and friendly people.

If you like adventure, we offer tour of Lamanai Archaeological Site that depart from the riverside deck on the property. More info about this in the "other things to note" section.

....Or you can relax and do nothing. If you don't want to leave the property, Marac
host_about:
We should die with memories…not dreams

"Don't be satisfied with stories, how things have gone with others. Unfold your own myth.” 
― Rumi
neighbourhood: Orange Walk, Belize, Orange Walk, Belize

name: Home in San Pedro · ★4.92 · 6 bedrooms · 7 beds · 6.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Villa #2 is set in a private enclave of radiant and immaculately appointed vacation homes, surrounded by the crystal blue waters of the San Pedro laguna in a stunningly tranquil and prime location, only a half mile by water from the heart of San Pedro town. Our private water taxi provides complimentary scenic 3-5 minute  scheduled boat shuttles to/from San Pedro.
host_about:
Hi, I'm Corrina! 

I grew up outside of Toronto, Ontario but spent most of my adult life in British Columbia, Canada experiencing the fulfilling coastal and mountain culture.

In 2013, I took my first trip to Belize and now spend 6 months of the year on Ambergris Caye where I host a plethora of architecturally stunning oceanfront holiday homes to wonderful guests like you. These homes are ideal and can accommodate anywhere from 8 - 98 guests which are perfect for large groups, weddings, birthdays and other events.  

After a few years, and many guests requesting similar homes and services in the lush mountains of Belize,  I decided to expand our rental inventory and offer our guests a luxurious "Surf n" Turf" package that includes 3-4 nights in one of our island homes and 3-4 nights in one of our lush mountain villas in San Ignacio, Cayo. 
If you desire to experience Belize in a most epic way then we have something for every guest in modern, stylish, safe, comfortable and clean environments within the most desirable communities. 

If I am unable to be on location when guests arrive than one of my representatives will meet/greet you upon arrival, transfer you to our properties, and assist you with anything you may need. Our concierge is the finest!

We can’t wait to meet you and welcome you to beautiful Belize!
See you soon. 

Smiles!

Corrina Taylor

host_about:
My family owns a small Inn located in Belize on Ambergris Caye, called Blue Tang Inn.
I have been traveling to Belize since 2000. Our Inn has 14 suites located right on the beach in San Pedro Town. 
We have the best staff, who will take great care of all your needs during your stay.  It's nice to have local people around who can direct you to the best places to eat and the most fun tours available. The convenient location, nice room amenities (including full kitchen) and helpful staff make Blue Tang Inn an awesome experience.

name: Villa in Placencia · ★4.93 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview:
This home is in the residential area of Plantation. You are right on the beach here, and the It is just 4 miles to the village of Maya Beach, where there are a selection bars, restaurants and grocery stores.

There are many tour opportunities in the Placencia area; SCUBA, snorkeling, jungle river trips and fly fishing just to name a few. The fishing is world class and makes Placencia home to many well known international fishing outfitters. The diving make this a favorite destination for SCUBA enthusiasts. The offshore reef is the second largest in the world and is a thrill to both novice and seasoned divers. There is easy access to the Hummingbird highway leading north to the mountains and many famous rain forest lodges. There are also a number of day spas on the peninsula. You may just elect to stay home, walk the beach, swing in a hammock, read and enjoy being in beautiful Belize.
host_about:
I am marine biologist and love nature. Originally from Austria we traveled a lot and lived in different countries but somehow Belize doesn't let us go :-) We, my wife Simone and I, live in Maya Beach. For years we have now been working as property managers for several properties in the area. 
We love diving, dining out and a cold beer on our dock overlooking the beautiful canal just steps away from the Placencia lagoon.
We are very much looking forward to hosting you in the small country of Belize.

name: Rental unit in Maya Beach · ★4.86 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The property is located in a beautiful cul-de-sac. It has large local trees, providing lots of shade. You can walk to the nearby beach or restaurants which are very close by.
host_about:
I am marine biologist and love nature. Originally from Austria we traveled a lot and lived in different countries but somehow Belize doesn't let us go :-)

We, my wife and I, live on the property of Simberts Apartments. We love diving, dining out and a cold beer on our dock overlooking the beautiful canal just steps away from the Placencia lagoon. Especially, we love the tropical garden/jungle on the property and we love to observe the local animals which are around all the time like agoutis, iguanas, different types of birds, raccoons, etc.

We are easy going people, well educated and love to discuss various topics. Have as much or little interaction with us, everything is fine and up to you.

We also manage Winter´s Avalon which is our neighbor property and we will meet and greet guests of this property as well.

name: Farm stay in Unitedville · 1 bedroom · 14 beds · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: The immediate neighborhood is deep rain forest JUNGLE! Lower Dover's 100 acre lodge has creeks & a river as boundaries. There are unexcavated Maya Ruins just outside your door! The closest neighbors & village food is a 15 minute walk away. You will love the variety of local food offered in our village.  Guatemalan, Belizean Creole, Thai & Italian families sell terrific food if you wish to opt out of family dining at Lower Dover.
host_about: NEAR... YET TOTALLY FAR OUT! Ranked #1 Specialty lodge in western Belize by TripAdvisor!  Lower Dover is close to the famous ATM Cave & a 15 min walk from a busy public bus stop in Unitedville yet you'll feel like you are on a secluded jungle isle surrounded by rivers.  You'll be sleeping atop Maya ceremonial grounds & surrounded by 100 acres of Maya ruins, exotic wildlife, nesting toucans, deep jungle & huge trees. Come explore nature trails, swim in fresh water streams, see nesting Toucans & learn about medicinal plants & Maya/British/Mennonites history.  Awake to sounds of the rainforest & an organic farm. There are clean, safe accommodations for every budget plus adventure tours, local food, warm hospitality & big on-site Maya ruins (est. population 10,000 in 900 A.D) hidden in the jungle just outside your cabana door. Centrally located in Cayo District location (between Belmopan & San Ignacio or a 2 hour ride from Hopkins) Lower Dover is a base camp for those traveling from the BZE international airport, the coast, cayes, or Tikal. If you are from Wisconsin, get your photo taken with Bucky Badger!  blog:  LDFieldJournal.wordpress.
neighbourhood: Unitedville, Cayo District, Belize, Central America, Belize

name: Guest suite in Hopkins · ★5.0 · Studio · 2 beds · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: Hopkins is an extremely friendly village - you'll love it!  It's very safe and welcoming, and there are a variety of local restaurants and bars, in addition to the more upscale restaurants found in the "resort area" which is outside the village.

name: Guest suite in Hopkins · ★4.60 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: The locals are incredibly friendly and laid back in Hopkins - you'll love them!  There are a variety of nice local restaurants and bars in walking distance, and many more upscale places in the "resort area" a short distance away.  Just walking through Hopkins is extremely fun!

name: Treehouse in Bullet Tree Falls · ★4.89 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 2 shared baths
neighborhood_overview: The Mopan river, and free tubing.
host_about: Spending the night under a 100 foot guanacaste tree in a tree house is like nothing else! The lodge is surrounded on three sides by the Mopan River, so a refreshing swim in clear water is never far away and the wildlife of the area abound. Yes, parrots and toucans are in great number here, along with hundreds of other types of birds, making this an ideal location for bird watching.  Coati, agouti, otter, and the giant green iguana are among the many animals which are regular visitors to our beautiful gardens which, though lush and exotic, are virtually mosquito free.

name: Aparthotel in Caye Caulker · ★4.94 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Weezie's Ocean Front Hotel is located south of the main village towards the airport. It is a quiet section of the island and ideal spot for a relaxing vacation. It is one of the few areas on the island where there is not a road between the hotel and the beach.  It is about a 15 minute walk along  the beach to the center of town.
host_about: We have been in the lodging business 30 years primarily in Vail Colorado. We owned and operated the Minturn Inn for 10 years and most recently owned and operated Hotel Minturn. In conjunction with those we have run minturnrentals which specializes in vacation rentals in Minturn Colorado.  2009  we expanded to Caye Caulker Belize and now have 5 small vacation cottages and a boutique 12 unit Hotel, Weezie's Ocean Front Hotel and Garden Cottages. We have 3 grown children and love escaping the cold Colorado winter for some warmth and sunshine in Caye Caulker

name: Vacation home in Caye Caulker · ★4.51 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The gated and fenced in property is located on the island's only scenic, seaside jungle road close enough to the village shopping, grocery stores & restaurants for all your needs.  It is less than 1 mile from the village.  Please note: the whole island is only 2 1/2 miles long. Headlamps and/or flashlights are necessary for night travel to & from the Village on the bikes.  Or, golf cart taxis and rentals are readily available if you prefer.
host_about: We are an adventurous couple who love to travel. We are happy finding unique and exotic places by the sea to visit.  Our last vacation day, 10 years ago, on a whim, we discovered this amazing home of our dreams. We came for the sea but stayed for the beautiful people, only a short flight from our family seaside home in Cape Canaveral Fl.  We enjoy sharing them with other travelers.

name: Home in San Ignacio · ★4.95 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
We are in the rural area outside of San Ignacio town. The drive does not take more than around 15 minutes from downtown, but it can feel a bit farther.

Please review the location carefully on the map to see the proximity from town. If close proximity to San Ignacio town proper is important, this may not be the place for you unless you have a rental car. If you want a private and relaxing area with most of the comforts of home, but still be close enough to get to town quickly, this is the perfect place for you.
host_about: We are a retired couple from San Ignacio Town here in Belize. We developed the property as a family retreat over the years with plans to retire here eventually. We enjoy traveling and spending time with our kids and grandkids. We also enjoy hosting guests from all over the world and sharing our small slice of paradise with them. Our goal is to always provide exceptional hospitality to all our guests. See you soon!

name: Boutique hotel in Hopkins · ★4.88 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
host_about: I am Canadian born and raised in the far north. Came down to Belize and love it and after 2 years of visiting I bought a property and developed Latitude 17 over the last 11 years.  The village of Hopkins is a great location for being out in the sea or beach and close to jungle, Mayan ruins or any part of the country with a few hours.

name: Home in Santa Elena · ★4.97 · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: We are blessed to live in a quiet neighborhood right next to the Macal River and bridge that enters into the heart of San Ignacio town where  the market is located, wonderful restaurants and tourist attractions are many.  In just a 5 minute walk, you will be in the heart of San Ignacio / Cayo.
host_about:
Hello my name is Arturo, my wife is Maria and we have three grown children.  

My wife and I have been married for 24 years (2015) and still feel like it was yesterday. We have our oldest child,  at University in Guatemala studying law, my daughter is at college in Belize majoring in English and our youngest, is in High School. He enjoys music.

We are a very close, united family and have lived in Cayo for over 40 years.  We have a very large home that we would like to share with our guests.  We look forward to your visit.

Welcome!

name: Bed and breakfast in San Pedro · ★4.83 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Beachfront and only a short walk to the center of town. Lots of bars, restaurants and markets nearby.
host_about: I came to Belize on a whim with my best friend and ended up falling in love with the island and now calling it home. Together we run the restaurant/bar/hostel and you can always find us here.  We both love scuba diving and are happy to tell you all about our favorite spots.  We're both from Texas so don't be surprised to see the TV downstairs tuned into the Cowboys game every Sunday.  We would love to have you stay with us and fall in love with the beauty of the island. Feel free to ask any questions about Belize and I will do my best to point you in the right direction even if its not staying with us.

Guesthouse in Caye Caulker · ★4.64 · Studio · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
We are in the heart of Caye Caulker where Luciano Reyes Street meets Middle Street. We are in the thick of nightlife so if you are light sleeper this may not be the space for you.

Reggae Cafe' is a stone throw away, serving local budget friendly breakfast. A few doors down is the local super market and we’re a 5 minute walk to Caye Caulker’s front street restaurants and shops. If you feel like having a local libation the I&I Reggae Bar across the street is the place.
host_about: Born and raised in California and now living on a small island in Belize. I enjoy meeting travelers from all over the world while they visit our beautiful Island and Reef.

name: Boutique hotel in Bullet Tree Falls · 1 bedroom · 11 beds · 8 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Located on the banks of the Mopan River, our boutique resort is both a serene and scenic place for guests to rest in between tours or just lounge around with a good book. The quaint community of Bullet Tree is slow-paced though only a five minute drive from the bustling town of San Ignacio.

Whether you are in your room, on our hardwood veranda, on the banks of the Mopan River or by the pool you will enjoy being relaxed and pampered as our friendly staff caters to all your needs. We focus on bringing you an unsurpassed level of service in an elegant and comfortable setting.

name: Rental unit in Belize City · ★4.33 · 1 bedroom · 4 beds · 1 shared bath
host_about: We have own the inn started from 2006, we enjoy our new friends. Either you are passing through for a day or two, or even long stay, we welcome you to come to our beautiful country of Belize.

name: Home in San Pedro · ★4.77 · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Casa Redonda is located in a beautiful quiet area
where you will enjoy the spectacular views including the Hol Chan Marine Reserve and cool breeze from the sea.

name: Guest suite in San Pedro · ★4.84 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: The guest house is in a local neighbourhood.  This is not a resort.  I have iguanas lounging in the trees and it feels like home.
host_about:
I was born and raised in Africa.  My parents owned a remote, luxury lodge so I was raised in the bush in Africa.  After high school I travelled extensively  and ended up in Hawaii for over 25 years!  My son moved to the eastern USA and as it was so far from Hawaii, I decided to move closer to him.  Luckily I landed in Belize!  I have been here for 10 years.  My guest house keeps me busy and I love the Airbnb lifestyle!
Can't wait to meet you!

name: Bed and breakfast in San Pedro · ★4.96 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Marbucks Bed and Breakfast fka Day Dreamin' Bed and Breakfast is tucked into the prestigious Tres Cocos neighborhood on the north end of Ambergris Caye.  This area is primarily composed of large, beachfront, residential homes and is quiet and very safe.
host_about: Avid divers and lovers of adventure, good people and great wine, Ambergris Caye was a natural fit when we decided to semi-retire to Belize.  In June of 2014, we broke ground on a unique cluster of luxe cabanas - unlike any other on the island - the kind of place we would want to stay and the kind of place we can readily host others.  We'd love for Daydreamin' to serve as the backdrop for the wonderful getaway you deserve.  Come see us soon.
neighbourhood: San Pedro, Ambergris Caye, Belize, Belize

name: Rental unit in Belize City · ★4.74 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Bella Vista is a sought after area of Belize City that is safe and quiet and is only a 2 minutes walk to the Caribbean Sea!
host_about: A Belizean local that have been throughout the country of Belize. If you come to Belize I can guide you with different location throughout Belize and inform you of where all the great deals are!

name: Home in Hattieville Village, Belize District · ★4.25 · 3 bedrooms · 7 beds · 1 bath
host_about: Family man with 5 children. Trying to raise all kids properly and make a decent living at the same time. Love to travel with family on road trips so know what it means to go 'home' to a place that feels like home and has what is needed to create a memorable stay. Therefore I am offering my home for your service and enjoyment. It is a comfy little home and has a lot of privacy and is in a very secure area outside of Hattieville. There is a full-time caretaker on site who looks after your well being and safety.  Please enjoy!!

name: Cabin in Unitedville · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: There are no other cabanas in Belize so close to the main highway yet so wild and centrally located in the Cayo District of western Belize. Our exotic jungle paradise is 1/2 mile / .8 kilometers from the George Price (Western) Highway that connects Belize City with Guatemala. Centrally located in UNITEDVILLE in the Cayo District location between Belmopan & San Ignacio, it’s a base camp for those traveling from the BZE international airport, the coast, cayes, or Tikal.  Despite it’s easy highway access, Lower Dover is secluded on 99 acres of old growth rain-forest on the Belize River, on top of a newly discovered Maya ceremonial center.
host_about: NEAR... YET TOTALLY FAR OUT! Ranked #1 Specialty lodge in western Belize by TripAdvisor!  Lower Dover is close to the famous ATM Cave & a 15 min walk from a busy public bus stop in Unitedville yet you'll feel like you are on a secluded jungle isle surrounded by rivers.  You'll be sleeping atop Maya ceremonial grounds & surrounded by 100 acres of Maya ruins, exotic wildlife, nesting toucans, deep jungle & huge trees. Come explore nature trails, swim in fresh water streams, see nesting Toucans & learn about medicinal plants & Maya/British/Mennonites history.  Awake to sounds of the rainforest & an organic farm. There are clean, safe accommodations for every budget plus adventure tours, local food, warm hospitality & big on-site Maya ruins (est. population 10,000 in 900 A.D) hidden in the jungle just outside your cabana door. Centrally located in Cayo District location (between Belmopan & San Ignacio or a 2 hour ride from Hopkins) Lower Dover is a base camp for those traveling from the BZE international airport, the coast, cayes, or Tikal. If you are from Wisconsin, get your photo taken with Bucky Badger!  blog:  LDFieldJournal.wordpress.

name: Nature lodge in Belmopan · ★4.83 · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Jaguar Creek is nestled in the middle of the rainforest about a 30 minute drive outside of Belmopan. The location is central to all the adventures the mainland of Belize has to offer! We're across the highway from Blue Hole National Park and a few minute drive from Llamanai Chocolate. Organize a tour to visit the ATM caves, go horseback riding or ziplining. Due to our remote location access to wi-fi is very limited and sometimes non-existent depending on the weather. We welcome you to unplug and reconnect with nature.
host_about:
We are a spiritually-minded social enterprise that seeks to fill our guests with awe through a truly unique experience while making a positive difference in our local community. 

We not only support local entrepreneurs, limit our environmental impact and develop local talent but we also donate a large percentage of our profits to PathLight International, an innovative non-profit organization that is changing the lives of children, teachers and local communities immediately around Jaguar Creek. We’re confident that PathLight is helping shape the future leaders of this great nation.

When you stay with us you help create positive change in the lives of our friends and neighbors who live in one of the most economically-disadvantaged areas in all of Latin America.

name: Place to stay in Belmopan · ★4.29 · 2 bedrooms · 5 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: We're nestled in one of the most beautiful - and most economically depressed - regions in the world. Jaguar Creek has been a life-giving partner with our local villages for many years and we're proud of the progress many of our neighbors have made. We believe we should be part of the solution to the poverty our friends and neighbors experience. And by staying with us you can be a part of that solution too.
host_about:
We are a spiritually-minded social enterprise that seeks to fill our guests with awe through a truly unique experience while making a positive difference in our local community.

name: Rental unit in Placencia · ★4.94 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Dolce Cabana is situated in the private, safe, and conveniently located Harbour Place neighborhood of Placencia - only a 5-minute walk to the nearest amenities. Harbour Place is a premier marina, flanked by canals and waterways. It is an established community with long-term owners. Our guests love our location, so close to everything, yet set back for the quiet, security and privacy they seek.
host_about: I first came to Belize 24 years ago, fell in love, and bought a lot in Placencia Village. A few years later I built a house and later expanded it to include 3 one-bedroom apartments. I enjoy being a host and  sharing my knowledge and recommendations with my guests! For those who fall in love with Belize like I did, I offer my services as a real estate agent with Re/Max 1st Choice.

name: Rental unit in San Pedro · ★4.88 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Although we are close to everything, we are tucked back into a residential neighborhood that is fairly quiet and the ocean is a 2 minute stroll from your front door. Our neighborhood is safe and you will feel comfortable walking around no matter if it is day or night. We have bars and restaurants close by in walking distance. We are located near the airstrip, However, we are at the sweet spot where the planes have either already taken off or are coasting in for their landing, so it is pretty quiet, considering. For those that prefer a gym to the beach for a work out, it is just down the road from us and day passes to the pool are available for our guests!

*Please note that we are not on the beach - especially when you are reviewing the property "Location" category after your stay. We work really hard to do everything we can to ensure that all our reviews are 5 stars in all categories in order to keep our Superhost rating; but we cannot change our location on the island. If
host_about:
Gold Standard Certified Property Owner, all units are certified and available for guests. 

I'm Lisa, I first visited Belize in 2016 and fell in love with the feel of the country of Belize. Every region has it's own magic, but I found mine on Ambergris Caye in San Pedro. The people are the friendliest that you will find anywhere and will make you feel welcome! 

I am not just an Abnb host that has an extra bedroom or unit to rent out and want to make a few extra bucks.  Belize Tropical Dream Villas is a unique property with an invested and hospitality trained owner. This property and the guests that stay with me are the heart of my business!  

My life dreams and goals have included being near the ocean for years now and I have the heart for hospitality.  After getting dual degrees in Hospitality Management and Culinary Arts, I began looking for a place to make my dream a reality!  

Belize met my 5 criteria: 
1. Close to the ocean  
2. English speaking  
3. Easy currency conversion
4. Affordable and fairly quick for our guests to get to 
5. Affordable to purchase inside our means

When the opportunity was presented to be able to purchase an apartment building in my favorite city - I decided to make a leap of faith and catch my dream! 

I am excited to share the island with you, help you feel comfortable and at home here, and most important - ensure that you have a most memorable vacation filled with experiences unique to the beautiful country of Belize!  

- Your Host, Lisa

name: Bed and breakfast in Teakettle · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Relax and play right on the Chaya Maya reserve.  Take a ride down the Belize River by motor boat, canoe or tube. Take a jungle nature hike, pick your own fruit, birdwatch, view and hear wildlife, or relax in paradise.
host_about: My Husband Gregg and I are owners of Chaya Maya Jungle Lodge and Calypso Beach Retreat in Belize.
property_type: Private room in bed and breakfast

name: Resort in San Pedro · ★4.72 · 1 bedroom · 4 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Caribbean Villas hotel is an Oceanside property which includes a private dock for swimming and snorkelling. The property is just a 10 minute walk along the beach into town.
