name: Place to stay in Dangriga · ★4.60 · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 1 bath
Home in Placencia · ★4.73 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The Placencia peninsula is an amazing place.  It is a narrow spit of land, only a couple hundred yards wide, so easy to get from sea to lagoon in a matter of moments.  Each has different things to offer - the oceanside has the beach, which offers easy swimming, but the lagoon has more wildlife and 'character', with dolphins, manatees, local fishermen and the everchanging clouds/mountains/sunsets to enjoy.  It is a growing village, with more bars and restaurants each season to enjoy, including our favourites the Maya Beach Bistro, Mangoes and Singing Sands.
host_about:
I am marine biologist and love nature. Originally from Austria we traveled a lot and lived in different countries but somehow Belize doesn't let us go :-) We, my wife Simone and I, live in Maya Beach. For years we have now been working as property managers for several properties in the area. 
We love diving, dining out and a cold beer on our dock overlooking the beautiful canal just steps away from the Placencia lagoon.
We are very much looking forward to hosting you in the small country of Belize.

name: Home in Caye Caulker · ★4.86 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Rental unit in Maya Beach · ★4.67 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The property is located in a beautiful cul-de-sac. It has large local trees, providing lots of shade. You can walk to the nearby beach or restaurants which are very close by.
host_about:
I am marine biologist and love nature. Originally from Austria we traveled a lot and lived in different countries but somehow Belize doesn't let us go :-)

We, my wife and I, live on the property of Simberts Apartments. We love diving, dining out and a cold beer on our dock overlooking the beautiful canal just steps away from the Placencia lagoon. Especially, we love the tropical garden/jungle on the property and we love to observe the local animals which are around all the time like agoutis, iguanas, different types of birds, raccoons, etc.

We are easy going people, well educated and love to discuss various topics. Have as much or little interaction with us, everything is fine and up to you.

We also manage Winter´s Avalon which is our neighbor property and we will meet and greet guests of this property as well.

name: Villa in San Pedro · ★4.75 · 6 bedrooms · 9 beds · 6 baths
neighborhood_overview: We are located in the safest neighborhood on the island.  We are part of the South Ambergris Caye Neighborhood watch and have private security patrol for our entire neighborhood.

name: Cabin in San Ignacio · ★4.97 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
We are in the rural area outside of San Ignacio town. The drive does not take more than around 15 minutes from downtown, but it can feel a bit farther.

Please review the location carefully on the map to see the proximity from town. If close proximity to San Ignacio town proper is important, this may not be the place for you unless you have a rental car. If you want a private and relaxing area with most of the comforts of home, but still be close enough to get to town quickly, this is the perfect place for you.
host_about: We are a retired couple from San Ignacio Town here in Belize. We developed the property as a family retreat over the years with plans to retire here eventually. We enjoy traveling and spending time with our kids and grandkids. We also enjoy hosting guests from all over the world and sharing our small slice of paradise with them. Our goal is to always provide exceptional hospitality to all our guests. See you soon!

name: Bungalow in Belmopan · ★4.93 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Security wise, this is a safe neighborhood, the property is fenced, the house has security bars, there is good night-time lighting and we have caring observant neighbours.
host_about:
Hi, I like to work hard and play hard.  I multi-task and am engaged in many productive endeavors at any one time, but I also love to party and meet friends.  I enjoy reading for pleasure...not too serious material, and learning new languages.  I love to have intellectual discussion and debate...and I like swimming.

As your host, I will basically leave you your space, but am easily reachable for any questions or assistance you may need.  I like to provide an initial introduction to places, activities, and people in the immediate environment, so that you feel comfortable of your surroundings as soon as possible.  Because I work full time I am honest about the time when I can be available on any given day.

When I myself travel, I love to do so by road whenever possible and by staying at more basic accommodations, because I think that's when you best get to KNOW the people and place you visit.  I also like to have a fixed base and make day trips...something that is quite possible living in Belmopan, as it is in the center of the small but beautiful country of Belize.

It would be great if you choose to visit Belmopan, Belize, as the people and the country are multi-cultural, interesting, friendly and helpful.  I wish that someday you decide to grace us with a visit.

name: Home in Benque Viejo Del Carmen · ★4.94 · 5 bedrooms · 5 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview: Better in Belize (BIB) is an Eco-Community in the Mayan Mountains in the Cayo District of Belize. The community boost a community garden, a recreation area, many roads to hike and explore. We are 10.5 miles from Benque which has many attractions and supplies. San Ignacio is also close with a daily market, restaurants and lots of opportunities to explore.
host_about: A Professional Photographer from Kitchener, Ontario Canada. We host three workshops a year in Belize at Casa Santa Maria.
neighbourhood: Benque Viejo Del Carmen, Cayo, Belize, Belize

name: Boutique hotel in Hopkins · ★4.88 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
host_about: I am Canadian born and raised in the far north. Came down to Belize and love it and after 2 years of visiting I bought a property and developed Latitude 17 over the last 11 years.  The village of Hopkins is a great location for being out in the sea or beach and close to jungle, Mayan ruins or any part of the country with a few hours.

name: Cottage in Caye Caulker · ★4.86 · Studio · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Beautiful ocean view capturing the natural breeze, very relaxing, private and quite for after hours.
host_about:
My name is Amiela Ash (also know as Amie), I am a born Belizean and raised in the southern region of Belize, Toledo District, in a remote village called San Pedro Columbia. While I was attending college, I would regularly come to Caye Caulker to work  part time jobs. After  accomplishing my college degree in 2008 I fell in love with the island and eventually moved to reside in Caye Caulker. 
Ever since my stay, I have been working at various businesses within the island gaining invaluable experiences, meeting many faces and knowing the areas within my community. I then worked for Caye Caulker Rentals, now known as Caye Caulker Vacation Homes as a receptionist, then promoted to manager and eventually became the new owner of the business. 
As the new owner of the Caye Caulker Vacation Homes,  my goal is for you (guest) to spend quality time at this island, with quality services and hospitality offered by my business.

name: Aparthotel in Caye Caulker · ★4.92 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Weezie's is located  south of the main village in a quiet section of the island. It is a 15 minute walk up the coast on the beach path to town or a quick bike ride.
host_about: We have been in the lodging business 30 years primarily in Vail Colorado. We owned and operated the Minturn Inn for 10 years and most recently owned and operated Hotel Minturn. In conjunction with those we have run minturnrentals which specializes in vacation rentals in Minturn Colorado.  2009  we expanded to Caye Caulker Belize and now have 5 small vacation cottages and a boutique 12 unit Hotel, Weezie's Ocean Front Hotel and Garden Cottages. We have 3 grown children and love escaping the cold Colorado winter for some warmth and sunshine in Caye Caulker

name: Resort in San Pedro · 12 bedrooms · 13 beds · 13 baths
neighborhood_overview:
White sand beach, mature coconuts, Caribbean sea, and barrier reef.
Entire retreat is built directly on 200' sandy beach with private pier.
Only thing between rooms and sea is sand!
Barrier reef 1/2 mile - Mata Grande cut.

name: Bed and breakfast in Crooked Tree · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
We are located in a quiet area well removed from the village life but still easily accessible if the need arises.

The location is ideally suited for birding enthusiasts with access to local trails and the nearby lagoon.
host_about:
I am the reservation manager of the bed and breakfast owned and managed by my sister Becky and her husband Robert. 

We are natives of Crooked Tree Village. We have lived abroad for several years and returned home. We are active in our local church,  nature lovers. 
Becky is a great cook & an avid gardener. 
I’m an avid birder & loves gardening and outdoors as well. 
  
Motto:
Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; in all your ways submit to him, and he will make your paths straight. Proverbs 3: 5-6
property_type: Private room in bed and breakfast

name: Home in Bullet Tree Falls · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
Rental unit in San Pedro · ★4.91 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: We are located in the quaint Boca del Rio district in the town of San Pedro. The beach stroll  is a host to many beach bars, restaurants, dive shops, tour guides and water sport activities. Always lots to do on Boca del Rio beaches.
host_about: We purchased property on the beautiful Island of Ambergris Caye in the Town of San Pedro in 2013. Since we have been busy adding on to our property to create Casa del Rai guest house. We want to be your home away from home each and every time you visit this beautiful Island. We know you will fall in love just as we have. We spend 6-8 months here a year and enjoy the long summer days back in Canada. We have never looked back since our decision to move her...our smiles get bigger each and every day.

name: Rental unit in San Pedro · ★4.78 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Tropical setting. The nearest neighbors are miles away.
World famous Tranquility Bay and Margaritaville are 3 miles away.
1 mile to convenience stores.
host_about:
Traveled more than 20 countries,
Chose Belize as a final destination.

name: Home in Ambergris Caye · ★4.90 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Our home is located 10 miles north of San Pedro Town on a beautiful white sand beach at Sapphire Beach Resort. There is a charming Tiki bar and restaurant onsite but you can also purchase your own groceries. If you are looking for peace and quiet but also want to be accessible to town, the restaurants and the some of the best diving/snorkeling in the Caribbean, our home is what you are looking for!
host_about:
I am a person who loves adventure travel to exotic locations which is why I fell in love with Belize. From being in the jungle on the mainland to diving and hitting the beach on Ambergris Caye, Belize offers something for everyone who loves the outdoors.  We love to share our second home with guests who appreciate the beauty of Belize and the charm of its people.
There is no other place I would rather be than sitting on my front porch looking out at the Caribbean sea. It's a dream come true for us and hope all of our guests enjoy our home as much as we do.

name: Place to stay in Belize City · ★4.17 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
host_about: We have own the inn started from 2006, we enjoy our new friends. Either you are passing through for a day or two, or even long stay, we welcome you to come to our beautiful country of Belize.

name: Home in Caye Caulker · ★4.70 · 6 bedrooms · 10 beds · 4.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: North Caye Caulker is the newly developing part of Caye Caulker and boasts colorful water, great fishing, snorkeling and plenty of safe space to enjoy SUPs and kayaking!
host_about: I am on airbnb to make connections, share the views, the warmth, and the adventure that brought me to my homes around the world.

name: Condo in San Pedro · ★4.79 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview:
This three-bedroom island rental is in a friendly village-style resort with a tropical vibe. It's located 10 miles north of San Pedro on Ambergris Caye in Belize. The second largest barrier reef in the world is right outside our door. Belize is known for world-class diving and snorkeling, as well as fly fishing and deep sea fishing.

This is not a big loud party resort, this is a laid-back, tranquil and peaceful resort for nature-appreciating, adventurous types who want to wind down and leave the fast pace of San Pedro town behind.

This rental is remote and secluded. Be ready for adventure!
host_about: I've always loved to travel, but I found my home in Belize.  I step off the plane in Belize City, and my outlook changes.  At home, I'm busy, hard-working, and driven.  In Belize, I'm just relaxed and happy.  I can't wait until Relaxed and Happy becomes my full-time thing.  In a few years I'll retire and live in my condo full-time, but until then, you're all welcome to enjoy it.

name: Condo in Placencia Village · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Stroll the historic Placencia sidewalk for an array of food choices, watch children fish from the pier, or grab a beer at a beach bar and listen to local music as the sun sets over the Caribbean.

All within 3 minutes of driving and about 5 minutes of driving to down town.

name: Treehouse in Bullet Tree Falls · ★4.89 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 2 shared baths
neighborhood_overview: The Mopan river, and free tubing.
host_about: Spending the night under a 100 foot guanacaste tree in a tree house is like nothing else! The lodge is surrounded on three sides by the Mopan River, so a refreshing swim in clear water is never far away and the wildlife of the area abound. Yes, parrots and toucans are in great number here, along with hundreds of other types of birds, making this an ideal location for bird watching.  Coati, agouti, otter, and the giant green iguana are among the many animals which are regular visitors to our beautiful gardens which, though lush and exotic, are virtually mosquito free.

name: Cabin in Belize District · ★4.81 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Peaceful, eco friendly, environment with all the modern amenities, inside a cabin .
host_about:
I’m a Native Belizean living in Belize City with my beautiful wife and daughters. We’d love to host you, your friends or family in any of our exclusive properties. The Eco Monkey Cabin is a tourist favorite, with its private lake tucked into the heart of Isabella Bank jungle. 

This cabin was a labor of love, that took me two months to build. My family and I have created an outdoor private hideaway for relaxing, reading, or simply doing what we Belizeans call “Go slow” (don’t be in a rush for anything :)

I will be your super-guide, driving you to and from tours, arranging adventures and ensuring that your trip is one worthy of (Hidden by Airbnb) . Looking forward to meeting you!

name: Cabin in San Ignacio · ★4.83 · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: We have a lot of land to run around in. Our neighborhood is pretty quiet, safe, and everyone minds their own business. Like the rest of Central America, we too have dogs and the whole block does as well, so bring ear plugs because sometime they can get loud and annoying. Our dogs are in the main house's property so if you want no interaction with them, so be it.
host_about: As travelers, we know the struggle it is to find sites to see & activities to do in a country you’ve never been before, and most importantly to find a perfect place to rest after a long day of exploring. Therefore, not only do we provide a relaxing environment, but also free travel agency services to our guests. We feel as though we are still new at running things on Airbnb; nevertheless, we will continue to be the host that we would like to be hosted by.

name: Home in Caye Caulker · ★4.79 · 4 bedrooms · 5 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview: Our location is toward the southern end of the Caye. It is just around the corner from the Caye Caulker Airport, which has a newly built airstrip. Tropic Air and Mayan Air provide several round trip daily flights from Belize City which are less than 10 minutes duration. The village or main town is a few blocks away, and is about a ten minute ride by golf cart. It is easily accessible by foot or bicycle as well. Public beaches are in the village. Our street, Avenida Mangle, has both private residences and vacation properties. The neighborhood is dense with palms, and beautiful tropical foliage lines the sandy streets.
host_about:
Joi de Vivre -  Passion Victim - La Vie En Rose Everyday
When I'm not bringing music to the people, you'll find me bummin in Belize.

name: Home in Belize City · ★4.58 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The river is close by about a 5 -10 minutes walk away. You can also enjoy a canoe tour or fishing experience as you take in all the natural scenery of wild life and howler monkeys all near by.
ALSO, CLOSE BY you will find the amazing Belize Zoo, the Howler Monkey Sanctuary, Mayan ruins, Cave-tubing and Zip-lining, local exotic wine makers. You can also drive to the city and take the local ferry to Caye Caulker or San Pedro where you can go out for the day or an overnight at one of my other 5 Airbnbs to explore the island kayaking, snorkeling/diving on the reef or even rent a sail boat.

name: Aparthotel in Ambergris Caye · ★4.84 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
A Stunning, Untouched Eden on the island of Ambergris Caye, Belize.

At our Resort, the rush of time slows. The resort is beckoning guests to one of the world's last unspoiled paradises. Shape your holiday at this secluded beach resort.

Explore the underwater treasures of one of the world's premier dive locations in the Caribbean; Belize which is known for their MesoAmerican; the second largest barrier reef in the world and the Grand Blue Hole.

Sip a cocktail on your private terrace as you watch the sun dip below the horizon. Or simply lounge on the white coral sand and soak up the radiant sun. Escape to this tranquil, wonderfully relaxed choice of beach resort.

Nestled on the tip of North; Ambergris Caye Belize, 9 miles north of San Pedro town.

Imagine a romantic vacation for you both; or a wonderful vacation with your family or favorite friends. You can sit back & chill, Relax in your style of vacation; “a glass of wine with that

name: Bed and breakfast in Orange Walk · ★4.96 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: We are not in town but have 4 permanent neighbors along our dirt road. All are friendly and all are Belizean to the bone.   Please note that IF you are community minded, we have a friend who is starting village library nearby and if you want to slip a few gently used books for young people in your suitcase, we can find them a good home. ( especially biographies!)
host_about: Bart was born here in Orange Walk, Barb  in Pennsylvania (former Peace Corps volunteer).Barb has worked as a dental hygienist and a mom, Bart as a teacher and conservation here and a US VocationalTeacher. We are pretty easy to get along with, as long as we are fed and dry and have our nap. We enjoy receiving visitors who know more than we do about anything except maybe fried Twinkies or satan worship.
neighbourhood: Orange Walk, Orange Walk District, Belize
property_type: Private room in bed and breakfast

name: Cabin in San Ignacio  · ★4.79 · 2 bedrooms · 5 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is small, we live at the top of the hill and have three neighbors that are local. Very private, very safe and we love it. If your staying July, Aug, Sep, enjoy two very high producing Avocado trees. Jun, July, and Aug, enjoy native fruit of our mango trees. We also have a Bread fruit tree, Feb,March, April, and May. They are used like potatoes, boil, bake or fry!!! Two huge almond trees that produce all year long. A tamarin fruit tree, Nov, Dec, and Jan. They are pod looking, eat, or make fresh Tamarin juice. Coconut trees and one banana tree. Also go pick leafs off the all spice tree, boil in pot and the smell is amazing and drink as tea!
host_about:
Hello, We are Rose and Nancy Vella, we are natives to Sonoma County California. We have known each other since 1977, and got legally married January 18, 2015 at our beautiful Bodega Head, with our 4 closest friends. We had our big wedding 5/15/15 for our family and friends. Rose bought our Belize home in 2011, as an investment and a retirement get away. We are both lovers of travel, traveling in our trailer, camping, going to SF Giants games, going to concerts, and old cars. Rose has been to Europe twice to spend time with her family in Malta. She has also traveled around Italy, Greece, Canada, England, Hawaii, Mexico,Belize, Costa Rica, and the caribbean.
Not to mention various places with in the US.  I'v been to Mexico, Hawaii and Belize. We own two 55 Chevy's and are avid car show participants. Rose drove me to school my sophomore year everyday in that car and we of course had some of or favorite wedding photos taken in our yellow and white 55. 
We take care of my 83 year old dad, nicknamed DADDY-O. So when we need some much needed time away, well you know where we head...... Thats right 
our lovey little casita in San Ignacio Belize. 
Roses motto is " Do It Once, Do It Right" 
So that's how she lives her life!
As for me..... Well my motto is " Everyday Is A Good Day, Some Are Just Better Than Others"

name: Condo in San Pedro · ★4.83 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: This complex is just a block away from the turquoise Caribbean sea and white beach. It is conveniently located close to supermarkets,a hardware store, a bakery, gas station, restaurants and bars, golf cart rental and a church.
host_about: Hummingbird Island Suites is owned by Hummingbird Furnishings, an award winning Belizean family business. On October 5th 1987, Robert and Yvette Lopez humbly began crafting furniture in their garage. Today, Hummingbird Furnishings has become Belize's premier furniture manufacturer, furnishing the finest resorts and homes across Belize. In 2015, they ventured into the hospitality business with locations in San Pedro, Ambergris Caye and Maya Beach on the Placencia peninsula. Both locations have private vacation suites with accommodations for up to 20 guests to enjoy a quiet, comfortable and affordable vacation. Each suite is personally decorated and accessorized for guests to feel at home.

name: Home in Long Caye · ★4.72 · 2 bedrooms · 6 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
There are no neighbors, roads, stores, trinket shops - nada. You must bring all your supplies with you. The vat water at the house is perfect for cooking, washing and drinking - but if you get nervous about that, bring a 5 gallon water container for the cooler. No Montezuma's revenge, but if you're sensitive, play it safe. Myself, I drink the water here but not in Houston where I keep an apartment LOL.

If you need an overnight stay out of Houston, I have a rental there and can send you a discounted price. Houston to Long Caye is a 2.5 hour flight :-)

The resorts are usually busy, so if you are looking for interaction, they are warm, welcoming and very friendly! That being said, the resorts could also be empty and you'll be the only persons on the island - Run naked in the warm wind and howl at the evening moon, being feral is allowed.

It is one of the most beautiful places on earth. Quiet and tranquil. It's my escape from the "real world" and when not
host_about: World traveler looking for the next adventure! If I'm in your city, I'm probably on assignment as a professional photographer :-) My life goal is to visit as many places as possible and document my experiences there - maybe one day I'll publish that travel book.....

name: Bungalow in Cristo Rey · ★4.97 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Cristo Rey Village, Cayo, Belize is the perfect destination for nature-lovers of all ages. From its beautiful tropical diverse wildlife to its stunning river and foothills of Mountain Pine Ridge, this village offers a unique and breathtakingly beautiful experience. For those who love the outdoors, there is plenty to do. Enjoy a leisurely stroll through our lush jungle property, explore the crystal clear Macal river that flows by our property or take our kayak out for even more pristine nature viewing. You can also take a dip in the refreshing waters of the local waterfalls. For those who want to explore the local culture, visit the nearby Mayan ruins, or take a trip to nearby San Ignacio. There are plenty of activities for the adventurer in you, from ziplining to horseback riding. With so much to offer, Cristo Rey Village, Cayo, Belize is the perfect destination for you!

Lucky Dreamer Lodge is in a beautiful place to vacation, mostly because of all the wonderful Belizeans th
host_about:
Hi, we are Cheryl & Jeff, founders of Lucky Dreamer Lodge in San Ignacio Belize. 

Check us out online at @lucky_dreamer_lodge 

We have extensive experience in the hospitality industry with over 33 years of combined experience at Walt Disney World and another 10+ years of joint experience in owning/operating our own restaurant, Herb Farm, and Bed & Breakfast in the states.

We strive to exceed our guests' expectations!

host_about: We have been in the lodging business 30 years primarily in Vail Colorado. We owned and operated the Minturn Inn for 10 years and most recently owned and operated Hotel Minturn. In conjunction with those we have run minturnrentals which specializes in vacation rentals in Minturn Colorado.  2009  we expanded to Caye Caulker Belize and now have 5 small vacation cottages and a boutique 12 unit Hotel, Weezie's Ocean Front Hotel and Garden Cottages. We have 3 grown children and love escaping the cold Colorado winter for some warmth and sunshine in Caye Caulker

name: Guesthouse in Bullet Tree Falls · ★4.86 · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Located on a peninsula in the village of Bullet Tree Falls, Cohune Palms is a peaceful, shady spot on the river.  It is a great village to walk around - meet locals, eat some great food often with handmade tortillas, or watch a football game.
host_about: Well traveled and full of experience - lol.  As a host, l like to make sure guests are  happy and have everything they need to relax and enjoy their vacation.
neighbourhood: Bullet Tree Falls, Cayo District, Belize

name: Condo in Placencia · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Located on a private island at the end of a dead-end street, it is always quiet and peaceful. As you will see on the map and in the pictures, our pontoon boat takes you across the 80 ft canal which provides easy access to town, an easy 5 minute walk to all the village has to offer. This unique aspect is the reason we love this location providing privacy, breath-taking views, and ease of access to town.

name: Bungalow in San Ignacio · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
host_about: You need to be a bit adventurious because you stay in the middle of the beautiful Belizian jungle.  Rob, the dutchman who built with his Belizean family this great hotspot, kindly welcomes you and tell you all about the species who live in the jungle. Come along, enjoy nature and taste a bit of real jungle life.

name: Bed and breakfast in Belize City · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: It is almost 20 years Villa Boscardi is open and has been growing. We have open Villa Boscardi wanting to offer travelers (like we are) a safe, clean, reasonable, friendly and welcoming bed and breakfast. Really a place we would enjoy staying to if we were the ones traveling. And without presumption we think it has worked beautifully.
host_about:
My name if Francoise, I have traveled and lived in Africa, Europe, United States of America and Belize (Central America) and Turks and Caicos (Caribbean Islands).
Enjoy and love to meet people and share my joy of traveling.
property_type: Private room in bed and breakfast

name: Boutique hotel in Placencia · ★4.75 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Placencia is a cute little beach village.  We have delicious food, world class diving, and land activities such as zip lining and tubing.
host_about: We are a highly rated boutique hotel experience, with 12 separate and unique rooms to choose from. Located in the heart of Placencia Village, you will be in walking distance to all the best beaches, restaurants, stores and popular attractions. Let us make your vacation an experience to remember.

name: Bungalow in Placencia · ★4.56 · Studio · 2 beds · 1 bath
Home in San Pedro · ★5.0 · 5 bedrooms · 6 beds · 5 baths
Cabin in Teakettle · ★4.92 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: We are just minutes away from Belmopan (perhaps the smallest capital city in the Americas); but the neighbourhood is rural and peaceful where most residents are either farmers or craftspeople.  There are small bars, eateries and grocery shops within easy access.
host_about: I am a retired diplomat and former senior officer in the Government of Belize. I enjoy nature and the quiet serenity of the rainforest. I also love people, great music, great conversations and great movies. I have travelled all over the world in my capacity as Ambassador, and have met many interesting people with whom I still keep in contact. My wife, Bernadette, and I are very open-minded and treat our guests as friends and kin. Retirement from diplomacy meant a new direction, so we chose to build three cottages and open our private retreat to paying guests, which would keep us in contact with people from all over the world. We love it here. We are happy to have you join us in a welcoming, uncomplicated environment where warmth and friendship await you. The longer you stay, the happier we all are. We particularly like to host persons who are on short or long-term consultancies in the Belmopan area; newlyweds looking for a honeymoon getaway, couples with young families, or adventurous grown-ups who use our place as a base for forays into rock-climbing, zip-lining, cave-tubing, rainforest hiking or ancient Maya site explorations; also retired couples who just want a quiet place to refresh the soul. You are all welcome.

name: Condo in San Pedro · ★4.85 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Quiet and family friendly, yet only a three block walk to central park, restaurants, pubs and shops
host_about: I have been living on San Pedro my whole life. I enjoy putting my feet in the sea and looking at natures best. i am now in charge of guest services for Tradewinds Paradise Villas. I am qualified to take care of all your needs during your entire trip. Our owner Mr. Bill Toonen has been here since 1986 and has a wealth of knowledge to share with you. I will be here to welcome you personally when you arrive. On a daily basis i can book any diving, fishing, snorkeling or mainland tours you may want to do. I can also recommend the best restaurants, shops and pubs. Of course most all of these things I have experienced myself.

name: Home in Placencia · ★4.88 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Moonflower has 24/7 presence. Our groundskeepers, Jaime & Gerison, keeps the beach free of seagrass and detritus and our security guards Edward & Daniel patrol the grounds at night. Our hospitality manager, Ms. Joyce, is long-time Placencia resident and is available to answer any questions our guests may have about Moonflower or Placencia in general and can assist in booking tours and suggesting adventures.
Placencia has its roots as a fishing village and fishing remains a vital part of its economy. Fisherman sell their catch each evening at the point and to local restaurants. There are no chains here- no big box stores, no McDonald's. Everything is fresh and local. Small vegetable & fruit stands abound, as do eateries and small shops. Take in a soccer game at the field in the village's center. Grab a cocktail at a thatch-roofed bar and experience the local fare at one of the dozens of open-air restaurants on the beach, sidewalk, and main road. Local tour operators offer
host_about: Stay at home Dad for my two daughters: Charlotte (Charley) & Josephine (Josey), husband to Kathleen, Screen-printer, Owner of TwoFives Apparel, avid traveler & host, and lover of all things Belize.

name: Bungalow in San Ignacio · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
host_about: Come and experience Belize’s natural wonders. Whether it be exploring an ancient Maya city or zip lining through the unspoiled rainforest, there’s plenty to do here. Cave tubing, horseback riding, bird watching, hiking, and canoeing are just a few of the many popular tours and activities that we offer.

name: Bungalow in Placencia · ★4.77 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Your rental unit is directly ACROSS the street from the Caribbean sea. It's a short walk across the road for you to use the beach. Again, just to be clear, the beach is ACROSS THE ROAD from your location.

If you're looking for restaurants you need not travel farther than Maya Beach or Placencia Village. There is a new grocery store in Seine Bight (a 10 minute bike ride or a 5 minute drive) called Public's. It has a large selection of food, toiletries, fresh fruit and veggies and dairy. It has pretty much everything you will need.
There is also a nice fruit and veggie stand in Seine Bight village called Myrna's, the first little stand on the right hand side heading south. Nothing is more than about a 15 minute drive away. This is a quiet residential neighborhood. Please be respectful of that. No loud parties please.

Next door there is a large resort with restaurants, mini golf, a bigger pool, a martini bar and a gym. All open to public for a sma
host_about: We may be small, but we have lots of heart.

name: Home in Caye Caulker City · ★4.65 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The home is located in the Bahia neighborhood, a short 10 minute bicycle ride from the village.

name: Home in San Ignacio · ★4.68 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The town is about a 1/4 mile away and the center is about 3/4 mile.  It is easily walked but a taxi only cost $5 USD for up to 4 persons.
host_about: I like to travel... currently at 40 countries. This year will complete 50 years living and/or working in Belize. My wife Suzi and I have raised a family of 5 kids, who in turn, have married to people from 5 countries.  Suzi and I both love music, nature,  and cultural foods.  Our passion is striving to make the world a better place, one step at a time. I am involved in the new Organic Foods movement and the Wellness movement in Belize.  Together Suzi and I have built the Maya Mountain Lodge that has 45 years serving visitors to Belize. Now Covid has created new opportunities to serve others.

name: Boutique hotel in Placencia · ★4.43 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
Villa in San Pedro Town · ★4.71 · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 4 baths
neighborhood_overview:
There is a restaurant and bar a short walk along the beach just north of Anil Mar and another one about the same distance just south. By golf cart you have numerous other options between Anil Mar and town, places like Crocs Sunset Bar, Portofino, Rojo Lounge, Truck Stop, Cococabana, O, Stella's Smile, Paco's Tiki Bar, Marbucks, Aqua, Rain, Mata Chica's Mambo, Aji Tapa Lounge, Tipsy Lobster, Pirates Treasure, Dive Bar, Pur, and more. All the places listed are within a 20-minute golf cart ride of Anil Mar except for the closest, they're a 10-minute walk at most along the beach. In town, there's just too many to list but we'd be happy to let you know our favorites.

The villa is located the same distance from town as it is to Secret Beach.

name: Nature lodge in San Ignacio · ★4.43 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
Surrounded by rainforest and set next to the Macal River, our property is a approx. a 7 minute walk from the centre of San Ignacio.
No other location comes close to offering all the amenities as us, and yet adjacent to town. We are a retreat in the middle of a vibrant city.

Our property has an ideal setting for fishing and horse riding. Our tour desk can arrange trips to nearby caves and Mayan ruins, as well as bird watching excursions.
host_about:
Hi, 
I have been in the travel business for over a decade! 
I understand the ins and outs of travelings. I want to make your vacation comfortable and memorable. 
I am here to assist you for anything you need. 

Buen Viaje!

name: Rental unit in San Pedro · ★4.94 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: We are located in the quaint Boca del Rio district in the town of San Pedro. The beach stroll  is a host to many beach bars, restaurants, dive shops, tour guides and water sport activities. Always lots to do on Boca del Rio beaches.
host_about: We purchased property on the beautiful Island of Ambergris Caye in the Town of San Pedro in 2013. Since we have been busy adding on to our property to create Casa del Rai guest house. We want to be your home away from home each and every time you visit this beautiful Island. We know you will fall in love just as we have. We spend 6-8 months here a year and enjoy the long summer days back in Canada. We have never looked back since our decision to move her...our smiles get bigger each and every day.

name: Rental unit in San Pedro · ★4.71 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Very safe and quiet! Very close to restaurants and bars!
host_about: Friendly easy going person! Enjoy meeting new people all the time! Really enjoy snorkeling and fishing or just beach cruising! Enjoy life, its too short! Live and let live!'

name: Hotel in Orange Walk · ★4.67 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Please visit and find us (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN)
host_about: Mr. P run a small hotel right next to the river in Orange Walk Town. We are more for quite and tranquil relaxation.

name: Rental unit in San Ignacio · ★4.0 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Located on the slope of a hill, this home is located in a residential neighborhood and is generally quiet and calm.  Conveniently nearby (within 5 minutes walk) is a restaurant, store, petrol station, and the bus route.

name: Aparthotel in San Pedro · ★4.35 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
The beach is only two blocks away!
San Pedro town is an easy 5 minute walk along the beach where friendly Belizean people, tasty local food, infectious music and lively festivals await.

We are steps away from our beautiful private white sand beach, with easy access to diving, snorkeling, and many other water activities.
We have an authentic island atmosphere.

Things to do:
Perhaps you don't want to do anything more than relax by the freshwater swimming pool, lie in a hammock with a book and drink cocktails looking out to sea as the sun sets. But if you are feeling more active, there is a huge range of things to do on and off the island, which the staff are more than happy to arrange for you.
Ambergris Caye is all about water sports, and there are many available to you without you ever having to leave the island. You can choose from:
- Kayaking
- Wind-Surfing
- Jet-Skiing
- Canoeing
- Airboating
- Take a Cruise
host_about:
Hi, 
I have been in the travel business for over a decade! 
I understand the ins and outs of travelings. I want to make your vacation comfortable and memorable. 
I am here to assist you for anything you need. 

Buen Viaje!

name: Villa in Caye Caulker · ★4.69 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Beautiful ocean view capturing the natural breeze, very relaxing, private and quite for after hours.
host_about:
My name is Amiela Ash (also know as Amie), I am a born Belizean and raised in the southern region of Belize, Toledo District, in a remote village called San Pedro Columbia. While I was attending college, I would regularly come to Caye Caulker to work  part time jobs. After  accomplishing my college degree in 2008 I fell in love with the island and eventually moved to reside in Caye Caulker. 
Ever since my stay, I have been working at various businesses within the island gaining invaluable experiences, meeting many faces and knowing the areas within my community. I then worked for Caye Caulker Rentals, now known as Caye Caulker Vacation Homes as a receptionist, then promoted to manager and eventually became the new owner of the business. 
As the new owner of the Caye Caulker Vacation Homes,  my goal is for you (guest) to spend quality time at this island, with quality services and hospitality offered by my business.

name: Home in Hopkins, Stann Creek · ★4.85 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Hopkins is a great area for vacationing, with plenty of of restaurants from high end to less expensive local pubs and eateries. There are lots of things to do, with beautiful beaches and great fishing.

name: Guest suite in San Pedro · ★4.78 · Studio · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The guest house is at the end of a street in a local neighbourhood.  There are lots of trees and birds.  Yet it is super close to stores, restaurants and the beach.  A three minute walk to the beach.  Our roads are sand and thus has a beach feel!
host_about:
I was born and raised in Africa.  My parents owned a remote, luxury lodge so I was raised in the bush in Africa.  After high school I travelled extensively  and ended up in Hawaii for over 25 years!  My son moved to the eastern USA and as it was so far from Hawaii, I decided to move closer to him.  Luckily I landed in Belize!  I have been here for 10 years.  My guest house keeps me busy and I love the Airbnb lifestyle!
Can't wait to meet you!

name: Cottage in Orange Walk · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Typical village living in a modest but modern elevated concrete home.
neighbourhood: Orange Walk, Orange Walk District, Belize

name: Condo in Placencia · ★4.60 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
host_about:
Vacasa
Vacation Home Management

Vacasa unlocks the possibilities of how we enjoy vacation homes. We take care of managing our homeowners’ vacation houses so they can have peace of mind (and their home when they want to). And our guests book vacations confidently knowing they’re going to find exactly what they’re looking for without any surprises.

Each vacation home is always cared for by our professional local teams who implement our high cleanliness and maintenance values, while the hands-off tasks of vacation rental management--marketing, filing taxes, and maintaining a website--are handled by a specialized central support team. Our passion and focus remain true: to empower our homeowners, guests, and employees to invest in vacation.

Our hospitality manager, Ms. Joyce, is long-time Placencia resident and is available to answer any questions our guests may have about Moonflower or Placencia in general and can assist in booking tours and suggesting adventures.

name: Rental unit in Placencia · ★4.71 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Placencia has its roots as a fishing village and fishing remains a vital part of its economy.  Fisherman sell their catch each evening at the point and to local restaurants.  There are no chains here- no big box stores, no McDonald's.  Everything is fresh and local.  Small vegetable & fruit stands abound, as do eateries and small shops.  Take in a soccer game at the field in the village's center.  Grab a cocktail at a thatch-roofed bar and experience the local fare at one of the dozens of open-air restaurants on the beach, sidewalk, and main road.  Local tour operators offer excursions to go fishing, snorkeling, diving, tubing, hiking, zip-lining, paddle-boarding, and just about any other outdoor activity you can think of.  Happy Exploring!!
host_about: Stay at home Dad for my two daughters: Charlotte (Charley) & Josephine (Josey), husband to Kathleen, Screen-printer, Owner of TwoFives Apparel, avid traveler & host, and lover of all things Belize.

name: Condo in Corozal · ★4.54 · 3 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is quite unique with ex-pats from the United States, Canada and Great Britain.  They come from every walk of life.  There are three restaurants in the immediate area and three Inns.  Rice and Beans  is the local dish and it is very reasonable.  Corozal Blue is close by and a great place for pizza.
host_about: I am a retired Hotelier with over 35 years experience.  I enjoyed my career and now get to host guests in my home in Belize, so I still get satisfaction from looking after guests but I don't have the large staff I had in the hotel business.  Life in Belize is so much simpler.   I enjoy the people of Belize and am learning to take it easy.

name: Cabin in San Ignacio  · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Our excellent location is less than 2 miles from downtown San Ignacio giving you the convenience of being close to downtown and all of the restaurants with all of the ambiance of being in the jungle.  We are close enough that all of the tour companies will pick you up and return you to your door at no extra charge.
host_about:
I am Virginia Krohn and I am not only the owner of Villa Cayo but I designed, drew the plans for and built the villas.  I am also a real estate broker and the owner of Belize Live-Retire-Invest  which is myself and a group of expats dedicated to helping other people relocate to Belize. 


Originally from Texas I am a sculptor, painter and a custom home builder who knows how to pay attention to detail.   After visiting Belize in the '80s my husband and I returned to the states, sold our home and business and relocated to Belize in 1991.  Living on the beach for almost 20 years just 60' from that beautiful teal water was magical.  As the island changed the magic did disappear and the new dream became building a luxury Eco-resort in the jungle.

 

One of the best things I like about Belize is that I can afford to have someone help run our business,  have a housekeeper and a gardener which allows me the time to do the creative things I want to do while providing jobs for talented Belizeans.  Belize is not for everyone and it is only what you make of it.

name: Condo in Belize City · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Driftwood bay community is an upscale residential area nestled in one of the most safest neibourhoods with exclusive access and view to nature with the fresh caribbean sea breeze and views with the many gifts of nature to enjoy.

name: Rental unit in Caye Caulker · ★4.91 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: A quiet neighborhood but close to the village. Beautiful ocean views and breezes.
host_about: Having traveled a lot and lived in the States, Europe, Brazil and Mexico, we have a good feel for what guests are looking for in a hotel.

name: Rental unit in Caye Caulker · ★4.66 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Within stone's throw of supermarket, restaurants/bars and half minute walk to beach! Friendly neighbours consists of tour guides, fishermen and long time islanders. Chapito’s is centrally located budget apartments. Apartments come with full kitchen to allow you to prepare meals and save some money. Host is willing to share island information to make your stay more memorable.
host_about: Friendly and responsible.  Recently retired Principal of the only High School on Caye Caulker. Like the freedom, carefree atmosphere of the island and the friendly, helpful people!  Love to share my knowledge and experience of growing up on La Isla Cariñosa!

name: Bed and breakfast in Teakettle · ★4.95 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
Secluded, quiet and safe. Belmopan is about 15 minutes away and there is a small convenience grocery store about a mile from us. Many of our guests enjoy the dinners that we provide as an option, instead of driving to a restaurant in Belmopan. On Fridays Saturdays & Sundays, we highly recommend a nearby restaurant.

We are about 5 minutes away from Teakettle Village, where tour companies pick up passengers for the Actun Tunichil Muknal (ATM) Cave. We are also central to numerous other attractions reached via the George Price (Western) and Hummingbird highways.
host_about:
My wife Peggy and I enjoy meeting travelers and learning about where they live and have traveled. My goal is to facilitate a comfortable stay and enriching experiences for our guests at River Wildlife Sanctuary. I like to help guests plan their trips and, where possible, arrange for small discounts on adventure tours. 

With 32 years as a national park ranger naturalist, I know how to assist guests in having the best possible experience during their limited time in Belize. I am an experienced photographer and like to advise guests about getting great photos. We have several birding trails and our place has been designated a birding hotspot.  

Peggy is an excellent cook and enjoys preparing hearty breakfasts and delicious dinners for guests.
property_type: Private room in bed and breakfast

name: Condo in San Pedro · ★4.95 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: 20 seconds down the beach is The Dive Bar Belize and Seastar - a first class dive shop and full service restaurant and bar.  We are minutes from Marbucks Coffee House, The Truck Stop - San Pedro's newest outdoor addition that features 2 restaurants, an ice-cream parlor, bar and play area with horse-shoes and corn hole tournaments.  Also nearby:  Stella's Smile - a beautiful wine bar that features a different dinner menu every night AND a spectacular sun-set deck, Feliz Bar and Grill - a sports-bar and favorite place to take in that special game, and Pirates Restaurant - specializing in a local delicacy - the Lion Fish!!  Twisted Palm Villas is also only minutes from downtown San Pedro and all the shopping, restaurants and nightlife of the jewel city of Belize.   There is a very good grocery store just minutes away for all your grocery needs, including dry and canned goods, liquor and beer, fruits and vegetables.
host_about: Spencer and I bought the hotel in July, and are excited to take on this new adventure.  We are originally from the San Antonio area of Texas but have owned in San Pedro for over seven years now. We also own Elite Adventures Belize, which is the dive shop just steps from the hotel. We look forward to meeting everyone.

name: Bed and breakfast in Tobacco Caye · ★4.81 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
Tobacco Caye is located in the middle of the Belize Barrier Reef at the northern edge of the South Water Caye Marine Reserve.

This palm fringed five-acre islet is part of the South Water Caye Marine Reserve, a 17,878-acre offshore wonderland for divers, snorkelers, and kayakers. With a year-round population of only 30 and no televisions, public telephones, the island is the perfect place to relax in a hammock and unplug from your busy life back home.
host_about: I love to travel, and there is nothing more that I enjoy than seeing the world, meeting new people, and learning from other cultures.  I live and work in Canada, but my heart is in Belize, where I manage two off-the-grid properties in unique breathtaking locations, with an authentic Belizean flair.
neighbourhood: Tobacco Caye, Stann Creek District, Belize
property_type: Private room in bed and breakfast

name: Nature lodge in Hopkins · ★4.85 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: The resort is  inside the Mayflower Bocawina National Park . A $5 fee is required to access the park. Located inside the park is the Longest Zipline in Belize, 5 different waterfalls and unexcavated Mayan ruins! The park is also an excellent location for Bird watching, with more than 200 species of birds identified in the area.  Other activities offered at the park include waterfall rappelling, hiking, horseback riding, and more!
host_about: I love to travel, and there is nothing more that I enjoy than seeing the world, meeting new people, and learning from other cultures.  I live and work in Canada, but my heart is in Belize, where I manage two off-the-grid properties in unique breathtaking locations, with an authentic Belizean flair.

name: Boutique hotel in Caye Caulker · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Property is directly on the town football / soccer field and in the very center of town. Close to shopping, bars and restaurants. One street over from the beach, and the best views for sunsets on our 4th floor roof top bar. You can also enjoy your breakfast up top!
host_about: Casual and fun. Live on property and happy to help with any aspect of your trip.

name: Rental unit in Belize City · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Home in Corozal · ★4.52 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled on a street with the seaside on one side and a canal on the other. The canal is salt water and we are about a half block from the sea. We have a 41 ft. slip, so if your boating friends want to visit, you will have a place for their boat.
The canal isn't very deep, but at high tide there is room to take a boat out. A low draft boat is ideal. There are three restaurants in the immediate area and two hotels, so take time to enjoy the local fare. There are also two bicycles available for nominal rent.
host_about: I am a retired Hotelier with over 35 years experience.  I enjoyed my career and now get to host guests in my home in Belize, so I still get satisfaction from looking after guests but I don't have the large staff I had in the hotel business.  Life in Belize is so much simpler.   I enjoy the people of Belize and am learning to take it easy.

name: Rental unit in San Pedro · ★4.82 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Although we are close to everything, we are tucked back into a residential neighborhood that is fairly quiet and the ocean is a 2 minute stroll from your front door. Our neighborhood is safe and you will feel comfortable walking around no matter if it is day or night. We have bars and restaurants close by in walking distance. We are located near the airstrip, However, we are at the sweet spot where the planes have either already taken off or are coasting in for their landing, so it is pretty quiet, considering. For those that prefer a gym to the beach for a work out, it is just down the road from us and day passes to the pool are available for our guests!

*Please note that we are not on the beach - especially when you are reviewing the property "Location" category after your stay. We work really hard to do everything we can to ensure that all our reviews are 5 stars in all categories in order to keep our Superhost rating; but we cannot change our location on the island. If
host_about:
Gold Standard Certified Property Owner, all units are certified and available for guests. 

I'm Lisa, I first visited Belize in 2016 and fell in love with the feel of the country of Belize. Every region has it's own magic, but I found mine on Ambergris Caye in San Pedro. The people are the friendliest that you will find anywhere and will make you feel welcome! 

I am not just an Abnb host that has an extra bedroom or unit to rent out and want to make a few extra bucks.  Belize Tropical Dream Villas is a unique property with an invested and hospitality trained owner. This property and the guests that stay with me are the heart of my business!  

My life dreams and goals have included being near the ocean for years now and I have the heart for hospitality.  After getting dual degrees in Hospitality Management and Culinary Arts, I began looking for a place to make my dream a reality!  

Belize met my 5 criteria: 
1. Close to the ocean  
2. English speaking  
3. Easy currency conversion
4. Affordable and fairly quick for our guests to get to 
5. Affordable to purchase inside our means

When the opportunity was presented to be able to purchase an apartment building in my favorite city - I decided to make a leap of faith and catch my dream! 

I am excited to share the island with you, help you feel comfortable and at home here, and most important - ensure that you have a most memorable vacation filled with experiences unique to the beautiful country of Belize!  

- Your Host, Lisa

name: Rental unit in San Pedro · ★4.78 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Boutique hotel in Belize · ★4.87 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
There are several restaurants, bars, dive/snorkel shops and grocery stores within walking distance. Most convenient and highly rated by our guests is The Dive Bar Belize and Seastar Belize. The Dive bar is a full-service, breakfast, lunch, dinner and bar and has excellent food and service (as reviewed by our guests). Seastar Belize offers great diving, snorkeling and fishing packages. They also offer free use of kayaks and paddle boards to our mutual guests. This allows guests to paddle out to the reef (20 minutes?), tie off to a buoy and snorkel around in their own private aquarium!

Palapa Tours is also an excellent tour operator and is located 15 minutes walking from Twisted Palm Villas.

Other restaurants within 15 minutes walking: Pirates Restaurant (2 minute walk), The Truck Stop (15 minutes), Marbuck's Coffee Cafe (15 minutes), Stella's Smile (15 minutes), Feliz Bar and Grill (3 minutes).
host_about: Spencer and I bought the hotel in July, and are excited to take on this new adventure.  We are originally from the San Antonio area of Texas but have owned in San Pedro for over seven years now. We also own Elite Adventures Belize, which is the dive shop just steps from the hotel. We look forward to meeting everyone.

name: Serviced apartment in Placencia · ★4.66 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
We are in a busy area of Placencia Beach with lots of people walking up and down the beach. We are next to two lively open-air beach bar/restaurants; if you are looking for a quiet environment then we are not the place for you.

Our property is fenced in which makes it safe and gives our property a private feel.
host_about: I am a Belizean native, born and raised in the coastal town of Placencia. The units that we rent are named after my mother, Julia. She started this business back in the late 1980s.  We have survived several hurricanes and now the covid pandemic.  I am a wife and mother of 5 children. My primary job is a high school teacher and on the side, I manage the overall operations of the business for my parents who are now retired. We have a small staff of 2 individuals that are there to ensure your needs are met while you stay at Julia's.

name: Villa in Hopkins · ★4.69 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
Home in Caye Caulker · ★4.44 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
host_about:
Vacasa
Vacation Home Management

Vacasa unlocks the possibilities of how we enjoy vacation homes. We take care of managing our homeowners’ vacation houses so they can have peace of mind (and their home when they want to). And our guests book vacations confidently knowing they’re going to find exactly what they’re looking for without any surprises.

Each vacation home is always cared for by our professional local teams who implement our high cleanliness and maintenance values, while the hands-off tasks of vacation rental management--marketing, filing taxes, and maintaining a website--are handled by a specialized central support team. Our passion and focus remain true: to empower our homeowners, guests, and employees to invest in vacation.

name: Bed and breakfast in Belmopan · ★5.0 · 4 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: We are on a quiet road leading from Roaring Creek which is a small village on the outskirts of Belmopan. Within a 10 minute car ride is the capital city of Belmopan. There are several good restaurants, the Cabana night club, as well as a hospital, pharmacies, supermarkets, hardware stores etc.
host_about:
Nikki & Jerry are a husband and wife team, founders of Belize Bird Rescue and owners of Rock Farm 50 acre reserve. We have been in Belize since 2003 and fell into bird rescue entirely by accident. We now run the country's only licensed multi-species avian rescue centre, helping orphaned, injured or rescued birds of all species with a focus on halting the illegal trade in wild-caught parrots. 
Rock Farm Guest House generates sustainable income to keep the rescue funded. Staying with us in our home will make you feel warm and fuzzy all over as, not only will you enjoy a beautiful property, you will be helping us to save the birds!
We operate a home-from-home with lovely rooms and great home cooking. We have 50 acres of fabulous grounds for you to explore, and a crystal-clear river to swim in.
Please note that we don't have AC or TV in the rooms and there are dogs on the property and the parrots are very loud in the morning!

name: Cottage in San Ignacio · ★4.95 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Sanpopo is within walking distance of town, the market, Cahal Pech Mayan Ruins and Green Iguana Conservation Project and if you don't feel like walking hop on one of the many taxi's (USD 5 a trip) that pass right by the entrance. With it's tree top setting in sub tropical gardens you will feel like you have been whisked away to another world, and it will feel like you are living in the jungle, close enough for you to enjoy the facilities of the town, but away from the hustle & bustle to allow you to get back in touch with nature. A mere 15-20 minute walk to Cahal Pech Maya Ruins and the Iguana Sanctuary and the famous Xunantunich is less than 8 miles away !

The rainy season is between June and August and is the most beautiful time of year, where the rainforests truly come to life and where the short burst of mid-afternoon rain serves to cool. The dry season is from February through May.
Average annual rainfall in most parts of Belize is about 50 inches, but the Cayo D
host_about:
The family's permanent  home is 'on site', Jenny and I live here with our 2 grown up children, Craig apart from assisting us  also works at the Belize rapture center, Kayleigh is the Crazy Cat Lady , as well as helping us she also owns/runs the only cat sanctuary in Belize it is located in the grounds but totally isolated from the rentals.
we never leave the property unattended so one of will always  available should you need any assistance

name: Bungalow in Belmopan · ★4.97 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: The home is located in a safe neighborhood near the US Embassy and other State Embassies. Additionally, you can access downtown Belmopan in 10 minutes while walking where most of the commercial and government administrative offices are located. It's also within 5 minutes walking distance from the hospital.
host_about: I am a professional working in the development field. I enjoy riding my Victory Hammer along the scenic highways of Belize. What truly brings me joy however is being in the kitchen experimenting in making local dishes especially soups and having a good meal and drink with family and friends.

name: Bed and breakfast in San Pedro · ★4.88 · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Within walking distance of our property you can find a handful of restaurants and bars that offer delicious Belizean fare and drinks. A couple of places offer kayaking, paddle board and other fun rentals. Secret beach has crystal blue waters to enjoy. Grab a complimentary hammock Float and take it down a short path to beach access and enjoy the beautiful, clean waters. You can rent jet skis or take a fishing/snorkeling trip nearby. Enjoy the beach and beautiful waters of Secret Beach!
host_about: We are the owners of Secret Beach Cabanas at Paradise on the Caye at Secret Beach.   We love people, the sunshine, the beautiful beach, and the laid back island that makes up Ambergris Caye.  Our goal is to make your stay the best you've ever experienced. Please come and let us share La Isla Bonita with you.
property_type: Private room in bed and breakfast

name: Rental unit in San Pedro · ★4.80 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview: We are located in the heart of San Pedro across from the town square and the beach, where you can watch San Pedrano families gather and socialize or try some tacos from the local street vendors.
host_about: Enthusiastic backpacker turned boutique hotel owner. I love to make my guests feel at home here at Parham Plaza Hotel. Sharing travel stories over a couple of beers with my guests is an ideal evening for me.

name: Rental unit in San Pedro · ★4.88 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Safe and quiet
host_about: Friendly easy going person! Enjoy meeting new people all the time! Really enjoy snorkeling and fishing or just beach cruising! Enjoy life, its too short! Live and let live!'

name: Condo in San Pedro · ★4.62 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Quiet and family friendly, yet only a three block walk to central park, restaurants, pubs and shops
host_about: I have been living on San Pedro my whole life. I enjoy putting my feet in the sea and looking at natures best. i am now in charge of guest services for Tradewinds Paradise Villas. I am qualified to take care of all your needs during your entire trip. Our owner Mr. Bill Toonen has been here since 1986 and has a wealth of knowledge to share with you. I will be here to welcome you personally when you arrive. On a daily basis i can book any diving, fishing, snorkeling or mainland tours you may want to do. I can also recommend the best restaurants, shops and pubs. Of course most all of these things I have experienced myself.

name: Home in San Pedro · ★4.67 · 6 bedrooms · 10 beds · 6.5 baths
Home in Maya Beach · ★4.94 · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The property is located in a beautiful cul-de-sac. It has large local trees, providing lots of shade. You can walk to the nearby beach or restaurants which are very close by.
host_about:
I am marine biologist and love nature. Originally from Austria we traveled a lot and lived in different countries but somehow Belize doesn't let us go :-)

We, my wife and I, live on the property of Simberts Apartments. We love diving, dining out and a cold beer on our dock overlooking the beautiful canal just steps away from the Placencia lagoon. Especially, we love the tropical garden/jungle on the property and we love to observe the local animals which are around all the time like agoutis, iguanas, different types of birds, raccoons, etc.

We are easy going people, well educated and love to discuss various topics. Have as much or little interaction with us, everything is fine and up to you.

We also manage Winter´s Avalon which is our neighbor property and we will meet and greet guests of this property as well.

name: Home in Dangriga · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 3 baths
Cottage in Belize · ★4.64 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Fishing, snorkeling, SCUBA diving, kiteboarding, windsurfing, paddle-boarding are all within a few minutes walk from our central location on the beach.

Children play and dance, pets sleep lazily in the sand, people chat, passers-by stop to take photos, the sun rises, life happens....
host_about:
Love to travel & explore new cultures & countries.  

Look forward to assisting you in finding your new home on the island of Caye Caulker, Belize.

Island Cheers,
Caye Caulker Realty

name: Rental unit in Caye Caulker · ★4.59 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Chapito’s is centrally located budget apartments. Apartments come with full kitchen to allow you to prepare meals and save some money. Host is willing to share island information to make your stay more memorable.

.
host_about: Friendly and responsible.  Recently retired Principal of the only High School on Caye Caulker. Like the freedom, carefree atmosphere of the island and the friendly, helpful people!  Love to share my knowledge and experience of growing up on La Isla Cariñosa!

name: Rental unit in Belmopan · ★4.58 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: The Penthouse is conveniently located near downtown Belmopan and surrounded by restaurants, supermarkets, and convenience stores. The market and bus station is about a 6 minute walk away. Tour buses and guides are familiar with the building and have picked up guests from the front of the building.
host_about:
Born, raised, and having spent most of my life in Belize City, I moved to Belmopan about ten years ago. I am an avid lover and collector of local wooden sculptures which can be seen throughout my apartments. My collection includes giant sculptures that weigh thousands of pounds to small mayan heads.  My goal is to provide my guests with a good value - clean safe and unique spaces to stay while in Belmopan, at an affordable price. I am available by (Hidden by Airbnb) or phone call at any time. 

Please note that all my apartments, ranging from studios to two-bedrooms, are located in the same compound on Constitution Drive.

name: Guest suite in Belmopan · ★3.75 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
This is a vibrant neighborhood with stores, vegetable market, local eateries, bakery, laundromat, the Isidoro Beaton football stadium and the George Price Center for Peace and Development located within a two block radius.

It is a multi-cultural area with indigenous Belizeans, Central American immigrants, and persons of other countries living within a two-mile area.

We are just 2 blocks from the Ring Road, around which many people go walking or jogging in the early morning or evening.
host_about:
Hi, I like to work hard and play hard.  I multi-task and am engaged in many productive endeavors at any one time, but I also love to party and meet friends.  I enjoy reading for pleasure...not too serious material, and learning new languages.  I love to have intellectual discussion and debate...and I like swimming.

I  am easily reachable for any questions or assistance you may need.  I like to provide an initial introduction to places, activities, and people in the immediate environment, so that you feel comfortable of your surroundings as soon as possible.  Because I work full time I am honest about the time when I can be available on any given day.

When I myself travel, I love to do so by road whenever possible and by staying at more basic accommodations, because I think that's when you best get to KNOW the people and place you visit.  I also like to have a fixed base and make day trips...something that is quite possible living in Belmopan, as it is in the center of the small but beautiful country of Belize.

It would be great if you choose to visit Belmopan, Belize, as the people and the country are multi-cultural, interesting, friendly and helpful.  I wish that someday you decide to grace us with a visit.

name: Guesthouse in Belmopan · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
Rental unit in Caye Caulker · ★4.91 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: We live on the South End of Caye Caulker in a residential area 15 min by bike away from the Village action.  All our neighbors are "off grid" as electricity has not made it's way here yet (we don't really want it)  At Comfortably Numb you will have all the comforts of home, lights, fan, good wifi powered by reliable solar without the interruption/blackouts which often occur in town. Having said this it can be dark at night (no street lights) so we don't recommend walking home or riding the bikes after dark, but if you do, we provide flashlights and headlamps. Golf cart taxies are plentiful and inexpensive.
host_about: Hi, I'm Cindy, and along with my husband Don, have retired to our dream home in Belize, where we're starting the next chapter. We've created a hip, chic,and private vacation getaway in an area on Caye Caulker, away from the crowd. We are seasoned travelers and have come to love the small boutique properties around the world and I try very hard to pay attention to detail to bring some luxury to your space while maintaining an eco friendly and responsible environment. We love the laid back vibe of Caye Caulker and I hope you will feel it here too.

name: Hotel in Placencia · ★4.61 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
We are in a busy area of Placencia Beach with lots of people walking up and down the beach. We are next to two lively open-air beach bar/restaurants; if you are looking for a quiet environment then we are not the place for you.

Our property is fenced in which makes it safe and gives our property a private feel.
host_about: I am a Belizean native, born and raised in the coastal town of Placencia. The units that we rent are named after my mother, Julia. She started this business back in the late 1980s.  We have survived several hurricanes and now the covid pandemic.  I am a wife and mother of 5 children. My primary job is a high school teacher and on the side, I manage the overall operations of the business for my parents who are now retired. We have a small staff of 2 individuals that are there to ensure your needs are met while you stay at Julia's.

name: Cottage in San Pedro · ★4.77 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: My house is in a quiet safe neighborhood. People are friendly and you will meet an interesting mix of locals, ex-pats and tourists when you go for walks along the beach. Everyone says hello.
host_about: I am a psychotherapist and a scuba diver. I am originally from Scotland, but have lived in the U.S. for most of my adult life. I have traveled extensively, but found my "happy place" on Ambergris Caye in Belize

name: Aparthotel in Belize · ★5.0 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Weezie's is located about a 15 minute walk south of town in a quiet section of the island
host_about: We have been in the lodging business 30 years primarily in Vail Colorado. We owned and operated the Minturn Inn for 10 years and most recently owned and operated Hotel Minturn. In conjunction with those we have run minturnrentals which specializes in vacation rentals in Minturn Colorado.  2009  we expanded to Caye Caulker Belize and now have 5 small vacation cottages and a boutique 12 unit Hotel, Weezie's Ocean Front Hotel and Garden Cottages. We have 3 grown children and love escaping the cold Colorado winter for some warmth and sunshine in Caye Caulker

name: Guesthouse in Teakettle · 3 bedrooms · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
We are located in at Good Living Ranch, Teakettle Village nestled in the Cayo District, Midway between the capital City of Belmopan & the busy touristic twin town of Santa Elena & San Ignacio. Be greet by early morning mists. Enjoy the pristine environment, hiking in old growth forest; float along a crystal clear jungle river, and relax to the sounds of nature. Discover the adventures of inland Belize, exploring hidden Maya ruins, mysterious caverns and journey to the ancient Maya underworld.

Our home is located adjacent a very busy highway that makes exploring easy. we are are located just a few miles from Belmopan and San Ignacio. We are in the heart of Inland adventure.
Happy Living Ranch is where we are located on the outskirts of Camalote near B & B Store sits our purple & blue building on the curve. Situated on the left side of the highway coming from Cayo and right coming from Belmopan.
host_about: You can now feel at home in Belize. Our welcoming guesthouse offers our guests a very comfortable, clean, affordable and safe place to call home while exploring the wonders of Belize. Earn your Belizean Free Spirited Badge today. Create your unique footprint to leave in Belize and take with you all the imprinted memories.

name: Guesthouse in Teakettle · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
We are located in at Good Living Ranch, Teakettle Village nestled in the Cayo District, Midway between the capital City of Belmopan & the busy touristic twin town of Santa Elena & San Ignacio. Be greet by early morning mists. Enjoy the pristine environment, hiking in old growth forest; float along a crystal clear jungle river, and relax to the sounds of nature. Discover the adventures of inland Belize, exploring hidden Maya ruins, mysterious caverns and journey to the ancient Maya underworld.

Our home is located adjacent a very busy highway that makes exploring easy. we are are located just a few miles from Belmopan and San Ignacio. We are in the heart of Inland adventure.
Happy Living Ranch is where we are located on the outskirts of Camalote near B & B Store sits our purple & blue building on the curve. Situated on the left side of the highway coming from Cayo and right coming from Belmopan.
