name: Cabin in San Ignacio  · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
host_about:
I am Virginia Krohn and I am not only the owner of Villa Cayo but I designed, drew the plans for and built the villas.  I am also a real estate broker and the owner of Belize Live-Retire-Invest  which is myself and a group of expats dedicated to helping other people relocate to Belize. 


Originally from Texas I am a sculptor, painter and a custom home builder who knows how to pay attention to detail.   After visiting Belize in the '80s my husband and I returned to the states, sold our home and business and relocated to Belize in 1991.  Living on the beach for almost 20 years just 60' from that beautiful teal water was magical.  As the island changed the magic did disappear and the new dream became building a luxury Eco-resort in the jungle.

 

One of the best things I like about Belize is that I can afford to have someone help run our business,  have a housekeeper and a gardener which allows me the time to do the creative things I want to do while providing jobs for talented Belizeans.  Belize is not for everyone and it is only what you make of it.

name: Home in Placencia · ★4.62 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Your rental unit is directly ACROSS the street from the Caribbean sea. You just have to cross the road to the beach and snorkeling just offshore.

Again, just to be clear, the beach is ACROSS THE ROAD from your location.

If you're looking for restaurants you need not travel farther than Maya Beach or Placencia Village. Even closer is the new Serenian Bay resort featuring Inky's restaurant and bar.
There is a new grocery store in Seine Bight (a 10 minute bike ride or a 5 minute drive) called Public's. It has a large selection of food, toiletries, fresh fruit and veggies and dairy. It has pretty much everything you will need.
There is also a nice fruit and veggie stand in Seine Bight village called Myrna's, the first little stand on the right hand side heading south. Nothing is more than about a 15 minute drive away. This is a quiet residential neighborhood. Please be respectful of that. No loud parties please.
host_about: We may be small, but we have lots of heart.

name: Resort in San Pedro · ★4.55 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Belize is the only English speaking Latin American country, offering all the rich history, tastes and colors of Latin America and the Caribbean, with the convenience of being both an English and Spanish speaking country. The resort is on an island off the coast of Belize, just over a mile south of San Pedro Town, which is far enough from the hustle and bustle to provide a truly tranquil setting and its own private beach access (the cove shaped beach is over 300ft long!). The pool, perhaps the largest on the entire island, is where I like to relax and enjoy the nighttime sky’s thousands of stars. You can see the beach from the pool and it is one of the most tranquil places I have ever been. The island has almost no cars, mostly golf carts, making it quiet and serene as well as environmentally friendly.

name: Condo in Ambergris Caye · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
We are located a 1/2 mile north of the bridge leaving San Pedro, Belize. Our neighborhood is more relaxed than the hustle and bustle of downtown but close enough that you are just a short drive from the many restaurants and activities located in town.
There are three restaurants in the immediate vicinity of the property. The on site bar and restaurant, The Dog House Sports Lounge, is open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner (7am – 10pm every day). They have Belizean breakfast dishes and casual bar food and mixed drinks throughout the day.
Just to the north of our property (a 2 minute walk on the beach) is 303 Belize, an over the water bar and restaurant. They are open for lunch and dinner (every day of the week) and focus more on seafood. They have live music most evenings as well. Underneath 303 Belize, is Elite Adventures, a dive and snorkel shop.
Just south of our property is the Farmhouse Market and Cafe. They offer a wide selection of fresh coffees, juices/smoothies,
host_about:
Tres Cocos Resort @ The Cloisters, is a charming family-run establishment where island living meets modern comfort. 
We have fond childhood memories on the property before its transformation into a vacation rental oasis. 
Each condo is individually owned and thoughtfully appointed, ensuring a unique and personalized experience for our guests. We invite you to experience the warmth of Belizean hospitality in every detail during your stay with us.

name: Treehouse in Bullet Tree Village · ★4.96 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Bullet Tree Falls is a village located along the Mopan River in Cayo District, Belize. It lies approximately five kilometers (three miles) northwest of San Ignacio.

name: Cabin in Orange Walk · ★4.23 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
host_about:
Vacasa
Vacation Home Management

Vacasa unlocks the possibilities of how we enjoy vacation homes. We take care of managing our homeowners’ vacation houses so they can have peace of mind (and their home when they want to). And our guests book vacations confidently knowing they’re going to find exactly what they’re looking for without any surprises.

Each vacation home is always cared for by our professional local teams who implement our high cleanliness and maintenance values, while the hands-off tasks of vacation rental management--marketing, filing taxes, and maintaining a website--are handled by a specialized central support team. Our passion and focus remain true: to empower our homeowners, guests, and employees to invest in vacation.

name: Townhouse in Placencia · ★4.55 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
Villa in San Pedro · ★4.86 · 5 bedrooms · 8 beds · 5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Our home is located in a natural reserve and bird sanctuary where you may have the pleasure of seeing many pink and white Spoonbills, various birds of the Caribbean as well as tarpon, permit, bonefish and wildlife such as deer, dolphins, and crocs. (Which are not aggressive) However, please do not feed nor approach any wildlife you see, and only swim off the frontside of the property.  Ambergris Caye is made up of 60% mangroves and lagoons which are the natural habitat for a variety of species and we do not recommend swimming in the lagoon areas. San Pedro's most popular restaurants, beach bars, night clubs, grocery stores, markets, spas, and tour companies are all within footsteps from our dock and San Pedro's Airport and Water Taxi terminals are literally 3 blocks away. No need to rent a golf cart for your entire stay unless you want to...but I highly suggest renting one for a day or two to check out Secret Beach (not-so-secret anymore) and north/south of the island.
host_about:
Hi, I'm Corrina! 

I grew up outside of Toronto, Ontario but spent most of my adult life in British Columbia, Canada experiencing the fulfilling coastal and mountain culture.

In 2013, I took my first trip to Belize and now spend 6 months of the year on Ambergris Caye where I host a plethora of architecturally stunning oceanfront holiday homes to wonderful guests like you. These homes are ideal and can accommodate anywhere from 8 - 98 guests which are perfect for large groups, weddings, birthdays and other events.  

After a few years, and many guests requesting similar homes and services in the lush mountains of Belize,  I decided to expand our rental inventory and offer our guests a luxurious "Surf n" Turf" package that includes 3-4 nights in one of our island homes and 3-4 nights in one of our lush mountain villas in San Ignacio, Cayo. 
If you desire to experience Belize in a most epic way then we have something for every guest in modern, stylish, safe, comfortable and clean environments within the most desirable communities. 

If I am unable to be on location when guests arrive than one of my representatives will meet/greet you upon arrival, transfer you to our properties, and assist you with anything you may need. Our concierge is the finest!

We can’t wait to meet you and welcome you to beautiful Belize!
See you soon. 

Smiles!

Corrina Taylor

name: Rental unit in Hopkins · ★4.94 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Shallow Bay Beach House located in Sittee Point resorts and residential area, just outside of Hopkins Village in Belize. Perfect balance between adventure and relaxation this private home waiting for you right in the Caribbean waters, watch wild life and relax under thatched roof palapa at the end of 100 feet private pier. Village of Hopkins is 2 miles away where you can enjoy life in a real working seaside community along with a full spectrum of the traditional and leading edge, both in music and food. This vibrant community will not leave you unchanged. Enjoy your privacy and creature comforts, dip into the sea, or immerse yourself in a new culture—all from Shallow Bay Beach House, your private beach house.

The resort area is minutes away (less then 1 mile) with restaurants and bars and offers golf cart or bicycles and kayak rentals. The village of Hopkins is within 2 miles and provides local charm, culture, food and music and the friendliest people on earth. Hike the ju
host_about:
We are from Southern California, USA. We both work in technology and love to travel locally and internationally.
While traveling we discovered Belize and fell in love with Hopkins. We decided to make this our second home. We enjoy our beautiful Caribbean beach house, listening to the waves and feeling the ocean breeze. We wanted to share this wonderful place with other travelers and this is how we became AirBnB hosts. We have been hosting with AirBnB now for more than 5 years and really enjoy it. We are easy going, positive people who are open to new cultures and meeting people from different backgrounds. We have now discovered a beautiful backcountry San Diego right in our backyard and are proud to host another vacation home in the historic town of Julian, California.

name: Cabin in Unitedville‎ · ★4.95 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Unitedville is centrally located and there are Mayan ruins both in Unitedville and Blackman Eddy, a half mile away. We are near to Spanish Lookout, where the 'modern' Mennonites are located, and the traditional Mennonites are also nearby in Lower Barton.

name: Rental unit in Belmopan · ★4.43 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
This is a very vibrant community, with long-time Belizeans and Central American Belizeans living in the area. Within a couple blocks you have bakery, local eateries, supermarket, laundromat, vegetable market, etc.

You can have live comfortably and interestingly in Belmopan. This area has a multi-ethnic population, comprised of the Creole, Garifuna, Maya, Central American Mestizo, Chinese, Taiwanese, Indian, North-Americans, and many Europeans. A lot of the expats work with the many embassies and consulates, and have an active community and social life in Belmopan. As home to the University of Belize, seat of government and location of several embassies and consulates, Belmopan also receives a lot of commuting workers on a daily basis.
host_about:
Hi, I like to work hard and play hard.  I multi-task and am engaged in many productive endeavors at any one time, but I also love to party and meet friends.  I enjoy reading for pleasure...not too serious material, and learning new languages.  I love to have intellectual discussion and debate...and I like swimming.

I  am easily reachable for any questions or assistance you may need.  I like to provide an initial introduction to places, activities, and people in the immediate environment, so that you feel comfortable of your surroundings as soon as possible.  Because I work full time I am honest about the time when I can be available on any given day.

When I myself travel, I love to do so by road whenever possible and by staying at more basic accommodations, because I think that's when you best get to KNOW the people and place you visit.  I also like to have a fixed base and make day trips...something that is quite possible living in Belmopan, as it is in the center of the small but beautiful country of Belize.

It would be great if you choose to visit Belmopan, Belize, as the people and the country are multi-cultural, interesting, friendly and helpful.  I wish that someday you decide to grace us with a visit.

name: Rental unit in Belmopan · ★4.75 · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: This rental is centrally located just two blocks from the George Price Center of Peace and Development, a Shopping Center, laundromat, eateries, vegetable market and corner shop.  Public transport is a stone's throw away.  Belmopan is centrally located in Belize, with public buses to the north, south, east and west.  Belmopan is home to the national university and is the seat of government.  Everything, including schools, medical facilities, banks, parks, tennis and basketball courts, are within walking or biking distance.

name: Rental unit in San Pedro · ★4.96 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: We are located in the quaint Boca del Rio district in the town of San Pedro. The beach stroll  is a host to many beach bars, restaurants, dive shops, tour guides and water sport activities. Always lots to do on Boca del Rio beaches.
host_about: We purchased property on the beautiful Island of Ambergris Caye in the Town of San Pedro in 2013. Since we have been busy adding on to our property to create Casa del Rai guest house. We want to be your home away from home each and every time you visit this beautiful Island. We know you will fall in love just as we have. We spend 6-8 months here a year and enjoy the long summer days back in Canada. We have never looked back since our decision to move her...our smiles get bigger each and every day.

neighborhood_overview: Located on a peninsula in the village of Bullet Tree Falls, Cohune Palms is a peaceful, shady spot on the river.  It is a great village to walk around - meet locals, eat some great food often with handmade tortillas, or watch a football game.
host_about: Well traveled and full of experience - lol.  As a host, l like to make sure guests are  happy and have everything they need to relax and enjoy their vacation.
neighbourhood: Bullet Tree Falls, Cayo District, Belize

name: Aparthotel in Belize · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Weezie's is located about a 15 minute walk or a quick bike ride to the town center.
host_about: We have been in the lodging business 30 years primarily in Vail Colorado. We owned and operated the Minturn Inn for 10 years and most recently owned and operated Hotel Minturn. In conjunction with those we have run minturnrentals which specializes in vacation rentals in Minturn Colorado.  2009  we expanded to Caye Caulker Belize and now have 5 small vacation cottages and a boutique 12 unit Hotel, Weezie's Ocean Front Hotel and Garden Cottages. We have 3 grown children and love escaping the cold Colorado winter for some warmth and sunshine in Caye Caulker

neighborhood_overview:
Nearby are restaurants with a big variety of real good local and international cuisine.
Nighthawks can chosse out of three bars in the nearby village.

A 5 minutes’ walk brings you to a creek with crystal clear water and a nice swimming hole.
host_about:
I born, growing up and educated in Chile, I met My beloved Peter 2015. we started our Green Valley Inn on january 1st. 2017.
 Peter wrote: Born, growing up and educated in Germany, in 2004 I decided to escape the hustle of the daily live in Europe and moved to Belize. 
With Wolfs Place, McWolfs Restaurant and Wolfs Tours I started successful tourism businesses.
This kind of work was a completely new experience. My original background is IT and I used to own and run a computer/ internet company in Germany.
 I revived Wolfs Tours and started with Green Valley Inn a new outlet for tourists.
In my free time I write and publish essays and books about Belize.

name: Rental unit in Hopkins · ★4.89 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
AJ Palms is in the village of Hopkins, which is part of the charm I think, but I also know that it is not what everybody is looking for.
Hopkins is still very much a village community in a developing country, we are a village, not a resort tourist destination. Hopkins is a wonderful community with a unique Garifuna culture, come to Hopkins with that in mind, embrace a different land and culture, and you will love it.
If you are looking for an isolated, or resort experience, for your vacation, then we may not be the right place for you.
Being in the village can sometimes mean you will hear children, dogs, radios, chicken and roosters, and we do have a restaurant that has opened up next door that sometimes plays loud music, but mostly you will hear the breeze through the palm trees and the sound of the waves.
host_about:
I am the owner and manager of a guesthouse in Hopkins since 1998 and I've managed AJ Palms Apartments since 2014. 
I'm British by birth, and naturalized Belizean by choice. 

I lived in Germany, off and on, for 10 years before moving to Belize. I am fairly good at speaking German, not all that great at writing it - but I am willing to try. 

I've always felt renting out my rooms and apartments is like renting out a part of my home, hopefully my guests get to feel the same way when they I host them.

I'm enjoying my life on the beach.

name: Condo in Belize · ★4.92 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: 20 seconds down the beach is The Dive Bar Belize and Seastar - a first class dive shop and full service restaurant and bar.  We are minutes from Marbucks Coffee House, The Truck Stop - San Pedro's newest outdoor addition that features 2 restaurants, an ice-cream parlor, bar and play area with horse-shoes and corn hole tournaments.  Also nearby:  Stella's Smile - a beautiful wine bar that features a different dinner menu every night AND a spectacular sun-set deck, Feliz Bar and Grill - a sports-bar and favorite place to take in that special game, and Pirates Restaurant - specializing in a local delicacy - the Lion Fish!!  Twisted Palm Villas is also only minutes from downtown San Pedro and all the shopping, restaurants and nightlife of the jewel city of Belize.   There is a very good grocery store just minutes away for all your grocery needs, including dry and canned goods, liquor and beer, fruits and vegetables.
host_about: Spencer and I bought the hotel in July, and are excited to take on this new adventure.  We are originally from the San Antonio area of Texas but have owned in San Pedro for over seven years now. We also own Elite Adventures Belize, which is the dive shop just steps from the hotel. We look forward to meeting everyone.

name: Condo in San Pedro · ★4.78 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Great food and nightlife a few doors down on the beach with great food at the Sand Bar, Melt and Palapa Bar. A grocery store Caye Mart is one block off the beach. You can walk along the beach to down town San Pedro. Chuck and Robbie's dive shop is right out the front door providing the most amazing dive and snorkeling trip ever. They also offer fishing trips and paddle boards. Can you say location, location, location?

name: Boutique hotel in Hopkins · ★4.89 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Hopkins is a vibrant traditional village that comes alive early in the morning with the singing of tropical birds and the occasional rooster letting you know it's morning! If you're looking to experience the culture of a local village in Belize, this is the Place to be.
host_about: I am Canadian born and raised in the far north. Came down to Belize and love it and after 2 years of visiting I bought a property and developed Latitude 17 over the last 11 years.  The village of Hopkins is a great location for being out in the sea or beach and close to jungle, Mayan ruins or any part of the country with a few hours.

name: Cottage in Punta Gorda · ★4.67 · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
In Big Falls Village - ca. 10 min. by car - you can find some nice little restaurants. For example "Coleman`s Cafe".
More different restaurants, bars and shops are located in Punta Gorda Town - 12 miles away.
host_about:
Hallo, ich bin Marisa. Ursprünglich aus Deuschland, lebe ich zur Zeit mit meinem Mann und meinen beiden wundervollen Kindern (momentan 21 und 14 Jahre alt) im Dschungel von Belize, dem Land meiner Träume. 
Raus aus zivilisiertem Alltagsstress, überfüllten Autobahnen, überbevölkerten Wohngebieten, weg von Luftverschmutzung, Abwassergebühren, Werbesendungen im Briefkasten...ect. Rein in die Natur, mit Brüllaffen als Nachbarn, morgendlichen Weckalarm von Papageien, nur Insektengeräuschen der Zirkaden in der Nacht, viele fröhliche und freundliche Menschen rundherum. Saubere Luft, Sonne, viel Wasser durch die Nähe von Flüssen, Seen und dem türkisfarbenen karibischen Meer. Rein in ein neues Abendteuer!
Ich freue mich immer neue inspirierende Menschen kennenzulernen, die gern über den Tellerrand hinausschauen und an mehr glauben als einem die Medien zeigen. 
Liebe, lebe, lache!
Namasté

name: Condo in San Pedro · ★4.71 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Great food and nightlife a few doors down on the beach with great food at the Sand Bar, Melt and Palapa Bar. A grocery store Caye Mart is one block off the beach. You can walk along the beach to down town San Pedro. Chuck and Robbie's dive shop is right out the front door providing the most amazing dive and snorkeling trip ever. They also offer fishing trips and paddle boards. Can you say location, location, location?

name: Rental unit in Hopkins · ★4.97 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
AJ Palms is in the village of Hopkins, which is part of the charm I think, but I also know that it is not what everybody is looking for.
Hopkins is still very much a village community, not a resort tourist destination, but it is a wonderful community with a unique Garifuna culture. Come to Hopkins with that in mind, embrace a different land and culture, and you will love it.
If you are looking for an isolated, or resort experience, for your vacation, then we may not be the right place for you.
Being in the village can sometimes mean you will hear children, dogs, radios, chicken and roosters, and we do have a restaurant that has opened up next door that sometimes plays loud music, but mostly you will hear the breeze through the palm trees and the sound of the waves.
host_about:
I am the owner and manager of a guesthouse in Hopkins since 1998 and I've managed AJ Palms Apartments since 2014. 
I'm British by birth, and naturalized Belizean by choice. 

I lived in Germany, off and on, for 10 years before moving to Belize. I am fairly good at speaking German, not all that great at writing it - but I am willing to try. 

I've always felt renting out my rooms and apartments is like renting out a part of my home, hopefully my guests get to feel the same way when they I host them.

I'm enjoying my life on the beach.

name: Tiny home in Belize · ★4.60 · 1 bedroom · 4 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The Salvapan area is one of the newer areas of Belmopan and looks more like a village than a city.  Its unique as the village-like community has a traditional daily life and farm animals can be see around the neighborhood such as chickens and horses.  Wildlife sightings on and around the tiny houses is also common including grey foxes, howler monkeys, birds of all kinds and other animals.
host_about: Hi my name is Carren.  I am 45 and have 2 kids and am married! I am super creative and enjoy spending time outside, traveling and gardening. I love to read so whenever I can find the time, I enjoy a good book and relaxing!  I am an avid traveler in Belize and enjoy sharing and guiding my guests to the Beautiful Belize destinations!

name: Rental unit in Placencia · ★4.85 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The Sea House Apartments is located in the village and is withing 5-20 walking distance of most of the restaurants, bars, gift shops and grocery stores.

neighborhood_overview: Xunantunich, Cahal Pech, Also if you woukd like any tour information or advice questions can be directed to any personal that is in the main house.
host_about: Adventures

name: Nature lodge in Seven Miles El Progresso · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Within 2 miles or 10 minutes of the village is a butterfly farm and horseback riding farm.  We are approximately a 45 minute drive to Barton Creek Cave a natural cave and archaeological. We are in proximity to several internationally recognized attractions including Caracol, one of the most spectacular Mayan sites, Big Rock Falls,  Rio on the Pools and Rio Frio Cave. We are situated 30 minutes from San Ignacio and an hour from Belmopan which means that our guests have access to all of the attractions in these areas.
neighbourhood: Seven Miles El Progresso, Cayo District, Belize

name: Condo in Ambergris Caye · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
We are located a 1/2 mile north of the bridge leaving San Pedro, Belize. Our neighborhood is more relaxed than the hustle and bustle of downtown but close enough that you are just a short drive from the many restaurants and activities located in town.
There are three restaurants in the immediate vicinity of the property. The on site bar and restaurant, The Dog House Sports Lounge, is open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner (7am – 10pm every day). They have Belizean breakfast dishes and casual bar food and mixed drinks throughout the day.
Just to the north of our property (a 2 minute walk on the beach) is 303 Belize, an over the water bar and restaurant. They are open for lunch and dinner (every day of the week) and focus more on seafood. They have live music most evenings as well. Underneath 303 Belize, is Elite Adventures, a dive and snorkel shop.
Just south of our property is the Farmhouse Market and Cafe. They offer a wide selection of fresh coffees, juices/smoothies,
host_about:
Tres Cocos Resort @ The Cloisters, is a charming family-run establishment where island living meets modern comfort. 
We have fond childhood memories on the property before its transformation into a vacation rental oasis. 
Each condo is individually owned and thoughtfully appointed, ensuring a unique and personalized experience for our guests. We invite you to experience the warmth of Belizean hospitality in every detail during your stay with us.

name: Guest suite in Belmopan · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: The house has security bars and good night-time lighting.  Caring observant neighbours.
host_about:
Hi, I like to work hard and play hard.  I multi-task and am engaged in many productive endeavors at any one time, but I also love to party and meet friends.  I enjoy reading for pleasure...not too serious material, and learning new languages.  I love to have intellectual discussion and debate...and I like swimming.

I  am easily reachable for any questions or assistance you may need.  I like to provide an initial introduction to places, activities, and people in the immediate environment, so that you feel comfortable of your surroundings as soon as possible.  Because I work full time I am honest about the time when I can be available on any given day.

When I myself travel, I love to do so by road whenever possible and by staying at more basic accommodations, because I think that's when you best get to KNOW the people and place you visit.  I also like to have a fixed base and make day trips...something that is quite possible living in Belmopan, as it is in the center of the small but beautiful country of Belize.

It would be great if you choose to visit Belmopan, Belize, as the people and the country are multi-cultural, interesting, friendly and helpful.  I wish that someday you decide to grace us with a visit.

name: Hotel in Belize · ★4.50 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
Hotel in Caye Caulker · ★4.24 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
Resort in San Pedro · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Belize is the only English speaking Latin American country, offering all the rich history, tastes and colors of Latin America and the Caribbean, with the convenience of being both an English and Spanish speaking country. The resort is on an island off the coast of Belize, just over a mile south of San Pedro Town, which is far enough from the hustle and bustle to provide a truly tranquil setting and its own private beach access (the cove shaped beach is over 300ft long!). The pool, perhaps the largest on the entire island, is where I like to relax and enjoy the nighttime sky’s thousands of stars. You can see the beach from the pool and it is one of the most tranquil places I have ever been. The island has almost no cars, mostly golf carts, making it quiet and serene as well as environmentally friendly.

name: Home in Hopkins · ★4.74 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The are numerous amenities within a few minutes walking distance from the house.  The local convenience store which can supply most of what you want or need is just around the corner.  Fresh fruit and vegetable stands are an easy walk as are many of the local restaurants. You do need to remember that you are in the heart of the village.  While the beach front is fairly quiet, you can expect to occasionally hear local drumming, roosters crowing and children laughing.  It's part of the village life experience.  Our neighbours are very quiet and will always have a friendly hello.

name: Treehouse in Unitedville‎ · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Nearby are restaurants with a big variety of real good food.

A 5 minutes’ walk brings you to a creek with crystal clear water and a nice swimming hole.
host_about:
I born, growing up and educated in Chile, I met My beloved Peter 2015. we started our Green Valley Inn on january 1st. 2017.
 Peter wrote: Born, growing up and educated in Germany, in 2004 I decided to escape the hustle of the daily live in Europe and moved to Belize. 
With Wolfs Place, McWolfs Restaurant and Wolfs Tours I started successful tourism businesses.
This kind of work was a completely new experience. My original background is IT and I used to own and run a computer/ internet company in Germany.
 I revived Wolfs Tours and started with Green Valley Inn a new outlet for tourists.
In my free time I write and publish essays and books about Belize.

name: Hotel in San Pedro · ★4.90 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: We are located in the heart of San Pedro across from the town square and the beach, where you can watch San Pedrano families gather and socialize or try some tacos from the local street vendors.
host_about: Enthusiastic backpacker turned boutique hotel owner. I love to make my guests feel at home here at Parham Plaza Hotel. Sharing travel stories over a couple of beers with my guests is an ideal evening for me.

name: Condo in Billy White · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
This chunk of heaven has rolling hills with tropical fruit trees and pines. It’s in the Billy White area just 2.5 miles from the popular Mennonite community Spanish Lookout which is the center for local produce, fresh meat, fresh baked goods, and modern-day conveniences.

Quaint, safe Spanish Lookout is 20 minutes from San Ignacio – a favorite of expats and tourists - which also has a hospital. The property is fenced completely; some is cleared for cattle, some for tree & farming and year-round gardening. The rest of the 90 acres is lush tropical vegetation. Heaven Valley has a pond and a freshwater creek running throughout. The property is accessible directly from the main road but maintains privacy and spaciousness.
host_about:
I love driving, checking out real estate and visiting museums.  
Whenever I travel, I to have a Starbucks and a buffet nearby.
I love running or working out every day and eating vegetarian and healthy.
When not working I can usually be found at the health food store .

name: Treehouse in Sarteneja · ★4.78 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: The farm is only 5 minutes walk from the village of Sarteneja. Sarteneja is a traditional fishing village, nature oriented, stuck between the sea and the jungle. It is unspoiled by massive tourism and offer to contemplate a real face of Belize. People are very helpful and friendly, zero security problem, you can walk day and night no worry.
host_about: I am a wildlife biologist, born in Geneva. I like to study animal behavior . I am more an introvert type but enjoy socializing.

name: Rental unit in Seine Bight · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
host_about:
Retired engineer,  very athletic,  sailboat delivery captain, enjoys cooking and entertaining friends and family....
Very adventures spirit...

name: Cabin in Caye Caulker  · ★4.64 · 5 bedrooms · 1 bed · 1 private bath
Place to stay in Belmopan · ★4.93 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The Maya Mountain rainforest of central Belize is truly unique, and boasts some of the most amazing biodiversity anywhere in the world. Recently the Belize Audubon Society identified over 150 different bird species right around our Lodge! We have a family of Howler Monkeys that come by every so often, and the night bursts into song every night from our many insect neighbors.
host_about:
We are a spiritually-minded social enterprise that seeks to fill our guests with awe through a truly unique experience while making a positive difference in our local community. 

We not only support local entrepreneurs, limit our environmental impact and develop local talent but we also donate a large percentage of our profits to PathLight International, an innovative non-profit organization that is changing the lives of children, teachers and local communities immediately around Jaguar Creek. We’re confident that PathLight is helping shape the future leaders of this great nation.

When you stay with us you help create positive change in the lives of our friends and neighbors who live in one of the most economically-disadvantaged areas in all of Latin America.

name: Tiny home in Belmopan · ★4.86 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The Salvapan are has a rich Mestizo culture and guests should definately experience a more relaxed and cultural experience. Sample the delicious and inexpensive foods like burritos, carnitas, panades and salbutes from small restaurants along the main street (Cemetery Road). Belmopan is one of the smallest cities in the whole world with a population of 20 thousand people so don't expect big city life, but rather come prepared to go along with a slower pace of life!
host_about: Hi my name is Carren.  I am 45 and have 2 kids and am married! I am super creative and enjoy spending time outside, traveling and gardening. I love to read so whenever I can find the time, I enjoy a good book and relaxing!  I am an avid traveler in Belize and enjoy sharing and guiding my guests to the Beautiful Belize destinations!

name: Guesthouse in San Ignacio · ★4.92 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Easy access to tours, transportation, restaurants, banks, churches, stores. We will book any tours you want with a local tour company and they will pick you up at our gate. So many options and so many things to do. So many great restaurants/bars. Ask us and we can recommend some of our favorites.
host_about:
We are Canadians who packed up our truck with Everything we owned, put our dog in the backseat and drove South. We arrived in Belize in October of 2016 and purchased this property 2 months later.
We Love hosting people from All over the World. And Love our Adopted country. We have assimilated into Belizean culture quickly and enjoy All of the events hosted throughout town. 
We really enjoy sharing our life and experiences with our guests as we share our deck overlooking the Macal River.

name: Bungalow in  Benque Viejo · ★5.0 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: A developing community with approximately 20 permanent residents and approximately 30 homes have been built or in the process of being built.  The community consists of 128 lots.  Roads within the community have been upgraded and some of the green spaces have been planted with fruit bearing trees and there are gardens that produce vegetables, etc.
host_about: I am retired from the business banking sector and consider Belize to be my second home.  It is my intention to spend a minimum of one month each winter at my place.  I enjoy travelling, being outdoors and spending time with my family and friends.

name: Bungalow in Corozal · ★4.87 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
HUMMINGBIRD COTTAGE LOCATION:
In the heart of Corozal Town - Eighth Avenue.
Corozal District is the fastest growing expat community in Belize. It is 5 minutes walk to the seafront and supermarkets, 10 minutes walk to the Farmers Market. 10 minutes drive to Corozal airstrip, with San Pedro 15 minutes away by plane. The fantastic Chetumal US style Shopping Malls and the new Chetumal International Airport are conveniently 25 minutes by car.

Experience a unique day trip to the famous Lamanai ruins, take the boat across the bay for photos and lunch, the boat for a day or two over to San Pedro island. Share your adventure with a Belikin beer and meal with some of Corozal's expats, by visiting several little bistros by the Bay, its rustic, its different, its friendly and so easy as the whole country - speaks English!

Local attractions:
Tour Guide can pick-you-up right from our gates !
Spanish Lookout & Mennonite Communities
Lamanai Mayan Ruin
host_about:
We love Belize! We especially enjoy to welcome our guests to their own private cabana or condo, and then we leave you in peace. We have two cabanas for rent, both securely situated within our gated grounds and a 3 bedroom condo.
Come visit! Nadia

neighborhood_overview: This is a gated and private development with patrolled security for comfort and piece of mind.

name: Rental unit in Belize · ★4.61 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
See Belize is 400 feet from the BELIZE RIVER, 1 minute from the historic landmark, HAULOVER BRIDGE, 5 miles from PHILIP GOLDSON INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT and 4.9 miles from downtown BELIZE CITY. It is, therefore, close enough to the City yet enough away to enjoy peace, quiet, and privacy.

Beers, Stout, and Sodas are on sale. Pre-ordered Breakfast and Lunch are available.

Food delivery is available from nearby eateries and pizzerias.

FREE THINGS TO DO ON SITE:

1. Unwind and enjoy breathtaking views of the Caribbean Sea.
2. Relax or sunbathe on the Overwater Deck.
3. Watch sea birds, fishes, iguanas, stingrays, and occasional turtles, crocodiles and manatees from the Overwater Deck. 
4. Fish off the Overwater Deck.
5. Have a picnic, or romantic dinner on our Overwater Deck.
6. Order drinks from our mini-bar and chill on one of our Decks.
7. Dive or swim in our 40' x 16' 6' and 4' deep infinity pool. 
8. Get a s
host_about: I had travelled around the world and opened See Belize Vacation Rentals in December 2016 to offer guests a warm and homey stay that I looked forward to when I travelled. Indeed, being able to offer a warm hospitable stay alongside my Housekeeper and my son Kelvin has been a rewarding experience. Contact us via phone or Whats App to promptly assist you. The closest shop is 0.2 mile away, restaurant, bar & pizzeria 1 mile away. We sell cold drinks.

name: Nature lodge in Belize District · ★5.0 · 8 bedrooms · 2 beds · 8 baths
neighborhood_overview: Crooked tree Village is full of History. Established around 1750, Crooked Tree Village is considered one of the earliest inland European inland settlements in Belize. This Belizean Creole Village has around 1000 inhabitants and the village is surrounded  by Lagoons and Creeks.
host_about:
Hi my name is Verna Samuels widow and mother of 3 beautiful daughters. I am the Manager and Part owner of the most popular lodge in Crooked Tree Village known as the Birds Eye View Lodge! 

I am known to be very energetic and self driven. I love to travel around the world and meet new people. I also consider myself to be very industrious. In my spare time I do Argo processing using local fruits such as: Cashew, Pineapple, Mango, blackberry etc......
My favourite motto is  I CAN & I WILL watch me!

name: Villa in San Ignacio · ★4.67 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 3 baths
host_about:
Vacasa
Vacation Home Management

Vacasa unlocks the possibilities of how we enjoy vacation homes. We take care of managing our homeowners’ vacation houses so they can have peace of mind (and their home when they want to). And our guests book vacations confidently knowing they’re going to find exactly what they’re looking for without any surprises.

Each vacation home is always cared for by our professional local teams who implement our high cleanliness and maintenance values, while the hands-off tasks of vacation rental management--marketing, filing taxes, and maintaining a website--are handled by a specialized central support team. Our passion and focus remain true: to empower our homeowners, guests, and employees to invest in vacation.

name: Nature lodge in San Pedro Columbia · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
Our village has a wealth of hidden treasures: there are several cacao farms who do tours and chocolate making, there is a wonderful Permaculture farm and also a butterfly farm, where you can see how to raise the amazing Blue Morpho butterfly, among others. You can go swimming, visit Maya ruins, caves, waterfalls, go on jungle hikes, nature is at your beck and call!
You can also make a trip into PG, to see the market, make drums, sample local culture ...the list goes on....!
neighbourhood: San Pedro Columbia, Toledo District, Belize

Rental unit in Caye Caulker · ★4.65 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: the guest house is located on beach front street, corner of Avenida Hicaco & Chapoose Street, 10 minutes walking distance on the front street to the split for swimming.

name: Condo in Belize · ★4.95 · 2 bedrooms · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: 20 seconds down the beach is The Dive Bar Belize and Seastar - a 1st class dive shop and full service restaurant and bar.  We are minutes from Marbucks Coffee House, The Truck Stop - San Pedro's newest outdoor addition, that features 2 restaurants, an ice-cream parlor, bar and play area with horse-shoes and corn hole tournaments.  Also nearby: Stella's Smile - a beautiful wine bar that features a different dinner menu every night AND a spectacular sun-set deck, Feliz Bar and Grill - a sports-bar and favorite place to take in that special game, and Pirates Restaurant - specializing in a local delicacy - the Lion Fish!!  Twisted Palm Villas is also only minutes from downtown San Pedro and all the shopping, restaurants and nightlife of the jewel city of Belize.   There is a very good grocery store just minutes away for all your grocery needs, including dry and canned goods, liquor and beer, fruits and vegetables.
host_about: Spencer and I bought the hotel in July, and are excited to take on this new adventure.  We are originally from the San Antonio area of Texas but have owned in San Pedro for over seven years now. We also own Elite Adventures Belize, which is the dive shop just steps from the hotel. We look forward to meeting everyone.

name: Home in Ladyville · 5 bedrooms · 5 beds · 3.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Ideally located for those wanting to truly experience Belize at its best.

Explore famous Maya Ruins, take a short drive out to the Belize Zoo, enjoy the scenic water taxi ride to the cayes, beaches, caves and a whole range of other activities. Belize is truly an adventure with something to offer everyone. Ever tried zip-lining or water-tubing? Don't miss the opportunity to do so when in Belize.

Because of the property's proximity to the historic and bustling Belize City, take advantage of the opportunity to visit the Museum, the colonial architecture of Fort George, St. John's Cathedral (the oldest Anglican Church in Central America dating back to 1847) as well as ongoing cultural activities at the Bliss Institute. Lunch at Bird's Island is a must! If you are lucky, you just might catch the Swing Bridge, built circa 1923 in action, allowing passage for tall boats.

If you are interested in visiting Maya ruins, the nearest to our property would be
host_about:
We're a professional couple living in Grand Cayman. Proud citizens of both Belize and the Cayman Islands. We love early morning jogs, family cookouts, and travel -- we've covered six of the seven continents together and with our kids.

We built our beautiful Belizean vacation home in 2006 to allow us the freedom to return home frequently and to enjoy the benefits of family, friends, nature and all that Belize has to offer.

name: Bungalow in San Ignacio · ★4.85 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1.5 shared baths
neighborhood_overview:
You will love Cahal Pech plenty of room to take morning walks to see the early morning wildlife or grab some flashlights and head to the temples at night.

Also the Victor Galvez Stadium is a park with basketball ball courts and football fields it also has a running track 3 minute walk from home.

Cahal Pech Resort with a swimming pool is close by if you don't fancy going to midas
host_about:
I'm fully vaccinated 
I love to travel I've been to north south and every country in central America I've done a bit of Europe and a spec of the middle East

I'm a gold standard hotel owner in San Ignacio and started a  new business similar to uber 

I'm a easy flexible person and looking forward to hosting you

name: Rental unit in San Ignacio · ★4.95 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The apartment complex is located in a residential area but is within walking distance to down-town,  the grocery store, as well as the magnificent Cahal Pech Maya Ruin.  A recently renovated sporting park excellent for your fitness routine is less than a five-minute walk away.

name: Cabin in Orange Walk · ★4.88 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Orange Walk is a true feel of small town Northern Belize. If you're coming in from Belize City, look out for the sugar factory at the entrance of the town (you'll see two smoke stacks on your right hand side). Acres and acres of cane fields line the highways and villages surrounding Orange Walk. We are also home to 2 of the 3 rum distilleries in Belize. An 8-minute drive will take you to the center of town. The street leading to the market is blocked off for pedestrians on Saturday mornings. Take a stroll and buy some fresh fruit.

Orange Walk is not one of the traditional tourist destinations in Belize. Come here for Mayan Temples, culture, Mestizo cuisine, rum, and friendly people.

If you like adventure, we offer tour of Lamanai Archaeological Site that depart from the riverside deck on the property. More info about this in the "other things to note" section.

....Or you can relax and do nothing. If you don't want to leave the property, Marac
host_about:
We should die with memories…not dreams

"Don't be satisfied with stories, how things have gone with others. Unfold your own myth.” 
― Rumi
neighbourhood: Orange Walk, Orange Walk District, Belize

name: Rental unit in Belize · ★4.68 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
See Belize is 400 feet from the BELIZE RIVER, 1 minute from the historic landmark, HAULOVER BRIDGE, 5 miles from PHILIP GOLDSON INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT and 4.9 miles from downtown BELIZE CITY. It is, therefore, close enough to the City yet enough away to enjoy peace, quiet, and privacy.

Beers, Stout, and Sodas on sale. Pre-ordered Breakfast and Lunch are available.

Food delivery is available from nearby eateries and pizzerias.

FREE THINGS TO DO ON SITE:

1. Unwind and enjoy breathtaking views of the Caribbean Sea.
2. Relax or sunbathe on the Overwater Deck.
3. Watch sea birds, fishes, iguanas, stingrays, and occasional turtles, crocodiles and manatees from the Overwater Deck. 
4. Fish off the Overwater Deck.
5. Have a picnic, or romantic dinner on our Overwater Deck.
6. Order drinks from our mini-bar and chill on one of our Decks.
7. Dive or swim in our 40' x 16' 6' and 4' deep infinity pool. 
8. Get a swim
host_about: I had travelled around the world and opened See Belize Vacation Rentals in December 2016 to offer guests a warm and homey stay that I looked forward to when I travelled. Indeed, being able to offer a warm hospitable stay alongside my Housekeeper and my son Kelvin has been a rewarding experience. Contact us via phone or Whats App to promptly assist you. The closest shop is 0.2 mile away, restaurant, bar & pizzeria 1 mile away. We sell cold drinks.

name: Guest suite in Belmopan · ★4.67 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
host_about:
Hi, I like to work hard and play hard.  I multi-task and am engaged in many productive endeavors at any one time, but I also love to party and meet friends.  I enjoy reading for pleasure...not too serious material, and learning new languages.  I love to have intellectual discussion and debate...and I like swimming.

I  am easily reachable for any questions or assistance you may need.  I like to provide an initial introduction to places, activities, and people in the immediate environment, so that you feel comfortable of your surroundings as soon as possible.  Because I work full time I am honest about the time when I can be available on any given day.

When I myself travel, I love to do so by road whenever possible and by staying at more basic accommodations, because I think that's when you best get to KNOW the people and place you visit.  I also like to have a fixed base and make day trips...something that is quite possible living in Belmopan, as it is in the center of the small but beautiful country of Belize.

It would be great if you choose to visit Belmopan, Belize, as the people and the country are multi-cultural, interesting, friendly and helpful.  I wish that someday you decide to grace us with a visit.

name: Nature lodge in Punta Gorda · ★4.93 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
In Big Falls Village - ca. 10 min. by car - you can find some nice little restaurants. For example "Norvillys" and "Coleman`s Cafe".
More different restaurants, bars and shops are located in Punta Gorda Town.
host_about:
Hallo, ich bin Marisa. Ursprünglich aus Deuschland, lebe ich zur Zeit mit meinem Mann und meinen beiden wundervollen Kindern (momentan 21 und 14 Jahre alt) im Dschungel von Belize, dem Land meiner Träume. 
Raus aus zivilisiertem Alltagsstress, überfüllten Autobahnen, überbevölkerten Wohngebieten, weg von Luftverschmutzung, Abwassergebühren, Werbesendungen im Briefkasten...ect. Rein in die Natur, mit Brüllaffen als Nachbarn, morgendlichen Weckalarm von Papageien, nur Insektengeräuschen der Zirkaden in der Nacht, viele fröhliche und freundliche Menschen rundherum. Saubere Luft, Sonne, viel Wasser durch die Nähe von Flüssen, Seen und dem türkisfarbenen karibischen Meer. Rein in ein neues Abendteuer!
Ich freue mich immer neue inspirierende Menschen kennenzulernen, die gern über den Tellerrand hinausschauen und an mehr glauben als einem die Medien zeigen. 
Liebe, lebe, lache!
Namasté

name: Home in San Ignacio · ★4.92 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Our house is conveniently located. Close to super markets, produce market, restaurants, the bus terminal, and car rental companies. A private college is not far. Both former and current mayors of San Ignacio live within a few blocks away.
host_about: Before permanently settling in Belize, my wife and I traveled the world. Having had the experience of staying in guesthouses and 5star hotels, we realize, what a traveler needs to feel comfortable away from home in a foreign country. We offer a cozy place in a safe neighborhood,  and provide plenty of complementary purified, drinking water.  As a former professor of biology and ecology and my wife as an artist/designer, we incorporate both our talents to ensure our guests will have an exhilarating , educational and comfortable experience in Belize.  We like to make our guests as welcomed as we possibly can in a country, which has so much to offer.                                                                                            If you have any questions please ask.....we are here to be of assistance. Hope to see you soon.

name: Nature lodge in Cayo District · ★4.82 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Within 2 miles or 10 minutes of the village is a butterfly farm and horseback riding farm.  We are approximately a 45 minute drive to Barton Creek Cave a natural cave and archaeological. We are in proximity to several internationally recognized attractions including Caracol, one of the most spectacular Mayan sites, Big Rock Falls,  Rio on the Pools and Rio Frio Cave. We are situated 30 minutes from San Ignacio and an hour from Belmopan which means that our guests have access to all of the attractions in these areas.

name: Cottage in Placencia · ★4.66 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
We are in a busy area of Placencia Beach with lots of people walking up and down the beach. We are next to two lively open-air beach bar/restaurants; if you are looking for a quiet environment then we are not the place for you.

Our property is fenced in which makes it safe and gives our property a private feel.
host_about: I am a Belizean native, born and raised in the coastal town of Placencia. The units that we rent are named after my mother, Julia. She started this business back in the late 1980s.  We have survived several hurricanes and now the covid pandemic.  I am a wife and mother of 5 children. My primary job is a high school teacher and on the side, I manage the overall operations of the business for my parents who are now retired. We have a small staff of 2 individuals that are there to ensure your needs are met while you stay at Julia's.

name: Cottage in Placencia · ★4.58 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath

Despite our efforts to ensure a comfortable environment, we cannot guarantee complete silence. Guests are encouraged to consider this when booking, especially if seeking a quieter stay. Refunds will not be issued for noise-related concerns, as it is beyond our control. We appreciate your understanding as we balance the vibrant atmosphere with guest comfort. name: Bed and breakfast in Belize City · ★4.97 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
host_about:
I retired in October 2013 after 30 years with Esso Standard Oil S. A. Limited, an affiliate of ExxonMobil.  I had my share of travelling around the globe and worked in Expatriate Assignments in Miami, Fl., Nassau Bahamas, Georgetown Guyana, Doha Qatar, Malabo Equatorial Guinea, Luanda Angola, and of course Belize City, Belize Central America.

I enjoy meeting people and sharing my experiences of foreign places and cultures.  My appetite has always been healthy and I am always willing to try local dishes of the places I visit.

Being a bed and breakfast host is a new experience for me but I believe I have enough knowledge of what travellers look for when away from home.  In fact one year I spent 35 weeks in hotels around the Caribbean and Central America and I kept wondering why I was renting an apartment in Miami during that time!
property_type: Private room in bed and breakfast

name: Home in Placencia · ★4.59 · 4 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2.5 baths
host_about:
Vacasa
Vacation Home Management

Vacasa unlocks the possibilities of how we enjoy vacation homes. We take care of managing our homeowners’ vacation houses so they can have peace of mind (and their home when they want to). And our guests book vacations confidently knowing they’re going to find exactly what they’re looking for without any surprises.

Each vacation home is always cared for by our professional local teams who implement our high cleanliness and maintenance values, while the hands-off tasks of vacation rental management--marketing, filing taxes, and maintaining a website--are handled by a specialized central support team. Our passion and focus remain true: to empower our homeowners, guests, and employees to invest in vacation.

I grew up in Belize and my parents still live there and are in charge of the property. I do the booking. They take care of the guests. You will be in good hands!

name: Home in Cayo District · ★4.59 · 3 bedrooms · 6 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: We are set in the Barton Creek Valley surrounded by the Mayan Mountain Rainforest and lush Jungle.  Barton Creek Valley is a rural area known for the traditional farming that takes place there.  Our on-site Barton Creek Café serves food sourced from the surrounding farms.  Barton Creek crosses the road in and there is a low water crossing that is easily accessible by 2WD vehicles in normal conditions. Please understand that if you are visiting during the monsoon/high rain season, water level may require you to take an alternate route in. If you are reserving during those time periods, please reach out to confirm the best travel route.
host_about: Hi, I’m Mike Bogaert. My two boys & I live on our farm on the property that contains Barton Creek Cave, Mike’s Place jungle lodging, & Barton Creek Café. In addition to serving our guests, we are active in serving the local community & provide internet services to the school in Seven Miles El Progresso Community, allowing the young people to pursue their education by utilizing modern technology to keep pace with students in more developed areas.

name: Serviced apartment in San Pedro · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
We are located 9 miles miles north of the village, so that makes our place the best spot to just get away from it all.

And since we have golf cart rentals on site, and with the water taxi going back and forth between the village and our place, it's easy to decide one morning to go and spend the day in San Pedro, with all the boutiques, restaurants, bars and shops.
host_about:
My name is Charles and my partner Dennis and I have owned this piece of paradise for several years now.

We both love being able to get away from all the "hustle and bustle" of city life and want to share our piece of paradise with other individuals who want to relax and enjoy their vacation.

Nature lodge in Bermudian Landing · ★4.53 · 10 bedrooms · 20 beds · 12.5 baths
host_about:
I was borne and lived all  my life on this family property that shares the same parking lot with the Community Baboon Sanctuary  I have been an educator for more than 30 years in Belize at the primary and tertiary levels.  I love plants and am promoting organically grown fruits and vegetables. I love to put a smile on people face. We have some lovely cabanas and offer very interesting and exciting nature tours.  
I love to show my guests our local wildlife (monkeys, bush rabbits, birds, etc.), Mayan ruins, and our horses. My favorite places to visit include the Grand Canyon, Niagara Falls, Belize Barrier Reef and the Belize Rain Forest.

name: Cabin in San Ignacio · ★4.91 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
It’s true: parts of Belize are getting touristy. But San Ignacio remains rustic, making it a great base for budget-friendly tropical adventure travel, as well as a great base for a day trip to Tikal in neighboring Guatemala

The rainy season is between June and August and is the most beautiful time of year, where the rainforests truly come to life and where the short burst of mid-afternoon rain serves to cool. The dry season is from February through May.
Average annual rainfall in most parts of Belize is about 50 inches, but the Cayo District receives significantly less—fewer than 15 inches per year.

San Ignacio is at the heart of the Cayo district of Belize. It’s a great jumping-off point for exploring Belizean nature, culture, and history.

It’s also the perfect counterpoint to relaxing on the beaches of San Pedro or Caye Caulker, and mixing some adventure and culture in San Ignacio is a great way to round out a beachy Belize itinerary.
host_about:
The family's permanent  home is 'on site', Jenny and I live here with our 2 grown up children, Craig apart from assisting us  also works at the Belize rapture center, Kayleigh is the Crazy Cat Lady , as well as helping us she also owns/runs the only cat sanctuary in Belize it is located in the grounds but totally isolated from the rentals.

name: Condo in Belize · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
We are just 2 blocks from the Split.
A great place to spend the day! There is a great bar and grill called The Lazy Lizard that has excellent food and cold drinks. The split is a body of water separating North and South Caye Caulker. It is a great place to snorkel for free. There is a dock for sun bathing and easy access to the water. There is also a fishing area for those that want to try their luck. Kayaks and paddle boards are available for rent.

name: Farm stay in Teakettle · ★4.97 · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Village life were most people are related to Mary. Quiet, safe, and secure.
host_about:
'Follow your heart' 

I came to Belize from Boston to start a new life by developing land. It took five years before the first house was delivered.  Over that time,  I picked up knowledge, and experience of this beautifully wild, natural country.

 Mary is a village girl and we started a family in 2012. She can make baskets and cook on a fire hearth. She also likes to do nails, dress up, yet has a wealth of information from living off the land.

Faith, our daughter was born premature, but she survived (a miracle) and thrives.  

We work,  but enjoy our downtime with music, creative activities, or relaxing with a nice drink. Mary likes to play cards and socialize. Faith loves the outdoors, playing, climbing trees, and riding her bike.

We also enjoy having guests for conversation and hospitality. We have done birthday parties, cookouts, and holiday spreads with our guests.
 
Thanks for the consideration of Faith's Farm.

neighborhood_overview: We are on a quiet road leading from Roaring Creek which is a small village on the outskirts of Belmopan. Within a 10 minute car ride is the capital city of Belmopan. There are several good restaurants, the Cabana night club, as well as a hospital, pharmacies, supermarkets, hardware stores etc.
host_about:
Nikki & Jerry are a husband and wife team, founders of Belize Bird Rescue and owners of Rock Farm 50 acre reserve. We have been in Belize since 2003 and fell into bird rescue entirely by accident. We now run the country's only licensed multi-species avian rescue centre, helping orphaned, injured or rescued birds of all species with a focus on halting the illegal trade in wild-caught parrots. 
Rock Farm Guest House generates sustainable income to keep the rescue funded. Staying with us in our home will make you feel warm and fuzzy all over as, not only will you enjoy a beautiful property, you will be helping us to save the birds!
We operate a home-from-home with lovely rooms and great home cooking. We have 50 acres of fabulous grounds for you to explore, and a crystal-clear river to swim in.
Please note that we don't have AC or TV in the rooms and there are dogs on the property and the parrots are very loud in the morning!

I was born in Belize, but I travel back and forth between Los Angeles, Miami, Houston, Belize and the world! 
I am passionate about Belize and I love helping others discover its untouched beauty.
I enjoy traveling and learning about other cultures. To quote Maya Angelou, I believe that people "are more alike ... than we are unalike."
I enjoy making my guests feel at home and I look forward to hosting you.

Also, you will be within 1 mile of the Belizean-Guatemalan border, ideal for travelers who would like to take advantage and visit two countries without having to pay additional airfare.

If you want to join in on Belize’s nightlife, you can take a $5 BZD taxi ride to San Ignacio (8-10min); known for its bars, clubs, and restaurants, we would love for you to join in on the fun!

Julie

name: Place to stay in San Ignacio · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
Rental unit in San Pedro · ★4.89 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Although we are close to everything, we are tucked back into a residential neighborhood that is fairly quiet and the ocean is a 2 minute stroll from your front door. Our neighborhood is safe and you will feel comfortable walking around no matter if it is day or night. We have bars and restaurants close by in walking distance. We are located near the airstrip, However, we are at the sweet spot where the planes have either already taken off or are coasting in for their landing, so it is pretty quiet, considering. For those that prefer a gym to the beach for a work out, it is just down the road from us and day passes to the pool are available for our guests!

*Please note that we are not on the beach - especially when you are reviewing the property "Location" category after your stay. We work really hard to do everything we can to ensure that all our reviews are 5 stars in all categories in order to keep our Superhost rating; but we cannot change our location on the island. If
host_about:
Gold Standard Certified Property Owner, all units are certified and available for guests. 

I'm Lisa, I first visited Belize in 2016 and fell in love with the feel of the country of Belize. Every region has it's own magic, but I found mine on Ambergris Caye in San Pedro. The people are the friendliest that you will find anywhere and will make you feel welcome! 

I am not just an Abnb host that has an extra bedroom or unit to rent out and want to make a few extra bucks.  Belize Tropical Dream Villas is a unique property with an invested and hospitality trained owner. This property and the guests that stay with me are the heart of my business!  

My life dreams and goals have included being near the ocean for years now and I have the heart for hospitality.  After getting dual degrees in Hospitality Management and Culinary Arts, I began looking for a place to make my dream a reality!  

Belize met my 5 criteria: 
1. Close to the ocean  
2. English speaking  
3. Easy currency conversion
4. Affordable and fairly quick for our guests to get to 
5. Affordable to purchase inside our means

When the opportunity was presented to be able to purchase an apartment building in my favorite city - I decided to make a leap of faith and catch my dream! 

I am excited to share the island with you, help you feel comfortable and at home here, and most important - ensure that you have a most memorable vacation filled with experiences unique to the beautiful country of Belize!  

- Your Host, Lisa

Vacasa unlocks the possibilities of how we enjoy vacation homes. We take care of managing our homeowners’ vacation houses so they can have peace of mind (and their home when they want to). name: Boutique hotel in Placencia · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Chabil Mar’s place is located in Placencia, Stann Creek District, Belize.

Chabil Mar is conveniently located 5 minutes drive from the Placencia local airport and daily life of Placencia Village, a traditional fishing Village, located at the end of the 16 mile long Placencia Peninsula.

Current Government of Belize policies preclude any guests from leaving their accommodation except to travel on a Government approved tour and use of a Government approved guide.

Chabil Mar's full service property includes a restaurant and Roaming Butler service for dining and drinks. All Villas include full kitchens. Our staff can provide market purchases on your behalf and some restaurants in Placencia Village are available for delivery services to Chabil Mar for your convenience.

Chabil Mar's full service property includes a restaurant and Roaming Butler service for dining and drinks. All Villas include full kitchens. Our staff can provide market purchases on your behalf and some restaurants in Placencia Village are available for delivery services to Chabil Mar for your convenience.
