name: Rental unit in San Ignacio · ★4.81 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: We are situated directly infront of San Ignacio's most popular restaurant, one street away from the Macal park, and surrounded by residential houses with an Elementary School behind us. A 5 minute walk down the street leads you to down town San Ignacio where there is a pedestrian traffic only area, as well as the Welcome Center.

name: Home in Caye Caulker · ★4.92 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Bungalow in Ladyville · ★4.84 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
This bungalow house is located just outside of the hustle and bustle of Belize City, yet close enough to arrive by a short drive. Nestled in the peaceful suburbs and surrounded by nature, this bungalow house is located on a gated private property in one of the safest neighborhoods in Belize.
The bungalow house is just 5 -8 minutes drive away from supermarkets, restaurants, clubs, banks, pharmacies, and 10 minutes drive away from the international airport.
The apartment is located at a perfect location from which to explore Belize. There are also many tourist attractions nearby such as the Altun Ha Maya Ruin, the Belize River, the Belize Baboon Sanctuary, the Bird Sanctuary, the Belize Zoo, Zipp Lining, Cave Tubing, and more. Superb Location; Affordable accommodation!
host_about: Greetings! I am Paula, a retired high school teacher. I spend my time running my Airbnb rental (C-Ray Vacation Rentals) and supporting my two sons and my husband in all their endeavors whether it be in the sport of road cycling,  their professional careers or our trucking business. I enjoy going to church and I love nature, traveling, reading and exercising. I enjoy meeting and interacting with people of different cultures.

name: Rental unit in Belize · ★4.94 · 1 bedroom · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Bayblue is located on the north west side of our beautiful island nestled at the end of a no trough street. All the properties in this are use primarily for the accommodation business makings this area the most quiet, clean and peaceful area on the island. It gives the impression your alone in the tropics enjoying the ambiance, soaking up the sun rays and Caribbean breeze all by yourself. The Cottage is only 5 min bike ride from the center of town, the island is divided in two north and south with both side been approximately 1.5 mile in length and 1 mile at its widest point. There is no public transportation on the island only privately owned taxi to shuttle you around if needed and several golf cart rental. Bayblue conviently provide bicycles for our guest and have ample parking space on the property if they decide to rent a cart during their stay.
host_about:
I'm a humble , respectable, honest and hard working individual. My objective is to assure all our visiting guest regardless of wherever the origin may be from that they may have the most pleasant, memorable and enjoyable experience of a lifetime. 

A experience that they will be most comfortable to share with family and friends whenever they reflect on past visited destination in their lifetime. I will stop at nothing to make their visit a one in a lifetime experience.

name: Villa in Belize · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 3 baths
host_about: NAI Belize provides Belize Property Management services to Vacation Rental Homes in Belize.  Our reservations staff will respond to your requests, confirm your stay and assist with transportation options to the island of Ambergris Caye and provide a list of things to do during your stay.

name: Condo in San Pedro · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: This is a quiet, family friendly area of the beach--2 1/2 miles north of town. There are about several restaurants within walking distance from condo.
host_about:
I am retired and living on the beachfront. Casual. Quiet. Steps from the ocean.
My favorite things—
Driving on the beach.
Sitting by the breaking waves.
Shelling.
Watching the sun rise.
Listening to the sea wind blow.
Feeling Daytona roar during Bike Week in March and Biketoberfest in October.
Listening to rustle of palms in the evening breeze when in Belize.
My motto is from Enya:
You cannot change what's over, but only where you go.

name: Home in San Pedro · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
Home in Ladyville · ★4.91 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Safe, quiet, outdoor security cameras. Private community with neighborhood watch lookout program in effect.

name: Cabin in Belize · ★4.56 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Unitedville is centrally located and there are Mayan ruins both in Unitedville and Blackman Eddy, a half mile away. We are near to Spanish Lookout, where the 'modern' Mennonites are located, and the traditional Mennonites are also nearby in Lower Barton.

name: Home in Placencia · ★5.0 · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 4.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Sirenian Bay is located approximately 9 miles north of Placencia Village. We offer complimentary from into the village and to locations within 30 minutes of the resort including restaurants in the area
host_about:
We’re Brian and Brenda Montgomery – Manatee Villa is our dream home and we’re delighted to be able to share it with you.

The story of our Villa has been a long time in the making. In fact, it goes all the way back to 2003, when Brian received a life-changing diagnosis. 
 
When you learn you have Stage 4 cancer and are given just six months to live, you begin to reflect on the things that are important to you.

For us it was family and loved ones first and foremost – and the wonderful experiences we could share together.

It was during that trying time when the idea of a beachside retreat came to us. But our dream seemed just that – a dream.

Brian was undergoing treatment, and we were fighting with all that we had to hold on to him.

One evening, with the lyrics of the Beach Boys’ Kokomo washing over us, we made a bold decision. We’d fight through this, and when Brian was well enough, we’d begin exploring the beauty of the Caribbean.

That day finally came, and we were off to Jamaica and then Aruba shortly thereafter.

Years passed, and life intervened, but that dream was always in front of us.

Then one year our travels took us to the stunning beaches of Placencia, Belize.

With its perfect weather, gorgeous setting and wonderful people, Placencia captured our hearts like nowhere else. We knew we’d found the setting for our Villa.

Every piece of Manatee Villa has been crafted for spending time with loved ones – for relaxing, connecting and making memories together.

It’s luxurious, private and a true home away from home in one of the most relaxing settings in the world.

And we’re delighted to have you join our family and become a part of our story.

Because our Villa is your villa. And we can’t wait for you to arrive!

- Brian and Brenda

P.s. If you’d like to learn more about Brian’s inspiring story, you can pick up a copy of his new book "The Nice Entrepreneur" on Amazon.

name: Rental unit in Placencia · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: The condo includes a shared swimming pool and thatched roof viewing dock on the Caribbean sea for your enjoyment. There is a rooftop palapa with a sitting area where you can enjoy beautiful sunsets. There is also a shared outdoor barbecue area where guests can grill a meal. There is a caretaker on site to assist you. Local tour guides are available for water and land tours.
host_about: I love family, the sea, sunrises and sunsets.

name: Serviced apartment in Hopkins · ★4.56 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: This apartment is located at the resort area in Hopkins Village.

name: Home in Caye Caulker · ★4.60 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
This house is located outside the main village in a residential area where you live among the local people. The area does not have a touristy vibe. Beware that Belize is a developing country and minimum wage is low. This means that few people can afford a house of their own and often more than 1 family live on a property under sometimes poor conditions.

Caye Caulker is a small island and the main restaurants, shops, supermarkets, dive-/snorkel tour operators are about a 15-25 minute walk or a 10-15 minute bike ride away. In the area close to the house are a few small food stalls and the nearest grocery store is a few minutes by bike. On rainy days (yes, we have them, it's the tropics after all) the roads can be a challenge with slippery potholes and big puddles, but if you like a bit of adventure it will be no problem at all.
host_about: Originally from the Netherlands and now living on the small tropical island of Caye Caulker in Belize. I enjoy the 'go slow' mentality of island life and live by the day.  I'm a real dog lover and work as a volunteer at the Caye Caulker Humane Society.

name: Guesthouse in San Pedro · ★4.88 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The island of Ambergris Caye, “La Isla Bonita”, is a popular tourist destination. You can get here from the mainland either via an 15 minute flight or a 90 minute boat trip.

San Pedro, the only town on the island, has retained its charm while handling the growing number of visitors. Sunset Beach Resort is located 2.5 miles/4 km south of the town core, which means you are away from the crowds yet still within easy reach of everything.

Town is not far away when you want to go in for some live music, shopping, restaurants, etc. But there are things close by too; here are a few things within walking distance of Sunset Beach:

--Suya Tour operator (1 minute walk)
--Marin’s, a small grocery store (2 minute walk)
--A couple of nice restaurants (4-10 minute walk)
--Beach Bar & Grill (15 minute walk; breakfast, lunch, dinner, live music, outdoor bowling)

The Belize Barrier Reef, the longest in the western hemisphere, is just 1/2 mile (
host_about:
I've lived most of my life in the U.S. (where I am from) but have also lived for a couple of months to up to two years in different countries: Germany, Spain, Australia, Colombia, Ecuador, Mexico, & Belize. Since 2011 I've been living a somewhat nomadic lifestyle while exploring, working & volunteering in new & old places in the Americas and Europe. It's a great way to keep learning!

In my travels I stumbled upon the opportunity to do something that I love -- helping vacation rental owners help people like you with their dream vacations on Ambergris Caye, Belize!

I also have a condo in Cartagena, Colombia; if you're looking for a 30+ night stay (to volunteer; learn Spanish, salsa dancing, or scuba diving; work remotely with a Caribbean view; escape the winter...) let me know!

'Pack for a Purpose' is an organization that links travelers who'd like to help fulfill wish lists of non-profits in developing countries. I partner with them with schools, community organizations & animal rescue groups in both Colombia & Belize. These groups would love to have your help!

Not yet an AirBNB member? Join via this referral link and save $$ on your first booking, maybe even for a stay in Cartagena or Belize! : www.airbnb.com/c/bsmalley

name: Rental unit in Placencia · ★4.97 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Driftwood Gardens Guesthouse is located towards the top of Placencia Village. Placencia Village is very much a tourist beach destination, but also truly a  working village. The neighborhood has a mix of locals, tourists, and expats all going about their daily routine.   There are lots of children who you'll see walking to school every morning. People here are friendly..."good morning" and "good evening" are expected when passing someone, even if you've never met previously.
host_about:
We moved to Belize in 2017 from New Jersey to enjoy year-round sun, sea, and warm weather. After years of research and reconnaissance, working multiple jobs and saving as much as possible, we finally dropped our old life, quit those jobs, and moved to Belize.  We chose Placencia as our paradise, and bought this guesthouse within weeks of arriving.  Since then we have enjoyed adapting to the “Barefoot Perfect” lifestyle of the village. We love living in this warm community full of friendly faces and being within walking distance of everywhere we need to go.

Phil’s passion is health and fitness and appreciates being active outdoors year-round. While enjoying all the perks that Belize offers, he has not totally abandoned his prior career path and still works remotely as a physical therapist. 

Megan dabbles in real estate, indulges her creative side by writing a blog (Real Life Recess) and crafting, and is also a superb source of information on expat life, village happenings,  and unique experiences.

We live onsite on the top floor of the guesthouse. We are always available to answer questions, assist with recommendations, and ensure your stay is as relaxing and memorable as possible . Please feel free to approach us at any time!

name: Villa in San Pedro · ★4.79 · 4 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is very unique, there is no other place like it on the island. It is gated, and very secluded - away from the main roads.  As a result sitting on your deck or rooftop gives you the feeling of tranquility;  very relaxing.  But if you want to go out for a wonderful meal, within minutes you have access to dozens of restaurants.
host_about: Your hosts love the Caribbean and especially Belize.  It is a warm climate in many ways, including the culture. We love music, and the wonderful restaurants you will find on the island.  Life's too short, enjoy every day like it may be your last!

name: Condo in Ambergris Caye · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
We are located a 1/2 mile north of the bridge leaving San Pedro, Belize. Our neighborhood is more relaxed than the hustle and bustle of downtown but close enough that you are just a short drive from the many restaurants and activities located in town.
There are three restaurants in the immediate vicinity of the property. The on site bar and restaurant, The Dog House Sports Lounge, is open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner (7am – 10pm every day). They have Belizean breakfast dishes and casual bar food and mixed drinks throughout the day.
Just to the north of our property (a 2 minute walk on the beach) is 303 Belize, an over the water bar and restaurant. They are open for lunch and dinner (every day of the week) and focus more on seafood. They have live music most evenings as well. Underneath 303 Belize, is Elite Adventures, a dive and snorkel shop.
Just south of our property is the Farmhouse Market and Cafe. They offer a wide selection of fresh coffees, juices/smoothies,
host_about:
Tres Cocos Resort @ The Cloisters, is a charming family-run establishment where island living meets modern comfort. 
We have fond childhood memories on the property before its transformation into a vacation rental oasis. 
Each condo is individually owned and thoughtfully appointed, ensuring a unique and personalized experience for our guests. We invite you to experience the warmth of Belizean hospitality in every detail during your stay with us.

name: Rental unit in Belize · ★4.92 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Love your stay in this spacious getaway, located in the town of Benque Viejo Del Carmen, you will be less than a 5-minute drive from one of Belize’s most popular attractions, Xunantunich; a Mayan site that dates back more than 1000 years. Also, you will be within 1 mile of the Belizean-Guatemalan border, ideal for travelers who would like to take advantage and visit two countries without having to pay additional airfare.
host_about: Hi my name is Judy and I recently moved back to this tropical paradise I call home. Prior to Belize, I was living in Miami, Florida but always had a desire to come back home where greeting every stranger you walk past is a way of life. I try to live life passionately and I am always excited to meet others who do the same.

name: Home in Long Caye · 4 bedrooms · 6 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: This is an island residence with only two neighboring lobster camps on either side of the island. All transportation is done by boat that stays with you during your stay.

Tilt-ta-Dock is nestled in a very quiet area which provides a very relaxing atmosphere for guests. Town is less than a mile away, which gives guests options for participating in activities which allow for interactions with locals as well as expats.

name: Guesthouse in Corozal · ★4.88 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
host_about:
Hello, I am Rodolfo Riveroll, better known as Rudy, I am 60 years of age, retired from the Telephone company of Belize, and I am an Electrical Engineer by profession. I am married to my lovely wife Flor and we have two children.
Flor and I will be your humble hosts at Las Villitas del Mar, we are looking forward to have you visit us.

name: Guesthouse in Corozal · ★4.96 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The resort is located just north of Corozal Town in Corozal District and just south of Chetumal, Mexico. Tilt-ta-Dock is nestled in a very quiet area which provides a very relaxing atmosphere for guests. Town is less than a mile away, which gives guests options for participating in activities which allow for interactions with locals as well as expats.

name: Guesthouse in San Pedro · ★4.75 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
I love the peacefulness and tranquility of the area. Private beach, private pier, you can't beat it!
The proximity of Suya Tours is incredibly convenient, as they are one of the premier tour operators on the island.
There is also a convenient store on the corner with the main road into San Pedro, where you can get basic food stuffs.
We are within walking distance of many bars and restaurants.
host_about:
I am so fortunate to have been asked by my oldest best friend to host rentals at her Sunset Beach and Cartagena properties! Both of us share a love of Latin American culture that has continued to solidify our friendship over the years. 
I frequently travel to both locations to know thoroughly the rentals and destinations!

My home base is in Tucson, Arizona, close to the Mexican border and a culture that is very close to my heart. My love of Latin culture and the Spanish language was inspired by my Mexican grandmother. I have traveled extensively in Mexico, Central America and South America.  I have been a hiking guide in the southwest (including the Grand Canyon) since 2000 and currently operate a guiding company in the Copper Canyon region of Mexico, home to the world renowned Tarahumaran.

From Reef to Ruins
I am enamored with Ambergris Caye and Cartagena and hope the enthusiasm is contagious!  
Most visitors are attracted to Belize for the water. The Caribbean offers innumerable opportunities for exploration. Belizean waters boast a myriad of amazing sea creatures, among them the incredible, huge and docile manatee. This beautiful giant is everywhere threatened, but Belize boasts the largest number of remaining manatees in the world. Explore the water from diving and snorkeling to simply hanging out on the beach! 
As amazing as the water is, what I find particularly appealing is the multi ethnicity of Ambergris Caye. One can stroll from one end of a street in San Pedro and hear not only English, the official language, but Spanish, Belizean creole and several dialects of Mayan. Want to pick up another language? Here’s your opportunity! People are open, friendly and kind.
Cartagena is a city like no other. Stroll aimlessly the streets of this World Heritage Site with a mind to simply "take it all in".  There is so much history in this city! From forts and beautiful colonial buildings, to great restaurants and museums, the Old Walled City has it all. And of course there is the wall itself and the sea!
As in Belize, the Colombians are unbelievably friendly and the Cartageneros particularly so. The Caribbean openness and "laid back" culture infuse everyone and everything. Shop for a few days in the local supermarket, and you'll be having little old ladies asking your advice on which cut of meat to buy!

name: Guesthouse in Hopkins · ★4.91 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: We are right on the beach! We are in the village of Hopkins, which is part of the charm I think, but I also know that it is not what everybody is looking for. Hopkins is still very much a village community, not a resort tourist destination, but it is a wonderful community with a unique Garifuna culture. Come to Hopkins with that in mind, embrace a different land and culture, and you will love it. If you are looking for a resort style vacation, then we may not be the right place for you. Being in the village can sometimes mean you will hear children, dogs, radios, chicken and roosters, but mostly you will hear the breeze through the palm trees and the sound of the waves.
host_about:
I am the owner and manager of a guesthouse in Hopkins since 1998 and I've managed AJ Palms Apartments since 2014. 
I'm British by birth, and naturalized Belizean by choice. 

I lived in Germany, off and on, for 10 years before moving to Belize. I am fairly good at speaking German, not all that great at writing it - but I am willing to try. 

I've always felt renting out my rooms and apartments is like renting out a part of my home, hopefully my guests get to feel the same way when they I host them.

I'm enjoying my life on the beach.

name: Home in Placencia · ★4.95 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Once a sleepy fishing village, Placencia has emerged as a “must go to destination” to enjoy outdoor adventures, beachfront bars, a variety of restaurants, and spacious beaches. Located at the end of the 16-mile Placencia peninsula, the village offers restaurants, shopping, beach bars, accommodations, and tour services.

A boat ride from the Placencia Village can bring you to one of the largest reefs in the world for fantastic diving, snorkeling and fishing opportunities. Other excursions include: Food tours, Mayan Ruins tour, Monkey River tour, ATM Cave tours, Cockscomb Basin Wildlife Sanctuary and more.
host_about:
Hello!
A little bit about me: In 2013, I visited Placencia, Belize and fell in love with the village, people, food, and the relaxing way of life. I eventually purchased the original Toucan Lulu house and transformed it into The Coconut House and built the Ocean Front and Ocean View Bungalows from the ground up.

Years later, I expanded to Chicago's desirable West Loop neighborhood and renovating 3 apartments. All on Airbnb!
  
Thank you!
Carolyn

name: Rental unit in San Pedro · ★4.96 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Although we are close to everything, we are tucked back into a residential neighborhood that is fairly quiet and the ocean is a 2 minute stroll from your front door. Our neighborhood is safe and you will feel comfortable walking around no matter if it is day or night. We have bars and restaurants close by in walking distance. We are located near the airstrip, However, we are at the sweet spot where the planes have either already taken off or are coasting in for their landing, so it is pretty quiet, considering. For those that prefer a gym to the beach for a work out, it is just down the road from us and day passes to the pool are available for our guests!

*Please note that we are not on the beach - especially when you are reviewing the property "Location" category after your stay. We work really hard to do everything we can to ensure that all our reviews are 5 stars in all categories in order to keep our Superhost rating; but we cannot change our location on the island. If
host_about:
Gold Standard Certified Property Owner, all units are certified and available for guests. 

I'm Lisa, I first visited Belize in 2016 and fell in love with the feel of the country of Belize. Every region has it's own magic, but I found mine on Ambergris Caye in San Pedro. The people are the friendliest that you will find anywhere and will make you feel welcome! 

I am not just an Abnb host that has an extra bedroom or unit to rent out and want to make a few extra bucks.  Belize Tropical Dream Villas is a unique property with an invested and hospitality trained owner. This property and the guests that stay with me are the heart of my business!  

My life dreams and goals have included being near the ocean for years now and I have the heart for hospitality.  After getting dual degrees in Hospitality Management and Culinary Arts, I began looking for a place to make my dream a reality!  

Belize met my 5 criteria: 
1. Close to the ocean  
2. English speaking  
3. Easy currency conversion
4. Affordable and fairly quick for our guests to get to 
5. Affordable to purchase inside our means

When the opportunity was presented to be able to purchase an apartment building in my favorite city - I decided to make a leap of faith and catch my dream! 

I am excited to share the island with you, help you feel comfortable and at home here, and most important - ensure that you have a most memorable vacation filled with experiences unique to the beautiful country of Belize!  

- Your Host, Lisa

name: Condo in San Pedro · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is a nice and quiet area.  There is a small corner market that is easy to walk to, as well as several restaurants and bars close by.
host_about:
My name is Christine Cotten, owner of Belize Travel Adventures.  I began my travels to Belize in early 2004.  Immediately falling in love with the country I continued visiting, making at least four trips a year.  Ultimately, the frequent visits led me to moving and living full time in Belize twice - once owning and operating a business catering to both locals and tourists, and the second time my husband and I just needed to get back and enjoy the so many things we were missing about the country.  I currently split my time between N. Carolina, Louisiana, and Belize.  I continue to explore all options for your adventure, and trust me; the adventure never stops in Belize. 

I have had the opportunity to travel extensively throughout the entire country of Belize, and I can tell you that Sunset Beach is one of my favorite properties in San Pedro.  The owners do a great job of keeping up the property and paying a lot of attention to detail.  Sunset Beach is the perfect location being 2.5 miles south of San Pedro Town.  The south end of Ambergris Caye is so peaceful, and Sunset Beach is just minutes away from town while traveling down a mostly paved road.  About 1/4 mile before you reach Sunset Beach the road becomes nice and sandy that is well maintained.

This unique property sits on 200 feet of beachfront for only 13 units, which never gives you the feeling of being over crowded.

name: Condo in San Pedro · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is a nice and quiet area.  There is a small corner market that is easy to walk to, as well as several restaurants and bars close by.
host_about:
My name is Christine Cotten, owner of Belize Travel Adventures.  I began my travels to Belize in early 2004.  Immediately falling in love with the country I continued visiting, making at least four trips a year.  Ultimately, the frequent visits led me to moving and living full time in Belize twice - once owning and operating a business catering to both locals and tourists, and the second time my husband and I just needed to get back and enjoy the so many things we were missing about the country.  I currently split my time between N. Carolina, Louisiana, and Belize.  I continue to explore all options for your adventure, and trust me; the adventure never stops in Belize. 

I have had the opportunity to travel extensively throughout the entire country of Belize, and I can tell you that Sunset Beach is one of my favorite properties in San Pedro.  The owners do a great job of keeping up the property and paying a lot of attention to detail.  Sunset Beach is the perfect location being 2.5 miles south of San Pedro Town.  The south end of Ambergris Caye is so peaceful, and Sunset Beach is just minutes away from town while traveling down a mostly paved road.  About 1/4 mile before you reach Sunset Beach the road becomes nice and sandy that is well maintained.

This unique property sits on 200 feet of beachfront for only 13 units, which never gives you the feeling of being over crowded.  

I can also assist you with all your needs while in Belize (booking your local flights, a golf cart rental, or any excursions you may be interested in).  I will pass on my many suggestions and tips for the area.

name: Bungalow in Placencia · ★4.93 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Once a sleepy fishing village, Placencia has emerged as a must go to beach destination to enjoy outdoor excursions, beachfront activities, a variety of restaurants and bars. Located at the end of the 16-mile Placencia peninsula, the village offers restaurants, shopping, beach bars, accommodations, and tour services.

A boat ride from the Placencia Village can bring you to the 2nd LARGEST reefs in the WORLD for fantastic diving, snorkeling and fishing opportunities. Other excursions include: Food tours, Mayan Ruins tours, Monkey River tour, ATM Cave tours, Cockscomb Basin Wildlife Sanctuary and more.
host_about:
Hello!
A little bit about me: In 2013, I visited Placencia, Belize and fell in love with the village, people, food, and the relaxing way of life. I eventually purchased the original Toucan Lulu house and transformed it into The Coconut House and built the Ocean Front and Ocean View Bungalows from the ground up.

Years later, I expanded to Chicago's desirable West Loop neighborhood and renovating 3 apartments. All on Airbnb!
  
Thank you!
Carolyn

name: Bungalow in Placencia · ★4.91 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Once a sleepy fishing village, Placencia has emerged as a “must go to destination” to enjoy outdoor adventures, beachfront bars, a variety of restaurants, and spacious beaches. A boat ride from the Placencia Village can bring you to one of the largest reefs in the world for fantastic diving, snorkeling and fishing opportunities. Other excursions include: Food tours, Mayan Ruins tour, Monkey River tour, ATM Cave Tours, Cockscomb Basin Wildlife Sanctuary and more.

name: Cabin in San Ignacio · ★4.83 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
- right across the street is the San Ignacio Farmer's market
- close by the French Bakery
- a quick walk from the centre + main bus stop (you don't necessarily need a taxi from the bus stop to the property)
- ATMs and Banks close by
- CK sports close by

name: Condo in Ambergris Caye · 2 bedrooms · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
We are located a 1/2 mile north of the bridge leaving San Pedro, Belize. Our neighborhood is more relaxed than the hustle and bustle of downtown but close enough that you are just a short drive from the many restaurants and activities located in town.
There are three restaurants in the immediate vicinity of the property. The on site bar and restaurant, The Dog House Sports Lounge, is open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner (7am – 10pm every day). They have Belizean breakfast dishes and casual bar food and mixed drinks throughout the day.
Just to the north of our property (a 2 minute walk on the beach) is 303 Belize, an over the water bar and restaurant. They are open for lunch and dinner (every day of the week) and focus more on seafood. They have live music most evenings as well. Underneath 303 Belize, is Elite Adventures, a dive and snorkel shop.
Just south of our property is the Farmhouse Market and Cafe. They offer a wide selection of fresh coffees, juices/smoothies,
host_about:
Tres Cocos Resort @ The Cloisters, is a charming family-run establishment where island living meets modern comfort. 
We have fond childhood memories on the property before its transformation into a vacation rental oasis. 
Each condo is individually owned and thoughtfully appointed, ensuring a unique and personalized experience for our guests. We invite you to experience the warmth of Belizean hospitality in every detail during your stay with us.

name: Home in Belmopan · ★4.91 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Guests can walk to restaurants, stores, supermarkets, bus station and everywhere. If it's raining, they can take a taxi for about $2.50 U.S. or $5 Bze. Belmopan is a fairly safe city that encourages walking.
host_about:
Since hard work doesn’t kill anyone, I believe in maximizing each day between family and my job. I enjoy family get togethers. Thanksgiving and Super Bowl weekend brings out the playfulness in me. 

Hobbies include fishing, traveling and spending quality time with my wife and kids.

host_about:
Vacasa
Vacation Home Management

Vacasa unlocks the possibilities of how we enjoy vacation homes. We take care of managing our homeowners’ vacation houses so they can have peace of mind (and their home when they want to). And our guests book vacations confidently knowing they’re going to find exactly what they’re looking for without any surprises.

Each vacation home is always cared for by our professional local teams who implement our high cleanliness and maintenance values, while the hands-off tasks of vacation rental management--marketing, filing taxes, and maintaining a website--are handled by a specialized central support team. Our passion and focus remain true: to empower our homeowners, guests, and employees to invest in vacation.

name: Bungalow in Ladyville · ★4.76 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
This bungalow house is located just outside of the hustle and bustle of Belize City, yet close enough to arrive by a short drive. Nestled in the peaceful suburbs and surrounded by nature, this bungalow house is located on a gated private property in one of the safest neighborhoods in Belize.
The bungalow house is just 5 -8 minutes drive away from supermarkets, restaurants, clubs, banks, pharmacies, and 10 minutes drive away from the international airport.
The apartment is located at a perfect location from which to explore Belize. There are also many tourist attractions nearby such as the Altun Ha Maya Ruin, the Belize River, the Belize Baboon Sanctuary, the Bird Sanctuary, the Belize Zoo, Zipp Lining, Cave Tubing, and more.
host_about: Greetings! I am Paula, a retired high school teacher. I spend my time running my Airbnb rental (C-Ray Vacation Rentals) and supporting my two sons and my husband in all their endeavors whether it be in the sport of road cycling,  their professional careers or our trucking business. I enjoy going to church and I love nature, traveling, reading and exercising. I enjoy meeting and interacting with people of different cultures.

name: Rental unit in Caye Caulker · ★4.91 · 3 bedrooms · 6 beds · 3 baths
host_about: Velento Rentals-19 unique Properties on the Island of Caye Caulker, a quaint island surrounded by the second largest reef in the world. Top notch diving, snorkeling, fishing. Warm weather year round. Lots of beach restaurants/pubs within walking distance. All of our properties have amenities such as large swimming pools, private dock access, AC, wifi, and  palapas for relaxation. Great for Families, couples, or honeymooners.

name: Townhouse in San Ignacio · ★4.86 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: Located just 15 minutes walking distance from downtown, the home is perched on top of a hill offering great views of the Bullet Tree River Valley, and gets great breeze throughout the day. We are located just 20 minutes away from one of the country's major Mayan ruins (Cahal Pech), and have 3 grocery stores all within 5 minute's walking distance from the house. The neighborhood is safe, with a neighborhood watch program in place, and very friendly neighbors.
host_about:
Welcome to beautiful San Ignacio.
I am a retired accountant , born & grown in San Ignacio ! 

Breezy Panorama House sits on top of a hill allowing you to relax and admire the surrounding mountains with the historical Cahal Pech maya temples in its backyard!
You enjoy privacy as house is all  yours and enjoy taking in the view from the balcony.  

We are Gold Standard and 
I am fully vaccinated and  follow COVID  protocols !

name: Loft in San Ignacio · ★4.95 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: Located just 15 minutes walking distance from downtown, the home is perched on top of a hill offering great views of the Bullet Tree River Valley, and gets great breeze throughout the day. We are located just 20 minutes away from one of the country's major Mayan ruins (Cahal Pech), and have 3 grocery stores all within 5 minute's walking distance from the house. The neighborhood is safe, with a neighborhood watch program in place, and very friendly neighbors.
host_about:
Welcome to beautiful San Ignacio.
I am a retired accountant , born & grown in San Ignacio ! 

Breezy Panorama House sits on top of a hill allowing you to relax and admire the surrounding mountains with the historical Cahal Pech maya temples in its backyard!
You enjoy privacy as house is all  yours and enjoy taking in the view from the balcony.  

We are Gold Standard and 
I am fully vaccinated and  follow COVID  protocols !

name: Home in Hopkins · ★4.95 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Shallow Bay Beach House is located in Sittee Point resort and residential area just outside Hopkins Village in Belize. From this location, you can enjoy life in a real working seaside community along with a full spectrum of the traditional and leading edge, both in music and food. This vibrant community will not leave you unchanged.

Enjoy your privacy and creature comforts, dip into the sea, or immerse yourself in a new culture—all from Shallow Bay Beach House, your private beach getaway. The resort area is minutes away (less than 1 mile) with restaurants and bars and offers golf cart and kayak rentals. The village of Hopkins is within 2 miles and provides local charm, culture, food and music and the friendliest people on earth. Hike the jungle, engage the sea, climb a Mayan ruin. or watch the local birds, all from Shallow Bay Beach House.
host_about:
We are from Southern California, USA. We both work in technology and love to travel locally and internationally.
While traveling we discovered Belize and fell in love with Hopkins. We decided to make this our second home. We enjoy our beautiful Caribbean beach house, listening to the waves and feeling the ocean breeze. We wanted to share this wonderful place with other travelers and this is how we became AirBnB hosts. We have been hosting with AirBnB now for more than 5 years and really enjoy it. We are easy going, positive people who are open to new cultures and meeting people from different backgrounds. We have now discovered a beautiful backcountry San Diego right in our backyard and are proud to host another vacation home in the historic town of Julian, California.

name: Condo in San Pedro · ★4.25 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: We are just a few blocks to the super fun and colorful town of San Pedro, which is the main town on Ambergris Caye. Grand Baymen is close to supermarkets, restaurants, and golf cart rentals.
host_about:
ECI DEVELOPMENT LTD

CREATING VALUE THROUGH SOCIALLY RESPONSIBLE DEVELOPMENT

ECI Development is a real estate development company working in Central and Latin America for over 20 years, creating people-centered, vibrant communities. We create value through socially responsible development of properties. 

We would be honored to have you as our guest and would love to have you stay with us!

name: Home in San Ignacio · ★4.65 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
We are in the heart of downtown San Ignacio just steps away from the town center, great bars, restaurants and archaeological sites. A great location to get around town by foot or by public transportation.

San Ignacio is a small, culture-oriented town located in the mountainous Cayo District of mainland Belize. Its location is perfect for any travelers coming from or going to Guatemala and Mexico and of course travelers looking to explore the natural treasures Belize has to offer. With many amazing water falls, rivers, caves, Mayan Temples, animal life and unique experiences, everyone will find their reason to stay a little longer than expected.

name: Condo in Seine Bight · ★5.0 · 4 bedrooms · 10 beds · 3.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: In the gated community of Naia only 4 minutes walk along the beach is the Naia Spa Resort located, which offers relaxing Spa treatments, a fitness center and 2 Restaurants as a nice addition to the neighborhood. Next door to the South lies Sirenian Bay Resort with Inky´s Mini Golf Course and Inky´s bar and Grill. Sirenian also offers a tennis and pickleball court, wine cellar, cocktail bar and a spa and fitness center.
host_about:
I am the Property Manager of The Villas at Cocoplum and will answer all your questions about your stay. Once you arrived I will meet and greet you and together with my staff, I will do everything to make your stay memorable and fantastic. 

Originally from Austria, I moved to Belize in 2008. I love to scuba dive, hike, travel and enjoy good food and company.

See you soon in sunny Belize :-)
neighbourhood: Seine Bight, Stann Creek District, Belize

name: Home in San Ignacio · ★4.83 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
This space is amazing because it is only approximately 10 minutes walk to the restaurants and bars downtown. All you have to do is walk down a hill and you'll be there in no time. It is also about 5 minutes walk to a local wine house on the opposite way from going to town.
Please note: There is potential to noise since it is located in close proximity to downtown. You can expect to hear dogs barking, cars passing by, church bells, etc. Nonetheless, you will enjoy the house.
host_about:
Growing up in Belize, I got to experience both the jungle life and the Caribbean Sea life. As a traveler, I know what it is like to want a relaxing and peaceful environment after a long day of exploring & traveling.

My hope is that you’ll enjoy the homes I’ve listed and make it your home while you’re in Belize visiting. 

With Light,

Hannah

name: Condo in San Pedro · ★4.82 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
This unique vacation unit makes you want to simply want to walk around with your camera and create unforgettable memories.
The locals on the island are called San Pedranos. You will certainly feel the calm, friendly aura which makes you not wanting to head back home.

Our reliable staff host a lot of returned guests.
host_about:
Greetings from La Isla Bonita!

I’m an island girl that loves nature. I grew up here on Ambergris Caye in the town of San Pedro so you can call me an island expert.  Feel free to ask me any question, I will be happy to answer you. Travel and meeting people are my passion.  Between my staff and myself we will make sure that your stay with us in an enjoyable one.  Welcome to Ambergris Caye; Welcome to BELIZE.

neighborhood_overview: La Rotonda is happily situated close to the village but far enough to get away from local traffic and crowds.

name: Cottage in Stann Creek District · ★4.89 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Maya Beach has several great restaurants, a couple of grocery stores and even a bowling alley!
host_about:
I am marine biologist and love nature. Originally from Austria we traveled a lot and lived in different countries but somehow Belize doesn't let us go :-) We, my wife Simone and I, live in Maya Beach. For years we have now been working as property managers for several properties in the area. 
We love diving, dining out and a cold beer on our dock overlooking the beautiful canal just steps away from the Placencia lagoon.
We are very much looking forward to hosting you in the small country of Belize.

name: Aparthotel in Seine Bight · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
Gail’s home is located in Seine Bight, Stann Creek District, Belize.

We are situated directly on the Caribbean Sea on the Placencia Peninsula on the edge of the tiny Village of Siene Bight. A 15 minute golf cart drive places you in Placencia Village on the southeastern coast of Belize, a popular holiday destination for North American expats and tourists.

The Placencia village, the worlds smallest Mainstreet called "the sidewalk" is located on the southern tip of the 16-mile long narrow Placencia Peninsula, a relaxed “barefoot friendly” community that bills itself as the caye (island).
host_about: I am a mother of four and have two precious grandchildren.  My husband and I came to Belize in 2008 and the next thing I knew we had bought a small Inn on the Caribbean.  We decided it would be a nice adventure we enjoy meeting new people, so it has turned out to be a good choice for us. And there is always adventure in Belize.
neighbourhood: Seine Bight, Stann Creek District, Belize

name: Cabin in San Ignacio · ★4.95 · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 1 private bath
Rental unit in San Pedro /Ambergris Caye · ★4.91 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Seaside Casa is located on the southernmost tip of the island. If you like to be secluded and have your "private space," then Seaside Casa is for you. So quiet and peaceful, great getaway from all the hustle and bustle.

There is security across the road from us.
host_about: My name is Joan and my husband's name is Michael.  We have been married since 1996.  We came to San Pedro on vacation in 2011.  We instantly fell in love with the island.  We bought property here the same year.   We went back to NY sold our business, our home and everything in it.  We packed 11 suitcases and moved to San Pedro in January 2012.  We have a 21 year old daughter, that lives down here with us.  Her name is Katie.  She does college online.  She was 10 years old when we moved here.  We also have a 34 year old daughter, that is married with a little boy and baby girl.  They live in upstate New York.
neighbourhood: San Pedro /Ambergris Caye, Belize District, Belize

name: Serviced apartment in Placencia · ★4.91 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds
neighborhood_overview: Placencia is very laid back and you can surely get the basic items you will need. It's very informal so come prepared to feel relaxed and enjoy the beach.

name: Home in Belize District · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
Nature lodge in Unitedville‎ · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Nearby are restaurants with a big variety of real good food and a grocery store. A 5 minutes’ walk brings you to a creek with crystal clear water and a nice swimming hole.
host_about:
I born, growing up and educated in Chile, I met My beloved Peter 2015. we started our Green Valley Inn on january 1st. 2017.
 Peter wrote: Born, growing up and educated in Germany, in 2004 I decided to escape the hustle of the daily live in Europe and moved to Belize. 
With Wolfs Place, McWolfs Restaurant and Wolfs Tours I started successful tourism businesses.
This kind of work was a completely new experience. My original background is IT and I used to own and run a computer/ internet company in Germany.
 I revived Wolfs Tours and started with Green Valley Inn a new outlet for tourists.
In my free time I write and publish essays and books about Belize.

name: Guesthouse in Hopkins · ★4.84 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Hopkins is a native fishing village, just a short boat ride to the second largest coral reef in the world. Snorkel with the sea life for the adventure of a lifetime or dive. Tours and boat trips are offered by local certified Tour Guides for a fee. The village has a  large gift shop, numerous restaurants, bike and motorcycle rentals all in walking distance. There is a grocery store right next door for your convenience.  Holidays tend to be loud and festive lasting all night long, so if traveling here for Easter, Christmas, Hopkins Days, St Vince Day Nov 18-Nov 20, New Years and numerous Holidays plan on all night loud festive partying
host_about: We opened the White Horse Guest House, in Hopkins Belize Central America in 2017 to raise money to help build safe houses for human trafficked children. This is a modern 3 rooms, 1 suite and 2 Bungalows right on the Caribbean Sea. We have raised our children and are enjoying our new life. We were from the USA but Belize is now our home. We love to meet new people! We hope you come stay with us!

name: Home in Caye Caulker · ★4.28 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
host_about:
Vacasa
Vacation Home Management

Vacasa unlocks the possibilities of how we enjoy vacation homes. We take care of managing our homeowners’ vacation houses so they can have peace of mind (and their home when they want to). And our guests book vacations confidently knowing they’re going to find exactly what they’re looking for without any surprises.

Each vacation home is always cared for by our professional local teams who implement our high cleanliness and maintenance values, while the hands-off tasks of vacation rental management--marketing, filing taxes, and maintaining a website--are handled by a specialized central support team. Our passion and focus remain true: to empower our homeowners, guests, and employees to invest in vacation.

name: Rental unit in Belize · ★4.85 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Love your stay in this spacious getaway, located in the town of Benque Viejo Del Carmen, you will be less than a 5-minute drive from one of Belize’s most popular attractions, Xunantunich; a Mayan site that dates back more than 1000 years. Also, you will be within 1 mile of the Belizean-Guatemalan border, ideal for travelers who would like to take advantage and visit two countries without having to pay additional airfare.
host_about: Hi my name is Judy and I recently moved back to this tropical paradise I call home. Prior to Belize, I was living in Miami, Florida but always had a desire to come back home where greeting every stranger you walk past is a way of life. I try to live life passionately and I am always excited to meet others who do the same.

host_about: I love nature, road trips, the outdoors and traveling.  I enjoy being a tourist in my beautiful country Belize.

name: Cottage in San Pedro, Ambergris Caye · ★4.83 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Our neighbourhood is known as Mata Grande.  It's one of the most beautiful areas on the island where you will find a number of private homes and a couple small hotels/condos.  Las Amapolas is on a lovely beach and is calm and peaceful.  Since it is on a family estate sometimes you will find family members enjoying the beach.  Our closest neighbour is Captain Robby that lives with his family in the compound.  The main road  is easily accessible but can be bumpy at times due to pot holes. Tropical Escape Grill & Bar is just a three minutes walk on the beach south of the property. They are open for breakfast, lunch and dinner and allow their patrons to swim in the pool.  A few steps north is Mambo's Restaurants at Mata Chica Resorts (high end/expensive). This resort offers a day pass for a fee that enables you to use their pool. These are the closest restaurants to us.  There are a few others within a ten to fifteen minutes drive or many other options in town. There are two small shops cl

Greetings from La Isla Bonita!

I’m an island girl that loves nature. I grew up here on Ambergris Caye in the town of San Pedro so you can call me an island expert.  Feel free to ask me any question, I will be happy to answer you. Travel and meeting people are my passion.  Between my staff and myself we will make sure that your stay with us in an enjoyable one.  Welcome to Ambergris Caye; Welcome to BELIZE.

host_about: Hi I'm from the beautiful country of BELIZE . I live where you vacation and I enjoy every day of it!! was born and raised here but love to travel on my free time. name: Boutique hotel in Placencia · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Placencia is a cute little beach village.  We have delicious food, world class diving, and land activities such as zip lining and tubing.
host_about: We are a highly rated boutique hotel experience, with 12 separate and unique rooms to choose from. Located in the heart of Placencia Village, you will be in walking distance to all the best beaches, restaurants, stores and popular attractions. Let us make your vacation an experience to remember.

name: Villa in San Pedro Town · ★5.0 · 5 bedrooms · 6 beds · 5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The villas are located 3.3 miles north of "the bridge" or 4 miles from the centre of town. It's situated in a location that's just far enough away from the hustle and bustle but is still only a short drive into town. The villas are only a short.5 mile drive to the Secret Beach road.

There is a restaurant and bar right next door at Las Terrazas on the south side of the property, there are several others within a short distance. By cart you have numerous other options between north of the bridge, places like Portofino, Truck Stop, Stella's Smile, Paco's Tiki Bar, Marbucks, Reefers Restaurant and Beach Bar, Rain, Aji Tapa Lounge, Garage Seafood and Steakhouse, Pirates Treasure, Rum Dog, Dive Bar and more. All of the places listed are within a 15-minute golf cart ride of Solaria Villas. Our Mobile Guest Guide lists all of our favourites and more and is integrated with GMaps so you'll have no problem finding them.

There are several grocery stores north of the bridge,

name: Bungalow in Barton Creek · ★4.79 · 2 bedrooms · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: We are in a remote jungle valley with a small village beside us where most of our workers come from ..There are a few small village stores there where all the basics , fruit ,vegetables, snacks and drinks can be purchase . On the other side is the old world Mennonite s that farm with hand and horse ...There primary farming is fruit and vegetables
host_about: Hi, I’m Mike Bogaert. My two boys & I live on our farm on the property that contains Barton Creek Cave, Mike’s Place jungle lodging, & Barton Creek Café. In addition to serving our guests, we are active in serving the local community & provide internet services to the school in Seven Miles El Progresso Community, allowing the young people to pursue their education by utilizing modern technology to keep pace with students in more developed areas.

name: Condo in Ambergris Caye · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
We are located a 1/2 mile north of the bridge leaving San Pedro, Belize. Our neighborhood is more relaxed than the hustle and bustle of downtown but close enough that you are just a short drive from the many restaurants and activities located in town.
There are three restaurants in the immediate vicinity of the property. The on site bar and restaurant, The Dog House Sports Lounge, is open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner (7am – 10pm every day). They have Belizean breakfast dishes and casual bar food and mixed drinks throughout the day.
Just to the north of our property (a 2 minute walk on the beach) is 303 Belize, an over the water bar and restaurant. They are open for lunch and dinner (every day of the week) and focus more on seafood. They have live music most evenings as well. Underneath 303 Belize, is Elite Adventures, a dive and snorkel shop.
Just south of our property is the Farmhouse Market and Cafe. They offer a wide selection of fresh coffees, juices/smoothies,
host_about:
Tres Cocos Resort @ The Cloisters, is a charming family-run establishment where island living meets modern comfort. 
We have fond childhood memories on the property before its transformation into a vacation rental oasis. 
Each condo is individually owned and thoughtfully appointed, ensuring a unique and personalized experience for our guests. We invite you to experience the warmth of Belizean hospitality in every detail during your stay with us.

name: Cabin in Corozal District · ★4.80 · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 1 bath
Condo in Corozal District · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
Villa in Mountain Pine Ridge · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
We are located in Mountain Pine Ridge proper. All visitors that enter the Forest Reserve pass through a secured gate. Our property located between Blancaneaux Lodge and Gaia Riverlodge. Our guests are always welcome to enjoy the restaurants and bars at both lodges.

For those seeking more adventure while in the Mountain Pine Ridge area there are many activities and tours to choose from. We are one of the closest overnight accommodations to the Mayan ruin, Caracol, which is the largest ruin in Belize. Other adventures include Rio Frio Cave, Rio On Pools, 1000 ft. Falls, Barton Creek Cave, ziplining, horseback riding, as well as many other activities. As an added bonus, Big Rock Waterfall is within walking distance from the house (1 mile).
host_about: We are a Belizean/Canadian couple living in San Ignacio, Belize. We love to travel and have set up our vacation rentals just as we would want them if we were the guests!
neighbourhood: Mountain Pine Ridge, Cayo District, Belize

name: Condo in San Ignacio  · ★4.97 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The Cayo District
Belize has a lot to offer to travelers, and the Cayo District in Western Belize is ground zero if you want to make the most of your time here. Guatemala is just a stone’s throw away, but you could stay for months without having to cross over the border to find new things to do.

Cayo used to be the beating heart of the Maya civilization in Belize, and that means that there are still plenty of well-preserved ruins to explore. The same qualities that made Cayo such fertile territory for the Mayas also makes it an ideal location to live, work, and play.

Vast and seemingly endless networks of caves create a fascinating and parallel underworld to what happens on the surface, and these once sacred networks of underground have become popular destinations for spelunking and cave tubing. Aboveground, Cayo is bursting at the seams with hiking trails, dense jungles, and refreshing swimming holes. The low population density and an admirable commitment to
host_about:
I am Virginia Krohn and I am not only the owner of Villa Cayo but I designed, drew the plans for and built the villas.  I am also a real estate broker and the owner of Belize Live-Retire-Invest  which is myself and a group of expats dedicated to helping other people relocate to Belize. 


Originally from Texas I am a sculptor, painter and a custom home builder who knows how to pay attention to detail.   After visiting Belize in the '80s my husband and I returned to the states, sold our home and business and relocated to Belize in 1991.  Living on the beach for almost 20 years just 60' from that beautiful teal water was magical.  As the island changed the magic did disappear and the new dream became building a luxury Eco-resort in the jungle.

 

One of the best things I like about Belize is that I can afford to have someone help run our business,  have a housekeeper and a gardener which allows me the time to do the creative things I want to do while providing jobs for talented Belizeans.  Belize is not for everyone and it is only what you make of it.

neighborhood_overview: We are located in the heart of San Pedro across from the town square and the beach, where you can watch San Pedrano families gather and socialize or try some tacos from the local street vendors.
host_about: Enthusiastic backpacker turned boutique hotel owner. I love to make my guests feel at home here at Parham Plaza Hotel. Sharing travel stories over a couple of beers with my guests is an ideal evening for me.

name: Cabin in San Ignacio · ★4.86 · 1 bedroom · 4 beds · 2 shared baths
Rental unit in Belize · ★4.95 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Guesthouse in Hopkins · ★4.99 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: We are right on the beach! We are in the village of Hopkins, which is part of the charm I think, but I also know that it is not what everybody is looking for. Hopkins is still very much a village community, not a resort tourist destination, but it is a wonderful community with a unique Garifuna culture. Come to Hopkins with that in mind, embrace a different land and culture, and you will love it. If you are looking for a resort style vacation, then we may not be the right place for you. Being in the village can sometimes mean you will hear children, dogs, radios, chicken and roosters, but mostly you will hear the breeze through the palm trees and the sound of the waves.
host_about:
I am the owner and manager of a guesthouse in Hopkins since 1998 and I've managed AJ Palms Apartments since 2014. 
I'm British by birth, and naturalized Belizean by choice. 

I lived in Germany, off and on, for 10 years before moving to Belize. I am fairly good at speaking German, not all that great at writing it - but I am willing to try. 

I've always felt renting out my rooms and apartments is like renting out a part of my home, hopefully my guests get to feel the same way when they I host them.

I'm enjoying my life on the beach.

neighborhood_overview: Nearby are restaurants with a big variety of real good food. A 5 minutes’ walk brings you to a creek with crystal clear water and a nice swimming hole, the Belize River is about 1/2 mile away.
host_about:
I born, growing up and educated in Chile, I met My beloved Peter 2015. we started our Green Valley Inn on january 1st. 2017.
 Peter wrote: Born, growing up and educated in Germany, in 2004 I decided to escape the hustle of the daily live in Europe and moved to Belize. 
With Wolfs Place, McWolfs Restaurant and Wolfs Tours I started successful tourism businesses.
This kind of work was a completely new experience. My original background is IT and I used to own and run a computer/ internet company in Germany.
 I revived Wolfs Tours and started with Green Valley Inn a new outlet for tourists.
In my free time I write and publish essays and books about Belize.

name: Cabin in Punta Gorda · 3 bedrooms · 6 beds · 3 baths
host_about: Born and raised in a tropical country I love the outdoors, the forests and the living on a small farm. I love working with people, and teaching about them about nature. I love reggae and country music, but would listen to most.

name: Condo in Placencia · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Placencia Village is just a 5 minute walk, or if you want, rent a golf cart. This village reminds us of a small Caribbean fishing port with a cool vibe.

name: Rental unit in Spanish Lookout · ★4.30 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
This chunk of heaven has rolling hills with tropical fruit trees and pines. It’s in the Billy White area just 2.5 miles from the popular Mennonite community Spanish Lookout which is the center for local produce, fresh meat, fresh baked goods, and modern-day conveniences.

Quaint, safe Spanish Lookout is 20 minutes from San Ignacio – a favorite of expats and tourists - which also has a hospital. The property is fenced completely; some is cleared for cattle, some for tree & farming and year-round gardening. The rest of the 100 acres is lush tropical vegetation. Heaven Valley has a pond and a freshwater creek running throughout. The property is accessible directly from the main road but maintains privacy and spaciousness.
host_about:
I love driving, checking out real estate and visiting museums.  
Whenever I travel, I to have a Starbucks and a buffet nearby.
I love running or working out every day and eating vegetarian and healthy.
When not working I can usually be found at the health food store .

name: Rental unit in San Pedro · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Although we are close to everything, we are tucked back into a residential neighborhood that is fairly quiet and the ocean is a 2 minute stroll from your front door. Our neighborhood is safe and you will feel comfortable walking around no matter if it is day or night. We have bars and restaurants close by in walking distance. We are located near the airstrip, However, we are at the sweet spot where the planes have either already taken off or are coasting in for their landing, so it is pretty quiet, considering. For those that prefer a gym to the beach for a work out, it is just down the road from us and day passes to the pool are available for our guests!

*Please note that we are not on the beach - especially when you are reviewing the property "Location" category after your stay. We work really hard to do everything we can to ensure that all our reviews are 5 stars in all categories in order to keep our Superhost rating; but we cannot change our location on the island. If
host_about:
Gold Standard Certified Property Owner, all units are certified and available for guests. 

I'm Lisa, I first visited Belize in 2016 and fell in love with the feel of the country of Belize. Every region has it's own magic, but I found mine on Ambergris Caye in San Pedro. The people are the friendliest that you will find anywhere and will make you feel welcome! 

I am not just an Abnb host that has an extra bedroom or unit to rent out and want to make a few extra bucks.  Belize Tropical Dream Villas is a unique property with an invested and hospitality trained owner. This property and the guests that stay with me are the heart of my business!  

My life dreams and goals have included being near the ocean for years now and I have the heart for hospitality.  After getting dual degrees in Hospitality Management and Culinary Arts, I began looking for a place to make my dream a reality!  

Belize met my 5 criteria: 
1. Close to the ocean  
2. English speaking  
3. Easy currency conversion
4. Affordable and fairly quick for our guests to get to 
5. Affordable to purchase inside our means

When the opportunity was presented to be able to purchase an apartment building in my favorite city - I decided to make a leap of faith and catch my dream! 

I am excited to share the island with you, help you feel comfortable and at home here, and most important - ensure that you have a most memorable vacation filled with experiences unique to the beautiful country of Belize!  

- Your Host, Lisa

name: Condo in San Pedro · ★4.97 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: This complex is just a block away from the turquoise Caribbean sea and white beach. It is conveniently located close to supermarkets,a hardware store, a bakery, gas station, restaurants and bars, golf cart rental and a church.
host_about: Hummingbird Island Suites is owned by Hummingbird Furnishings, an award winning Belizean family business. On October 5th 1987, Robert and Yvette Lopez humbly began crafting furniture in their garage. Today, Hummingbird Furnishings has become Belize's premier furniture manufacturer, furnishing the finest resorts and homes across Belize. In 2015, they ventured into the hospitality business with locations in San Pedro, Ambergris Caye and Maya Beach on the Placencia peninsula. Both locations have private vacation suites with accommodations for up to 20 guests to enjoy a quiet, comfortable and affordable vacation. Each suite is personally decorated and accessorized for guests to feel at home.

name: Serviced apartment in Seine Bight · ★4.50 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Gail’s home is located in Seine Bight, Stann Creek District, Belize.

We are situated directly on the Caribbean Sea on the Placencia Peninsula on the edge of the tiny Village of Siene Bight. A 15 minute golf cart drive places you in Placencia Village on the southeastern coast of Belize, a popular holiday destination for North American expats and tourists.

The Placencia village, the worlds smallest Mainstreet called "the sidewalk" is located on the southern tip of the 16-mile long narrow Placencia Peninsula, a relaxed “barefoot friendly” community that bills itself as the caye (island).
host_about: I am a mother of four and have two precious grandchildren.  My husband and I came to Belize in 2008 and the next thing I knew we had bought a small Inn on the Caribbean.  We decided it would be a nice adventure we enjoy meeting new people, so it has turned out to be a good choice for us. And there is always adventure in Belize.
neighbourhood: Seine Bight, Stann Creek District, Belize

name: Rental unit in Chunox · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
host_about:
Stephen Honeybill has been a gentleman of adventure and a world traveler his whole life.  His career as an award winning producer / director of television programs began at the BBC and subsequently PBS. His career allowed him to fulfill his passion to explore many of the world’s most interesting and beautiful countries.  In his personal travels, he sailed a 50 foot ketch 10,000 miles from Hong Kong to the Mediterranean, surviving an attack by pirates in the Indian Ocean.  Stephen was also the navigator of “Ten Romeo” a single engine Beach Bonanza from Albany, New York to the North Pole.  Later, on a trans-Atlantic flight, the crew set a world speed record for a flight from Washington D.C. to Moscow.
A trip in 2010 brought Stephen to Belize, where Queen Elizabeth graces the country’s bank notes and English is spoken.  In early 2011, he moved to Belize. After designing and overseeing the construction, The Crimson Orchid Inn opened in December of 2012.

name: Bed and breakfast in Chunox · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Orchid Bay is a gated community with 24/7 security for your peace of mind.
host_about:
Stephen Honeybill has been a gentleman of adventure and a world traveler his whole life.  His career as an award winning producer / director of television programs began at the BBC and subsequently PBS. His career allowed him to fulfill his passion to explore many of the world’s most interesting and beautiful countries.  In his personal travels, he sailed a 50 foot ketch 10,000 miles from Hong Kong to the Mediterranean, surviving an attack by pirates in the Indian Ocean.  Stephen was also the navigator of “Ten Romeo” a single engine Beach Bonanza from Albany, New York to the North Pole.  Later, on a trans-Atlantic flight, the crew set a world speed record for a flight from Washington D.C. to Moscow.
A trip in 2010 brought Stephen to Belize, where Queen Elizabeth graces the country’s bank notes and English is spoken.  In early 2011, he moved to Belize. After designing and overseeing the construction, The Crimson Orchid Inn opened in December of 2012.
property_type: Private room in bed and breakfast

name: Boutique hotel in Seine Bight · ★4.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
We are situated directly on the Caribbean Sea on the Placencia Peninsula on the edge of the tiny Village of Siene Bight. A 15 minute golf cart drive places you in Placencia Village on the southeastern coast of Belize, a popular holiday destination for North American expats and tourists.

The Placencia village, the worlds smallest Mainstreet called "the sidewalk" is located on the southern tip of the 16-mile long narrow Placencia Peninsula, a relaxed “barefoot friendly” community that bills itself as the caye (island).
host_about: I am a mother of four and have two precious grandchildren.  My husband and I came to Belize in 2008 and the next thing I knew we had bought a small Inn on the Caribbean.  We decided it would be a nice adventure we enjoy meeting new people, so it has turned out to be a good choice for us. And there is always adventure in Belize.
neighbourhood: Seine Bight, Stann Creek District, Belize

host_about: We purchased property on the beautiful Island of Ambergris Caye in the Town of San Pedro in 2013. Since we have been busy adding on to our property to create Casa del Rai guest house. host_about: Easy Inn hotel

name: Cabin in Orange Walk · ★4.86 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Orange Walk is a true feel of small town Northern Belize. If you're coming in from Belize City, look out for the sugar factory at the entrance of the town (you'll see two smoke stacks on your right hand side). Acres and acres of cane fields line the highways and villages surrounding Orange Walk. We are also home to 2 of the 3 rum distilleries in Belize. An 8-minute drive will take you to the center of town. The street leading to the market is blocked off for pedestrians on Saturday mornings. Take a stroll and buy some fresh fruit.

Orange Walk is not one of the traditional tourist destinations in Belize. Come here for Mayan Temples, culture, Mestizo cuisine, rum, and friendly people.

If you like adventure, we offer tour of Lamanai Archaeological Site that depart from the riverside deck on the property. More info about this in the "other things to note" section.

....Or you can relax and do nothing. If you don't want to leave the property, Marac
host_about:
We should die with memories…not dreams

"Don't be satisfied with stories, how things have gone with others. Unfold your own myth.” 
― Rumi
neighbourhood: Orange Walk, Orange Walk District, Belize

I can also recommend the best restaurants, shops and pubs. Of course most all of these things I have experienced myself.

name: Boat in Belize City · ★4.78 · 1 bedroom · 8 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The Old Belize Marina sits right on the George Price Highway and very easy to find. Drive to Belize city (take a taxi, rent a car or take a bus - there are plenty passing by, raise your hand. Please mind that if it is an Express bus it won’t stop) and explore the old capital, there are some great restaurants in the area, lots of places to see and walk.
As for the best part - you are couple hours sail away from the best snorkeling places in Belize where you won’t have to stay in line or follow the crowd - you will be all alone where ever we go! We can visit Goffs Caye, St George’s Caye or go to Caye Caukler or Ambergris Caye; Hideaway Caye - eat some fresh catch or swim in the untouched coral reef all around, pirate caye of King Lewey, South water Caye, Tobacco Caye, Thatch Caye, Ray Caye, Long Coco Caye etc! All there just for you! Unlimited snorkeling - captain knows some great spots and can either give you the freedom of exploring on your own or accompany you on that adventure!
host_about: We are a family of 3: mom dad and a7 year old troublemaker!!! We love to travel, especially sail and to meet great people!

name: Bungalow in San Ignacio · ★5.0 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 private bath
host_about: Before permanently settling in Belize, my wife and I traveled the world. Having had the experience of staying in guesthouses and 5star hotels, we realize, what a traveler needs to feel comfortable away from home in a foreign country. We offer a cozy place in a safe neighborhood,  and provide plenty of complementary purified, drinking water.  As a former professor of biology and ecology and my wife as an artist/designer, we incorporate both our talents to ensure our guests will have an exhilarating , educational and comfortable experience in Belize.  We like to make our guests as welcomed as we possibly can in a country, which has so much to offer.                                                                                            If you have any questions please ask.....we are here to be of assistance. Hope to see you soon.

name: Home in Belize City · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
Bed and breakfast in San Ignacio · ★4.95 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: The Mopan river, and free tubing.
host_about: Spending the night under a 100 foot guanacaste tree in a tree house is like nothing else! The lodge is surrounded on three sides by the Mopan River, so a refreshing swim in clear water is never far away and the wildlife of the area abound. Yes, parrots and toucans are in great number here, along with hundreds of other types of birds, making this an ideal location for bird watching.  Coati, agouti, otter, and the giant green iguana are among the many animals which are regular visitors to our beautiful gardens which, though lush and exotic, are virtually mosquito free.
property_type: Private room in bed and breakfast

name: Place to stay in Belmopan · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Frank's Eddy Village is conveniently located in the heart of Belize just minutes from cave tubing, zip lining, and other natural attractions. You'll be just steps away from one of the cleanest natural streams in the world. You won't find many tourists nearby as this is mostly a locals part of town. We're about a 45 minute drive from the international airport.
host_about:
Retired dentist
Retired Navy Captain

name: Home in Hopkins · ★4.69 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
Home in Placencia · ★5.0 · 5 bedrooms · 7 beds · 4.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: neighborhood is very quiet and peaceful,  no big hotel, noisy bar or resort around, we are in a residential part of the village,  where the side walk was still only a path in the sand a few years ago... entertainment is only few minutes away, walking on the side walk to the center of the village or few sandy steps upNorth to the beach club.
host_about: Enjoying the privilege of living in the tropics for the last 20 years of my life and more especially in Belize since 2008 with my husband and 4 kids.  I am engineer in tropical agronomy which gave me the opportunity to travel the world and manage various projects and businesses. Amongst all the places were we lived, we find Belize very special, we fell in love with its peaceful diversity, its diverse and scenic landscapes, its climate, its people, its laid back environment... we love sharing this secret and have no doubt you will love it just as much as we do !

host_about:
I am daughter of Orange Walk Town and look forward to hosting you in my home and my beautiful corner of the world - “Belize!!”.

I enjoy traveling and experiencing new cultures and places and am an avid tourist of my own country as well.  I look forward to sharing with you all that you can do, live and experience in UnBelizable Belize.

name: Home in San Ignacio · ★4.94 · 3 bedrooms · 5 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview: We are located on one of the main streets in San Ignacio. Our home is in a residential neighborhood. Most of the neighbors have lived there for more than 20 yrs. We all know who is who, which makes it safe and peaceful.
host_about:
Born and raised in beautiful Belize, lived in   Texas for some years but back in San Ignacio and hosting our Airbnb Family home. I love meeting new people from every corner of the world.
I am laid back, no frills as one might say. I enjoy company, exchanging stories with friends or quiet time with my family.  I do not have a 9-5 job so Hosting is gold
