name: Farm stay in Belmopan · ★4.92 · 2 bedrooms · 6 beds · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
Beautiful farming community. Meet real farmers and see real farms, see the underrated beauty of small scale agricultural Belize. Great place to walk, jog or hike.

Our favorite places in the neighborhood:

Agua Viva Road: Bike or hike the winding road through the jungle filled with enchanting sights and sounds.

Hummingbird Highway: One of the most scenic drives on Earth. Featured in Time Magazine.

White Rock Farm: Goat milk and luxurious hand-made cheeses on a real animal farm.

Scotchie's in Belmopan: Authentic Caribbean food. We love the soups and jerk chicken.

Lamanai Chocolate: Home of the "Chocolate Experience" on a real Mayan operated Chocolate farm.

Pasquale's in Belmopan: Best calzones, subs and salads around in our opinion.

St Hermann's Cave: Great short hikes. Cave tubing also an option (with licensed guide).

Blue Hole National Park: Swim under the shade of jungle canopy in a natu
host_about: "Life moves pretty fast. If you don't stop and look around once in a while, you could miss it." Ferris Bueller

name: Condo in Placencia · ★4.64 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
host_about:
Vacasa
Vacation Home Management

Vacasa unlocks the possibilities of how we enjoy vacation homes. We take care of managing our homeowners’ vacation houses so they can have peace of mind (and their home when they want to). And our guests book vacations confidently knowing they’re going to find exactly what they’re looking for without any surprises.

Each vacation home is always cared for by our professional local teams who implement our high cleanliness and maintenance values, while the hands-off tasks of vacation rental management--marketing, filing taxes, and maintaining a website--are handled by a specialized central support team. Our passion and focus remain true: to empower our homeowners, guests, and employees to invest in vacation.

name: Boutique hotel in Placencia · ★4.88 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
host_about: ex-pat from Pt Reyes, CA, living in Placencia, Belize for many years, as well as yearly traveller to all parts of the world. I designed and built my property with custom mosaic tilework, lush tropical gardens offering Bananas, Coconuts, Mangoes, Papaya, Star & Passion fruits and more for guests to pick & enjoy with adjacent compost to feed our soil-enjoy many aspects of life, especially all living beings, yoga, meditation, reading, live music and performance-LOVE PUNTA!, gardening, cooking & baking, biking, hiking, kayaking, swimming, snorkeling, and travelling to distant places, meeting like minded people who appreciate life and all it's wonders....enjoy welcoming guests to Placencia and sharing my love of Belize and her varied people and awesome sites.

host_about: We have been in the lodging business 30 years primarily in Vail Colorado. We owned and operated the Minturn Inn for 10 years and most recently owned and operated Hotel Minturn. In conjunction with those we have run minturnrentals which specializes in vacation rentals in Minturn Colorado.  2009  we expanded to Caye Caulker Belize and now have 5 small vacation cottages and a boutique 12 unit Hotel, Weezie's Ocean Front Hotel and Garden Cottages. We have 3 grown children and love escaping the cold Colorado winter for some warmth and sunshine in Caye Caulker

neighborhood_overview: The guest house sits in a residential neighbourhood.  Yet its close to the beach, dock, shops, bakery and restaurants.
host_about:
I was born and raised in Africa.  My parents owned a remote, luxury lodge so I was raised in the bush in Africa.  After high school I travelled extensively  and ended up in Hawaii for over 25 years!  My son moved to the eastern USA and as it was so far from Hawaii, I decided to move closer to him.  Luckily I landed in Belize!  I have been here for 10 years.  My guest house keeps me busy and I love the Airbnb lifestyle!
Can't wait to meet you!

name: Cottage in San Pedro Town, Ambergris Caye, Belize · ★4.87 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Our neighbourhood is known as Mata Grande. It's one of the most beautiful areas on the island where you will find a number of private homes and a couple small hotels/condos. Las Amapolas is on a lovely beach and is calm and peaceful. Since it is on a family estate sometimes you will find family members enjoying the beach. Our closest neighbour is Captain Robby that lives with his family in the compound. The main road is easily accessible but can be bumpy at times due to pot holes. Tropical Escape Grill & Bar is just a three minutes walk on the beach south of the property. They are open for breakfast, lunch and dinner and allow their patrons to swim in the pool. A few steps north on the beach is Mambo's Restaurants at Mata Chica Resorts (high end/expensive). This resort offers a day pass for a fee that enables you to use their pool. These are the closest restaurants to us. There are a few others within a ten to fifteen minutes drive or many other options in town. There are two small sho
host_about:
Greetings from La Isla Bonita!

I’m an island girl that loves nature. I grew up here on Ambergris Caye in the town of San Pedro so you can call me an island expert.  Feel free to ask me any question, I will be happy to answer you. Travel and meeting people are my passion.  Between my staff and myself we will make sure that your stay with us in an enjoyable one.  Welcome to Ambergris Caye; Welcome to BELIZE.
neighbourhood: San Pedro Town, Ambergris Caye, Belize, Belize District, Belize

name: Rental unit in Caye Caulker · ★4.40 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: North Caye Caulker is developing at an incredible rate. We are secluded but just minutes from Blu Zen Resort, it is a short walk from our house and offers a bar, pool and beach front. This is one of the best spots on Caye Caulker and it is located on the north side (like us).
host_about: I am on airbnb to make connections, share the views, the warmth, and the adventure that brought me to my homes around the world.

name: Villa in San Pedro · 4 bedrooms · 5 beds · 3 baths
Villa in San Ignacio · ★4.90 · 3 bedrooms · 5 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Kukulkan Villa is located on a wonderful hilltop setting overlooking the majestic Macal River valley.  Although we are only 10 minutes from San Ignacio Town, and across the river and just a mile upstream from Cristo Rey Village, you will feel like you are on a tropical island.  Unless wedding sounds waft across the river from the village, the only sounds you will hear will be from the surrounding abundant nature.  The many birds and occasional Howler Monkeys will provide you with a unique cacophony.  We hope you enjoy it.  It’s usually cool at night, so if you leave the fully screened windows open, the sound of nature will lull you to sleep.  And nature will clearly announce sunrise!
host_about:
Born and raised in beautiful Belize, I’m a full-time accountant at Francis Coppola’s Hideaways – Turtle Inn. I also oversee Kukulkan which is owned by Alvin Granoff, who is now a former lawyer, hotelier and legislator and now living in the USA. Alvin helped me and my brother pay for high school and also helped me through university.  He is really now really like part of our family and our village where Alvin has helped others manage to get a high school education.
My sister, Esther, and her husband will be on-site and help you with whatever you need.  You also can always reach me most easily by text or email as my work keeps me at Frances Ford Coppola’s hotel in Placencia or I'm with my three daughters being a dad.  But you can always feel free to contact me. I would love to share the many beautiful things Belize has to offer and will do everything possible to make your stay a memorable one.

name: Boutique hotel in Belize City · ★4.50 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: There are supermarkets , restaurants, gas stations, and a bank gym in a walking distance. Three major hospitals are within 2 miles. Also, the Belize sign and seashore promenade is about 10 minutes away , if you want to have a relaxing and safe jogging.
host_about: Easy Inn hotel

name: Home in Placencia · ★4.96 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Laura's Lookout is located in a great spot in Placencia Village. It is within a minute walk of the Main Municipal Pier, which is a popular spot for fishing, sightseeing, and swimming. There are also at least 6 restaurants within a minute walk, including Above Ground Coffee House and Tutti Frutti Gelateria. The beach is just minutes away, so you can easily enjoy all that Placencia has to offer. Diving or Snorkeling, the Dive shops are seconds away!

The house itself is located in a gated yard with 2 businesses, including the Placencia Post Office and Placencia Office Supply.

Overall, this house is a great option for those looking for a centrally located place to stay in Placencia. It is close to everything you could want or need.
host_about: I  am an artist and  business owner making Placencia, Belize my home for the past 25 years.

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood has a traditional look but most buildings are business oriented.  There are small hotels, boutiques, restaurants and stores on the same street.  Therefore, you can stay comfortably and experience a Belizean downtown neighborhood.

name: Farm stay in Punta Gorda · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
Our village has a wealth of hidden treasures: there are several cacao farms who do tours and chocolate making, there is a wonderful Permaculture farm and also a butterfly farm, where you can see how to raise the amazing Blue Morpho butterfly, among others. You can go swimming, visit Maya ruins, caves, waterfalls, go on jungle hikes, nature is at your beck and call!
You can also make a trip into PG, to see the market, make drums, sample local culture ...the list goes on....!

name: Rental unit in Ambergris Caye · ★4.80 · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Secluded, tropical and peaceful; you have the best of both worlds at our place: peace and relaxation away from the very animated village, or in a 35 to 45 minutes golf cart ride (if you feel adventurous and curious to discover the island!), there you are in the middle of the village with its friendly and smiling locals, boutiques, bars and restaurants!
host_about: Hello everyone.  We love to travel the world but our favorite is going from our home in the mountains to the beaches of Belize.  We hope you will love our Caribbean beach home and enjoy it as much as we do.

name: Cabin in Teakettle · ★4.67 · Studio · 2 beds · 1 bath
host_about: I am a retired diplomat and former senior officer in the Government of Belize. I enjoy nature and the quiet serenity of the rainforest. I also love people, great music, great conversations and great movies. I have travelled all over the world in my capacity as Ambassador, and have met many interesting people with whom I still keep in contact. My wife, Bernadette, and I are very open-minded and treat our guests as friends and kin. Retirement from diplomacy meant a new direction, so we chose to build three cottages and open our private retreat to paying guests, which would keep us in contact with people from all over the world. We love it here. We are happy to have you join us in a welcoming, uncomplicated environment where warmth and friendship await you. The longer you stay, the happier we all are. We particularly like to host persons who are on short or long-term consultancies in the Belmopan area; newlyweds looking for a honeymoon getaway, couples with young families, or adventurous grown-ups who use our place as a base for forays into rock-climbing, zip-lining, cave-tubing, rainforest hiking or ancient Maya site explorations; also retired couples who just want a quiet place to refresh the soul. You are all welcome.

name: Hotel in Caye Caulker · ★4.38 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Caye Caulker is a popular destination for scuba divers, snorkelers, anglers, and tourists who just want beach- oriented relaxation at budget prices. Although in the past it was sleepy fishing community, this fun loving island is today known more for its exotic tours to the world's 2nd largest Barrier Reef as well as the famous Hol Chan Marine Reserve. Take a ferry to the northside of the island and make a stop at Northside Beach or Blu Zen and enjoy the elegant services offered. Take pleasure in visiting Iguana Reef to experience the breathtaking sunset view while catching sight of the seahorses and stingrays.
host_about:
Hi , my name is Brandon and my Husband is Adam and we hope to be your host on the magical island of Caye Caulker . We fell in love  with this little island the first time we came here. Now, we are so happy to share our little piece  of this  paradise with you.  If you have the time, read our back ground story  of how we came to be. In mean time cheers to everyone!!! 

All my Listings are located at Popeyes Beach Condos, Caye Caulker which is now officially Gold Standard Certified! Thanks to our Amazing Team.

name: Home in San Pedro · ★4.88 · 4 bedrooms · 5 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The area is generally peaceful (quiet time 10 pm) with a few other houses and condo buildings in the beachfront area. Casa Redonda is separated by thick palm trees with its neighbor to the south & via a fence from the house to the north.

When you want to venture out of “seclusion” from your beach home, Stax Sunset Lounge and Cafe is a 3 minute walk away. Playa de Sala rooftop bar & restaurant is about a mile south. Just under a mile north (on the way to town) is the beachfront “Nest Grill” at Pelican Reef, and a bit beyond that are the Black Orchid Restaurant and Southern Charm Country Kitchen. Marin’s mini-mart is not far from these restaurants, and of course there are many other grocery shopping and dining options on the way to and in town.
host_about:
I've lived most of my life in the U.S. (where I am from) but have also lived for a couple of months to up to two years in different countries: Germany, Spain, Australia, Colombia, Ecuador, Mexico, & Belize. Since 2011 I've been living a somewhat nomadic lifestyle while exploring, working & volunteering in new & old places in the Americas and Europe. It's a great way to keep learning!

In my travels I stumbled upon the opportunity to do something that I love -- helping vacation rental owners help people like you with their dream vacations on Ambergris Caye, Belize!

I also have a condo in Cartagena, Colombia; if you're looking for a 30+ night stay (to volunteer; learn Spanish, salsa dancing, or scuba diving; work remotely with a Caribbean view; escape the winter...) let me know!

'Pack for a Purpose' is an organization that links travelers who'd like to help fulfill wish lists of non-profits in developing countries. I partner with them with schools, community organizations & animal rescue groups in both Colombia & Belize. These groups would love to have your help!

Not yet an AirBNB member? Join via this referral link and save $$ on your first booking, maybe even for a stay in Cartagena or Belize! : www.airbnb.com/c/bsmalley

name: Home in San Ignacio · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
host_about: Before permanently settling in Belize, my wife and I traveled the world. Having had the experience of staying in guesthouses and 5star hotels, we realize, what a traveler needs to feel comfortable away from home in a foreign country. We offer a cozy place in a safe neighborhood,  and provide plenty of complementary purified, drinking water.  As a former professor of biology and ecology and my wife as an artist/designer, we incorporate both our talents to ensure our guests will have an exhilarating , educational and comfortable experience in Belize. If you have any questions please ask.....we are here to be of assistance. Hope to see you soon.

name: Home in San Pedro Belize · ★4.95 · 4 bedrooms · 8 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview: Still Waters Belize is located in Mata Grande, a delightful residential area approximately 4 miles north of the bridge (San Pedro town).  This is one of the few areas of the island where you can walk the beach, without divisions by fences and bulkheads, and where the water meets the sand offering a beach and not bulkhead or seawall.  We are a quick 20 minute golf cart ride (and even shorter boat ride) to and from town, making it easy to go to town for shopping or dinner. However, there are several great restaurants and bars within walking distance (like Rojo Lounge, Sundiver Bar, Mambos at Mata Chica, etc.), and once you experience the peace and serenity that Still Waters offers, you may find yourself not wanting to leave the property!  Mata Grande grocery store is a two minute walk away and also offers grocery delivery services.

host_about:
I born, growing up and educated in Chile, I met My beloved Peter 2015. we started our Green Valley Inn on january 1st. 2017.
 Peter wrote: Born, growing up and educated in Germany, in 2004 I decided to escape the hustle of the daily live in Europe and moved to Belize. 
With Wolfs Place, McWolfs Restaurant and Wolfs Tours I started successful tourism businesses.
This kind of work was a completely new experience. My original background is IT and I used to own and run a computer/ internet company in Germany.
 I revived Wolfs Tours and started with Green Valley Inn a new outlet for tourists.
In my free time I write and publish essays and books about Belize.

name: Nature lodge in Gales Point · ★4.91 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: This is the original, ancestor village to the run a way slaves of the creole population.  Mahogany cutters for England.  Many of the cultural traditions are practiced still today.  Drumming and singing Sombi.  Weaving of baskets and nets.  Cooking healthy foods right from the farm.
host_about: Live to share my love for the village and the people in it.  Love nature and helping others discover.  It is my wife Myrtles dream to have a restaurant that fills the soul with healthy food.  90% of all our food comes from with in 10  mile of village.  Local farmers provide tree ripened fruits and vegetables.

Vacation Home Management

And our guests book vacations confidently knowing they’re going to find exactly what they’re looking for without any surprises.

Each vacation home is always cared for by our professional local teams who implement our high cleanliness and maintenance values, while the hands-off tasks of vacation rental management--marketing, filing taxes, and maintaining a website--are handled by a specialized central support team. Our passion and focus remain true: to empower our homeowners, guests, and employees to invest in vacation.

name: Resort in San Pedro, Ambergris Caye · 10 bedrooms · 8 beds · 10 baths
neighborhood_overview: Belize is the only English speaking Latin American country, offering all the rich history, tastes and colors of Latin America and the Caribbean, with the convenience of being both an English and Spanish speaking country. The resort is on an island off the coast of Belize, just over a mile south of San Pedro Town, which is far enough from the hustle and bustle to provide a truly tranquil setting and its own private beach access (the cove shaped beach is over 300ft long!). The pool, perhaps the largest on the entire island, is where I like to relax and enjoy the nighttime sky’s thousands of stars. You can see the beach from the pool and it is one of the most tranquil places I have ever been. The island has almost no cars, mostly golf carts, making it quiet and serene as well as environmentally friendly.

name: Bungalow in Belmopan · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
We are located in the Mountain View area of Belmopan a safe residential neighborhood near many stores, government offices, banks and health facilities. The neighbors are both friendly and often join us for supper when we make local Belizean food.

Belmopan is the Capitol of Belize and is the safest place to be, very quiet and homey and we have noticed has developed into a fitness culture. So you may often meet your host going to walk around the 'Ring Road' which is the central main road at the center of Belmopan which surrounds the original neighborhoods of Belmopan.

name: Boutique hotel in San Ignacio · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: We are situated 2.5 miles from the center of town (a mere 5 minutes' drive). This puts us in a secluded setting, away from the buzz of town. We boast panoramic, fresh views of the Maya Mountains. Our nature-filled setting will be sure to bring you much relaxation and wellness.

name: Home in San Ignacio · ★4.98 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
host_about: Born and raised in Belize, we moved to Florida to attend college.  Our roots remain strong in Belize and we love sharing our passion for our country with the world!

name: Rental unit in San Ignacio · ★5.0 · 17 bedrooms · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Our Guest house is minutes from center of San Ignacio Town; a vibrant traveler center from where all roads and activities spread out. Together with twin-town Santa Elena, on the east bank of the Macal River, this is the main population center to interact with locals and other travelers.
host_about: A family operated business, we try our best to live up to the expectation of our guest.

name: Home in San Pedro Belize · ★4.80 · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The area is generally peaceful (quiet time 10 pm) with a few other houses and condo buildings in the beachfront area. Casa Redonda is separated by thick palm trees with its neighbor to the south & via a fence from the house to the north.

When you want to venture out of “seclusion” from your beach home, Stax Sunset Lounge and Cafe is a 3 minute walk away. Playa de Sala rooftop bar & restaurant is about a mile south. Just under a mile north (on the way to town) is the beachfront “Nest Grill” at Pelican Reef, and a bit beyond that are the Black Orchid Restaurant and Southern Charm Country Kitchen. Marin’s mini-mart is not far from these restaurants, and of course there are many other grocery shopping and dining options on the way to and in town.
host_about:
I've lived most of my life in the U.S. (where I am from) but have also lived for a couple of months to up to two years in different countries: Germany, Spain, Australia, Colombia, Ecuador, Mexico, & Belize. Since 2011 I've been living a somewhat nomadic lifestyle while exploring, working & volunteering in new & old places in the Americas and Europe. It's a great way to keep learning!

In my travels I stumbled upon the opportunity to do something that I love -- helping vacation rental owners help people like you with their dream vacations on Ambergris Caye, Belize!

I also have a condo in Cartagena, Colombia; if you're looking for a 30+ night stay (to volunteer; learn Spanish, salsa dancing, or scuba diving; work remotely with a Caribbean view; escape the winter...) let me know!

'Pack for a Purpose' is an organization that links travelers who'd like to help fulfill wish lists of non-profits in developing countries. I partner with them with schools, community organizations & animal rescue groups in both Colombia & Belize. These groups would love to have your help!

Not yet an AirBNB member? Join via this referral link and save $$ on your first booking, maybe even for a stay in Cartagena or Belize! : www.airbnb.com/c/bsmalley

name: Rental unit in Belmopan · ★4.31 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The university and University gym are two minutes walk from the apartment.  There is also a grocery store five min walk away.
host_about: Couple with adult teenager and small child, no pets and a building with private units in a beautiful city.  Enjoy relaxing and being outdoors.

name: Rental unit in Belize City · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The unit is centrally located as it is has a restaurant directly across the street from the apt building ,its 5 mins walk from ATM, a huge grocery supermarket . Two  bakeries , a tortilla shop ,3 local restaurants and other small broceries shops are all within 5 mins walking or 1 block away from us.
host_about:
I love to travel and stay in nice accommodations.
 I have been to many places and know what traveler/vacationer look forward to. Let me help to make your vacation an unforgettable memory,

name: Townhouse in Benque Viejo Del Carmen · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: We are a peaceful people and the zone is very nice, calm and quiet. we are a friendly zone.
host_about: Outgoing and humble!  Nice to meet people! :) I love traveling and interacting & exploring the different cultures around the world.

name: Condo in San Pedro · ★4.99 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Location, location, location. Our neighborhood is the heart of the island with so much to offer. It's perfect for exploring, getting to know the locals and moving around easily. Next door we have one of the most popular local favs for ceviche and happy hour. Behind us we have a convenient grocery store, a pharmacy, and an adorable cafe. Within 2 minutes, you'll find the town's Central Park and a myriad of great restaurants. In front of us one of the most well known dive shops and a breezy massage place.

If you're looking to be in the middle of it all but with a beach retreat for peace and quiet, this is the perfect base.
host_about:
Hi! I'm Dora, born and raised in Belize. I grew up on one of Belize's islands and love to travel. I'm an entrepreneur,  a people lover, a laugh out louder, a super fan of my country, Belize. 

I love good food and creating and being part of awesome experiences.  :)

name: Condo in  Hopkins Village · ★4.93 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Hopkins is widely considered a hidden gem in Belize. It is a small, coastal, fishing village that is centrally located to the vast majority of Belize's most exciting water and land attractions. Hopkins Village is a Garifuna village on the coast of the Stann Creek District in Belize. Hopkins is considered by some Belizeans to be the cultural center of the Garifuna population in Belize. The town hosts its own national holiday, Hopkins Day, and welcomes people for their celebration on Garifuna Independence Day as well, they do this with drum ceremonies that can last till early hours in the morning.
Hopkins is surrounded by the Maya Mountains and the Cockscomb Range inland, and the Caribbean Sea on its shore. It is also very close to the Sittee River.

Today Hopkins is a small but vibrant community of approximately 1,000 villagers. The people live mostly by farming and fishing, and more recently many have found work in the growing tourist industry. The residents are known
host_about: Welcome to Seiri Del Mar Luxury Resort, your ultimate sanctuary of serenity in the heart of Belize. Seiri, meaning “Heaven” in Garifuna, lives up to its name with its breathtaking views of the crystal-clear Caribbean waters and the Belize barrier reef, making it the perfect getaway for those seeking a peaceful and luxurious escape.
neighbourhood: Hopkins Village, Stann Creek District, Belize

name: Treehouse in Sarteneja · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 5 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The house is in a orchard with horses running around. Its very quiet and nature surrounding, and its only 10 minutes walk from the fishing village of Sarteneja. Its a very safe area and the village has many grocery shops and restaurants serving fisherman specialties or vegi menu.
host_about: I am a wildlife biologist, born in Geneva. I like to study animal behavior . I am more an introvert type but enjoy socializing.

name: Home in Hopkins · ★4.96 · 4 bedrooms · 8 beds · 4 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Blue Parrot Beach House is one of the only private beach front rentals located in the resort district, 2 miles south of Hopkins.
The property is walking distance from some of the best restaurant in Hopkins and Belize.
We are next to a Padi 5 star dive shop and within walking distance on many great restaurants, bars, a gym, spa and convenience store.

name: Villa in Hopkins · ★4.71 · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: The house is located in the resort district, 2 miles south of Hopkins,  next to a Padi 5 dive shop and within a 2-10 min walk from  many great restaurants, bars, a gym, spa  and convenience store.

name: Condo in San Pedro · ★4.67 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: We are just a few blocks to the super fun and colorful town of San Pedro, which is the main town on Ambergris Caye. Grand Baymen is close to shopping, restaurants, and grocery store golf cart rentals.
host_about:
ECI DEVELOPMENT LTD

CREATING VALUE THROUGH SOCIALLY RESPONSIBLE DEVELOPMENT

ECI Development is a real estate development company working in Central and Latin America for over 20 years, creating people-centered, vibrant communities. We create value through socially responsible development of properties. 

We would be honored to have you as our guest and would love to have you stay with us!

name: Home in Hopkins/Sittee River Village · ★4.81 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
- Hopkins Village: Hopkins itself is a small village with a collection of exclusive beach resorts to the south of the main village, and several mom-and-pop restaurants and general stores in the village itself. For a small village, Hopkins had an impressive array of places to visit and many activities will keep you quite busy.

- Snorkeling/Scuba Diving: Belize has a magnificent living coral reef which is about 185 miles of a great variety of reef types, exotic coral formations, and encounter eagle rays, sea turtles, a wide diversity of exotic fish, and even dolphins or friendly nurse sharks nesting in this underwater ecosystem. Yes, you read right, dolphins and sharks!
There may be more than 360 species of sharks in the oceans of the world and Belize's waters atolls and mangrove estuaries are home to a few of these. This is truly a remarkable sight and certainly one to remember.

- Hiking Activities: Discover a breath-taking waterfall amidst Maya artifa

name: Bungalow in Stann Creek District · ★4.98 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: The Bungalow @ Pineapple Hill is halfway between the Capitol of Belize and The Caribbean Sea off  the spectacular Hummingbird Highway. you will pass thru Valleys full with Citrus and The Maya Mountains over mountain creeks and crystal clear rivers. Check out our Youtube Video which shows the whole property and amenities https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o3xD4SK1rms&feature=youtu.be. We are in a rural area but, there is a wonderful Ice Cream/yogurt/dairy shop 10 minutes away and a legendary tamale stand 1 minute away (Miss Bertha's Tamales) the zip line at Angel Falls and T.R.E.E.S, a jungle research center are 2 minutes away.Food store is 15 minutes east. All major services can be found in either Belmopan (West)or Dangriga(East) 30 minutes away. Our area is acclaimed as one of the most Beautiful areas in the country with access to all attractions, Maya Ruins as well as hiking, mountain biking, horse back riding, fishing, snorkeling, diving or just sight seeing.I wrote and recorded this s

name: Boat in San Pedro, Ambergris Caye · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Our Caribbean Sea is our backyard. Visit the Cayes and Atolls of Belize on this gorgeous sailing charter.
Add Diving if you like.
host_about:
Belize is an amazing place.  
We want to share our beautiful country with you!   
Sailing in Belize is the way to SEA everything while relaxing, fishing and snorkeling.  Taking in all the sites from The Blue Hole to Turneffe Atolls.
We have OPTIONS with THREE Catamarans to fit all budgets. 
2 High End Yachts with 3 Staterooms /  3 Bathrooms or 3 Staterooms / 2 Bathrooms and come with Chef Service to our more affordable Sailing Catamaran's that have Cooks to make all  your meals.
All options are flexible and we work with our Guests to make sure we cross all our "Ts" and dot all "I's".   We want all our Guests excited to arrive, sad to leave and planning to come back!
These are all inclusive trips and include all meals, all drinks, house bar, your accommodations,  Captain, Crew, Guiding, Cook/Chef Service, cooking, all sailing, fishing and snorkeling and are all apart of your stay with us. 
You can add diving if you like as some of our Crew are also Licensed Instructor & Dive Masters.    We will make sure to make your dreams come true!
This is an amazing vacation with  Xsite Belize Sailing & Adventures!

name: Cabin in Plantation · ★4.91 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
~OUR UNIQUE LOCATION~Why we love Plantation-Maya Beach area:

After 2 years of looking, we accidentally found the Plantation area. We realized that it offered us the perfect combination of “close but not too close” to the resorts and fantastic restaurants (minus the crowds and noise that come with being in a touristic destination.....)

Our property is in the QUIET Plantation area -*AWAY* from the big crowds, but close enough for day visits to the Village.

We are just 5 min drive to resorts with great restaurants.

We are ON THE beach and have the BEST sunset views over the lagoon!!! (With the Mayan mountains in the background... Breathtaking views!...)

We are 20 min drive to Placencia Village/Airport.
Fishing and snorkeling trips can be arranged to be picked up from our location (Ask us about details)

30 min drive to jungles with waterfalls- Jaguar Preserve-Cockscomb Basin Wildlife Sanctuary (We have yet to see a j
host_about: We are Adam and Cristina,  husband and wife duo living in Denver Colorado. We have a passion for discovering beautiful and exotic locations and love for sharing our homes in the city of Denver, in the mountains of Colorado and on the beach of Belize, with other city & nature lovers as well as adventure seekers like ourselves.  Adam is a local Coloradoan with Australian roots and Cristina is originally from Portugal and lived in New York and Los Angeles, before calling Denver home.

host_about: It's a husband and wife effort, and we have 3 beautiful kids. We are very family oriented and are willing to share our space with you.  During the week, the kids attend school and are on a schedule, which will give you a lot of privacy and quite time, if that is what you are looking for.  During the weekends, we spend time either at home or we go to explore some beautiful location in Belize.

name: Boutique hotel in Belize City · ★4.74 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
The Great House Inn is located in the historic Fort George Area: The Fort George area, a peninsula ringed by Marine Parade Boulevard and Fort Street, is one of the most pleasant in Belize City. Meander in the neighborhood and you’ll pass some impressive homes and buildings, including The Great House Inn now the only colonial guest house. The Baron Bliss Memorial and Fort George Lighthouse stand guard over it all. Towering over the coastline and facing the Belize Harbor, the Fort George Lighthouse was built as part of the memorial for Baron Bliss, Belize’s greatest benefactor. In fulfillment of his dying wish and financed with the generous proceeds he left the country, the tall structure was erected next to his tomb and memorial. While the public cannot enter the lighthouse, it remains an important, historic landmark in Belize City and is easy to spot while touring the Fort George area. The views from there also make for a nice photo op.

The sea breeze can be pleasant here,

name: Condo in San Ignacio  · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
We are located at mile 1 1/2 Cristo Rey Road in San Ignacio.  We are pinned on google maps and can be located easity.

Let us
know your arrival time at the Int'l airport and whether you are driving or
using the shuttle so that we can estimate your time of arrival.  We live here but we want to make sure we are
onsite when you arrive.

 

I
should mention that GPS does not work well here because there are no street
addresses.  Best thing to use is Google Maps because most of the
businesses here in Cayo have pins that show where we are located.  But
just case here is directions you can print out or put on your phone.  



First
of all.............

 

 

Customs will ask you
where you are staying and the address!

Villa Cayo, Mile 1 1/2
Cristo Rey Rd, in Santa Elena
host_about:
I am Virginia Krohn and I am not only the owner of Villa Cayo but I designed, drew the plans for and built the villas.  I am also a real estate broker and the owner of Belize Live-Retire-Invest  which is myself and a group of expats dedicated to helping other people relocate to Belize. 


Originally from Texas I am a sculptor, painter and a custom home builder who knows how to pay attention to detail.   After visiting Belize in the '80s my husband and I returned to the states, sold our home and business and relocated to Belize in 1991.  Living on the beach for almost 20 years just 60' from that beautiful teal water was magical.  As the island changed the magic did disappear and the new dream became building a luxury Eco-resort in the jungle.

 

One of the best things I like about Belize is that I can afford to have someone help run our business,  have a housekeeper and a gardener which allows me the time to do the creative things I want to do while providing jobs for talented Belizeans.  Belize is not for everyone and it is only what you make of it.

name: Nature lodge in San Ignacio · ★4.97 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: The Mopan river, and free tubing.
host_about: Spending the night under a 100 foot guanacaste tree in a tree house is like nothing else! The lodge is surrounded on three sides by the Mopan River, so a refreshing swim in clear water is never far away and the wildlife of the area abound. Yes, parrots and toucans are in great number here, along with hundreds of other types of birds, making this an ideal location for bird watching.  Coati, agouti, otter, and the giant green iguana are among the many animals which are regular visitors to our beautiful gardens which, though lush and exotic, are virtually mosquito free.

name: Home in San Pedro · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: The suites are in a very quiet and private community, only blocks away from the restaurants, bakery of fine breads or pastries, and from grocery stores . Also, fruits & vegetables stands are located very close. Banana Beach has a great restaurant and bar; Robins Kitchen and Delicia have wonderful inexpensive fine Belizian food just a few hundred feet away.

name: Condo in Ambergris Caye · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
We are located a 1/2 mile north of the bridge leaving San Pedro, Belize. Our neighborhood is more relaxed than the hustle and bustle of downtown but close enough that you are just a short drive from the many restaurants and activities located in town.
There are three restaurants in the immediate vicinity of the property. The on site bar and restaurant, The Dog House Sports Lounge, is open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner (7am – 10pm every day). They have Belizean breakfast dishes and casual bar food and mixed drinks throughout the day.
Just to the north of our property (a 2 minute walk on the beach) is 303 Belize, an over the water bar and restaurant. They are open for lunch and dinner (every day of the week) and focus more on seafood. They have live music most evenings as well. Underneath 303 Belize, is Elite Adventures, a dive and snorkel shop.
Just south of our property is the Farmhouse Market and Cafe. They offer a wide selection of fresh coffees, juices/smoothies,
host_about:
Tres Cocos Resort @ The Cloisters, is a charming family-run establishment where island living meets modern comfort. 
We have fond childhood memories on the property before its transformation into a vacation rental oasis. 
Each condo is individually owned and thoughtfully appointed, ensuring a unique and personalized experience for our guests. We invite you to experience the warmth of Belizean hospitality in every detail during your stay with us.

host_about: Am a 35 years Belizean that likes to travel, and at times it is difficult to find a space for a reasonable price. this motivated me to offer my space for travelers that are looking for comfort without the price tag.   the space offered has basic amenities for spending  a day or a few days,  always having the traveler in mind

name: Rental unit in Belmopan · ★4.67 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Conveniently located in the heart of Belmopan, restaurants, supermarkets, and activities are all short walks away.
host_about:
Born, raised, and having spent most of my life in Belize City, I moved to Belmopan about ten years ago. I am an avid lover and collector of local wooden sculptures which can be seen throughout my apartments. My collection includes giant sculptures that weigh thousands of pounds to small mayan heads.  My goal is to provide my guests with a good value - clean safe and unique spaces to stay while in Belmopan, at an affordable price. I am available by (Hidden by Airbnb) or phone call at any time. 

Please note that all my apartments, ranging from studios to two-bedrooms, are located in the same compound on Constitution Drive.

name: Resort in San Pedro · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 6 shared baths
neighborhood_overview: Belize is the only English speaking Latin American country, offering all the rich history, tastes and colors of Latin America and the Caribbean, with the convenience of being both an English and Spanish speaking country. The resort is on an island off the coast of Belize, just over a mile south of San Pedro Town, which is far enough from the hustle and bustle to provide a truly tranquil setting and its own private beach access (the cove shaped beach is over 300ft long!). The pool, perhaps the largest on the entire island, is where I like to relax and enjoy the nighttime sky’s thousands of stars. You can see the beach from the pool and it is one of the most tranquil places I have ever been. The island has almost no cars, mostly golf carts, making it quiet and serene as well as environmentally friendly.

neighborhood_overview: Belize is the only English speaking Latin American country, offering all the rich history, tastes and colors of Latin America and the Caribbean, with the convenience of being both an English and Spanish speaking country. The resort is on an island off the coast of Belize, just over a mile south of San Pedro Town, which is far enough from the hustle and bustle to provide a truly tranquil setting and its own private beach access (the cove shaped beach is over 300ft long!). The pool, perhaps the largest on the entire island, is where I like to relax and enjoy the nighttime sky’s thousands of stars. You can see the beach from the pool and it is one of the most tranquil places I have ever been. The island has almost no cars, mostly golf carts, making it quiet and serene as well as environmentally friendly.

name: Guesthouse in Bullet Tree Falls · ★4.79 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Located on a peninsula in the village of Bullet Tree Falls, Cohune Palms is a peaceful, shady spot on the river.  It is a great village to walk around - meet locals, eat some great food often with handmade tortillas, or watch a football game.
host_about: Well traveled and full of experience - lol.  As a host, l like to make sure guests are  happy and have everything they need to relax and enjoy their vacation.
neighbourhood: Bullet Tree Falls, Cayo District, Belize

name: Condo in San Pedro · ★4.67 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
host_about:
Vacasa
Vacation Home Management

Vacasa unlocks the possibilities of how we enjoy vacation homes. We take care of managing our homeowners’ vacation houses so they can have peace of mind (and their home when they want to). And our guests book vacations confidently knowing they’re going to find exactly what they’re looking for without any surprises.

Each vacation home is always cared for by our professional local teams who implement our high cleanliness and maintenance values, while the hands-off tasks of vacation rental management--marketing, filing taxes, and maintaining a website--are handled by a specialized central support team. Our passion and focus remain true: to empower our homeowners, guests, and employees to invest in vacation.

name: Earthen home in Benque Viejo del Carmen, Cayo · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Private community nestled in Belize Cayo district rain forest.
neighbourhood: Benque Viejo del Carmen, Cayo, Belize

name: Rental unit in San Ignacio · ★4.71 · Studio · 2 beds · 1 bath
Home in San Ignacio · ★4.96 · 4 bedrooms · 8 beds · 4 baths
neighborhood_overview: The Estate's  location is truly unbeatable. You're just a short drive or a leisurely walk away from the vibrant streets of downtown San Ignacio. Explore local markets, sample delicious Belizean cuisine, and immerse yourself in the culture and history of this charming town. Yet, when you return to Casa Suzie, you'll find yourself in a tranquil oasis, far removed from the hustle and bustle.Across the street from the San Ignacio Resort and Hotel and the Princess Casino.
host_about: Born and raised in Belize, we moved to Florida to attend college.  Our roots remain strong in Belize and we love sharing our passion for our country with the world!

name: Home in San Ignacio · ★4.67 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: There is the best coffee shop just around the corner, restaurants, and plenty of supermarkets as well.
host_about: Before permanently settling in Belize, my wife and I traveled the world. Having had the experience of staying in guesthouses and 5star hotels, we realize, what a traveler needs to feel comfortable away from home in a foreign country. We offer a cozy place in a safe neighborhood,  and provide plenty of complementary purified, drinking water.  As a former professor of biology and ecology and my wife as an artist/designer, we incorporate both our talents to ensure our guests will have an exhilarating , educational and comfortable experience in Belize.  We like to make our guests as welcomed as we possibly can in a country, which has so much to offer.                                                                                            If you have any questions please ask.....we are here to be of assistance. Hope to see you soon.

name: Cottage in Caye Caulker · ★4.83 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The Lily Pad is in a Safe and quiet area just South of town on the West side of the Island and it is only a 5 minute bike ride to the main town area.  There are 3 convenience stores within a 3 block range of the Cottage.

name: Home in Belize City · ★4.19 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Adrienne’s home is located in Belize.
It's a quiet village Filled with hundreds of species of birds and wildlife with the river just less than a 10 minutes walk away or the howler monkey tour 5 minutes drive away. You can also enjoy a canoe tour or fishing experience as you take in all the natural scenery of wild life and howler monkeys all near by.
host_about: Hi I'm from the beautiful country of BELIZE . I live where you vacation and I enjoy every day of it!! was born and raised here but love to travel on my free time. I'm a nature lover and passionate about preserving our planet and making a huge impact on it. I try to look at the world and life as positive as possible and enjoy a nice conversation about almost anything over a ice cold Belikin beer. I enjoy cycling fishing and just being outdoor!!!

name: Home in Hopkins · ★4.97 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Just a short stroll or bike ride away you’ll find a selection of beachside restaurants offering a variety of cuisines to suit your taste …and an ice cream shop, dive shops, paddleboard center and markets. Or head around the corner to Sittee River Marina for charter fishing, river kayaking, or a delicious meal and refreshing drink at Curves Restaurant in the Marina.

name: Hotel in Hopkins · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Hopkins is an extremely friendly village - you'll love it!  It's very safe and welcoming, and there are a variety of local restaurants and bars, in addition to the more upscale restaurants found in the "resort area" which is outside the village.

neighborhood_overview: A quiet neighborhood but close to the village. Beautiful ocean views and breezes from the property.
host_about: Having traveled a lot and lived in the States, Europe, Brazil and Mexico, we have a good feel for what guests are looking for in a hotel.

name: Rental unit in Camalote · 6 bedrooms · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Cayo is a district in western Belize with many parks and ecological reserves. Once the heart of the Belizean Maya world, it's rich with pre-Columbian archaeological sites. Cayo is known especially for the ruins of Xunantunich, with its 39m-high El Castillo pyramid, and Caracol, the country’s largest Mayan ruin. Many of its once-sacred Mayan caves are open for exploration, including Actun Tunichil Muknal.
host_about:
Owner of the Roaring River Golf and Accommodations
The Roaring River Golf and Accommodations is a small operations offering a comfortable yet affordable stay directing along the Roaring River nestled under the natural jungle canopy.
Our property is centrally located only a few miles out of the capital city of Belmopan and features the only functioning Golf Course in the country of Belize, natural trails through the surrounding jungle, excellent bird watching with over 250 species of birds and of course, the cool Roaring River which flows from an underground system beneath the property.

name: Home in San Pedro · ★5.0 · 3 bedrooms · 7 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview: This is a gated property located in the heart of San Pedro Town Directly south of "Ramons Reef Village" with grocery store, wine store and restaurants within walking distance.

name: Guest suite in Belmopan · ★4.75 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is smack in the middle to Belmopan City.  There is easy access to public transportation, stores, restaurants, the market, parks and more!
host_about: It's a husband and wife effort, and we have 3 beautiful kids. We are very family oriented and are willing to share our space with you.  During the week, the kids attend school and are on a schedule, which will give you a lot of privacy and quite time, if that is what you are looking for.  During the weekends, we spend time either at home or we go to explore some beautiful location in Belize.

name: Cabin in Santa Elena · 2 bedrooms · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is mainly Spanish speaking, guest are encouraged to walk during the day if its their choice but not at night.  Especially since there are few areas before coming out into the main highway that are not adequately light.

name: Home in Belize City · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths

name: Condo in San Pedro · ★4.94 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
You’ll be surrounded by the island’s top choice restaurants for great eats, dive shops with endless activities such as snorkeling, diving, paddle boarding, parasailing for the adventurous, and handmade crafts to take your trip home with you!

You will also get to see and make friends with the many third generation islanders families while you walk the streets of Old Downtown San Pedro!

name: Nature lodge in Cayo District · ★4.65 · 16 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: This property is located very close to the heart of San Ignacio town. Only 5 minutes from Xunantunich Maya Ruin. 10 minutes from the border of Guatemala where you could do Tikal easily in one day.

name: Condo in San Ignacio · ★4.88 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Some of the best ruins of Maya cities are located in Cayo District near our home, LUCINA's. LUCINA's is an ideal location for a variety of day trip options. Xunantunich maya ruins features an enormous pyramid temple soaring high above the jungle floor and is about 15 minute drive from our home. The ruins of Cahal Pech (a 5 minute drive away), once the home to Maya elites, lies on a gorgeous setting overlooking the Macal River. Further out, the ruins of Caracol are situated at higher altitudes in the Mountain Pine Ridge area of the Chiquibul National Park. Perhaps the most famous of all ancient Maya sites, the towering city of Tikal, is located just across the border from Cayo District in neighboring Guatemala. In addition, a 2 minute taxi ride can take you to enjoy vibrant San Ignacio downtown and its popular open-air market where you can pick up fruits and other cultural delights!
host_about: Hi there, thank you for checking out my profile. Lucina's is a locally owned family run business started by me, Marie DePaz, and my children.

name: Guest suite in Caye Caulker · ★4.74 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
Hotel in San Ignacio · ★4.67 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Guests will be able to interact with locals and experience the atmosphere of downtown San Ignacio. Great eats and drinks are located just a few feet away.

name: Cottage in Cristo Rey · ★4.92 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: You may hear dog barking from a distance coming from the neighborhood. Also, in the neighborhood you will hear church service on Saturday and Sunday for 2 hours starting at 7pm to 9pm. The rest of the nights are quiet and peaceful.
host_about: We are a Belizean family own cabana rentals located in our hometown, Cristo Rey Village. We have three cabanas in our 10 Acres property and each one is beautifully decorated with local arts and decor to make you feel right at home with all the amenities you need, complimented with an outstanding hospitality .

name: Boutique hotel in San Pedro · ★4.86 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: 20 seconds down the beach is The Dive Bar Belize and Seastar - a first class dive shop and full service restaurant and bar.  We are minutes from Crocs, PUR, Marbucks Coffee House, The Truck Stop - San Pedro's newest outdoor addition that features 3 restaurants, an ice-cream parlor, bar, pool and play area with horse-shoes and corn hole tournaments.  Also nearby:  Stella's Smile - a beautiful wine bar that features a different dinner menu every night AND a spectacular sun-set deck, Feliz Bar and Grill - a sports-bar and favorite place to take in that special game, and Pirates Restaurant - specializing in a local delicacy - the Lion Fish!!  Twisted Palm Villas is also only minutes from downtown San Pedro and all the shopping, restaurants and nightlife of the jewel city of Belize.   There is a very good grocery store just minutes away for all your grocery needs, including dry and canned goods, liquor and beer, fruits and vegetables.
host_about: Spencer and I bought the hotel in July, and are excited to take on this new adventure.  We are originally from the San Antonio area of Texas but have owned in San Pedro for over seven years now. We also own Elite Adventures Belize, which is the dive shop just steps from the hotel. We look forward to meeting everyone.

name: Cottage in Hopkins · ★4.67 · Studio · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: We’re located in the heart of Hopkins Village, a Garifuna fishing village whose customs of drumming and language continue.  We’re an easy stroll to locally owned restaurants, bars, shops, and mini-golf. We're steps away from the stunning Caribbean Sea. Hopkins is centrally located to many adventure activities such as hiking Cockscomb Nature Preserve, Maya ruins, inland Blue Hole, and zip lining at Bocawina—all make exciting day trips.
host_about:
Small-scale and casual, Hopkins Inn offers romantic, affordable, and decidedly low-key accommodations on a beach. Our intimate and unpretentious beach inn reflects our philosophy that true luxury is in life’s simple pleasures. We have four cabanas on the beach. Rates begin at $120US for the beach cabanas and $165US for the seafront and include tax and continental breakfast. Best rates are not through third parties, like AirBNB. To learn more about our inn, visit our website. 

Hopkins ia an authentic Garifuna fishing village, whose customes of drumming and language continue.

name: Bungalow in San Pedro · ★4.56 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
We are conveniently located near the last radio tower with some of the fastest wifi on the island, fast enough to stream videos on your devices. We are within paddling distance of the reef which is otherwise harder to get to without a boat.
For food options we are located near 2 restaurants, chat n chill who offer dinner service, and el norte who will serve breakfast and lunch. These 2 are the closest among many of the phenomenal restaurants to eat at in Belize. We also have a fruit and vegetable delivery service that comes every Tuesday, and Friday.
All of the establishments this far north are private, less noise from resorts, and more calm, quietly placed homes and casitas.
host_about:
I’m Colton and I have lived in Colorado my entire life. I am an avid outdoorsmen, who is passionate about yoga and environmental sustainability. 

I am also a huge fan of the ocean and anything that starts with the letter “s”, scuba diving, swimming, snorkeling, and surfing. 

I have taken on this project in Belize to fulfill a lifelong dream of being able to travel while working. I look forward to offering you a once in a lifetime opportunity to explore the serenity of Ambergris Caye. 

I love meeting people from every corner of the earth and I am excited to host you travelers. I will do my best to make your stay as comfortable as possible.

name: Condo in Ambergris Caye · ★4.95 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
We are located a 1/2 mile north of the bridge leaving San Pedro, Belize. Our neighborhood is more relaxed than the hustle and bustle of downtown but close enough that you are just a short drive from the many restaurants and activities located in town.
There are three restaurants in the immediate vicinity of the property. The on site bar and restaurant, The Dog House Sports Lounge, is open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner (7am – 10pm every day). They have Belizean breakfast dishes and casual bar food and mixed drinks throughout the day.
Just to the north of our property (a 2 minute walk on the beach) is 303 Belize, an over the water bar and restaurant. They are open for lunch and dinner (every day of the week) and focus more on seafood. They have live music most evenings as well. Underneath 303 Belize, is Elite Adventures, a dive and snorkel shop.
Just south of our property is the Farmhouse Market and Cafe. They offer a wide selection of fresh coffees, juices/smoothies,
host_about:
Tres Cocos Resort @ The Cloisters, is a charming family-run establishment where island living meets modern comfort. 
We have fond childhood memories on the property before its transformation into a vacation rental oasis. 
Each condo is individually owned and thoughtfully appointed, ensuring a unique and personalized experience for our guests. We invite you to experience the warmth of Belizean hospitality in every detail during your stay with us.

name: Villa in San Pedro · ★4.92 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: San Pedranos are friendly and helpful to visitors. If you are unsure on getting to a destination, do not hesitate to communicate with locals.
host_about:
Greetings from La Isla Bonita!

I’m an island girl that loves nature. I grew up here on Ambergris Caye in the town of San Pedro so you can call me an island expert.  Feel free to ask me any question, I will be happy to answer you. Travel and meeting people are my passion.  Between my staff and myself we will make sure that your stay with us in an enjoyable one.  Welcome to Ambergris Caye; Welcome to BELIZE.

name: Cabin in Seine Bight · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: we have a few restaurants with in walking distance. we do offer tours as well. Just ask!
neighbourhood: Seine Bight, Stann Creek District, Belize

name: Rental unit in Orange Walk · ★4.94 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The apartment building sits, literally right in the center of town, with a veranda view of all the hustle and bustle of our towns activities.  Most places are within close walking distance,   Restaurants, bars, stores & banks.
host_about:
Hi I'm Naz. 
I'll be one of your host as you stay in one of our two beautiful and spacious apartments.  Both apartments were designed and manufactured on location. By that I'm referring to the kitchen cabinets and some furniture, such as wall units.  As a designer and manufacture of custom cabinets at one time, in the US, I was able to bring in the simple yet contemporary layout of the apartments.  
As a child, thanks to my parents I was able to visit and live in different countries,  in different continents, living in Africa for ten years of my life.  I think that is why I enjoy meeting people!  I'm married with two children.  My wife Lina is originally from the Philippines,  we met and married in the US.  Looking forward to meeting you.  
With kind regards!
Naz.
neighbourhood: Orange Walk, Orange Walk District, Belize

name: Guest suite in Belize · ★4.68 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Quiet neighbourhood with several local restaurants a minute away. Childrens Park is one property away and within site of verandas. Back beach mangrove is accross the backyard.
host_about: Friendly and responsible.  Recently retired Principal of the only High School on Caye Caulker. Like the freedom, carefree atmosphere of the island and the friendly, helpful people!  Love to share my knowledge and experience of growing up on La Isla Cariñosa!

name: Guest suite in Belize · ★4.79 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
host_about: Friendly and responsible.  Recently retired Principal of the only High School on Caye Caulker. Like the freedom, carefree atmosphere of the island and the friendly, helpful people!  Love to share my knowledge and experience of growing up on La Isla Cariñosa!

name: Island in Hopkins Village · ★4.60 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Palmento Grove Garifuna Eco-Cultural & Healing Institute is the only full service indigenous owned vacation service provider in Hopkins offering authentic Garifuna & Belizean Cultural Experiences.   We are please to share our culture with our guests while our business also serves to provide & fund Garifuna Cultural Preservation Projects to our Garifuna Community of Hopkins. We are located at the Freshwater Lagoon Estuary which is the most popular fishing spot in Hopkins.  Over Johnson Island was originally  the home of 3 Yugandan sisters from which Hopkins derived its Garifuna name Yugada.  In the early 1900s a British overseer succeeded in occupying the island. The island then became a hub for commercial activities such as agricultural farm management, timber extraction & cattle farming.   Over Johnson Island is known to have the oldest well that provided portable water in the Commerce Bight Area that has been there for over 70 years.  The island continues to be of great historic sign
host_about: Director of Palmento Grove Garifuna Eco-Cultural & Fishing Institute, Located on the north side of Hopkins Village in southeastern Belize, Palmento Grove Garifuna Eco-Cultural and Fishing Institute consists of both a private island retreat and an inland Tour & Travel Services Business designed to reflect the authenticity of a traditional Garifuna village. Owned and operated by local Garifuna people, an Afro-Caribbean culture indigenous to Belize, Palmento Grove is one of the best places to experience authentic local culture in Belize.For more than 10 years, Palmento Grove Garifuna Eco-Cultural and Fishing Institute has served as a sustainable tourism business and a cultural preservation center. Situated amongst beautiful mangrove bushes on the edge of Fresh Water Creek Lagoon where it meets the Caribbean Sea, Palmento Grove feels like a world away. Specializing in authentic Garifuna cuisine and cultural activities, the institute serves as an outstanding introduction to Garifuna history and culture. Guests of Palmento Grove can wander the footpaths on this isolated strip of island or head out with local fishermen to try your luck at catching some of the many abundant species of fish and seafood that thrive in the area. Guests can use fresh-caught fish mixed with fresh vegetables from the gardens to learn how to cook mouthwatering traditional dishes like hudut, a Garifuna fish stew made with coconuts and plantains, all accompanied by the sounds of traditional Garifuna drumming. Designed to promote holistic healing and rejuvenation, Palmento Grove is a true sanctuary where guests are surrounded on all sides by fresh air and delightful scenery. Rooms at Palmento Grove are cozy and comfortable, furnished in the traditional Garifuna style, and with magnificent views looking out at the pristine garden & water view. Palmento Grove is an environmental and socially conscious business that is dedicated to empowering people through the promotion and preservation of traditional cultural knowledge, history, and way of life. Palmento Grove Garifuna Eco-Cultural & Fishing Institute is also the organizer of the Belize Paranda MusicFest, which promotes and protects traditional Garifuna Music in Belize as well as sponsoring an annual cultural and entrepreneurial summer camp for local youths. If you're looking for an oasis away from the stresses and strains of modern life, then Palmento Grove Garifuna Eco-Cultural & Fishing Institute is exactly the place that you've been looking for. Palmento also organizes tours to nearby attractions on the reef and mainland, including snorkeling, scuba diving, and trips to ancient Maya cities. The Institute can be reached from Belize City in about two and a half hours and is located in the historic Commerce Bight area on the north side of Hopkins Village in Stann Creek District. For a truly authentic Belizean experience, choose Palmento Grove Garifuna Eco-Cultural and Fishing Institute.

name: Hut in Crooked tree wildlife sanctuary · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
host_about: I would describe myself and business as  inviting and very family oriented. I love creating a atmosphere that people feel welcomed,  loved, and ready for a belly full of good food.

name: Hut in Crookedtree  · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath

name: Condo in San Pedro · ★4.49 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
host_about:
Vacasa
Vacation Home Management

Vacasa unlocks the possibilities of how we enjoy vacation homes. We take care of managing our homeowners’ vacation houses so they can have peace of mind (and their home when they want to). And our guests book vacations confidently knowing they’re going to find exactly what they’re looking for without any surprises.

Each vacation home is always cared for by our professional local teams who implement our high cleanliness and maintenance values, while the hands-off tasks of vacation rental management--marketing, filing taxes, and maintaining a website--are handled by a specialized central support team. Our passion and focus remain true: to empower our homeowners, guests, and employees to invest in vacation.

name: Serviced apartment in Placencia Village, Stann Creek District Belize, CA · ★4.91 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
- FREE Cleaning Services
- Perfect location for tourist and travelers
- Someone will be around to assist you (Customer Service)
- Private Spacious Living Area
- Full Laundry Room ($20 USD per load)
- Parking on Premises
host_about:
I'm a  local of Belize and Placencia Village is where all my childhood memories are :)

I enjoying hosting travelers from all around the world and sharing fun things to do while staying in Placencia. I'm very friendly and outgoing. I love feeling like a tourist in my own country so I've experienced a lot of the tours and activities here. 

Showing off my beautiful country is something that brings a lot of joy to me! Food also makes me happy especially the belizean cuisines.
neighbourhood: Placencia Village, Stann Creek District Belize, CA, Belize

name: Home in San Pedro · ★4.89 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Located 5.5 Miles North of San Pedro Town, La Perla del Caribe offers privacy in a relaxed setting with 12 individual villas sharing a 500 foot beach, pier and swimming pool. Nearby restaurants are walking distance. Or we can arrange private chef for your Villa. Tours can be arranged by the Guest Services staff on site and pick up on the pier in front of the villa. Your biggest decision of the day will be whether to go SCUBA diving to hunt Lion fish on the second largest barrier reef in the world, try snorkeling or just lounge by the beautiful swimming pool a few steps away.  If none of those feel right, hop on a golf cart to explore the island.
host_about:
La Perla Del Caribe features nine privately owned, custom designed villas available to guests seeking a truly private, upscale Belize vacation experience. These inviting, secluded vacation rentals dot four acres of lush undisturbed Caribbean beachfront. Each vacation home welcomes guests with a high-end, distinctly Mediterranean ambiance reflecting the local Belize heritage uniquely designed by each homeowner.

Escape to La Perla Del Caribe and find yourself just steps away from the pristine white sand coastline and famous Belize coral reef – recognized globally as one of the top dive sights in the world. Meanwhile, your vacation home is a scenic walk from some of the top culinary destinations in all of Ambergris Caye.

Prefer to hideaway in your private villa? Our onsite guest services manager can organize your very own private chef ready to bring the Belize flavor straight to your door.

Our picturesque property not only provides the perfect Caribbean hideaway, it’s recognized by a plethora of leading travel sites including TripAdvisor which tabbed La Perla Del Caribe with the coveted Certificate of Excellence.

La Perla Del Caribe features two, three, four and five bedroom beachfront villas all capturing the essence and beauty of a truly authentic Belize experience. Guests are treated to mahogany sun beds, artisan crafted furniture, private porches and a dazzling view of the Caribbean Sea.

name: Rental unit in San Pedro · ★4.33 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
host_about: Enthusiastic backpacker turned boutique hotel owner. I love to make my guests feel at home here at Parham Plaza Hotel. Sharing travel stories over a couple of beers with my guests is an ideal evening for me.

name: Guesthouse in San Pedro · ★4.76 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: The guest house is in a local neighbourhood.  This is not a resort.  I have iguanas lounging in the trees and it feels like a home!
host_about:
I was born and raised in Africa.  My parents owned a remote, luxury lodge so I was raised in the bush in Africa.  After high school I travelled extensively  and ended up in Hawaii for over 25 years!  My son moved to the eastern USA and as it was so far from Hawaii, I decided to move closer to him.  Luckily I landed in Belize!  I have been here for 10 years.  My guest house keeps me busy and I love the Airbnb lifestyle!
Can't wait to meet you!

name: Nature lodge in Teakettle · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Relax and play right on the Chaya Maya reserve.  Take a ride down the Belize River by motor boat, canoe or tube. Take a jungle nature hike, pick your own fruit, birdwatch, view and hear wildlife, or relax in paradise.
host_about: My Husband Gregg and I are owners of Chaya Maya Jungle Lodge and Calypso Beach Retreat in Belize.

name: Nature lodge in Long Caye · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Long Caye is in the Lighthouse Reef Atoll.  It is 45 miles off the coast of Belize.  The island is 2 miles long and 3/4 miles wide.  There is typically between 20 and 100 people on the island.  The island has dive shops, a couple lodges, 2 docks, beach volleyball, boardwalks, mangroves and beaches.  The island does not have cars, but has atv's, bicycles, and people on foot.
host_about: My Husband Gregg and I are owners of Chaya Maya Jungle Lodge and Calypso Beach Retreat in Belize.

name: Cottage in Hopkins · ★5.0 · Studio · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: We’re located in the heart of Hopkins Village, a Garifuna fishing village whose customs of drumming and language continue.  We’re an easy stroll to locally owned restaurants, bars, shops, and mini-golf. We're steps away from the stunning Caribbean Sea. Hopkins is centrally located to many adventure activities such as hiking Cockscomb Nature Preserve, Maya ruins, inland Blue Hole, and zip lining at Bocawina—all make exciting day trips.
host_about:
Small-scale and casual, Hopkins Inn offers romantic, affordable, and decidedly low-key accommodations on a beach. Our intimate and unpretentious beach inn reflects our philosophy that true luxury is in life’s simple pleasures. We have four cabanas on the beach. Rates begin at $120US for the beach cabanas and $165US for the seafront and include tax and continental breakfast. Best rates are not through third parties, like AirBNB. To learn more about our inn, visit our website. 

Hopkins ia an authentic Garifuna fishing village, whose customes of drumming and language continue.

name: Resort in San Pedro · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: There are a lot of activities for you to do at Ambergris Caye since it’s the heart of the tourism industry in Belize. There are great restaurants all around; from the fancy to the homey. Don’t be afraid to give a try to the local food as I’m sure your taste buds will forever be grateful. There are many great snorkel and dive sites you can book tours to such as Hol Chan Marine Reserve and Shark Ray Alley. We'll be more than willing to help you book these events if you so desire. Our barrier reef is the second largest in the world and is, therefore, a beautiful location to get to experience firsthand. Grocery stores are close by for whenever you’re ready to prepare that meal that’s been on your mind all day. If you are looking for some fun with water all day, an aquapark is also available on the island for your enjoyment. Central Park at the heart of the town is also a great place to start your night. Local presentations and events are regularly hosted at this location and therefore attr

name: Home in Benque Viejo Del Carmen · ★4.60 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: Benque Viejo is a small traditional town, a mirror of local culture full of delicious food, friendly people and nature. Our neighborhood is located on a safe and vivid zone where you can enjoy a quiet time, a warming walk to the river or the convenience store. The bus station is only five minutes away from the house in case you need to take a bus to San Ignacio, Cayo or anywhere you wish to go. Eating places are also available at walking distance.
neighbourhood: Benque Viejo Del Carmen, Cayo District, Belize

name: Rental unit in Belize City · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: This room is closely located to the Belize Zoo, the caves, Altun Ha Mayan Ruins, zip lining, horse back riding and Black Howler Monkey Sanctuary.  It is also an exceptional location for birding enthusiast, hikers and nature lovers.
host_about: A very friendly person,enrgetic and adventurous. always open for new opportunity and willing to go for an extra miles.

host_about: I’m originally from England. I spent  the last 25 years in the US - Tampa, Florida. Retired from office work and decided to open a beautiful resort on the beach in Placencia village.

name: Rental unit in Belize · ★4.80 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Beautiful ocean view capturing the natural breeze, very relaxing, private and quite for after hours.
host_about:
My name is Amiela Ash (also know as Amie), I am a born Belizean and raised in the southern region of Belize, Toledo District, in a remote village called San Pedro Columbia. While I was attending college, I would regularly come to Caye Caulker to work  part time jobs. After  accomplishing my college degree in 2008 I fell in love with the island and eventually moved to reside in Caye Caulker. 
Ever since my stay, I have been working at various businesses within the island gaining invaluable experiences, meeting many faces and knowing the areas within my community. I then worked for Caye Caulker Rentals, now known as Caye Caulker Vacation Homes as a receptionist, then promoted to manager and eventually became the new owner of the business. 
As the new owner of the Caye Caulker Vacation Homes,  my goal is for you (guest) to spend quality time at this island, with quality services and hospitality offered by my business.

neighbourhood: Seine Bight, Stann Creek District, Belize

Friendly residential area two minutes walk to the beach 🏖

host_about:
Luz: Born and raised on the island!! 
Dale: born in Vancouver BC, Canada, raised in San Pedro Ambergris Caye.
