Our picturesque property not only provides the perfect Caribbean hideaway, it’s recognized by a plethora of leading travel sites including TripAdvisor which tabbed La Perla Del Caribe with the coveted Certificate of Excellence.

La Perla Del Caribe features two, three, four and five bedroom beachfront villas all capturing the essence and beauty of a truly authentic Belize experience. Guests are treated to mahogany sun beds, artisan crafted furniture, private porches and a dazzling view of the Caribbean Sea.

name: Villa in San Pedro · ★4.40 · 5 bedrooms · 6 beds · 5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Located 5.5 Miles North of San Pedro Town, La Perla del Caribe offers privacy in a relaxed setting with 12 individual villas sharing a 500 foot beach, pier and swimming pool. Nearby restaurants are walking distance. Or we can arrange private chef for your Villa. Tours can be arranged by the Guest Services staff on site and pick up on the pier in front of the villa. Your biggest decision of the day will be whether to go SCUBA diving to hunt Lion fish on the second largest barrier reef in the world, try snorkeling or just lounge by the beautiful swimming pool a few steps away.  If none of those feel right, hop on a golf cart to explore the island.
host_about:
La Perla Del Caribe features nine privately owned, custom designed villas available to guests seeking a truly private, upscale Belize vacation experience. These inviting, secluded vacation rentals dot four acres of lush undisturbed Caribbean beachfront. Each vacation home welcomes guests with a high-end, distinctly Mediterranean ambiance reflecting the local Belize heritage uniquely designed by each homeowner.

Escape to La Perla Del Caribe and find yourself just steps away from the pristine white sand coastline and famous Belize coral reef – recognized globally as one of the top dive sights in the world. Meanwhile, your vacation home is a scenic walk from some of the top culinary destinations in all of Ambergris Caye.

Prefer to hideaway in your private villa? Our onsite guest services manager can organize your very own private chef ready to bring the Belize flavor straight to your door.

Our picturesque property not only provides the perfect Caribbean hideaway, it’s recognized by a plethora of leading travel sites including TripAdvisor which tabbed La Perla Del Caribe with the coveted Certificate of Excellence.

La Perla Del Caribe features two, three, four and five bedroom beachfront villas all capturing the essence and beauty of a truly authentic Belize experience. Guests are treated to mahogany sun beds, artisan crafted furniture, private porches and a dazzling view of the Caribbean Sea.

name: Bungalow in Lord's Bank · ★4.86 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: My Neighborhood is mostly quiet, apart from the noise from the International Airport and the road traffic through out the day. On weekend the neighbors  will sometime play their music. The area is developing so you will see little houses in the area and poor lighting on the street.

name: Guesthouse in Dangriga · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: We are located in the small Mayan Village of Maya Center.  It is located in the southern Stann Creek District.  We are a quiet neighborhood, 5 min walk to the Che'il Maya Chocolate Factory nearby and about 10 Km from The Cockscomb Basin Wildlife Sanctuary, the world's first jaguar reserve.

name: Guesthouse in Stann Creek District · 1 bedroom · 6 beds · 4 shared baths
neighborhood_overview: We are located in the small Mayan Village of Maya Center. It is located in the southern Stann Creek District. We are a quiet neighborhood, 5 min walk to the Che'il Maya Chocolate Factory nearby and about 10 Km from The Cockscomb Basin Wildlife Sanctuary, the world's first jaguar reserve.

name: Cottage in Cristo Rey · ★4.97 · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Alma del Rio is located 2 miles from Santa-Elena towards the Pine Ridge reserve. Though a sleepy road, before you reach our tranquil home, there are several great attractions - you will pass cool M farm where you can purchase fresh milk and Yogurt,  Eden Valley Mayan kitchen to taste delicious locally made chocolate, 'The bluffs' bar and grill for great food, drinks and live music, Maya mountain lodge that only use organic, fresh, local produce in their menu (vegan options available too!). 2 Min drive from our house you can find a magical waterfall. In San Antonio village, we highly recommend trying the the women's co-op restaurant - the best in traditional, hearty Mayan dishes that are some of the best in Belize.
host_about:
Alma del Rio, the 'soul of the river', is named after our little Alma Sophia, who was born here in Belize and is raised among it's diverse nature and culture. 
We've been living in Belize for over 9 years. In the first 2, we managed a luxury island resort and presently own a business introducing and distributing renewable energy products. We bring into Alma del Rio all we know and believe in - professional hospitality and environmental awareness.   
We will be more than happy to help you get around, visit the best destinations and plan your trip according to your preferences and budget. We know the hospitality industry in Belize well, and will be glad to share our knowledge with you. 
Have a wonderful day!
Tom, Hadas & Alma

name: Bungalow in Burrell Boom · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Peaceful Village, with access to the Belize River, Supermarkets and park.
host_about:
Mr. Thompson is a born Belizean who owns and operates Black Orchid Resort. He served as the president of the Belize Hotel Association and as a director after his presidency. Mr. Thompson lived in the United States for a number of years after which he decided to return to Belize, his home and establish a magnificent Business, now Black Orchid Resort, which employs all local from the surrounding villages. 
Mr Douglas Thompson is a very outgoing person with a very exuberant personality. Once you get to meet him, there are so much to learn from him.

name: Condo in San Pedro · ★4.38 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
host_about:
Vacasa
Vacation Home Management

Vacasa unlocks the possibilities of how we enjoy vacation homes. We take care of managing our homeowners’ vacation houses so they can have peace of mind (and their home when they want to). And our guests book vacations confidently knowing they’re going to find exactly what they’re looking for without any surprises.

Each vacation home is always cared for by our professional local teams who implement our high cleanliness and maintenance values, while the hands-off tasks of vacation rental management--marketing, filing taxes, and maintaining a website--are handled by a specialized central support team. Our passion and focus remain true: to empower our homeowners, guests, and employees to invest in vacation.

name: Cabin in Bullet Tree Falls · ★4.89 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
you- tube video available "Arrowhead lodge 1"
3 Miles to El Pilar an unexcavated Mayan Ruin is an amazing introduction to Belize. Our Jungle lodge is set in over 100 acres of prime jungle.
neighbourhood: Bullet Tree Falls, Cayo District, Belize

name: Home in Bullet Tree Falls · ★4.83 · 3 bedrooms · 6 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: This is a small village with many working families and retirees with dogs, sheep and horses located on the main road in Bullet Tree, please note that the road has cars traveling back and forth and you will hear the noise of the traffic. This is a village with families that do play music on occasion and I cannot control the noise.Activities range from unique waterfalls and scenic hikes to history and culture in San Ignacio, which is only a 15 minute drive away. San Ignacio shops and restaurants are a short distance to the east, while the awe-inspiring pyramid of the Xunantunich Mayan Ruins or the Cahal Pech Ruins  along with other activities such as cave tubing or exploring the jungles is an easy day trip to the south.
neighbourhood: Bullet Tree Falls, Cayo District, Belize

name: Rental unit in Caye Caulker · ★4.90 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is pretty unique on the island as we’re located on the southwest side of the island on end of a no trough street. All the property in this area are used for overnight tourism or retirement homes making this area the most quiet on the entire island.
host_about:
I'm a humble , respectable, honest and hard working individual. My objective is to assure all our visiting guest regardless of wherever the origin may be from that they may have the most pleasant, memorable and enjoyable experience of a lifetime. 

A experience that they will be most comfortable to share with family and friends whenever they reflect on past visited destination in their lifetime. I will stop at nothing to make their visit a one in a lifetime experience.

name: Tiny home in San pedro · ★4.98 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Located on Tarpon Bay— a small but growing community 4 miles south of downtown San Pedro in one of the safest areas on the island. A visit here is reminiscent of a slower time on the island, comfortably out of the noise of town. Playa de Sala boutique hotel next door offers convenient access to both a restaurant and Beachfront Boat Bar plus occasional live entertainment. Or drive your golf cart 15-25 minutes for a variety of food & drink options, groceries and a bakery. Explore Tarpon bay and its mangrove estuaries with the onsite paddle board or rent a kayak next door. Boat and dive Tour pickups can be arranged directly from the dock outfront. Our South end is well known for its safety and is patrolled by a vigilant Neighborhood watch.

Tarpon bay is well suited for kitesurfing and windsurfing directly from the beach out front If you have your own equipmen
host_about: Take calculated risks and pursue your dreams! That's what we did when we fell in love with Belize and spontaneously bought land then designed and built our own tiny dream homes here.  We live and work on Cape Cod and as recent empty nesters we travel as often as possible to San Pedro--the land of sunshine and happiness.   Hope you will love our places as much as we do!
neighbourhood: San pedro, Ambergris Caye, South, Belize

name: Condo in Placencia, Stann Creek District, Belize · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: In the gated community of Naia only 4 minutes walk along the beach is the Naia Spa Resort located, which offers relaxing Spa treatments, a fitness center and 2 Restaurants as a nice addition to the neighborhood. Next door to the South lies Sirenian Bay Resort with Inky´s Mini Golf Course and Inky´s bar and Grill. Sirenian also offers a tennis and pickleball court, wine cellar, cocktail bar and a spa and fitness center.
host_about:
I am the Property Manager of The Villas at Cocoplum and will answer all your questions about your stay. Once you arrived I will meet and greet you and together with my staff, I will do everything to make your stay memorable and fantastic. 

Originally from Austria, I moved to Belize in 2008. I love to scuba dive, hike, travel and enjoy good food and company.

See you soon in sunny Belize :-)
neighbourhood: Placencia, Stann Creek District, Belize, Belize

name: Hotel in Caye Caulker · ★4.93 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Our hotel is located on Caye Caulker's Avenida Hicaco - the Front Street. The Caribbean Sea is right across the street, the infamous split is a two-minute walk away, and a handful of tour shops & yummy eats are scattered around us.
host_about:
When looking for luxury accommodations in sandy Caye Caulker, Barefoot Caye Caulker Hotel provides the perfect combination of Cozy and Contemporary Suites you deserve on your vacation with plenty of on-site amenities for your convenience and comfort.

Located in the heart of the island’s Front Street, our Newly Renovated property has all the tropical vibes you need in our Six Ocean View Rooms with Private Balcony and Eight Courtyard Units overlooking our brand new pool and deck, including two fully-equipped 2-Bedroom Suites with an open concept living and kitchen space. The airy and open design of our modern hotel surrounded by lush greenery gives our guests the feeling of a private oasis with the convenience of accessing the island’s best restaurants, shops and hot spots the minute you leave the premises.

Come Visit us in Paradise, and don’t forget to Go Barefoot & Go Slow!

name: Condo in Ambergris Caye · ★4.80 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
We are located a 1/2 mile north of the bridge leaving San Pedro, Belize. Our neighborhood is more relaxed than the hustle and bustle of downtown but close enough that you are just a short drive from the many restaurants and activities located in town.
There are three restaurants in the immediate vicinity of the property. The on site bar and restaurant, The Dog House Sports Lounge, is open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner (7am – 10pm every day). They have Belizean breakfast dishes and casual bar food and mixed drinks throughout the day.
Just to the north of our property (a 2 minute walk on the beach) is 303 Belize, an over the water bar and restaurant. They are open for lunch and dinner (every day of the week) and focus more on seafood. They have live music most evenings as well. Underneath 303 Belize, is Elite Adventures, a dive and snorkel shop.
Just south of our property is the Farmhouse Market and Cafe. They offer a wide selection of fresh coffees, juices/smoothies,
host_about:
Tres Cocos Resort @ The Cloisters, is a charming family-run establishment where island living meets modern comfort. 
We have fond childhood memories on the property before its transformation into a vacation rental oasis. 
Each condo is individually owned and thoughtfully appointed, ensuring a unique and personalized experience for our guests. We invite you to experience the warmth of Belizean hospitality in every detail during your stay with us.

name: Villa in Mountain Pine Ridge  · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
We are located in Mountain Pine Ridge proper. All visitors that enter the Forest Reserve pass through a secured gate. Our property is located between Blancaneaux Lodge and Gaia Riverlodge. Our guests are always welcome to enjoy the restaurants and bars at both lodges.

For those seeking more adventure while in the Mountain Pine Ridge area there are many activities and tours to choose from. We are one of the closest overnight accommodations to the Mayan ruin, Caracol, which is the largest ruin in Belize. Other adventures include Rio Frio Cave, Rio On Pools, 1000 ft. Falls, Barton Creek Cave, ziplining, horseback riding, as well as many other activities. As an added bonus, Big Rock Waterfall is within walking distance from the house (1 mile).
host_about: We are a Belizean/Canadian couple living in San Ignacio, Belize. We love to travel and have set up our vacation rentals just as we would want them if we were the guests!

name: Rental unit in San Ignacio · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Why would you want to stay far away from town, where you can have to spend more on taxis? Stay close to town where you can walk to restaurants, grocery stores, public transportation, banks, etc.
host_about:
The best part of my job is getting the opportunity to meet people from all over the world. Even though I am not fortunate as yet to travel, I enjoy spending time with guest getting to know about their country. 
When I am not working, my life revolves around my two sons and husband.

name: Rental unit in San Pedro · ★4.53 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
We are located just south of the Boca Del Rio Bridge, we are just one curve away from the beach ( you can hear the waves crashing the reef..so soothing :) and we have the sea view and lagoon view.
Nearby we have a grocery stores, pharmacies, gym , bakery, fresh fruit and vegetable stalls, and of course not to forget the beach restaurants, bars, and tour shops .
behind us is residential area where you will see the locals and their homes, as well as the lagoon ( not safe to swim).
Laguna Drive is one of the most commuted streets since its the only road (aside from the beach) that leads to Boca del rio bridge ( needed to access north of the island), but don't be alarmed since the apartment is not on the ground floor the noise is basically non existent.

I have been travelling to and vacationing in Placencia Belize for more than 20 years now and started renting our first villa in 2008. Our passion is to help other families explore all Placencia has to offer, while offering convenient and resort-style amenities to enhance the vacation experience. We look forward to your questions!

host_about: I'm outgoing, friendly, helpful and a native Belizean and wedding planner.  I love reading, movies and also Love to travel!  I kayak every morning and I take tons of photos! As a host I'll be available by phone/WhatsApp all day, unless I'm out of the village, and I'll still be able to figure out how to help if needed.

Situated within Belize's largest marine reserve with amazing access to the colorful reef systems abundant with tropicals directly from the beach or choose to hire our expert guides and boats to access other spectacular eco-systems minute from our island paradise.

name: Rental unit in San Ignacio · Studio · 2 beds · 1 bath
Cabin in San Ignacio · ★4.99 · Studio · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Santa Cruz area is an up-and-coming neighborhood just off the beaten path on the outskirts of town. Located; on the Santa Elena side of the twin towns (San Ignacio/Santa Elena) near supermarkets, gas stations, coffee shops, restaurants, cultural and adventure activities. You will see school children and local families in their daily routines.

We do recommend a 4-wheel drive if you are renting a vehicle, especially in the rainy season. Because you never know where your adventures will take you.

If you do not feel like exploring, there is a delivery carrier to deliver food from several restaurants or stores for an additional charge.

name: Rental unit in LadyVille · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The Apartment is close to the Bacab Echo Park, baboon sanctuary, Altun Ha Mayan Ruin, and  small restaurant to enjoy amazing food. Local Bus stop, which takes you to Belize City and water taxi to head to the Cayes. You can also access the museum once you get to the Belize city. You can catch taxi cabs in the city as well.

name: Guest suite in Belize City · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Los Lagos is a private community, quiet and peaceful.  It's off the Philip Goldson Highway (Northern Highway) and just 15 minutes from the International Airport. We are close to the Eco park Bacab (7-minutes drive), where you can enjoy horseback riding, kayaking, nature tours among other things. Within a 30 minutes drive, you can visit our famous Community Baboon Sanctuary and get to see the habitat of the Black Howler Monkey. And  if you're interested in learning about our Mayan people, you can visit the Mayan Ruin Altun Ha within 40 minutes. There is so much to do within a short distance!
host_about: Hello! I'm delighted that you are planning a trip to Belize and I would love to be your host.  I've been living in Los Lagos for over 16 years. I consider my home a peaceful retreat in natural surroundings.  I enjoy getting to know new people from different backgrounds and culture. Gardening and spending time with my family are my favorite. I'm sure you'll be meeting my family on your visit. I'm a single parent and am self-employed. I’ll be happy to help you plan fun activities.

neighborhood_overview: Our cabins are located in a quite neighborhood in between Cristo Rey Village and Santa Elena town. San Ignacio and Santa Elena town are a quick 5 minutes drive to enjoy the nightlife and dine at great restaurants.
host_about: We are a Belizean family own cabana rentals located in our hometown, Cristo Rey Village. We have three cabanas in our 10 Acres property and each one is beautifully decorated with local arts and decor to make you feel right at home with all the amenities you need, complimented with an outstanding hospitality .

Roman & Sandra

We call Colorado home, Belize our second home.  We're looking forward to spending a large part of our retirement in Belize.

name: Condo in Ambergris Caye · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Just outside of San Pedro, our area is more relaxed than the hustle and bustle of downtown. Right next door is Dive Bar and Seastar Belize for dinner as well as arranging water based activities. On site there is Feliz Bar and Grill. Just a short walk down the road you can get fantastic local cuisine at Brisas Del Caribe.
Located in the heart of Central America, Belize is a hidden treasure worth exploring. Our place is located on the north end of the island of Ambergris Caye, close to the southern edge of the Yucatan peninsula, and bordering the second largest barrier reef in the world.
host_about:
Tres Cocos Resort @ The Cloisters, is a charming family-run establishment where island living meets modern comfort. 
We have fond childhood memories on the property before its transformation into a vacation rental oasis. 
Each condo is individually owned and thoughtfully appointed, ensuring a unique and personalized experience for our guests. We invite you to experience the warmth of Belizean hospitality in every detail during your stay with us.

name: Resort in Placencia · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Stay in a place where adventure meets relaxation. Stay where every room is a suite and the Caribbean sea is just steps away. Belize Ocean Club spans the entire Placencia peninsula, offering you views of the Caribbean sea and the Maya mountains and lagoon. Nestled on Maya Beach, the resort is just a short ride away from Placencia Village, where you can enjoy beach bars and local shopping.

Resort is located 100 miles south of Belize and Philip Goodson international airport, Resort is able to arrange transportation at an additional cost, either ground or air transportation.

Ambergris Caye, Belize...the Jewel of the Caribbean, voted the #1 Island by Trip Advisor 2014! The apartments are located on Princess Drive, just south of the San Pedro Airstrip. La Isla Bonita

name: Place to stay in Belize · 17 bedrooms · 1 bed · 1 private bath
host_about: I have been involved in the Hotel and Tourism Industry at different levels during the last 17 years in both Belize and Peten, Guatemala. I am currently the Sales and Marketing Manager at Crystal Paradise Resort, a Belizean owned and operated business located in the beautiful village of Cristo Rey, Cayo District. I have also completed a Tour Guide Training Course, and  a degree in Tourism Managment.  I have a passion for Caving and Scuba Diving that has taken me to many unique places throughout the country in search of adventure and thrills others only dream of. I have instilled a strong sense of conservation in my life and a commitment to the protection of the environment.

name: Guesthouse in Valley Community  · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
Coming to stay with us is a full immersion in the Jungle. We have built this sanctuary to reconnect to nature and to enjoy a more slow-paced lifestyle. We are surrounded by nature and the closest town (Dangriga) is a 30 minutes car ride.

There is so much to do in Belize! Here are a few of our favorites located in the Stann Creek district specifically, within a stone's throw of our property:


Angel Falls Zip Line & Water Rappelling (5 miles away). Known as "The Largest Zip Line in Central America." Just a short drive from Sattva Land.

Billy Barquedier National Park and Waterfall (3 miles away). Easily accessible and a quick five-minute drive from Sattva Land.

Antelope Falls (25 miles away). This 1,000-foot waterfall involves an intermediate one-hour hike to the pools with an incredible view of the ocean. Accessible by bus (though you will need to walk about 4 miles from the highway).

Additionally, Placencia is a quaint beac

name: Rental unit in Placencia · ★4.84 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Neighborhood is residential but not far from a local restaurant, church and school. The main road is a minute's walk down Kuba Aly @ Dawns Grill n Go... and since Placencia has only one road, everything is on this main street. There's a "sidewalk" (smallest street in the Guiness Book of World Records) that runs down the village center as well, and quite a few gift shops and restaurants are scattered along it. The sidewalk is parallel to the main road and is also very close to get to.
host_about: I'm outgoing, friendly, helpful and a native Belizean and wedding planner.  I love reading, movies and also Love to travel!  I kayak every morning and I take tons of photos! As a host I'll be available by phone/WhatsApp all day, unless I'm out of the village, and I'll still be able to figure out how to help if needed.

host_about: Enjoying the privilege of living in the tropics for the last 20 years of my life and more especially in Belize since 2008 with my husband and 4 kids.  I am engineer in tropical agronomy which gave me the opportunity to travel the world and manage various projects and businesses. Amongst all the places were we lived, we find Belize very special, we fell in love with its peaceful diversity, its diverse and scenic landscapes, its climate, its people, its laid back environment... we love sharing this secret and have no doubt you will love it just as much as we do !

name: Rental unit in Caye Caulker · ★4.40 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
host_about: I grew up on Caye Caulker and am a descendant of the Garifuna people who began arriving in then British Honduras on November 19th, 1802. This day is now a national holiday in Belize celebrated with drums, dancing and pageantry.  I enjoy the service industry and have worked for many years as property manager, bartender and general assistant.  I have had the pleasure of meeting people from all over the world.  At the same time my passion is the game of darts and I enjoy competing with people from other nations around the Caribbean.  I'm here to make your stay a "Game Shot".

name: Cottage in San Ignacio · ★4.96 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
We are to help with any queries you have regarding travel to and in Belize (even if you haven't booked yet) Feel free to message us !

Why you should visit San Ignacio Belize ?

San Ignacio is a hidden gem, located away from the beaten tourist track. Although most travelers spend time along the Belize coast, San Ignacio is well worth a stop along your Belize itinerary thanks to some of the best Mayan ruins in Central America like Caracol now being recognized as Belize's Hidden gem,
enjoy impressive Mayan caves and opportunities for adventure travel like kayaking, tubing and hiking.

It’s also a great way to learn the Belize culture and see a different side of the country. San Ignacio is located near the border with Guatemala, making Tikal available as a day trip ! San Ignacio is heavily influenced by its neighbor, so you will hear more Spanish here than around the coastal areas of Belize.

San Ignacio is a favorite tourist destination fo
host_about:
The family's permanent  home is 'on site', Jenny and I live here with our 2 grown up children, Craig apart from assisting us  also works at the Belize rapture center, Kayleigh is the Crazy Cat Lady , as well as helping us she also owns/runs the only cat sanctuary in Belize it is located in the grounds but totally isolated from the rentals.
we never leave the property unattended so one of will always  available should you need any assistance

name: Home in San Pedro · ★4.84 · 3 bedrooms · 6 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Located on the very popular and convenient front street. Right across the street from The Coffee Bar and Celis Deli, where you can grab great coffee and a quick breakfast. Also a short walk from great places to eat and drink, Blue water grill, Estels Dine by the sea, wild mangoes and Elvis kitchen to name a few favorites. The house is also in walking distance to both the water taxi port (Belize Express) and island airport (Tropic air and Maya Air).

name: Villa in Placencia · ★4.20 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Gail’s home is located in Seine Bight, Stann Creek District, Belize.

We are situated directly on the Caribbean Sea on the Placencia Peninsula on the edge of the tiny Village of Siene Bight. A 15 minute golf cart drive places you in Placencia Village on the southeastern coast of Belize, a popular holiday destination for North American expats and tourists.

The Placencia village, the worlds smallest Mainstreet called "the sidewalk" is located on the southern tip of the 16-mile long narrow Placencia Peninsula, a relaxed “barefoot friendly” community that bills itself as the caye (island).
host_about: I am a mother of four and have two precious grandchildren.  My husband and I came to Belize in 2008 and the next thing I knew we had bought a small Inn on the Caribbean.  We decided it would be a nice adventure we enjoy meeting new people, so it has turned out to be a good choice for us. And there is always adventure in Belize.

name: Farm stay in Belmopan · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Traveling from Belize city you will come to a large roundabout. Veer to the right of the round-about and continue across the bridge & through the village of Roaring Creek. Go 2 1/2 miles on the Western Highway until you come to a large commercial complex called Westar. continue straight ahead a few yards. up ahead you will see a large cement sign that says Banana Bank. Slow Down & prepare to turn right. Follow the winding dirt road until you reach a bridge. Cross the Belize River on the Agripino Cawitch Bridge. Continue about 1 1/2 miles. You will see a sign for the Global Outreach boys School turn left. Continue along this road approximately 2 1/2 miles. watch for a cement Banana Bank sign on the right. Here you will turn right, you are now on Banana Bank and our private road. You will drive 2 miles through pastures. When you reach the pink round pen you are at Banana Bank Lodge. Welcome To Banana Bank Lodge.
host_about: Banana Bank Horses & Belize Jungle Lodge

name: Bed and breakfast in San Ignacio · ★4.92 · 2 bedrooms · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: We are located in one of the highest hill streets in San Ignacio Town. Walking distance you will find the Cahal Pech archeological site which is a Maya Ruin and museum. There are also a few restaurants in the vicinity without having to go into town.
host_about:
I am a mother of 4 and grandmother of 6 with a passion to host and entertain people. I have been in the hospitality business for quite some time and enjoy meeting new people from around the world who visits my little jewel country.
I love to travel and read.
I have a catering business so cooking has always been a love of mine. 
Nana's Bnb is Gold Standard approved and I look forward to giving you a Gold Standard stay at my home.
property_type: Private room in bed and breakfast

name: Rental unit in Belmopan · ★4.76 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Conveniently located in the heart of Belmopan, restaurants, supermarkets, and activities are all short walks away.
host_about:
Born, raised, and having spent most of my life in Belize City, I moved to Belmopan about ten years ago. I am an avid lover and collector of local wooden sculptures which can be seen throughout my apartments. My collection includes giant sculptures that weigh thousands of pounds to small mayan heads.  My goal is to provide my guests with a good value - clean safe and unique spaces to stay while in Belmopan, at an affordable price. I am available by (Hidden by Airbnb) or phone call at any time. 

Please note that all my apartments, ranging from studios to two-bedrooms, are located in the same compound on Constitution Drive.

name: Condo in Caye Caulker · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
We are just 2 blocks from the Split.
A great place to spend the day! There is a great bar and grill called The Lazy Lizard that has excellent food and cold drinks. The split is a body of water separating North and South Caye Caulker. It is a great place to snorkel for free. There is a dock for sun bathing and easy access to the water. There is also a fishing area for those that want to try their luck. Kayaks and paddle boards are available for rent.
host_about: A relaxed island sanctuary, Firefly is the realisation of a dream that I'm glad to share with you.

name: Rental unit in Caye Caulker · ★4.75 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Restaurants;
Ever popular, Habenero's is one of the best the caye, offering a diverse menu of Mexican, home made pasta and locally inspired meals. Rose's Bar and Grill always has delicious fresh seafood and Tropical Paradise restaurant at the end of front street is a reliable and good value venue.

The lively and bohemian Pizza Caulker bakes the best pizzas on the caye. Run by the irrepressible Greg, it is always popular.

Close by is the up-market beach front restaurant, Coconut Reef.

For a great flavor of Caribbean cooking we recommend the Wish Willy Bar & Grill. Located a block behind cayereef, local chef Maurice serves authentic Belizean food in an informal environment. Great for a menu-free dinner - try the rum punch. It's been a favorite of veteran travellers to Caye Caulker for years. Very economical.

Another local favorite is Syd's. It serves traditional Belizean Cuisine of rice and beans, fish & chicken dishes and is popular wi

name: Bungalow in San Ignacio · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
Condo in Hopkins Village · ★4.96 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 3.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Hopkins is widely considered a hidden gem in Belize. It is a small, coastal, fishing village that is centrally located to the vast majority of Belize's most exciting water and land attractions. Hopkins Village is a Garifuna village on the coast of the Stann Creek District in Belize. Hopkins is considered by some Belizeans to be the cultural center of the Garifuna population in Belize.
host_about: Welcome to Seiri Del Mar Luxury Resort, your ultimate sanctuary of serenity in the heart of Belize. Seiri, meaning “Heaven” in Garifuna, lives up to its name with its breathtaking views of the crystal-clear Caribbean waters and the Belize barrier reef, making it the perfect getaway for those seeking a peaceful and luxurious escape.
neighbourhood: Hopkins Village, Stann Creek District, Belize

name: Villa in Hopkins · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 3.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Located just south of the resort area in the prestigious Phase 4 area of Sittee Point you will find a quiet neighborhood set on one of the best stretches of beach in Belize. Relax the day away spotting Manatee & Dolphins from your hammock. Count the many different species of birds that visit our yard. Watch the Pelicans fish for their lunch. Parrots, Hummingbirds and Osprey are also  frequently spotted. The lucky guests may even see the national bird of Belize the Keel Billed Toucan. Swim in our private beachfront pool. Kayak the beautiful Sittee River or take a night tour to the Bioluminescent lagoon just around the corner. Many tours offered that leave from the marina around the corner within walking distance can take you diving or snorkeling on the worlds second largest barrier reef. There you will also find The Curve Bar with delicious food and tropical drinks not to mention the amazing sunsets. name: Home in Hopkins · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Hopkins is a small, local community. It is the "friendliest village in all of Belize," so it is a very safe place to be. There are many local restaurants and bars you can patron at, as well as many site seeing and adventure spots.

*Tours:
- Belize Roots Tours
- Hopkins Kulcha Tours

*Attractions:
- Belize Zoo
- Cockscomb Basin Wildlife Sanctuary
- Zip lining
- Waterfall Rappelling
- Fishing, snorkeling and charter boats:
+ Seemore Adventures in Hopkins
- Paddleboarding:
+ Sup Hopkins in Hopkins
- Hiking & Waterfalls @ Billy Barquedeir National Park and Zipline, Hiking & Waterfalls @ - Mayflower Bocawina National Park
- Mayan Ruins
- Caves Tours

PLACES TO EAT NEAR CONDO:
- Mangos - walking distance (5 min)
- Lucky Lobster - 5 min drive
-Loggerhead
-Ba hay Fiesta
- Ella's Cool Spot
- T & C Kitchen
- Frogs Point
- Driftwood Pizza
host_about: I am a Christian, mother of four, grandmother of five and a world traveler.

name: Rental unit in Hopkins · ★4.42 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
host_about:
Vacasa
Vacation Home Management

Vacasa unlocks the possibilities of how we enjoy vacation homes. We take care of managing our homeowners’ vacation houses so they can have peace of mind (and their home when they want to). And our guests book vacations confidently knowing they’re going to find exactly what they’re looking for without any surprises.

Each vacation home is always cared for by our professional local teams who implement our high cleanliness and maintenance values, while the hands-off tasks of vacation rental management--marketing, filing taxes, and maintaining a website--are handled by a specialized central support team. Our passion and focus remain true: to empower our homeowners, guests, and employees to invest in vacation.

name: Rental unit in San Ignacio · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The town is about a 1/4 mile away and the center is about 3/4 mile. It is easily walked but a taxi only cost $5 USD for up to 4 persons.
host_about: I like to travel... currently at 40 countries. This year will complete 50 years living and/or working in Belize. My wife Suzi and I have raised a family of 5 kids, who in turn, have married to people from 5 countries.  Suzi and I both love music, nature,  and cultural foods.  Our passion is striving to make the world a better place, one step at a time. I am involved in the new Organic Foods movement and the Wellness movement in Belize.  Together Suzi and I have built the Maya Mountain Lodge that has 45 years serving visitors to Belize. Now Covid has created new opportunities to serve others.

name: Home in Santa Familia Village · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths

In this 1500 sq. ft. home you are lacking nothing of modern comforts!  It is cooled by ceiling fans in every room, and A/C to master bedroom if required (we have never used it, it cools off at night).
neighbourhood: Santa Familia Village, Cayo District, Belize

name: Rental unit in San Pedro · ★4.31 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
What is BAKKATOWN Belize?

BAKKATOWN is ‘Back of Town’.

This is where the local working people live.


- Guests can live “with the Locals”.
- Eating and shopping and socializing at local shops.
- Meeting people as they go about their days and evenings.

We provide economical accommodations for Travellers.

Travellers who want to spend their time and money on activities and experiences.

Travellers who do not want an expensive hotel room and tourist restaurant where the only locals they meet are the ones serving and cleaning up after them.

The Travellers who want to experience what Belize has to offer and value the Experience.

The lagoon is on the back of San Pedro Town, where the island is only 4 blocks wide in town.

We are on the edge of downtown, a few blocks from the beachfront and swimming beaches, and the shops and restaurants.

The airport and water taxi t
host_about: Welcome to Bakkatown Belize

Being able to give someone a vacation that they'll remember forever is the driving force behind what we do.  We aim to make every trip memorable!

neighborhood_overview: Our neighbors are friendly farmers and fisherman they offer a variety of cultural activities. Enjoy a traditional Mayan meal.
host_about: Adventure traveler

name: Farm stay in Middlesex · ★5.0 · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: Set back from the stunning Hummingbird Highway at MILE MARKER 26, The Nest is surrounded by the Maya Mountains and set in a Broadleaf Rainforest Farm with lots of  Belizean Adventures nearby.

name: Home in Benque Viejo Del Carmen · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Boasting the best neighborhood in Belize. See why we are the top retirement destination. Casual strolls around the neighborhood are rich with nature, history, and local activities. Organic market, swimming, art galleries, music festivals, and house of culture are all here. Take a stroll to the ancient Mayan ruins 4 blocks away.
neighbourhood: Benque Viejo Del Carmen, Cayo District, Belize

name: Hotel in Caye Caulker · Studio · 1 bed · 1 private bath
Treehouse in Middlesex · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Located 600 ft. west of Mile Marker 26 on the Hummingbird Hwy, halfway between the Capitol City Belmopan and the Caribbean Sea, Pineapple Hill is in a broadleaf rainforest tucked into the Maya Mountains just off the Stunning Hummingbird Highway. See our other Pineapple Hill AirBnB listings to get a complete overview of our 70 acre farm!

name: Rental unit in San Pedro · ★4.55 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The manicured property is close to the beach, upscale restaurants, local stores and local restaurants. The whole island has a village atmosphere.
I provide linens, bath towels, beach towels, shampoo/body wash and hand soap.
host_about:
I was born and raised in Africa.  My parents owned a remote, luxury lodge so I was raised in the bush in Africa.  After high school I travelled extensively  and ended up in Hawaii for over 25 years!  My son moved to the eastern USA and as it was so far from Hawaii, I decided to move closer to him.  Luckily I landed in Belize!  I have been here for 10 years.  My guest house keeps me busy and I love the Airbnb lifestyle!
Can't wait to meet you!

name: Rental unit in San Pedro · ★4.83 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
What is BAKKATOWN Belize?

BAKKATOWN is ‘Back of Town’.

This is where the local working people live.


- Guests can live “with the Locals”.
- Eating and shopping and socializing at local shops.
- Meeting people as they go about their days and evenings.

We provide economical accommodations for Travellers.

Travellers who want to spend their time and money on activities and experiences.

Travellers who do not want an expensive hotel room and tourist restaurant where the only locals they meet are the ones serving and cleaning up after them.

The Travellers who want to experience what Belize has to offer and value the Experience.

The lagoon is on the back of San Pedro Town, where the island is only 4 blocks wide in town.

We are on the edge of downtown, a few blocks from the beachfront and swimming beaches, and the shops and restaurants.

The airport and water taxi t
host_about: Welcome to Bakkatown Belize

name: Boutique hotel in Belize · ★4.78 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: We have a typical Belizean neighborhood with local people and culture right next to the center of town. Remember : “The Split” in not in the center but it is located in the northern  part of the island

name: Farm stay in Biscayne · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
We're located in a village, many of the villagers living in the village are small subsistence farmers, hunters, loggers and fisher folks.
There are quite a few Mayan ruins scattered throughout the village, most of which are not easily accessible.
host_about:
My name is Francine August, a born Belizean who loves living in Belize and in particular! the country side.
It would be my pleasure to show you all why I'm so in love with this place called: home.

name: Bed and breakfast in Belmopan City · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Quiet road leading to the golf course. Westar restaurant and convenience store at the end of the road
host_about:
Nikki & Jerry are a husband and wife team, founders of Belize Bird Rescue and owners of Rock Farm 50 acre reserve. We have been in Belize since 2003 and fell into bird rescue entirely by accident. We now run the country's only licensed multi-species avian rescue centre, helping orphaned, injured or rescued birds of all species with a focus on halting the illegal trade in wild-caught parrots. 
Rock Farm Guest House generates sustainable income to keep the rescue funded. Staying with us in our home will make you feel warm and fuzzy all over as, not only will you enjoy a beautiful property, you will be helping us to save the birds!
We operate a home-from-home with lovely rooms and great home cooking. We have 50 acres of fabulous grounds for you to explore, and a crystal-clear river to swim in.
Please note that we don't have AC or TV in the rooms and there are dogs on the property and the parrots are very loud in the morning!

name: Tiny home in Hopkins · ★4.89 · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: We are separated and yet not separated.  Just a few minutes in either direction are various amenities that you can enjoy.  Swimming, bars, restaurants, paddle boarding, yoga, fitness club, are all just a few minutes away by car or bicycle.
host_about:
I'm originally from Guelph, Ontario and my longtime dream was to move some place warm and tropical.   So now I've set up a small cabana business so other people can come and enjoy this slice of paradise for a reasonable cost.  

We, my husband and I, feel that you shouldn't have to spend all your vacation dollars on accommodations.  Instead go spend your vacation dollars on activities, tours, other destinations in Belize.

name: Villa in Placencia · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
host_about: KeyCaribe gives you access to stunning locations in Curacao, Sint Maarten and Aruba. We offer home accommodations, the finest amenities, customized activities and personalized services, the conveniences of a luxury resort or authentic adventurous vacation. Book now and let us unlock the Caribbean for you.

name: Villa in San Pedro · 3 bedrooms · 6 beds · 2 baths
Guesthouse in Placencia · ★4.98 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Our neighbours are all fabulous people and fun and friendly to interact with.
host_about: We are a relocated Canadian couple who drove down to live out our dreams in Belize.

name: Guesthouse in Placencia · ★4.95 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Our neighbours are all fabulous people and fun and friendly to interact with.
host_about: We are a relocated Canadian couple who drove down to live out our dreams in Belize.

name: Cabin in Orange Walk · 10 bedrooms · 18 beds · 10 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Orange Walk town will give you access to restaurants, stores and shops . It is about 10-15 min drive.

Belize City is 45-60min drive
host_about: I love traveling and learning new cultures! I teach yoga and host retreats and I am always on the look out for a unique place to host my next retreat!
neighbourhood: Orange Walk, Orange Walk District, Belize

name: Nature lodge in Unitedville‎ · ★5.0 · 5 bedrooms · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
Nearby are restaurants with a big variety of real good food.

A 5 minutes’ walk brings you to a creek with crystal clear water and a nice swimming hole.
host_about:
I born, growing up and educated in Chile, I met My beloved Peter 2015. we started our Green Valley Inn on january 1st. 2017.
 Peter wrote: Born, growing up and educated in Germany, in 2004 I decided to escape the hustle of the daily live in Europe and moved to Belize. 
With Wolfs Place, McWolfs Restaurant and Wolfs Tours I started successful tourism businesses.
This kind of work was a completely new experience. My original background is IT and I used to own and run a computer/ internet company in Germany.
 I revived Wolfs Tours and started with Green Valley Inn a new outlet for tourists.
In my free time I write and publish essays and books about Belize.

name: Island in Placencia · 5 bedrooms · 11 beds · 5.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Kanu is located just off the coast of Placencia, Belize. The boat ride from the Marina to the
island is about 20 minutes
host_about: I’m Kathy, a professional property manager.  I am a Belize resident and split time between Placencia and Texas. I have been travelling to and vacationing in Placencia Belize for more than 20 years now and started renting our first villa in 2008. Our passion is to help other families explore all Placencia has to offer, while offering convenient and resort-style amenities to enhance the vacation experience. We look forward to your questions!

name: Rental unit in San Pedro · ★4.71 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
host_about:
Vacasa
Vacation Home Management

Vacasa unlocks the possibilities of how we enjoy vacation homes. We take care of managing our homeowners’ vacation houses so they can have peace of mind (and their home when they want to). And our guests book vacations confidently knowing they’re going to find exactly what they’re looking for without any surprises.

Each vacation home is always cared for by our professional local teams who implement our high cleanliness and maintenance values, while the hands-off tasks of vacation rental management--marketing, filing taxes, and maintaining a website--are handled by a specialized central support team. Our passion and focus remain true: to empower our homeowners, guests, and employees to invest in vacation.

neighborhood_overview: Quite place, sparsely populated with mixed culture in Jacintoville
host_about: Adventure traveler

name: Tiny home in Hopkins, Stann Creek · ★4.82 · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: We are situated halfway between the village of Hopkins and the resorts.  Comfortable walk in either direction.
host_about:
I'm originally from Guelph, Ontario and my longtime dream was to move some place warm and tropical.   So now I've set up a small cabana business so other people can come and enjoy this slice of paradise for a reasonable cost.  

We, my husband and I, feel that you shouldn't have to spend all your vacation dollars on accommodations.  Instead go spend your vacation dollars on activities, tours, other destinations in Belize.

name: Condo in San Pedro · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
We are located a 1/2 mile north of the bridge leaving San Pedro, Belize. Our neighborhood is more relaxed than the hustle and bustle of downtown but close enough that you are just a short drive from the many restaurants and activities located in town.
There are three restaurants in the immediate vicinity of the property. The on site bar and restaurant, The Dog House Sports Lounge, is open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner (7am – 10pm every day). They have Belizean breakfast dishes and casual bar food and mixed drinks throughout the day.
Just to the north of our property (a 2 minute walk on the beach) is 303 Belize, an over the water bar and restaurant. They are open for lunch and dinner (every day of the week) and focus more on seafood. They have live music most evenings as well. Underneath 303 Belize, is Elite Adventures, a dive and snorkel shop.
Just south of our property is the Farmhouse Market and Cafe. They offer a wide selection of fresh coffees, juices/smoothies,
host_about:
Tres Cocos Resort @ The Cloisters, is a charming family-run establishment where island living meets modern comfort. 
We have fond childhood memories on the property before its transformation into a vacation rental oasis. 
Each condo is individually owned and thoughtfully appointed, ensuring a unique and personalized experience for our guests. We invite you to experience the warmth of Belizean hospitality in every detail during your stay with us.

name: Home in San Pedro · ★5.0 · 5 bedrooms · 5 beds · 5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Patrick's place is located in San Pedro, Belize.
We are walking distances from Mata Chica, Portofino Resort, Rojo Beach Bar, and Mata Grande grocery store all within a 10 minute walk!

name: Home in Corozal · ★4.53 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Across from One Mall grocery store and one of Corozal's best restaurants that faces the water is within walking distance.  As well as the intersection that leads to Cerros Mayan Ruin.

name: Boutique hotel in Punta Gorda · ★4.89 · 6 bedrooms · 6 beds · 6 baths
neighborhood_overview: The RAP is located in the middle of P.G.'s central business district and is just one block away from the beautiful Caribbean Sea which can be seen from the building's balcony.
host_about: United States Army Veteran

name: Home in San Pedro · ★5.0 · 4 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Le Reve is in the safe and popular Tres Cocos community - a prime and secure location only 1 mile from downtown San Pedro and Boca Del Rio. Plenty of restaurants and bars within a few blocks from our property. Belize Barrier Reef is your front yard (along with your massive pool and sun bathing deck). A beach path goes on for miles and the famous Marbucks Coffee House is only a 5 minute stroll down the beach. Love yoga? Akbol Yoga is located only a 10 minute jog away and they have an amazing restaurant offering a very healthy menu.
host_about:
Hi, I'm Corrina! 

I grew up outside of Toronto, Ontario but spent most of my adult life in British Columbia, Canada experiencing the fulfilling coastal and mountain culture.

In 2013, I took my first trip to Belize and now spend 6 months of the year on Ambergris Caye where I host a plethora of architecturally stunning oceanfront holiday homes to wonderful guests like you. These homes are ideal and can accommodate anywhere from 8 - 98 guests which are perfect for large groups, weddings, birthdays and other events.  

After a few years, and many guests requesting similar homes and services in the lush mountains of Belize,  I decided to expand our rental inventory and offer our guests a luxurious "Surf n" Turf" package that includes 3-4 nights in one of our island homes and 3-4 nights in one of our lush mountain villas in San Ignacio, Cayo. 
If you desire to experience Belize in a most epic way then we have something for every guest in modern, stylish, safe, comfortable and clean environments within the most desirable communities. 

If I am unable to be on location when guests arrive than one of my representatives will meet/greet you upon arrival, transfer you to our properties, and assist you with anything you may need. Our concierge is the finest!

We can’t wait to meet you and welcome you to beautiful Belize!
See you soon. 

Smiles!

Corrina Taylor

name: Bungalow in Belize City · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Located on the river that feeds to the beautiful reefs of Belize. We also have a 32 foot fishing Boat you may rent for the day with a Captain. We are a 6 acre property surrounded by the Jungle we have Monkeys. We have a pontoon for a evening River rides. Your host can give you more details

name: Condo in Hopkins · ★4.73 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Your stay comes with access to two onsite pools, a private beach, along with complimentary bike rentals to the nearby village. name: Home in San Pedro · ★5.0 · 4 bedrooms · 5 beds · 4 baths
host_about:
I am a avid scuba diver, sailor, fisherman and love to travel to tropical places. I have been coming to Belize for over 25 years. I never dreamed that I would end up building a house here, but it happened. Villa Tortuga is finally ready after a long 4 years of hard work. Now it's time for the easy part. For you to enjoy it! 

My goal is to make your adventure/vacation as easy and stress less as possible. I want everyone to leave Villa Tortuga with amazing memories to last a life time. You are fortunate enough to have my friend Patojo who is a local that was born on the island and his wife Sabrina will be your on site host. Patojo is a local, dive guide and trained most of the guides on the island. He and his dad & brothers are the ones who set up the buoys at all the dive sites to tie your boat off to so the reef didn't get damaged with anchors back in the day before being environmental was cool. They also found and named all the dive sites you see on the maps. I will be off site but available anytime if needed.

neighborhood_overview: as mentioned we are located about 1 mile from the edge of the village on the Southern part of the island.  There is no electrical grid once you're past the airstrip, and the road can be dark at night.  We recommend using headlamps/flashlights or taking a taxi at night as the golf cart path can be bumpy
host_about: Hi, I'm Cindy, and along with my husband Don, have retired to our dream home in Belize, where we're starting the next chapter. We've created a hip, chic,and private vacation getaway in an area on Caye Caulker, away from the crowd. We are seasoned travelers and have come to love the small boutique properties around the world and I try very hard to pay attention to detail to bring some luxury to your space while maintaining an eco friendly and responsible environment. We love the laid back vibe of Caye Caulker and I hope you will feel it here too.

neighborhood_overview: We are located right in the center of town. Banks are within walking distance and if you love to cook there are grocery stores,  The market is literally right across the street.  Do you love Ice cream... several places in the area. host_about:
Hi I'm Naz. 
I'll be one of your host as you stay in one of our two beautiful and spacious apartments.  Both apartments were designed and manufactured on location. By that I'm referring to the kitchen cabinets and some furniture, such as wall units.  As a designer and manufacture of custom cabinets at one time, in the US, I was able to bring in the simple yet contemporary layout of the apartments.  
As a child, thanks to my parents I was able to visit and live in different countries,  in different continents, living in Africa for ten years of my life.  I think that is why I enjoy meeting people!  I'm married with two children.  My wife Lina is originally from the Philippines,  we met and married in the US.  Looking forward to meeting you.  
With kind regards!
Naz.

name: Boutique hotel in San Pedro · ★4.76 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Secret Beach is a true paradise. It is the perfect place to relax and unwind. Enjoy the calm, blue, warm waters just steps from your room. Grab a complimentary hammock float and walk steps to water access. The sunsets are spectacular, as well as amazing stargazing at night. Secret Beach has become more popular with tourists. In walking distance you can rent kayaks, paddle boards, and tubes. The bars and restaurants open between 10-6 with a few exceptions that will take later dinner reservations including our on site bar and restaurants, The Boozy Octo!. Enjoy local cuisine and calm waters to swim in during the day and amazing sunsets and stargazing at night. It is a perfect balance of relaxation and fun!
host_about: We are the owners of Secret Beach Cabanas at Paradise on the Caye at Secret Beach.   We love people, the sunshine, the beautiful beach, and the laid back island that makes up Ambergris Caye.  Our goal is to make your stay the best you've ever experienced. Please come and let us share La Isla Bonita with you.

name: Tiny home in Teakettle · ★5.0 · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Teakettle is a rural/farming village. just minutes away from the capital city. Those who are not farmers commute to Belmopan for work and other government business. Teakettle is known for the spectacular and well-preserved Maya cave system Actun Tunicil Maknal (ATM) which contains centuries-old skeletons, ceramics and other Maya objects. Other Maya archaeological sites like Cahal Pech and Xunantunich are less than an hour's drive.
host_about: I am a retired diplomat and former senior officer in the Government of Belize. I enjoy nature and the quiet serenity of the rainforest. I also love people, great music, great conversations and great movies. I have travelled all over the world in my capacity as Ambassador, and have met many interesting people with whom I still keep in contact. My wife, Bernadette, and I are very open-minded and treat our guests as friends and kin. Retirement from diplomacy meant a new direction, so we chose to build three cottages and open our private retreat to paying guests, which would keep us in contact with people from all over the world. We love it here. We are happy to have you join us in a welcoming, uncomplicated environment where warmth and friendship await you. The longer you stay, the happier we all are. We particularly like to host persons who are on short or long-term consultancies in the Belmopan area; newlyweds looking for a honeymoon getaway, couples with young families, or adventurous grown-ups who use our place as a base for forays into rock-climbing, zip-lining, cave-tubing, rainforest hiking or ancient Maya site explorations; also retired couples who just want a quiet place to refresh the soul. You are all welcome.

name: Home in Caye Caulker · ★4.95 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Firefly Garden is at the end of a sandy cul-de-sac in a popular residential area which is generally quiet, though not immune to the sounds of village life. You might hear distant music, or animal noises. Nearby is the Suggestion Gourmet french bakery. In the morning you may hear a man on a bicycle cart tooting his horn - he sells a mound of hot fresh corn tortilla for BZ$2.50. Two blocks away is the small Caye Caulker airstrip which takes light aircraft.

Fernando Baltazar Alamilla friendly ambassador to his client initiated Fernando's Seaside Guest House in 1996.He was a fisherman and was also involved in tourism.His heart was open to expend the business in 2002 with more rooms.He is friendly,humble, and always welcoming his clients with a smile. Fernando Herman Alamilla became a REALTOR in 2002. In that time, he founded one real estate office on the North part of the country Belize in sarteneja village,Corozal District,Belize Central America and developed a reputation for integrity, honesty and professionalism.
“When Fernando  became a REALTOR there were very few people in the business in the area of sarteneja and you could say he was a pioneer of the area. “He instilled strong ethical and professional values in the real estate office he founded and became known as an ambassador and leader to many retirees ,Inventors that choose Belize as their second home vacation or home.
Alamilla’s commitment to professionalism is evident through his involvement with several professional bodies. Fernando Alamilla as Northern Coastal Realty is committed to the assurance of your “Dream”
Edit Biography 
Retire in Paradise "Belize".


Northern Coastal Realty


Belize has its doors open blue sky.The sea is a deeper blue, sparkling with sunlight.A gentle breeze comes drifting in from the caribbean sea,clean and refreshing, as your maid brings you breakfast in bed.

for a moment, you think you have died and gone to heaven.But this paradise is real.And affordable.In fact, it costs only half as much to live this dream lifestyle...as it would to stay in your own home!

name: Hotel in Toledo District · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
Hostel in Toledo District · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
Tiny home in Sittee Point · ★4.90 · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The Sundial Beach Cabana is in a quiet residential neighborhood, about 3 kilometers from the south end of Hopkins village.
Sitting half way down the coast line, many of the major tourist attractions are just a day trip away. A 40 minute boat ride will take you out to the largest barrier reef in the western hemisphere and over 400 pristine Cayes. The scuba diving and snorkeling are exceptional with Belize’s abundance of sea life along with some of the top dive sites in the world. On the mainland explore Mayan ruins, hike in the jungle and take a refreshing dip in the jungle’s infamous Blue Hole off the Hummingbird highway. Tube through caves, catch a zipline, or learn drumming from a local Garifuna drummer.
host_about:
Hi, 
We are Caroline & Jesse. We first visited Belize back in 2005 and fell in love with this small yet diverse country. In 2018, we took the plunge and bought the Sundial Beach Cabana, our home away from home. We try and spend as much time as possible there, but when we can't, we hope to share our love for Belize with others. We hope we get to host you.

name: Condo in Caye caulker · ★4.17 · Studio · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Caye Caulker is a popular destination for scuba divers, snorkelers, anglers, and tourists who just want beach- oriented relaxation at budget prices. Although in the past it was sleepy fishing community, this fun loving island is today known more for its exotic tours to the world's 2nd largest Barrier Reef as well as the famous Hol Chan Marine Reserve. Take a ferry to the northside of the island and make a stop at Northside Beach or Blu Zen and enjoy the elegant services offered. Take pleasure in visiting Iguana Reef to experience the breathtaking sunset view while catching sight of the seahorses and stingrays.
host_about:
Hi , my name is Brandon and my Husband is Adam and we hope to be your host on the magical island of Caye Caulker . We fell in love  with this little island the first time we came here. Now, we are so happy to share our little piece  of this  paradise with you.  If you have the time, read our back ground story  of how we came to be. In mean time cheers to everyone!!! 

All my Listings are located at Popeyes Beach Condos, Caye Caulker which is now officially Gold Standard Certified! Thanks to our Amazing Team.

Hi, my name is Jordan!

name: Boutique hotel in Hopkins · ★4.78 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Onsite Guide/ shuttle service, Three grocery stores within one mile, Public Beach access, 22 restaurants within a mile, Sports bars, Dance Halls, Bus Stop locations, 2 car rental shops, Gift shops, motorcycle rentals, shuttle services to all of Belize and Ferry service to Cayes.
host_about:
We love the Jungle, Waterfalls, Reefs and Sea-- and found Hopkins the perfect spot right in the middle.  Beautiful people, smiles and cultures all flourish in this fishing village.   Come be our guest and feel the love Belize has to offer!

For our guests convenience, we have added an on-site third party Concierge service, for all your tours and transfer needs.

Until we meet, 

Tyler and Val

name: Rental unit in Caye Caulker · ★4.57 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Foshay Tower is located in the heart of the Villa District consisting of a quiet residential neighborhood with private homes on tree-lined streets but just a ten minute walk to the center of the action.  We also have bicycles available for a small fee.
host_about: I grew up on Caye Caulker and am a descendant of the Garifuna people who began arriving in then British Honduras on November 19th, 1802. This day is now a national holiday in Belize celebrated with drums, dancing and pageantry.  I enjoy the service industry and have worked for many years as property manager, bartender and general assistant.  I have had the pleasure of meeting people from all over the world.  At the same time my passion is the game of darts and I enjoy competing with people from other nations around the Caribbean.  I'm here to make your stay a "Game Shot".

name: Tiny home in Caye Caulker · ★4.99 · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Located to the south of the village, our neighbourhood is a tree-filled, peaceful oasis. Every morning is full with the sounds of tropical birds singing away.
host_about:
We own a small vacation rental business on the island of Caye Caulker in the country of Belize. I, Hilary, am from Quebec, Canada and started spending my winters on Caye Caulker with my family when I was nine years old. I permanently moved to the island in 2001.
My husband, Pike, is from Orange Walk, a district in northern Belize. He moved to Caye Caulker for work in 1994, which is when we met and fell in love, and we got married in 2006 on Caye Caulker.
In 2007 our daughter, Lily, was born and our daughter, Ayla, was born in 2016.
I am a scuba instructor, Pike is a retired water taxi captain and we run our rental business together. 
We love to travel and enjoy having travellers stay with us. Our business is small and intimate, allowing us to ensure that your stay in Belize is authentic, creating memories for a lifetime.
Looking forward to meeting you!

name: Rental unit in San Pedro · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: THE NEIGHBORHOOD:  We’re not located on a main street, we’re located off a main street.  The property sits in a residential neighbourhood and is quiet.  It is nestled in by a cluster of Australian pine trees, located 1.5 miles south of town, and about a 10-15 minute drive from the island airstrip to the property.  It’s a one minute walk from the property to the beach, and one of the nicest restaurants on the island, serving breakfast, lunch and dinner.  Also within walking distances is Robyn’s Barbecue on weekends, two fruit stands (with an assortment of fresh fruits and vegetables), and a local grocery store.
host_about: My name is Lucinda, everyone calls me Nani.  Our family operates a small hotel located on the island of Ambergris Caye, Belize.  We have lived here for the past 18 years and absolutely love it.  If you're reading this, you're no doubt inquiring about Belize Budget Suites.  We cater to budget travelers - looking for first class accommodations.  Check out our various theme rooms and reserve the one that interests you the most.

host_about:
I have a background in speech pathology and audiology, with a strong interest in education and administration. My work in these fields has taught me the importance of clear communication, safety, and trust - values I carry into my hosting endeavors.

I hope your visit to Belize is filled with adventure, relaxation, and lasting memories.

name: Rental unit in Bullet Tree Falls, Cayo District · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
host_about: Hi, I'm Nikala.  I'm a mom and an educator from Houston, Texas.  I've lived in San Ignacio, Belize for 3 years now and I love it!  We've enjoyed hiking to Xunantinich, ziplining, swimming in the river, eating the delicious food, viewing the beautiful art and murals, and building relationships with the wonderful people in the community.  I think you will love it too!

name: Condo in Caye Caulker · ★4.60 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: North Caye Caulker - it’s the newest development area on the Caye Caulker. There are (3) resorts, Blu Zen, El Ben Cabanas and Northside Beach Club on the north side all with great restaurants and bars within walking or biking distance from Palm Life Belize.  Happy Lobster restaurant has open their second location on the north side and has been a staple in the village for years.  El Ben also offers guest pickup service for dinner and will take & deliver phone orders.  Belize Provisions is an online ordering service for groceries, liquor and bottle water for delivery to Palm Life.
host_about: Retired from Mississippi to the Alabama Gulf coast in 2010

name: Loft in San Pedro · ★4.92 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Our location is in the heart of San Pedro Town, You’ll be surrounded by the island’s top choice restaurants for great eats, and dive shops with endless activities such as snorkeling, diving, and paddle boarding. name: Boutique hotel in Placencia · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
Chabil Mar’s place is located in Placencia, Stann Creek District, Belize.

Chabil Mar is conveniently located 5 minutes drive from the Placencia local airport and daily life of Placencia Village, a traditional fishing Village, located at the end of the 16 mile long Placencia Peninsula.

Chabil Mar's full service property includes a restaurant and Roaming Butler service for dining and drinks. All Villas include full kitchens. Our staff can provide market purchases on your behalf and some restaurants in Placencia Village are available for delivery services to Chabil Mar for your convenience.
host_about: Chabil Mar Resort's Reservations Manager

name: Rental unit in San Pedro · ★4.75 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
Rental unit in San Pedro · ★4.50 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
host_about:
Vacasa
Vacation Home Management

Vacasa unlocks the possibilities of how we enjoy vacation homes. We take care of managing our homeowners’ vacation houses so they can have peace of mind (and their home when they want to). And our guests book vacations confidently knowing they’re going to find exactly what they’re looking for without any surprises.

Each vacation home is always cared for by our professional local teams who implement our high cleanliness and maintenance values, while the hands-off tasks of vacation rental management--marketing, filing taxes, and maintaining a website--are handled by a specialized central support team. name: Home in Cristo Rey Village · ★4.92 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Only 4 miles from the heart of San Ignacio along a scenic road that winds through the jungle towards Pine Ridge. Close to the locally owned shops in the village of Cristo Rey and other well known resorts and restaurants ... far enough from San Ignacio's hustle and bustle for peace and quiet yet close to everything you could dream of doing while visiting mainland Belize....think waterfalls, blue swimming holes, Mayan ruins, mountain hikes, cave tubing, zip lining, horseback riding, and even rappelling! Also available are local yoga classes, cooking classes, and we love suggesting and arranging all the fun stuff!
host_about:
Hi, I'm Corrina! 

I grew up outside of Toronto, Ontario but spent most of my adult life in British Columbia, Canada experiencing the fulfilling coastal and mountain culture.

In 2013, I took my first trip to Belize and now spend 6 months of the year on Ambergris Caye where I host a plethora of architecturally stunning oceanfront holiday homes to wonderful guests like you. These homes are ideal and can accommodate anywhere from 8 - 98 guests which are perfect for large groups, weddings, birthdays and other events.  

After a few years, and many guests requesting similar homes and services in the lush mountains of Belize,  I decided to expand our rental inventory and offer our guests a luxurious "Surf n" Turf" package that includes 3-4 nights in one of our island homes and 3-4 nights in one of our lush mountain villas in San Ignacio, Cayo. 
If you desire to experience Belize in a most epic way then we have something for every guest in modern, stylish, safe, comfortable and clean environments within the most desirable communities. 

If I am unable to be on location when guests arrive than one of my representatives will meet/greet you upon arrival, transfer you to our properties, and assist you with anything you may need. Our concierge is the finest!

We can’t wait to meet you and welcome you to beautiful Belize!
See you soon. 

Smiles!

Corrina Taylor
neighbourhood: Cristo Rey Village, Cayo District, Belize

name: Cottage in San Pedro, Ambergris Caye · ★4.76 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: With other Airbnbs, hostels, and home rentals in the area, this location is quite popular for both tourists and the locals.
neighbourhood: San Pedro, Ambergris Caye, Corozal District, Belize

name: Rental unit in San Pedro  · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Located steps away from the Caribbean  sea, walking distance from yoga studios, kayak rentals and some of the islands most popular restaurants and bars. A short golf cart, bike or boat ride to town center.
host_about: Been coming to Belize for 15 years. Have owned a home here with my life partner TERESA for 8 years. Enjoy diving snorkeling and fishing but mostly love the people of Belize. Love to show off the island and what it has to offer.

name: Home in Hopkins · ★5.0 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath

host_about:
We love the Jungle, Waterfalls, Reefs and Sea-- and found Hopkins the perfect spot right in the middle.  Beautiful people, smiles and cultures all flourish in this fishing village.   Come be our guest and feel the love Belize has to offer!

For our guests convenience, we have added an on-site third party Concierge service, for all your tours and transfer needs.

Until we meet, 

Tyler and Val

The villa is only minutes by car or golf cart to many good local restaurants, bowling alley, putt putt golf course, and grocery store.  For those flying in from Belize City, the Placencia airstrip is less than twenty minutes by car away.
