name: Rental unit in San Pedro · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Sapphire Beach Resort sits on the quieter part of Ambergris Caye, surrounded by luscious palm tree forests. Many people pack a cooler full of beers and snacks for the adventurous ride up to Secret Beach. With smoothed roads, this stretch of beach on the western side of the island is a delight to experience. Or head down to the more lively town of San Pedro, to experience the Belizean charm in restaurants, shops, boutiques, bars, and friendly locals.

name: Rental unit in San Pedro · ★4.84 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
host_about:
Vacasa
Vacation Home Management

Vacasa unlocks the possibilities of how we enjoy vacation homes. We take care of managing our homeowners’ vacation houses so they can have peace of mind (and their home when they want to). And our guests book vacations confidently knowing they’re going to find exactly what they’re looking for without any surprises.

Each vacation home is always cared for by our professional local teams who implement our high cleanliness and maintenance values, while the hands-off tasks of vacation rental management--marketing, filing taxes, and maintaining a website--are handled by a specialized central support team. Our passion and focus remain true: to empower our homeowners, guests, and employees to invest in vacation.

name: Guesthouse in Placencia · ★4.81 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Placencia Village is located at the tip of the 23 miles long narrow Placencia peninsula; on one side of the peninsula is the Caribbean ocean and on the other side is the lagoon. One World Rentals is almost at the very end of the road in the heart of actual village. Everything is close-by. You will find a mix of residential and commercial buildings and also a mix of locals and expats. The football field is right across from One World Rentals as well.

name: Rental unit in Gales Point · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: We are located on the Central Coast of Belize, Du East of Southern Lagoon, Belize District Belize Central America. Approx.  20 minutes driving Distance from Gales Point Manatee Village / Approx. 45 minutes from Democracia Village Junction, Mile 31 on the George Price Hwy from where you will pass Gales point Round about and drive into a Beach Road following Loggerhead Shores Signs. Gales Point Village is one of he oldest Garifuna/Creole Descent Village dated back to the 1800s.  Gales Point Village Major mode of income includes farming of ground foods, rearing of domesticated animals and fishing at the Southern Lagoon. Things to do at the village: Cultural experience and fishing trips with the locals. Additionally, on site, Loggerhead Turtles on the beach during mating seasons can be spotted mating and laying eggs on nearby beaches, and occasionally Jaguars circle around the area. Additionally, Once onsite, arrangements to go on a Mayan Temples Tour, Cave tubing Tour, Zipline among other

Additionally, on site, Loggerhead Turtles on the beach during mating seasons can potentially be spotted mating and laying eggs on nearby beaches, and occasionally Jaguars circle around the area. name: Hotel in San Pedro · ★4.98 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
If it is your first time on the island (the 2013 & 2014 #1 island in the world!) - please note - the water in San Pedro is some of the prettiest water in the world, with perfect white sand, but because it is an island, the shore takes a beating from the sea, and much of the beachfront is sea walled. Because we are close to the reef, there can be seagrass that washes in. However - the swimmable beaches we have - are gorgeous. All beaches in Belize are public, so you are welcome to walk freely on all the beachfront. Although many resorts are located on the beach, there are only a few spots people actually swim in the sea. Here are the popular spots to swim:
--You can walk right to the shore, steps away, from PUR, and walk the beautiful, picturesque beach front
--You can swim off the docks at Rum dog, just minutes walk away, head north on the beach
-- Or you can head over to Aji Tapa Bar & Restaurant at Bella Vista Resort, our sister property and use the kayaks, swim off

PUR Hotels are a collection of two properties in Belize. PUR Boutique Cabanas are the newest, adults-only, boutique cabanas on the tropical island of Ambergris Caye, Belize. name: Cabin in San Ignacio · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
host_about:
I am Virginia Krohn and I am not only the owner of Villa Cayo but I designed, drew the plans for and built the villas.  I am also a real estate broker and the owner of Belize Live-Retire-Invest  which is myself and a group of expats dedicated to helping other people relocate to Belize. 


Originally from Texas I am a sculptor, painter and a custom home builder who knows how to pay attention to detail.   After visiting Belize in the '80s my husband and I returned to the states, sold our home and business and relocated to Belize in 1991.  Living on the beach for almost 20 years just 60' from that beautiful teal water was magical.  As the island changed the magic did disappear and the new dream became building a luxury Eco-resort in the jungle.

 

One of the best things I like about Belize is that I can afford to have someone help run our business,  have a housekeeper and a gardener which allows me the time to do the creative things I want to do while providing jobs for talented Belizeans.  Belize is not for everyone and it is only what you make of it.

Alma del Rio, the 'soul of the river', is named after our little Alma Sophia, who was born here in Belize and is raised among it's diverse nature and culture. 
We've been living in Belize for over 9 years. In the first 2, we managed a luxury island resort and presently own a business introducing and distributing renewable energy products. We bring into Alma del Rio all we know and believe in - professional hospitality and environmental awareness.   
We will be more than happy to help you get around, visit the best destinations and plan your trip according to your preferences and budget. We know the hospitality industry in Belize well, and will be glad to share our knowledge with you. 
Have a wonderful day!
Tom, Hadas & Alma

neighborhood_overview:
The area is generally peaceful (quiet time 10 pm) with a few other houses and condo buildings in the beachfront area. Wilson Point has a fence around 3 sides of the property (on the road side, plus separating the property from its neighbors just to the south & the currently empty lot to the north).

When you want to venture out of “seclusion” from your beach home, Stax Sunset Lounge and Cafe is a 3 minute walk away. Playa de Sala rooftop bar & restaurant is about a mile south. Just under a mile north (on the way to town) is the beachfront “Nest Grill” at Pelican Reef, and a bit beyond that is the Black Orchid Restaurant. Marin’s mini-mart is also a mile north, and of course there are many other grocery shopping and dining options on the way to and in town.
host_about:
I've lived most of my life in the U.S. (where I am from) but have also lived for a couple of months to up to two years in different countries: Germany, Spain, Australia, Colombia, Ecuador, Mexico, & Belize. Since 2011 I've been living a somewhat nomadic lifestyle while exploring, working & volunteering in new & old places in the Americas and Europe. It's a great way to keep learning!

In my travels I stumbled upon the opportunity to do something that I love -- helping vacation rental owners help people like you with their dream vacations on Ambergris Caye, Belize!

I also have a condo in Cartagena, Colombia; if you're looking for a 30+ night stay (to volunteer; learn Spanish, salsa dancing, or scuba diving; work remotely with a Caribbean view; escape the winter...) let me know!

'Pack for a Purpose' is an organization that links travelers who'd like to help fulfill wish lists of non-profits in developing countries. I partner with them with schools, community organizations & animal rescue groups in both Colombia & Belize. These groups would love to have your help!

Not yet an AirBNB member? Join via this referral link and save $$ on your first booking, maybe even for a stay in Cartagena or Belize! : www.airbnb.com/c/bsmalley

name: Home in Stann Creek District · ★4.14 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
This Tiny Beach side home is located a few feet on your east off the Placencia road in the middle of the Garifuna village of Seine Bight, and a few feet from the beach of the Caribbean sea. From your balcony/Veranda you will see the main supermarket in Seine Bight, Publics Supermarket, not affiliate with Publix in Florida. Here you can find toiletries, snacks, cleaning supplies, fruits and vegetables as well as kitchen groceries for when you decide to cook up a storm. Opposite Publics is Vern restaurant, popularly known for their delicious Belizean dishes, including creole and Garifuna food. Try their finger licking meals.

A seven (7) minutes drive south will take you to the mega tourist destination of Placencia village where you will see the Guinness book of world record smallest road. You will find many more supermarkets and restaurants to visit.

Our neighbors are very warm, friendly, and helpful. Most of us have lived in the same homes for over 30 years. They're quick to say good "mawnin" morning, good "aftanoon" afternoon, good evening (after 3pm), and good night (after 6pm).

Across the street we have a beautiful seamstress, Judith who can mend anything needed, and her brother, Fidel, our neighborhood errand guy, just shout for him, he'll fetch some drinks and snacks for a tip... Ask Carla about Fidel, she'll help shout for him on your behalf :)

name: Home in  Maya Beach · ★5.0 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Placencia is a 16 mile long peninsula off the coast of mainland Belize that feels like an island. Placencia is only half a mile wide with the stunning Caribbean Sea to the east and the Lagoon and Maya Mountains, to the west.

Maya Beach, boasting the most beautiful beaches in Belize is north of the village. This quiet, beach community is quickly becoming a sought after destination in Belize; close to the village, excursions and many popular restaurants, bars and attractions.

name: Condo in San Pedro · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The island of Ambergris Caye, “La Isla Bonita”, is a popular tourist destination. You can get here from the mainland either via an 15 minute flight or a 90 minute boat trip.

San Pedro, the only town on the island, has retained its charm while handling the growing number of visitors. Miramar is located 2.5 miles/4 km south of the town core, which means you are away from the crowds yet still within easy reach of everything.

Town is not far away when you want to go in for some live music, shopping, restaurants, etc. But there are things close by too; here are a few things within walking distance of Miramar:

--Suya Tour operator (2 minute walk)
--Marin’s, a small grocery store (4 minute walk)
--A couple of nice restaurants (2-10 minute walk)
--Beach Bar & Grill (15 minute walk; breakfast, lunch, dinner, live music, outdoor bowling)

The Belize Barrier Reef, the longest in the western hemisphere, is just 1/2 mile (1 km) off shore.
host_about:
I've lived most of my life in the U.S. (where I am from) but have also lived for a couple of months to up to two years in different countries: Germany, Spain, Australia, Colombia, Ecuador, Mexico, & Belize. Since 2011 I've been living a somewhat nomadic lifestyle while exploring, working & volunteering in new & old places in the Americas and Europe. It's a great way to keep learning!

In my travels I stumbled upon the opportunity to do something that I love -- helping vacation rental owners help people like you with their dream vacations on Ambergris Caye, Belize!

I also have a condo in Cartagena, Colombia; if you're looking for a 30+ night stay (to volunteer; learn Spanish, salsa dancing, or scuba diving; work remotely with a Caribbean view; escape the winter...) let me know!

'Pack for a Purpose' is an organization that links travelers who'd like to help fulfill wish lists of non-profits in developing countries. I partner with them with schools, community organizations & animal rescue groups in both Colombia & Belize. These groups would love to have your help!

neighborhood_overview: Costa Nube is located just south of the air strip. All properties in the area are off grid utilizing solar for energy and rain catch for water supply. We are minutes from the village for dinning, shopping, day activities,  tours, or nightlife. Once back at Costa Nube enjoy the serenity & beauty of the mangrove reserve.
host_about:

We live here on site to ensure your stay is more rewarding and the off grid equipment works efficiently.

As a collective, water & electricity conservation efforts are important. Enjoy the nature paths through the southern part of the island.  Take one of the paddle boards out to the sea. We are minutes from the village for dinning, shopping, day activities,  tours, or nightlife. Once back at Costa Nube enjoy the serenity & beauty of the mangrove reserve.
host_about:
We’re Aldo & Kolleen from Las Vegas,USA. We came to this beautiful Island 8 years ago and decided to make it our new home.  We love traveling, food, drinks and entertainment ☺️.
We live here on site to ensure your stay is more rewarding and the off grid equipment works efficiently.

name: Boutique hotel in San Pedro · ★4.87 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
If it is your first time on the island (the 2013 & 2014 #1 island in the world!) - please note - the water in San Pedro is some of the prettiest water in the world, with perfect white sand, but because it is an island, the shore takes a beating from the sea, and much of the beachfront is sea walled. Because we are close to the reef, there can be seagrass that washes in. However - the swimmable beaches we have - are gorgeous. All beaches in Belize are public, so you are welcome to walk freely on all the beachfront. Although many resorts are located on the beach, there are only a few spots people actually swim in the sea. Here are the popular spots to swim:
--You can walk right to the shore, steps away, from PUR, and walk the beautiful, picturesque beach front
--You can swim off the docks at Rum dog, just minutes walk away, head north on the beach
-- Or you can head over to Aji Tapa Bar & Restaurant at Bella Vista Resort, our sister property and use the kayaks, swim off
host_about:
PUR Hotels are a collection of two properties in Belize. PUR Boutique Cabanas are the newest, adults-only, boutique cabanas on the tropical island of Ambergris Caye, Belize. The cabanas are a high-end, modern yet vintage, rustic-luxury experience, with a boutique hotel atmosphere, on-site full bar and Taco Bar, swim up pool bar, a mile north of the bridge.  

Our sister resort is Bella Vista Resort Belize. This is a 7-unit beachfront resort- and is a great package for guests coming to Belize. We welcome guests to book multiple properties!

We have wonderful, personable staff who will be in touch to get your prepared for your vacation with us!

name: Condo in San Pedro · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Diamante is located on the South end of town and a stone’s throw from the island’s airstrip and next door to the famous, The Blue Water Grill. Right on the corner heading to the main street, there is Walk- Mart Supermarket where you can shop all variety of groceries. Infront of Walk Mart there is Carlo & Ernie’s Runway bar, enjoy a great meal while having the view of the San Pedro Airstrip. And looking for an ATM? At the Sancas Plaza which is in front of the Tropic air Airport (3mins walking from US) there is an ATM. Being in the heart of San Pedro is convenient to our guest since you will have access to amazing restaurants with amazing views, steps away from all the activity in Town and from dive shops for a numerous list of excursions you can do.

name: Boutique hotel in Hopkins · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Welcome to the North side of Hopkins, the friendliest village in Belize. In the neighbourhood you will find local culture at the Lebeha Drumming Centre, several excellent local restaurants, as well as the Driftwood Pizza Restaurant and Pub, the go-to place in Hopkins on Tues nights. Dive/snorkel and fishing tour operators will pick you up on the beach right in front. Groceries are close by, with many fresh products brought right to you.

Nature lodge in Macaw Bank · 2 bedrooms · 5 beds · 1.5 shared baths
neighborhood_overview: The great location of our lodge is quite a distance from the nearby villages of both Cristo Rey and San Antonio. The easiest way to get there is by car. But as we said you have to be a little adventorous because the road is a little bumpy. But when you arrive with us you will enjoy the beauty of the Belizean jungle, you will enjoy the silence of the jungle. You will hear the whistling of beautiful birds like toekans or the noise of crickets. You may even hear a howler monkey. Just sit with your cabin and enjoy the silence of nature.
host_about: You need to be a bit adventurious because you stay in the middle of the beautiful Belizian jungle.  Rob, the dutchman who built with his Belizean family this great hotspot, kindly welcomes you and tell you all about the species who live in the jungle. Come along, enjoy nature and taste a bit of real jungle life.

name: Home in Maya Beach · ★4.80 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Maya Beach is a small community on the Placencia Peninsula, which is known for its 14 miles of natural beachfront, excellent restaurants, and fun beach bars. It's a perfect base for tours when you're contemplating jungle and ruins tours as well as water activities like fishing, diving or snorkeling. Maya Beach is 8 miles from Placencia Village and 4 miles from Seine Bight Village.
host_about:
I am marine biologist and love nature. Originally from Austria we traveled a lot and lived in different countries but somehow Belize doesn't let us go :-) We, my wife Simone and I, live in Maya Beach. For years we have now been working as property managers for several properties in the area. 
We love diving, dining out and a cold beer on our dock overlooking the beautiful canal just steps away from the Placencia lagoon.
We are very much looking forward to hosting you in the small country of Belize.
neighbourhood: Maya Beach, Stann Creek District, Belize

The caretaker, lives on the property with his 2 dogs, to assist you during your stay. There are 2 cabanas and the cottage on the property for rent.

name: Vacation home in San Pedro · ★4.89 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Our neighbourhood is known as Mata Grande. It's one of the most beautiful areas on the island where you will find a number of private homes and a couple small hotels/condos. Casita Teresita is on the same property of Las Amapolas. It is on a lovely beach and is calm and peaceful. Since it is on a family estate sometimes you will find family members enjoying the beach. Our closest neighbour is Captain Robby that lives with his family in the compound. The main road is easily accessible but can be bumpy at times due to pot holes. Troical Escape Grill & Bar is just a three minutes walk on the beach south of the property. They are open for breakfast, lunch and dinner and allow their patrons to swim in the pool. A few steps north is Mambo's Restaurants at Mata Chica Resorts (high end/expensive). This resort offers a day pass for a fee that enables you to use their pool. These are the closest restaurants to us. There are a few others within a ten to fifteen minutes drive or many other options
host_about:
Greetings from La Isla Bonita!

I’m an island girl that loves nature. I grew up here on Ambergris Caye in the town of San Pedro so you can call me an island expert.  Feel free to ask me any question, I will be happy to answer you. Travel and meeting people are my passion.  Between my staff and myself we will make sure that your stay with us in an enjoyable one.  Welcome to Ambergris Caye; Welcome to BELIZE.

name: Cabin in Unitedville‎ · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Our village is small (pop. 1000) but lively (6 bars & 6 churches).  But Lower Dover is on the fringe of town & secluded & quiet.   The neighbors you'll see will all be wild animals & birds since we are surrounded by jungle.
host_about: NEAR... YET TOTALLY FAR OUT! Ranked #1 Specialty lodge in western Belize by TripAdvisor!  Lower Dover is close to the famous ATM Cave & a 15 min walk from a busy public bus stop in Unitedville yet you'll feel like you are on a secluded jungle isle surrounded by rivers.  You'll be sleeping atop Maya ceremonial grounds & surrounded by 100 acres of Maya ruins, exotic wildlife, nesting toucans, deep jungle & huge trees. Come explore nature trails, swim in fresh water streams, see nesting Toucans & learn about medicinal plants & Maya/British/Mennonites history.  Awake to sounds of the rainforest & an organic farm. There are clean, safe accommodations for every budget plus adventure tours, local food, warm hospitality & big on-site Maya ruins (est. population 10,000 in 900 A.D) hidden in the jungle just outside your cabana door. Centrally located in Cayo District location (between Belmopan & San Ignacio or a 2 hour ride from Hopkins) Lower Dover is a base camp for those traveling from the BZE international airport, the coast, cayes, or Tikal. If you are from Wisconsin, get your photo taken with Bucky Badger!  blog:  LDFieldJournal.wordpress.

name: Vacation home in San Pedro · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: This lovely home is located just at the outskirts of town and is walking distance from the beach.  You can ride the bikes provided onsite to town or walk down the street and enjoy local Belizean Tacos or walk to Caribbean Villas and enjoy a well cooked meal at the resort restaurant.   Ever heard of Chicken Drop? Well if never, you can experience first hand at Corona Del Mar just a block away.

name: Condo in San Pedro · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: This home is located on Seagrape drive just 15 mins walk into town.  It is safe and just one block from the beach. One block north you can find local tacos which you have to try. Just south of the house is Caribbean Villas Resort- a great place to enjoy meals if you consume at the restaurant you are allowed to use the facilities. Alia is about 10mins walk south of the house where you can buy a resort pass and spend the day.

name: Guesthouse in San Pedro · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Tres Cocos is considered one of the BEST locations on the island for the fact that it has the islands best restaurants and bars just steps away.  Still just a short bike or golf cart ride to Boca Del Rio and the heart of downtown San Pedro.
host_about: Hi, I'm Kate, your host at Three by the Sea!  My husband Robert and I are excited to welcome you to San Pedro, Belize.  We moved to the island after years of visiting and dreaming of life outside the US and we are so glad we made the move.  We live on-site but like to travel as much as possible.  When not hosting, you can find us boating, fishing, sailing, biking and enjoying the social life and events that are a plentiful part of island-life.

name: Condo in San Pedro Town · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
We are located a 1/2 mile north of the bridge leaving San Pedro, Belize. Our neighborhood is more relaxed than the hustle and bustle of downtown but close enough that you are just a short drive from the many restaurants and activities located in town.
There are three restaurants in the immediate vicinity of the property. The on site bar and restaurant, The Dog House Sports Lounge, is open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner (7am – 10pm every day). They have Belizean breakfast dishes and casual bar food and mixed drinks throughout the day.
Just to the north of our property (a 2 minute walk on the beach) is 303 Belize, an over the water bar and restaurant. They are open for lunch and dinner (every day of the week) and focus more on seafood. They have live music most evenings as well. Underneath 303 Belize, is Elite Adventures, a dive and snorkel shop.
Just south of our property is the Farmhouse Market and Cafe. They offer a wide selection of fresh coffees, juices/smoothies,
host_about:
Tres Cocos Resort @ The Cloisters, is a charming family-run establishment where island living meets modern comfort. 
We have fond childhood memories on the property before its transformation into a vacation rental oasis. 
Each condo is individually owned and thoughtfully appointed, ensuring a unique and personalized experience for our guests. We invite you to experience the warmth of Belizean hospitality in every detail during your stay with us.
neighbourhood: San Pedro Town, Ambergris Caye, Belize District, Belize

name: Rental unit in San Pedro · ★4.86 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
This beachfront property is located in the heart of San Pedro Town. Just a stone’s throw away from the Water Taxi and an 8-minute walk from the airstrip. Take one step out of the front door and feel the sand between your toes - no shoes are required!

Fall asleep to the sound of the ocean and wake up to the view of the waves crashing against the 2nd largest Barrier Reef in the world. Interact and Embrace the Culture that many adore right outside!

name: Cabin in Santa Elena · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: If you are a tourist this provides an instant "home away from home".  If you are checking out Belize for a place to rent or buy this will provide a quiet, safe, centrally located place to tour the Cayo Area without the high cost of a hotel.  This place will save you time and money on whatever adventure you are here to experience.
host_about:
I am Virginia Krohn and I am not only the owner of Villa Cayo but I designed, drew the plans for and built the villas.  I am also a real estate broker and the owner of Belize Live-Retire-Invest  which is myself and a group of expats dedicated to helping other people relocate to Belize. 


Originally from Texas I am a sculptor, painter and a custom home builder who knows how to pay attention to detail.   After visiting Belize in the '80s my husband and I returned to the states, sold our home and business and relocated to Belize in 1991.  Living on the beach for almost 20 years just 60' from that beautiful teal water was magical.  As the island changed the magic did disappear and the new dream became building a luxury Eco-resort in the jungle.

 

One of the best things I like about Belize is that I can afford to have someone help run our business,  have a housekeeper and a gardener which allows me the time to do the creative things I want to do while providing jobs for talented Belizeans.  Belize is not for everyone and it is only what you make of it.

name: Cabin in Belize · ★4.31 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Vacation home in Ladyville · ★4.50 · 2 bedrooms · 8 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Quiet neighborhood with very friendly neighbors. Feel free to get acquainted with them and quickly feel at home. Need someone to run an errand for you? Start calling out loud for Uncle Fidel, he's our village errand guy... lives next door (right of the house). Just pay him a tip. He can get you pretty much anything you need. He's also our groundkeeper, I've personally known him since I was a child. Need transportation service...Call Tony! He is the best and most dependable drivers who lives just a few houses down. Want the coldest beer in the village, call Chipo, he's just at the corner. We are a tight community of family and friends that go way back 40 years. You'll Love our Rusty Blue!
host_about: Born and kissed by the Californian sun, raised in Miami and fatherland of Belize. Belize became my tapestry woven with culture, a foundation of belonging and kinship with my roots. In 2005, I gave life to Signature Residence, a corporate housing company rooted in the bustling energy of South Florida. In 2016, my Belizean childhood home was remodeled and is known as RustyBlueBelize. This restoration was a metamorphosis of nostalgia into modernity.

name: Cabin in Cristo Rey · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
host_about: I have been involved in the Hotel and Tourism Industry at different levels during the last 17 years in both Belize and Peten, Guatemala. I am currently the Sales and Marketing Manager at Crystal Paradise Resort, a Belizean owned and operated business located in the beautiful village of Cristo Rey, Cayo District. I have also completed a Tour Guide Training Course, and  a degree in Tourism Managment.  I have a passion for Caving and Scuba Diving that has taken me to many unique places throughout the country in search of adventure and thrills others only dream of. I have instilled a strong sense of conservation in my life and a commitment to the protection of the environment.

name: Cabin in Douglas Da Silva · 2 bedrooms · 5 beds · 1 bath
Hotel in Douglas Da Silva · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
Home in San Pedro · ★5.0 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 3 baths
host_about:
Hi, I'm Corrina! 

I grew up outside of Toronto, Ontario but spent most of my adult life in British Columbia, Canada experiencing the fulfilling coastal and mountain culture.

In 2013, I took my first trip to Belize and now spend 6 months of the year on Ambergris Caye where I host a plethora of architecturally stunning oceanfront holiday homes to wonderful guests like you. These homes are ideal and can accommodate anywhere from 8 - 98 guests which are perfect for large groups, weddings, birthdays and other events.  

After a few years, and many guests requesting similar homes and services in the lush mountains of Belize,  I decided to expand our rental inventory and offer our guests a luxurious "Surf n" Turf" package that includes 3-4 nights in one of our island homes and 3-4 nights in one of our lush mountain villas in San Ignacio, Cayo. 
If you desire to experience Belize in a most epic way then we have something for every guest in modern, stylish, safe, comfortable and clean environments within the most desirable communities. 

If I am unable to be on location when guests arrive than one of my representatives will meet/greet you upon arrival, transfer you to our properties, and assist you with anything you may need. Our concierge is the finest!

We can’t wait to meet you and welcome you to beautiful Belize!
See you soon. 

Smiles!

Corrina Taylor

name: Rental unit in San Pedro · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Home in San Pedro · ★4.36 · 3 bedrooms · 7 beds · 2.5 baths
host_about:
Vacasa
Vacation Home Management

Vacasa unlocks the possibilities of how we enjoy vacation homes. We take care of managing our homeowners’ vacation houses so they can have peace of mind (and their home when they want to). And our guests book vacations confidently knowing they’re going to find exactly what they’re looking for without any surprises.

Each vacation home is always cared for by our professional local teams who implement our high cleanliness and maintenance values, while the hands-off tasks of vacation rental management--marketing, filing taxes, and maintaining a website--are handled by a specialized central support team. Our passion and focus remain true: to empower our homeowners, guests, and employees to invest in vacation.

host_about: Hi my name is Jada Augustine. I currently work as a Speech and language pathologist in the schools/ private settings. I am the founder/CEO of my own 501c3 nonprofit Jada's got your backpack/Beyond the Label is an initiative here in Belize which provides students with free speech, occupational and behavioral therapy via tele-health.

name: Rental unit in San Pedro · ★4.92 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is near grocery stores, veggie stands, meat markets, coffee shops, juice stands, gyms, local attractions, dive shops, gift shops, pharmacies, and so much more. It is also less than a minute from one of the best boutiques on the island, so if you forgot a dress for an evening out, you won't have to look that far. You will be 2 minutes walking distance to the wonderful Elvi's Restaurant. The customer service is amazing and the food is spectacular. Don’t forget that the unit is only a block away from the beautiful Caribbean Sea and located in the heart of San Pedro. Walk to Lily's Treasure Chest, located on the beach and have a good breakfast to start your day. The location of this unit is perfect because you are so close to everything. You can walk to about everything in 2 minutes or less. It doesn't get better than that. Explore the island and see why everyone loves San Pedro the way they do. I can promise you that San Pedro is everything you have dreamed of.
host_about: Born in America on October 13 1951. Semi retired living in San Pedro Belize.

neighborhood_overview:
Ananda Guesthouse Cabanas is located in the lovely village of Bullet Tree, in the Cayo district of Belize about 15 min car ride for the main center of San Igncaio. We are situated along the rambling Mopan River and a 3 minute walk from great swimming spots and tubing opportunities.
The Guesthouse is a 5 minute walk to the center of the village where we feature our very own bakery, grocery store, fruits and veggie stand and a plethora of various small local eatery's. From t he center of the village you can also get a 10 min taxi ride to san Ignacio.

name: Hotel in Belmopan · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
host_about:
We are a spiritually-minded social enterprise that seeks to fill our guests with awe through a truly unique experience while making a positive difference in our local community. 

We not only support local entrepreneurs, limit our environmental impact and develop local talent but we also donate a large percentage of our profits to PathLight International, an innovative non-profit organization that is changing the lives of children, teachers and local communities immediately around Jaguar Creek. We’re confident that PathLight is helping shape the future leaders of this great nation.

When you stay with us you help create positive change in the lives of our friends and neighbors who live in one of the most economically-disadvantaged areas in all of Latin America.

name: Rental unit in San Ignacio · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Bullet Tree Falls is a village in Cayo District of western Belize. The village is located in the foothills of the Maya Mountains and has a population of about 3000 people, mostly Spanish-speaking mestizos. There is also a significant population of American and Canadian ex-pats living in the area.

The village is located along the verdant Mopan River about a 10-minute drive from San Ignacio Town. The two sides of the village are connected by the single-lane Salvador Fernandez Bridge.
host_about: I am the author of the book: The Ultimate Belize Bucket List. I am also the founder of BelizeHub.com. I am passionate about all things Belizean and I use my creative efforts to position Belize as one of the best places to visit in the world. I live in the quaint community of Bullet Tree Falls, near San Ignacio Town in western Belize.

name: Home in San Ignacio · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Bullet Tree Falls is a village in Cayo District of western Belize. The village is located in the foothills of the Maya Mountains and has a population of about 3000 people, mostly Spanish-speaking mestizos. There is also a significant population of American and Canadian ex-pats living in the area.

The village is located along the verdant Mopan River about a 10-minute drive from San Ignacio Town. The two sides of the village are connected by the single-lane Salvador Fernandez Bridge.

name: Cabin in Belize · ★4.38 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
Home in San Pedro Town · 4 bedrooms · 3 beds · 5 baths
neighborhood_overview: La Perla del Caribe is 5.5 Miles North of San Pedro Town and offers privacy and a relaxed, natural setting.  There are excellent restaurants and bars walking distance at nearby resorts.
host_about:
La Perla Del Caribe features nine privately owned, custom designed villas available to guests seeking a truly private, upscale Belize vacation experience. These inviting, secluded vacation rentals dot four acres of lush undisturbed Caribbean beachfront. Each vacation home welcomes guests with a high-end, distinctly Mediterranean ambiance reflecting the local Belize heritage uniquely designed by each homeowner.

Escape to La Perla Del Caribe and find yourself just steps away from the pristine white sand coastline and famous Belize coral reef – recognized globally as one of the top dive sights in the world. Meanwhile, your vacation home is a scenic walk from some of the top culinary destinations in all of Ambergris Caye.

Prefer to hideaway in your private villa? Our onsite guest services manager can organize your very own private chef ready to bring the Belize flavor straight to your door.

Our picturesque property not only provides the perfect Caribbean hideaway, it’s recognized by a plethora of leading travel sites including TripAdvisor which tabbed La Perla Del Caribe with the coveted Certificate of Excellence.

La Perla Del Caribe features two, three, four and five bedroom beachfront villas all capturing the essence and beauty of a truly authentic Belize experience. Guests are treated to mahogany sun beds, artisan crafted furniture, private porches and a dazzling view of the Caribbean Sea.
neighbourhood: San Pedro Town, Corozal District, Belize

name: Home in San Pedro · ★5.0 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 3.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: We are located on the south end of the island about a 20 minute cart ride from town on a dirt road.  The surrounding community is very quiet and relaxing.  We do have an amazing adult only roof top bar and kitchen available near by at Playa De Sala, great drinks, food and fun.  There is also an eating establishment called Some Place South that has great food and live music.  Marins is a small bodega grocery store about 2 miles away that has a little bit of everything you may need to get by.  You can explore the island on golf cart or bicycle. although most of the roads are dirt, you can explore the entire island!

name: Guesthouse in San Pedro · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Located 8 miles North of San Pedro, Ambergris Caye, or a 25-minute golf cart ride from the San Pedro bridge, with a fully fenced yard in a safe, quiet local Belizean community. Bikes are available with local convenience stores that carry all the essentials only a 5-minute ride away. Double kayak and paddleboard are available with beach access to the famous Mexico Rocks Marine Reserve area which is a shallow patch reef just offshore. From our location you can take a golf cart ride to secret beach for the day without going through town traffic or for more adventurous travelers, take a ride up north to the beautiful tranquility bay area where the barrier reef touches the island.

name: Rental unit in San Pedro · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
host_about:
Hi, I'm Corrina! 

I grew up outside of Toronto, Ontario but spent most of my adult life in British Columbia, Canada experiencing the fulfilling coastal and mountain culture.

In 2013, I took my first trip to Belize and now spend 6 months of the year on Ambergris Caye where I host a plethora of architecturally stunning oceanfront holiday homes to wonderful guests like you. These homes are ideal and can accommodate anywhere from 8 - 98 guests which are perfect for large groups, weddings, birthdays and other events.  

After a few years, and many guests requesting similar homes and services in the lush mountains of Belize,  I decided to expand our rental inventory and offer our guests a luxurious "Surf n" Turf" package that includes 3-4 nights in one of our island homes and 3-4 nights in one of our lush mountain villas in San Ignacio, Cayo. 
If you desire to experience Belize in a most epic way then we have something for every guest in modern, stylish, safe, comfortable and clean environments within the most desirable communities. 

If I am unable to be on location when guests arrive than one of my representatives will meet/greet you upon arrival, transfer you to our properties, and assist you with anything you may need. Our concierge is the finest!

We can’t wait to meet you and welcome you to beautiful Belize!
See you soon. 

Smiles!

Corrina Taylor

host_about: Hi there! My name is Faith. I grew up on the island of San Pedro, Belize since I was 4 years old. I knew from such a young age that I wanted to show my little island to the world by opening either a bed and breakfast or boutique hotel. For now, I own a vacation home. Flip Flop Inn is my first ever project right on the beach in the heart of San Pedro Town. I can't wait to meet you all and show you why I fell in love with Belize.

Hi my name is Elliott Budd, I am the director of M&B Management Ltd. I am born and raised in the "Belizean Jewel", Ambergris Caye, Belize. 

I have made a career in hospitality and have had the pleasure of managing a couple resorts. My true passion is to make everyone that we have visit our island enjoy it as much as I do! Whatever your dream adventure may involve, my team and I are here to make it happen! We provide concierge, front desk and reservation assistance. Unlike any other AirBnb property, we include these services FREE OF CHARGE!

host_about:
Alma del Rio, the 'soul of the river', is named after our little Alma Sophia, who was born here in Belize and is raised among it's diverse nature and culture. 
We've been living in Belize for over 9 years. In the first 2, we managed a luxury island resort and presently own a business introducing and distributing renewable energy products. We bring into Alma del Rio all we know and believe in - professional hospitality and environmental awareness.   
We will be more than happy to help you get around, visit the best destinations and plan your trip according to your preferences and budget. We know the hospitality industry in Belize well, and will be glad to share our knowledge with you. 
Have a wonderful day!
Tom, Hadas & Alma

name: Resort in San Ignacio · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
Walking distance to town: Shopping and restaurants.

San Ignacio is considered as the main hub to adventures in western Belize on the bank of Macal river. You have access to great Belizean food, fascinating historical monuments, beautiful sceneries of flora and fauna, wildlife conservation projects and a farmer's market with fresh produce. Be sure to see the Maya ruins of Cahal Pech, Tikal National Park, Nature and wildlife tour. Below are the nearby attractions:

Belize Botanic Gardens
San Ignacio Market
Creek Art Walter Castillo Home Art Gallery
San Ignacio & Santa Elena House of Culture
Ajaw Chocolate & Crafts
Green Iguana Conservation Project
Branch Mouth
Chaa Creek Natural History Museum
El Pilar, 1000 Foot Falls
Masewal Forest Garden Medicinal Trail

host_about:
Vacasa
Vacation Home Management

Vacasa unlocks the possibilities of how we enjoy vacation homes. We take care of managing our homeowners’ vacation houses so they can have peace of mind (and their home when they want to). And our guests book vacations confidently knowing they’re going to find exactly what they’re looking for without any surprises.

Each vacation home is always cared for by our professional local teams who implement our high cleanliness and maintenance values, while the hands-off tasks of vacation rental management--marketing, filing taxes, and maintaining a website--are handled by a specialized central support team. Our passion and focus remain true: to empower our homeowners, guests, and employees to invest in vacation.

name: Rental unit in Belize · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Located on the garden level, this cozy one-bedroom apartment is just steps from the dipping pool and wonderful views of the ocean. Decorated with tile floors, mahogany cabinets, and pictures from local artists, the living area has a beautiful couch and chair with coffee and end table, TV, and a small kitchen area equipped with a refrigerator, large sink, coffee pot, toaster, portable burner and water cooler. The bedroom boasts a very comfortable queen bed, dresser and end table, closet, along with a safe, and an AC. The bathroom has a large shower and is accessible from the bedroom and living area. Guests have access to the pool, the front beach area, dock and viewing deck! Bikes, kayaks and a peddle board are available for rent. Fisherman come into the dock almost daily with a fresh catch. There is access to the water at the end of the dock. Most everything (stores, restaurants, and bars) is within walking distance!

name: Rental unit in Caye Caulker · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Our unit is in the perfect spot, at the center of the beautiful BluZen resort, situated on the beach of North Caye Caulker with breathtaking views of the Caribbean and the world’s second largest barrier reef, with a refreshing tropical breeze.

Caye Caulker Village is only a short boat, golf cart, or bicycle ride away on the south side of the island. Caye Caulker is affectionately known as “La Isla Carinosa”, and the worry free and go-slow ambiance makes it the ideal getaway for travelers to bask in the sun, relax, rejuvenate and soak up the island vibes. This beloved island is five miles long and 1.2 miles wide with a population of around 2,000 people.

Caye Caulker is a model town that makes it easy for you to immerse yourself in the Belizean culture, brilliantly displayed in its boutiques and inspiring handcrafted local art. Of course, being only a mile away from the Belize Barrier Reef makes it ideal for sea enthusiasts; visitors can enjoy sailing, diving, sno

name: Rental unit in Belize City · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Lugar al Mar is part of a family home in the residential neighborhood of Kings Park, Belize City, an upscale and secure area centrally located in the city. There are several diplomatic missions on this street with 24-hour police post two doors down from the property and a police booth in the park around the corner. Regular police mobile patrols check in at the police post periodically throughout the day and night. Many properties in the vicinity also employ private security and utilize security cameras on their premises and there is a robust neighborhood watch program in place.
host_about:
My name is Gary. I am the owner and manager of the Lugar Al Mar rental apartment in Belize City. I live on the same property as the apartment, so I am never too far away if you need me. My daughter, Marissa, also helps out if I am not around.  

If you need some tips on getting some fishing done at the nearby seawall, I can help!

name: Condo in San Pedro · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
We are located a 1/2 mile north of the bridge leaving San Pedro, Belize. Our neighborhood is more relaxed than the hustle and bustle of downtown but close enough that you are just a short drive from the many restaurants and activities located in town.
There are three restaurants in the immediate vicinity of the property. The on site bar and restaurant, The Dog House Sports Lounge, is open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner (7am – 10pm every day). They have Belizean breakfast dishes and casual bar food and mixed drinks throughout the day.
Just to the north of our property (a 2 minute walk on the beach) is 303 Belize, an over the water bar and restaurant. They are open for lunch and dinner (every day of the week) and focus more on seafood. They have live music most evenings as well. Underneath 303 Belize, is Elite Adventures, a dive and snorkel shop.
Just south of our property is the Farmhouse Market and Cafe. They offer a wide selection of fresh coffees, juices/smoothies,
host_about:
Tres Cocos Resort @ The Cloisters, is a charming family-run establishment where island living meets modern comfort. 
We have fond childhood memories on the property before its transformation into a vacation rental oasis. 
Each condo is individually owned and thoughtfully appointed, ensuring a unique and personalized experience for our guests. We invite you to experience the warmth of Belizean hospitality in every detail during your stay with us.

name: Rental unit in San Pedro · ★4.95 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Location, location, location. Our neighborhood is the heart of the island with so much to offer. It's perfect for exploring, getting to know the locals and moving around easily. Next door we have one of the most popular local favs for ceviche and happy hour. Behind us we have a convenient grocery store, a pharmacy, and an adorable cafe. Within 2 minutes, you'll find the town's Central Park and a myriad of great restaurants. In front of us one of the most well known dive shops and a breezy massage place.

If you're looking to be in the middle of it all but with a beach retreat for peace and quiet, this is the perfect base.
host_about:
Hi! I'm Dora, born and raised in Belize. I grew up on one of Belize's islands and love to travel. I'm an entrepreneur,  a people lover, a laugh out louder, a super fan of my country, Belize. 

I love good food and creating and being part of awesome experiences.  :)

name: Tiny home in Belize · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Janeen's Belize Cottage is located just a short 5 minute bike ride to the village center. The cottage is in a small tiny home community with only three other cottages on the lot just on the outskirts of the village.
host_about:
Hello! 
I love to travel, be outdoors, hike, and camp. I worked in hotels and resorts for 25 years and now work in social services which I love!
Travel is a huge passion of mine, and I am excited to share my cozy home with those who love the same!

I love meeting/welcoming  new people from any part of the world, and I look forward to connecting with you as a host or a traveller. I will do my best to make your stay as comfortable as possible

name: Condo in Caye Caulker · ★4.67 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Caye Caulker is a friendly island. The moto is "Go Slow"

If you want to relax and enjoy a peaceful, car free environment you have come to the right place. Only golf carts allowed on the streets.
This tiny island and it's locals offer one of the greatest places to dive and snorkel or just relax and enjoy a rum punch at one of the many local bars!!
You can also book a tour back to the main land and visit the Mayan ruins or do some cave tubing and ziplining . The possibilities are endless.

name: Guesthouse in Hopkins · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath

We sre on the quiet north end of Hopkins, just by all the fancy resorts, about a 10 minute walk from the center of Hopkins.

host_about: I always say "Hopkins is a small drinking village with a slight fishing problem"

neighborhood_overview: Sapphire Beach Resort sits on the quieter part of Ambergris Caye, surrounded by luscious palm tree forests. Or head down to the more lively town of San Pedro, to experience the Belizean charm in restaurants, shops, boutiques, bars, and friendly locals.

name: Bungalow in Placencia · ★4.67 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Located on the stunning eastern coast of Belize on the uber exclusive peninsula of Placencia which is a hidden gem full of virgin beaches, local cuisine, culture and seclusion from the noise of large tourism. The Stann Creek District is a captivating destination that showcases the country's natural beauty and rich cultural heritage. This region offers a diverse range of attractions, from pristine beaches and lush rainforests to vibrant coastal towns and charming villages serving fresh local cuisine. The property gets access to the stunning Placencia hotel amenities as a bonus. From fishing, hiking, boating -this is the perfect destination for your most memorable vacation yet.
host_about: With a zest for travel and a knack for cultural exploration, we love to transform humble abodes into a gateway of world wonder! Whether you seek hidden gems or local hotspots, rest assured that your stay will be an immersive escapade!

host_about:
Vacasa
Vacation Home Management

Vacasa unlocks the possibilities of how we enjoy vacation homes. We take care of managing our homeowners’ vacation houses so they can have peace of mind (and their home when they want to). And our guests book vacations confidently knowing they’re going to find exactly what they’re looking for without any surprises.

Each vacation home is always cared for by our professional local teams who implement our high cleanliness and maintenance values, while the hands-off tasks of vacation rental management--marketing, filing taxes, and maintaining a website--are handled by a specialized central support team. Our passion and focus remain true: to empower our homeowners, guests, and employees to invest in vacation.

neighborhood_overview: Located on the stunning eastern coast of Belize on the uber exclusive peninsula of Placencia which is a hidden gem full of virgin beaches, local cuisine, culture and seclusion from the noise of large tourism. The Stann Creek District is a captivating destination that showcases the country's natural beauty and rich cultural heritage. This region offers a diverse range of attractions, from pristine beaches and lush rainforests to vibrant coastal towns and charming villages serving fresh local cuisine. The property gets access to the stunning Placencia hotel amenities as a bonus. From fishing, hiking, boating -this is the perfect destination for your most memorable vacation yet.
host_about: My name is Caroline. I’m obsessed with world travel and my city, Miami. I love sharing it with people so they feel the joy I feel when living here. I have an amazing team around me at Host and Keep, we are a short-term rental management company that loves design and all things hospitality. Traveling is the best way to grow, share and experience the beauty around you awakening all your senses. Welcome, I’m glad you’re here.

name: Home in San Pedro · 3 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The island of Ambergris Caye, “La Isla Bonita”, is a popular tourist destination. You can get to San Pedro (the only town on the island) from the mainland via a 15 minute flight or a 90 minute boat trip.

Casa Coccoloba is just on the southern edge of San Pedro town, so you are within easy reach of lots! The Caribbean sea is only about 350 yards away, a 5 minute walk. There are a variety of restaurants & stores within walking distance and San Pedro's Central Park, considered 'town core' (& where the water taxi docks to the mainland are located), is a mile north of the house. The San Pedro airport is less than a mile north.

With the house being on the one main north/south road, you will hear golf cart traffic as they buzz along, but generally from inside the house with the windows closed, it's not disturbing. (Note the lower level bedroom would be the one most affected by street/traffic noise.)
host_about:
I've lived most of my life in the U.S. (where I am from) but have also lived for a couple of months to up to two years in different countries: Germany, Spain, Australia, Colombia, Ecuador, Mexico, & Belize. Since 2011 I've been living a somewhat nomadic lifestyle while exploring, working & volunteering in new & old places in the Americas and Europe. It's a great way to keep learning!

In my travels I stumbled upon the opportunity to do something that I love -- helping vacation rental owners help people like you with their dream vacations on Ambergris Caye, Belize!

I also have a condo in Cartagena, Colombia; if you're looking for a 30+ night stay (to volunteer; learn Spanish, salsa dancing, or scuba diving; work remotely with a Caribbean view; escape the winter...) let me know!

'Pack for a Purpose' is an organization that links travelers who'd like to help fulfill wish lists of non-profits in developing countries. I partner with them with schools, community organizations & animal rescue groups in both Colombia & Belize. These groups would love to have your help!

Not yet an AirBNB member? Join via this referral link and save $$ on your first booking, maybe even for a stay in Cartagena or Belize! : www.airbnb.com/c/bsmalley

neighborhood_overview:
The caretaker, lives on the property with his 2 dogs, Buddy and Rex, to assist you during your stay. There are 2 cabanas and the cottage on the property for rent.
Our cottage is located on 400ft of oceanfront beach, just a bike or car ride away from the charming fisherman's village of Placencia Town where you will find many local shops, restaurants and beach bars. We are a 5 minute walk along the beach from luxury resorts like Laru Beya, Robert's Grove & Itzana where you can enjoy a meal or a tropical cocktail.

name: Rental unit in San Pedro · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The island of Ambergris Caye is about 26 miles long & a mile or so wide, a strip of land basically going northwest/southeast, with the Caribbean Sea & Belize Barrier Reef off the eastern side of the caye & what is typically referred to as the 'lagoon' to the west. San Pedro is the only town on the island, located about 6 miles from the southernmost tip. Instead of addresses, locations are noted as being X miles north or south of town along the one main road.

These El Estero buildings face the lagoon, and are located 2.5 miles/4 km north of San Pedro's town core, which means you are away from the crowds yet still within easy reach of everything. The Caribbean beach is across the road, and access is available via our neighbors at the Capricorn Restaurant about a third of a mile north. This property is just a mile north of the popular Truck Stop and close to restaurants & grocery options plus have easy access to Secret Beach (5 miles) & town. And Grand Caribe's new medical fac

neighborhood_overview:
Tara Del Sol is located in a safe and quiet neighborhood, at the end of a "cul-de-sac." Very little traffic passes through this neighborhood, making it a perfect place for families and people looking for tranquillity.

- Some Place South is a fantastic restaurant with an incredible mimosa bar just a short minute's walk from Tara Del Sol.
- There is a convenience store around the corner of the resort
- Island Wonder is a beach club located less than a 5-minute walk from the resort
- La Fonda De Nilo is an Argentinian Steak House located close to the resort

There are many more restaurants, bars, stores, tour operators, and more located close to Tara Del Sol

neighborhood_overview:
We love living at Tuquil-HA, and here's why:

Peaceful Serenity: Tuquil-HA offers a tranquil and serene environment that's perfect for unwinding and escaping the hustle and bustle of city life. The peaceful surroundings create a sense of calm and relaxation.

Natural Beauty: The expansive grounds and beautiful water pond system make our location truly special. We take pride in the lush greenery and vibrant plants that adorn the property, creating a picturesque setting for our guests to enjoy.

Safe and Secure: Tuquil-HA is known for its safety and security. We feel confident in the safety of our neighborhood, ensuring a worry-free and enjoyable experience for our guests.

Proximity to Belize City: Being near the old capital, Belize City, allows our guests to easily explore its historical sites, cultural attractions, and vibrant atmosphere. It's a convenient gateway to experiencing Belize's rich heritage.

Warm Hospitality: Our welcoming
host_about: My name is Godfrey Alford, my friends Ping! but i prefer Terminator, I am the  friendly face in any crowd! With and approachable charm and a knack for making everyone feel welcome, I am  your -to go  person for good vibes and great conversations. I always turn any gathering into a cozy get-together and have a way of bringing people closer, one smile at a time."

name: Home in San Ignacio · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
We are in an area called Cayo Vista or Kayworks Agricultural Layout. We are on the edge of San Ignacio proper and we enjoy the beautiful views of the town, the surrounding villages as well as the beautiful Yalbac Mountains.

We are a 5 minute drive to Burns Ave, the Welcome Center and the Farmers Market, a 4 minute drive to the Princess Casino and the Green Iguana Conservation Project. We are also close to Cahal Pech Ruins, Rolson's Restaurant and a 10 minute drive from Xunantunich Ruins.

Unlike any other AirBnb property, we include these services FREE OF CHARGE!

neighborhood_overview:
We are located right next to the capital city Belmopan. You will get to many restaurants, gas stations and grocery stores within a 5 min drive. Within 1/2 miles you will find a beautiful golf course, a bird rescue center and a coconut farm.
Enjoy the cold and clean water at the Blue Hole (just 20 min drive) and explore the Hermanscave right next to it.
For a great climbing and hiking experience, you will find the ATM cave just 24km from your home.
Within a 25km drive you will find a big advanced Mennonite Community, (Spanish Lookout). The area is famous for its woodworking, agriculture, and furniture making, making it ideal for obtaining high-quality foods (especially dairy products and chicken) and goods. The residents generally speak English and visitors are made to feel right at home.
host_about:
Hi, my name is Elisabeth. I'm 33 years old, my husband and I have 4 kids.
I enjoy renovating houses, being hospitality and planning partys.

name: Rental unit in San Pedro · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The island of Ambergris Caye is about 26 miles long & a mile or so wide, a strip of land basically going northwest/southeast, with the Caribbean Sea & Belize Barrier Reef off the eastern side of the caye & what is typically referred to as the 'lagoon' to the west. San Pedro is the only town on the island, located about 6 miles from the southernmost tip. Instead of addresses, locations are noted as being X miles north or south of town along the one main road.

These El Estero buildings face the lagoon, and are located 2.5 miles/4 km north of San Pedro's town core, which means you are away from the crowds yet still within easy reach of everything. The Caribbean beach is across the road, and access is available via our neighbors at the Capricorn Restaurant about a third of a mile north. This property is just a mile north of the popular Truck Stop and close to restaurants & grocery options plus have easy access to Secret Beach (5 miles) & town. And Grand Caribe's new medical fac
host_about:
I've lived most of my life in the U.S. (where I am from) but have also lived for a couple of months to up to two years in different countries: Germany, Spain, Australia, Colombia, Ecuador, Mexico, & Belize. Since 2011 I've been living a somewhat nomadic lifestyle while exploring, working & volunteering in new & old places in the Americas and Europe. It's a great way to keep learning!

In my travels I stumbled upon the opportunity to do something that I love -- helping vacation rental owners help people like you with their dream vacations on Ambergris Caye, Belize!

I also have a condo in Cartagena, Colombia; if you're looking for a 30+ night stay (to volunteer; learn Spanish, salsa dancing, or scuba diving; work remotely with a Caribbean view; escape the winter...) let me know!

'Pack for a Purpose' is an organization that links travelers who'd like to help fulfill wish lists of non-profits in developing countries. I partner with them with schools, community organizations & animal rescue groups in both Colombia & Belize. These groups would love to have your help!

Not yet an AirBNB member? Join via this referral link and save $$ on your first booking, maybe even for a stay in Cartagena or Belize! : www.airbnb.com/c/bsmalley

name: Home in Placencia · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Quiet, safe peaceful neighborhood. Ohana is right on the beach and feels very private. Bars and restaurants are at walking distance but far enought ot not be bothered by the noise or the traffic. The Placencia Beach club and the Chillpoint Cafe are our neighbours. Top Value supermarket, Placencia Pharmacy and Atlantic Bank ATM are at 3 minutes walking.
host_about: Enjoying the privilege of living in the tropics for the last 20 years of my life and more especially in Belize since 2008 with my husband and 4 kids.  I am engineer in tropical agronomy which gave me the opportunity to travel the world and manage various projects and businesses. Amongst all the places were we lived, we find Belize very special, we fell in love with its peaceful diversity, its diverse and scenic landscapes, its climate, its people, its laid back environment... we love sharing this secret and have no doubt you will love it just as much as we do !

name: Cabin in Spanish Lookout · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
This property is located in Duck Run 2, Cayo, just outside the thriving farming community of Spanish Lookout.

You will be within a 5 to 10 minute drive of all the major eateries and shopping in the area. We provide more info about your restaurant choices in our guestbook.

Located in the heart of Belize, most of the major tourist attractions are easily accessible within an hour's drive. We are also close to Guatemala, should you decide to hop over the border for a day trip to the magnificent Tikal Maya ruins. If you need assistance with information for booking tours, please feel free to reach out to us. Adventure awaits!

Vacasa unlocks the possibilities of how we enjoy vacation homes. We take care of managing our homeowners’ vacation houses so they can have peace of mind (and their home when they want to). Rental unit in San Pedro · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: San Pedro, is a tropical jewel that seamlessly combines stunning natural beauty with rich cultural experiences. Its pristine beaches, world-class diving at the Belize Barrier Reef, and diverse marine life draw adventure seekers, while the island's laid-back vibe, delicious cuisine, and welcoming locals provide a unique blend of relaxation and cultural immersion. Whether you're exploring underwater wonders, savoring local flavors, or simply basking in the sun, San Pedro offers an unforgettable Caribbean escape.
host_about: We're an adventurous young couple who share a deep passion for travel and exploration. I'm a professional ice hockey player based in Europe, currently studying digital marketing while pursuing my dive instructor license. Meanwhile, my girlfirend and co-host Karyne is dedicated to the mental health field, working with Telus Health, and aspiring to earn her master's degree in psychology. If you have any questions please don't hesitate to reach out.

name: Nature lodge in Belmopan · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Hidden Valley Wilderness Reserve is a luxurious eco-resort situated on a vast private reserve in the Mountain Pine Ridge area of Belize. The inn is tucked away amidst the rolling hills, lush tropical forests, and glistening waterfalls of the region, offering an idyllic retreat for nature lovers and adventure seekers alike. Sitting on 7200 private acres, there is always something new to discover.

The property offers an array of activities, including hiking, bird watching, mountain biking, and swimming in the natural pools of the nearby waterfalls. With its breathtaking natural surroundings, luxurious amenities, and exceptional service, Hidden Valley Wilderness Reserve is the perfect destination for a relaxing and rejuvenating vacation in Belize.

name: Villa in San Pedro · 4 bedrooms · 6 beds · 4 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Take the road less traveled, to the Habaneros region and find a private estate, on millionaire row, 9 miles north of San Pedro town on Ambergris Caye North. Discover, quaint and rustic restaurants, off-the-beaten path. Partner Restaurant just 50 yard walk South and Chat and Chill open on weekends, a 300 yard walk up the beach. Bonitos grocery, located just a quarter mile down the road, 4 miles to not so secret, secret beach, 15 mins golf cart ride south to a cluster of restaurants. We are just steps from the untouched turquoise ocean and ancient Mayan ruins. Become fully immersed in organic farm to table dining available for purchase in villa or outdoor dining, enjoy our 5 star personalized guest concierge experience, and find yourself only 200 feet from unspoiled fishing, snorkeling, scuba diving, and pristine white beaches.

- Please note that this region may be affected by shifting seasonal currents and weather patterns causing an influx of seaweed at the beach. - We
host_about:
US Air Force Veteran & working Tech professional who loves to travel and experience the world!! I lived in The Netherlands for 4 years--an amazing experience!
Favorite places to travel: Ambergris Caye, Belize & Santorini, Greece.
Favorite Band: A Day To Remember
Favorite Movie: Tommy Boy

host_about:
I've lived most of my life in the U.S. (where I am from) but have also lived for a couple of months to up to two years in different countries: Germany, Spain, Australia, Colombia, Ecuador, Mexico, & Belize. Since 2011 I've been living a somewhat nomadic lifestyle while exploring, working & volunteering in new & old places in the Americas and Europe. It's a great way to keep learning!

name: Condo in San Pedro · ★New · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
Rental unit in San Pedro · ★New · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The island of Ambergris Caye, “La Isla Bonita”, is a popular tourist destination. You can get here from the mainland either via an 15 minute flight or a 90 minute boat trip.

San Pedro, the only town on the island, has retained its charm while handling the growing number of visitors. Miramar is located 2.5 miles/4 km south of the town core, which means you are away from the crowds yet still within easy reach of everything.

Town is not far away when you want to go in for some live music, shopping, restaurants, etc. But there are things close by too; here are a few things within walking distance of Miramar:

--Suya Tour operator (2 minute walk)
--Marin’s, a small grocery store (4 minute walk)
--A couple of nice restaurants (2-10 minute walk)
--Beach Bar & Grill (15 minute walk; breakfast, lunch, dinner, live music, outdoor bowling)

The Belize Barrier Reef, the longest in the western hemisphere, is just 1/2 mile (1 km) off shore.

Seiri, meaning “Heaven” in Garifuna, lives up to its name with its breathtaking views of the crystal-clear Caribbean waters and the Belize barrier reef, making it the perfect getaway for those seeking a peaceful and luxurious escape.

name: Guesthouse in Caye Caulker · ★New · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
Hut in Cayo District · ★New · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: There is no neighborhood here. We are 5.5 miles off a paved road in the middle of the jungle! We are the neighborhood. You're about to enjoy a true rainforest experience with off-grid living.
host_about:
Our vision is to create unforgettable experiences in one-of-a-kind remote locations. We want to help our guests connect to nature and their true selves. Each of our resorts is a different mineral, with Jade Jungle Resort in the deep primal jungles of Belize being our first resort.

We provide everything from airport pickup to drop off so you can sit back and relax on your vacation.

name: Villa in Placencia · ★New · 4 bedrooms · 6 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview: Our villas on the waters of the Placencia Lagoon come complete with all the furnishings you'll need, including your own personal dock and dipping pool. Every rental includes a villa that includes two master suites and two bathrooms, as well as a kitchen and open living and dining space. Additional each villa features a detached casita with two additional guest rooms, sharing an interconnected Jack N Jill bathroom.  We have a Private Spa on property where you can indulge in the ultimate finishing touch to your villa stay with a private spa treatment.

name: Villa in Placencia · ★New · 4 bedrooms · 5 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Discover the idyllic oasis of Seabird, just 1.5 miles away from the vibrant Village of Placencia. This peaceful and secure neighborhood offers a perfect retreat, featuring a range of amenities designed to enhance your experience.

At Seabird, tranquility reigns supreme. Feel instantly at ease as you enter this quiet and secluded community, where 24-hour security ensures your peace of mind. Relax and unwind in the community pool, or take a leisurely paddle with the provided kayaks, giving you the opportunity to explore at your own pace.

Seabird offers a truly luxurious experience with its private splash pools, available at select properties. Enjoy a refreshing dip or simply bask in the warm Belizean sunshine as you soak up the peaceful ambiance of your own secluded outdoor oasis.

host_about: I’m Kathy, a professional property manager.  I am a Belize resident and split time between Placencia and Texas. I have been travelling to and vacationing in Placencia Belize for more than 20 years now and started renting our first villa in 2008. Our passion is to help other families explore all Placencia has to offer, while offering convenient and resort-style amenities to enhance the vacation experience. We look forward to your questions!
neighbourhood: Placencia Caye, Stann Creek District, Belize

name: Rental unit in Placencia · ★New · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Estarás muy bien ubicado, podrás disfrutar de todas las comodidades que necesitas y una vista preciosa
host_about:
Hi! 

Here are Montse, and Rodolfo , "Rudy" as my friends call me.

I'm a passionate traveller, and love the details when being a guest. I strongly believe  that, turning a trip into an experience is the real meaning of traveling nowadays. 

That's why, with Miriam, our manager in Placencia, it's our determination to provide, not just accommodation but an experience to our guests. 

You are more than welcome to enjoy the villas in Belize, that Montse has designed and built for your best experience, or the apartment in Vallarta. We work hard on offering you a unique experience in a unique country. We are semi retired and would love to have you in our place.

We look forward to hosting you!

neighborhood_overview: We are located within Mahogany Bay Village, the only Gated Community on Ambergris Caye!
host_about:
Hi my name is Elliott Budd, I am the director of M&B Management Ltd. I am born and raised in the "Belizean Jewel", Ambergris Caye, Belize. 

I have made a career in hospitality and have had the pleasure of managing a couple resorts. My true passion is to make everyone that we have visit our island enjoy it as much as I do! Whatever your dream adventure may involve, my team and I are here to make it happen! We provide concierge, front desk and reservation assistance. Unlike any other AirBnb property, we include these services FREE OF CHARGE!

name: Hotel in San Pedro · ★New · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: THE NEIGHBORHOOD:  We’re not located on a main street, we’re located off a main street.  The property sits in a residential neighbourhood and is quiet.  It is surrounded by Australian pine trees, located 1.5 miles south of town, and about a 10-15 minute drive from the island airstrip to the property.  It’s a one minute walk from the property to the beach, and one of the nicest restaurants on the island, serving breakfast, lunch and dinner.  Also within walking distances is Robyn’s Barbecue on weekends, two fruit stands (with an assortment of fresh fruits and vegetables), and a local grocery store.
host_about: My name is Lucinda, everyone calls me Nani.  Our family operates a small hotel located on the island of Ambergris Caye, Belize.  We have lived here for the past 18 years and absolutely love it.  If you're reading this, you're no doubt inquiring about Belize Budget Suites.  We cater to budget travelers - looking for first class accommodations.  Check out our various theme rooms and reserve the one that interests you the most.

name: Home in Placencia · ★New · 4 bedrooms · 6 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview:
With its dedication to luxurious amenities, Seabird Dwellings is an exclusive neighborhood that offers a combination of privacy, tranquility, security, and luxurious living.

Individual private docks and splash pools are other notable features of Seabird Dwellings. Owners can take full advantage of the neighborhood's serene watefront location, with their private docks providing convenient access for aquatic adventures. Splash pools offer residents a chance to relax and soak up the sun in privacy, away from the public eye.

After a day filled with exploration and adventure, treat yourself to the ultimate evening of relaxation at The Nest Spa. Nestled within this luxurious Seabird enclave, The Nest Spa offers an array of rejuvenating treatments, and topping off your day with a signature massage is the perfect way to unwind.

name: Villa in San Pedro · ★New · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
host_about:
Vacasa
Vacation Home Management

Vacasa unlocks the possibilities of how we enjoy vacation homes. We take care of managing our homeowners’ vacation houses so they can have peace of mind (and their home when they want to). And our guests book vacations confidently knowing they’re going to find exactly what they’re looking for without any surprises.

Each vacation home is always cared for by our professional local teams who implement our high cleanliness and maintenance values, while the hands-off tasks of vacation rental management--marketing, filing taxes, and maintaining a website--are handled by a specialized central support team. Our passion and focus remain true: to empower our homeowners, guests, and employees to invest in vacation.

name: Home in Placencia · ★New · 4 bedrooms · 6 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Seabird Neighborhood in Placencia:

Welcome to the private and serene Seabird neighborhood in Placencia, where tranquility meets luxury. This exclusive area is nestled along the sparkling water.

Seabird is known for its secluded and peaceful atmosphere, providing an idyllic escape from the hustle and bustle of everyday life.

For those seeking a taste of local culture, the nearby Placencia Village offers a myriad of shops, restaurants, and bars where you can immerse yourself in the vibrant atmosphere and sample the local cuisine.

Placencia Village:

Experience the vibrant charm of Placencia Village, a bustling hub of culture and adventure located just minutes away from Seabird. This picturesque waterfront village boasts a colorful array of charming shops, galleries, and local eateries, allowing you to indulge in a true taste of Belizean culture.

Tiny home in Belize · ★New · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Located at the widest part of the island, close to the airstrip. Residential area with many trees and bird life.
host_about:
We own a small vacation rental business on the island of Caye Caulker in the country of Belize. I, Hilary, am from Quebec, Canada and started spending my winters on Caye Caulker with my family when I was nine years old. I permanently moved to the island in 2001.
My husband, Pike, is from Orange Walk, a district in northern Belize. He moved to Caye Caulker for work in 1994, which is when we met and fell in love, and we got married in 2006 on Caye Caulker.
In 2007 our daughter, Lily, was born and our daughter, Ayla, was born in 2016.
I am a scuba instructor, Pike is a retired water taxi captain and we run our rental business together. 
We love to travel and enjoy having travellers stay with us. Our business is small and intimate, allowing us to ensure that your stay in Belize is authentic, creating memories for a lifetime.
Looking forward to meeting you!
